original: folios are missing I /
analyzed: folios are missing i
translated: The folios are missing.

original: pāpikāṃ dṛṣṭiṃ grāhayeyaṃ //
analyzed: pāpikām dṛṣṭim grāhayeyam
translated: I would grasp a sinful view.

original: atha tena kṣaṇena māraḥ pāpīmāñ chīghram eva svabhavanād antarhāyāyuṣmato 'śvajito veṣaliṃgeryāpathena tayoḥ satpuruṣayoḥ purato 'ntarmārge
analyzed: atha tena kṣaṇena māraḥ pāpī imām śīghram eva sva bhavanāt antarhāya āyuṣmataḥ śvajitaḥ veṣa liṃga īryāpathena tayoḥ sat puruṣayoḥ puratas ntarmārge
translated: Then at that very moment, Māra, the evil one, quickly disappeared from his own abode and in the guise, form, and manner of the Venerable Aśvajit, stood in front of those two good men on the road,

original: sthitvaivam āha //
analyzed: sthitvā evam āha
translated: and said this:

original: uktaṃ pūrvam idaṃ mayā hi vitathaṃ hetūpamaṃ kāraṇaṃ
analyzed: uktam pūrvam idam mayā hi vitatham hetu upamam kāraṇam
translated: This was previously said by me, this false simile of a cause,

original: yuvayor eva manaḥpracāraniyamaṃ vijñāyatuṃ kiṃ yuvāṃ /
analyzed: yuvayoḥ eva manaḥ pracāra niyamam vijñāyatum kim yuvām
translated: having understood the regulation of the activity of your mind, what do you two know?

original: sarvaṃ caitad apārthakaṃ hi kathitaṃ nāsty atra hetuḥ punaḥ
analyzed: sarvam ca etat apārthakam hi kathitam nā asti atra hetuḥ punar
translated: And all this is indeed uselessly told, there is no cause here again,

original: kṛṣṇasyāsya śubhasya karmaṇa iha prāptiḥ phalaṃ vā kutaḥ // /
analyzed: kṛṣṇasya asya śubhasya karmaṇaḥ iha prāptiḥ phalam vā kutas
translated: from where is there attainment or result of this black or white action here?

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuru-mi-ya

original: kṣipraṃ kāmaguṇeṣv atīva carataṃ krīḍāṃ yuvāṃ vindataṃ
analyzed: kṣipram kāma guṇeṣu atīva caratam krīḍām yuvām vindatam
translated: Quickly engage in the sense pleasures to the highest degree, you two should find pleasure,

original: mṛtyur nāsti na janma nārtijarase lokaḥ paro nāsti vā /
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ nā asti na janma nā ārti jarase lokaḥ paraḥ nā asti vā
translated: there is no death, no birth, no suffering, old age, or world, or a world beyond.

original: puṇyāpuṇyaphalaṃ ca karmajanitaṃ nāsty atra hetukriyā
analyzed: puṇya apuṇya phalam ca karma janitam na asti atra hetu kriyā
translated: And there is no result of good or bad action produced by action, here there is no causal activity,

original: lābhāye vadatīha śākyatanayo mā śraddhayā gacchathaḥ // /
analyzed: vadati iha śākya tanayaḥ mā śraddhayā gacchathaḥ
translated: the son of the Śākya speaks for the sake of gain here, do not go by faith.

original: athopatiṣyakaulitayor etad abhūt /
analyzed: atha upatiṣya kaulitayoḥ etat abhūt
translated: Then this occurred to Upatiṣya and Kaulita:

original: māro vatāyaṃ pāpīmān upasaṃkrānta āvayoḥ
analyzed: māraḥ vata ayam pāpīmān upasaṃkrāntaḥ āvayoḥ
translated: Surely this is the evil Māra who has come to us,

original: pravrajyāvicchandanārthaṃ /
analyzed: pravrajyā vicchandana artham
translated: in order to dissuade us from going forth.

original: athopatiṣyaḥ parāṅmukhaḥ svapariṣadam āhūyaivam āha /
analyzed: atha upatiṣyaḥ parāṅmukhaḥ sva pariṣadam āhūya evam āha
translated: Then Upatiṣya, turning away, addressed his assembly, saying:

original: śruṇata yūyaṃ māṇavakāḥ smarata saṃsāradoṣān /
analyzed: śruṇata yūyam māṇavakāḥ smarata saṃsāra doṣān
translated: Listen, young men, remember the faults of saṃsāra.

original: jarayā pīḍito loko mṛtyunā parivāritaḥ /
analyzed: jarayā pīḍitaḥ lokaḥ mṛtyunā parivāritaḥ
translated: The world is afflicted by old age, surrounded by death.

original: ubhayos tatprahāṇāya pravrajyāṃ sādhu gṛhṇatha // /
analyzed: ubhayoḥ tad prahāṇāya pravrajyām sādhu gṛhṇatha
translated: For the abandonment of both, it is good to take up the going forth.

original: atha kaulito māraṃ provāca //
analyzed: atha kaulitaḥ māram provāca
translated: Then Kauṇḍinya said to Māra:

original: ājñātaḥ pravaraḥ satāṃ matidharo dharmas triduḥkhāntakṛt
analyzed: ājñātaḥ pravaraḥ satām mati dharaḥ dharmaḥ tri duḥkhānta kṛt
translated: The supreme Dharma, which is known by the wise, ends the three sufferings.

original: kaścin nāsti yadāvayor matim imāṃ vyuccālayet sarvathā /
analyzed: kaścid nā asti yadā āvayoḥ matim imām vyuccālayet sarvathā
translated: There is no one who can in any way shake our resolve.

original: tṛṣṇāyāḥ praśamāya dhīramanasāv āvāṃ sadā vyutthitau
analyzed: tṛṣṇāyāḥ praśamāya dhīra manasau āvām sadā vyutthitau
translated: We are always intent on abandoning craving, with minds firm.

original: mā siṃhākṛtinā sṛgālavacanair āvāṃ mater bhrāmaya // /
analyzed: mā siṃha ākṛtinā sṛgāla vacanaiḥ āvām mateḥ bhrāmaya
translated: Do not confuse us with the words of a jackal in the form of a lion.

original: yāś ca devatā dṛṣṭasatyās tā gaganasthitās tābhyāṃ satpuruṣābhyāṃ sādhukāraṃ Kurumiya pradaduḥ /
analyzed: yāḥ ca devatāḥ dṛṣṭa satyāḥ tāḥ gagana sthitāḥ tābhyām sat puruṣābhyām sādhukāram pradaduḥ
translated: And the gods who had seen the truth, standing in the sky, gave applause to those two good men, saying:

original: sādhu sādhu satpuruṣau sarvalokaviśiṣṭa eṣa mārgo yad uta pravrajyāniṣkramaḥ /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu sat puruṣau sarva loka viśiṣṭaḥ eṣa mārgaḥ yat uta pravrajyā niṣkramaḥ
translated: Excellent, excellent, good men! This path, namely going forth and renunciation, is supreme in the whole world.

original: sarvaduḥkhopaśānta eṣa mārgaḥ /🔽sarvatathāgatagocarāvatāra eṣa mārgaḥ /
analyzed: sarva duḥkha upaśāntaḥ eṣa mārgaḥ  sarva tathāgata gocara avatāraḥ eṣa mārgaḥ
translated: This is the path that pacifies all suffering.🔽This is the path that enters the domain of all the Tathagatas.

original: sarvabuddhair bhagavadbhir varṇitaḥ praśasta eṣa mārgo yad uta pravrajyāniṣkrama iti /
analyzed: sarva buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ varṇitaḥ praśastaḥ eṣa mārgaḥ yat uta pravrajyā niṣkramaḥ iti
translated: This is the path that has been praised and extolled by all the Blessed Buddhas, namely, going forth and leaving home.

original: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīmān duḥkhito durmanā vipratisārī tatraivāntardhānaṃ jagamā //
analyzed: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīmān duḥkhitaḥ durmanāḥ vipratisārī tatra eva antardhānam jagama
translated: Then indeed Mara, the evil one, unhappy, dejected, and remorseful, disappeared right there.

original: atha khalūpatiṣyakaulitau parivrājakau svapariṣadam avalokayaivaivam ūcatuḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu upatiṣya kaulitau parivrājakau sva pariṣadam avalokaya eva evam ūcatuḥ
translated: Then indeed the wandering mendicants Upatisya and Kaulita, looking at their own assembly, said this:

original: yat khalu māṇavakā yūyaṃ jānīdhvam āvāṃ jarāmaraṇasāgarapāraṃgamāya tathāgatam uddiśya pravrajyāṃ saṃprasthitau /
analyzed: yat khalu māṇavakāḥ yūyam jānīdhvam āvām jarā maraṇa sāgara pāraṃgamāya tathāgatam uddiśya pravrajyām saṃprasthitau
translated: You young men should know that we are setting out to go forth to the Tathagata in order to cross the ocean of old age, death, and so on.

original: yaḥ punar yuṣmākaṃ necchati bhagavataḥ śāsane pravrajitum ihaiva nivartatāṃ /
analyzed: yaḥ punar yuṣmākam na icchati bhagavataḥ śāsane pravrajitum iha eva nivartatām
translated: But whoever among you does not wish to go forth in the Blessed One's teaching, let him turn back right here.

original: sarvāṇi ca tāni paṃcamāṇavakānāṃ śatāny evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: sarvāṇi ca tāni paṃca māṇavakānām śatāni evam āhuḥ
translated: And all those five hundred young men said this:

original: yat kiṃcid vayaṃ jānīmas tat sarvaṃ yuvayor anubhāvena /
analyzed: yat kiṃcid vayam jānīmaḥ tat sarvam yuvayoḥ anubhāvena
translated: Whatever we know, that is all by your power.

original: nūnaṃ yuvām udārasthāne pravrajitau /
analyzed: nūnam yuvām udāra sthāne pravrajitau
translated: Surely you have gone forth in a lofty place.

original: yam uddiśya pravrajitau yuvāṃ tam uddiśya vayam api pravrajiṣyāmaḥ //
analyzed: yam uddiśya pravrajitau yuvām tam uddiśya vayam api pravrajiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will go forth for the sake of the one for whose sake you have gone forth.

original: athopatiṣyakaulitau parivrājakau paṃcaśataparivārau bhagavaṃtam uddiśya pravrajyāṃ
analyzed: atha upatiṣya kaulitau parivrājakau paṃcaśata parivārau bhagavaṃtam uddiśya pravrajyām
translated: Then the wandering mendicants Upatiṣya and Kaulita, having learned that the Blessed One had gone forth,🔽and that they were setting out for the Blessed One to go forth, then the evil Māra

original: saṃprasthitau viditvātha māraḥ pāpīmān bahirājagṛhasya mahānagarasya mahāprapātam
analyzed: saṃprasthitau viditvā atha māraḥ pāpīmān bahis rājagṛhasya mahā nagarasya mahā prapātam
translated: magically created a great abyss outside the great city of Rājagṛha,

original: abhinirmitavān yojanaśatam adhastād Kurumiya
analyzed: abhinirmitavān yojana śatam adhastāt
translated: a yojana deep, a yojana wide,

original: yathā tau na śakṣyataḥ śravaṇasya gautamasyāntikam upasaṃkramitum iti /
analyzed: yathā tau na śakṣyataḥ śravaṇasya gautamasya antikam upasaṃkramitum iti
translated: so that they would not be able to approach Gautama the Śramana.

original: bhagavāṃś ca punaḥ tādṛśam ṛddhyabhisaṃskāram abhisaṃścakāra yathā tāv upatiṣyakaulitau parivrājakau taṃ mahāprapātaṃ na dadṛśatuḥ /
analyzed: bhagavān ca punar tādṛśam ṛddhi abhisaṃskāram abhisaṃścakāra yathā tau upatiṣya kaulitau parivrājakau tam mahā prapātam na dadṛśatuḥ
translated: And the Blessed One again performed a miracle of supernormal power such that the wandering mendicants Upatiṣya and Kaulita did not see that great abyss.

original: ṛjunā mārgeṇa gacchataḥ /
analyzed: ṛjunā mārgeṇa gacchataḥ
translated: They went along the straight path.🔽Again, the evil Māra magically created a mountain in front of them,

original: punar api māraḥ pāpīmāṃs tayoḥ purataḥ parvatam abhinirmimīte dṛ / / / / / suṣiraṃ yojanasahasram uccatvena sahasraṃ ca siṃhānām abhinirmimīte
analyzed: punar api māraḥ pāpīmān tayoḥ puratas parvatam abhinirmimīte suṣiram yojana sahasram ucca tvena sahasram ca siṃhānām abhinirmimīte
translated: a thousand yojanas high and a thousand yojanas wide, and magically created a thousand lions

original: caṇḍānāṃ duṣṭānāṃ ghorāṇāṃ /
analyzed: caṇḍānām duṣṭānām ghorāṇām
translated: fierce, vicious, and terrifying.

original: tau ca satpuruṣau bhagavatas tejasārddhyanubhāvena ca taṃ parvatam api na dadṛśatuḥ na ca siṃhān na ca siṃhanādañ chuśruvatuḥ /
analyzed: tau ca sat puruṣau bhagavataḥ tejasā arddhi anubhāvena ca tam parvatam api na dadṛśatuḥ na ca siṃhāt na ca siṃha nādam śuśruvatuḥ
translated: And by the power of the Blessed One's splendor, those two good men did not see even that mountain, nor did they hear the lions or the lion's roar.

original: ṛjunā ca mārgeṇa yena bhagavāṃs tenopasaṃkrāmatuḥ /
analyzed: ṛjunā ca mārgeṇa yena bhagavān tena upasaṃkrāmatuḥ
translated: And they approached the Blessed One by the straight path.

original: bhagavāṃś cānekaśatasahasrayā pariṣadā parivṛtaḥ puraskṛto dharmaṃ deśayati sma //
analyzed: bhagavān ca aneka śata sahasrayā pariṣadā parivṛtaḥ puraskṛtaḥ dharmam deśayati sma
translated: And the Blessed One was teaching the Dharma, surrounded and revered by an assembly of many hundreds of thousands.

original: atha khalu bhagavān bhikṣūn āmantrayate sma /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān bhikṣūn āmantrayate sma
translated: Then the Blessed One addressed the monks:

original: paśyata yūyaṃ bhikṣavaḥ etau dvau satpuruṣau gaṇapramukhau gaṇaparivārau /
analyzed: paśyata yūyam bhikṣavaḥ etau dvau sat puruṣau gaṇa pramukhau gaṇa parivārau
translated: Monks, look at these two good men, the leaders of the assembly, surrounded by the assembly.

original: āhuḥ /
analyzed: āhuḥ
translated: They said:

original: paśyāmo vayaṃ bhagavan //
analyzed: paśyāmaḥ vayam bhagavan
translated: We see them, Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /🔽etau dvau satpuruṣau saparivārau mamāntike pravrajitvā eko mama sarvaśrāvakāṇāṃ prajñāvatām agro Kurumiya
analyzed: bhagavān āha  etau dvau sat puruṣau sa parivārau mama antike pravrajitvā ekaḥ mama sarva śrāvakāṇām prajñāvatām
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: bhaviṣyati dvitīyo ṛddhimatām //
analyzed: bhaviṣyati dvitīyaḥ ṛddhimatām
translated: These two good men, together with their retinues, have gone forth in my presence. One will be foremost among all my disciples in wisdom, and the other will be foremost in miraculous powers.

original: athānyataro bhikṣus tasyāṃ velāyām imā gāthā abhāṣata //
analyzed: atha anyataraḥ bhikṣuḥ tasyām velāyām imāḥ gāthāḥ abhāṣata
translated: Then a certain monk, at that time, spoke these verses:

original: etau ca vijñapuruṣau parivāravantau yau vyākṛtau hitakareṇa narottamena /
analyzed: etau ca vijña puruṣau parivāravantau yau vyākṛtau hita kareṇa nara uttamena
translated: These two wise men, surrounded by their retinues, who were prophesied by the Benefactor, the Best of Men,

original: samanvitāv ṛddhidhiyā viśāradāv upemy ahaṃ gauravajāta etau // /
analyzed: samanvitau ṛddhi dhiyā viśāradau upemi aham gaurava jātaḥ etau
translated: and with the confident knowledge of spiritual powers.

original: atha khalu sa bhikṣur utthāyāsanād bahubhir bhikṣubhiḥ sārdhaṃ bahubhiś ca gṛhasthapravrajitair abhyudgamya tau satpuruṣau paryupāsate sma
analyzed: atha khalu sa bhikṣuḥ utthāya āsanāt bahubhiḥ bhikṣubhiḥ sārdham bahubhiḥ ca gṛhastha pravrajitaiḥ abhyudgamya tau sat puruṣau paryupāsate sma
translated: Then that monk rose from his seat, and together with many monks and many lay people, he approached and served those two good men.

original: atha tau satpuruṣau yena bhagavāṃs tenopajagmatuḥ /
analyzed: atha tau sat puruṣau yena bhagavān tena upajagmatuḥ
translated: Then those two good men went to where the Blessed One was.

original: upetya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandya tṛpradakṣiṇaṃ kṛtvā bhagavataḥ purataḥ sthitvā bhagavaṃtam etad ūcuḥ /
analyzed: upetya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya kṛtvā bhagavataḥ puratas sthitvā bhagavaṃtam etat ūcuḥ
translated: Having approached, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, circumambulated him three times, and stood in front of the Blessed One. They said this to the Blessed One:

original: labhevahy āvāṃ vā bhagavato 'ntike pravrajyopasaṃpadbhikṣubhāvam /
analyzed: labhevahi āvām vā bhagavataḥ ntike pravrajyā upasaṃpad bhikṣu bhāvam
translated: May we receive from the Blessed One the going forth, full ordination, and monkhood.

original: careyam āvāṃ bhagavato 'ntike brahmacaryaṃ //
analyzed: careyam āvām bhagavataḥ ntike brahmacaryam
translated: May we practice the holy life in the presence of the Blessed One.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: kiṃnāma yuvāṃ kulaputrau /
analyzed: kiṃnāma yuvām kula putrau
translated: What are your names, young men?

original: upatiṣya āha /
analyzed: upatiṣyaḥ āha
translated: Upatiṣya said:

original: tiṣyasya brāhmaṇasyāhaṃ putra upatiṣyo nāma /
analyzed: tiṣyasya brāhmaṇasya aham putraḥ upatiṣyaḥ nāma
translated: I am the son of the Brahmin Tiṣya, named Upatiṣya.

original: mātā me śārikā nāma /
analyzed: mātā me śārikā nāma
translated: My mother is named Śārikā.

original: tato me janma /
analyzed: tatas me janma
translated: That is where I was born.

original: tena me śāriputra iti nāmadheyaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: tena me śāriputraḥ iti nāmadheyam kṛtam
translated: Therefore, my name is Śāriputra.

original: abhyanujñāto 'haṃ Kurumiya
analyzed: abhyanujñātaḥ ham
translated: I have been permitted by Kuruṃkiy

original: pūrvaṃ mātāpitṛbhyāṃ pravrajyāyai //
analyzed: pūrvam mātā pitṛbhyām pravrajyāyai
translated: First, by my parents, for the sake of going forth.

original: kolita āha /
analyzed: kolitaḥ āha
translated: Kolita said:

original: pitā me kauṇḍiṇyo nāma /
analyzed: pitā me kauṇḍiṇyaḥ nāma
translated: My father is named Kauṇḍinya.

original: tena me kaulito nāma /
analyzed: tena me kaulitaḥ nāma
translated: Because of him, my name is Kauṇḍinya.

original: mātā me mudgalā nāma /
analyzed: mātā me mudgalā nāma
translated: My mother is named Mudgala.

original: tena me maudgalyāyana iti sāmānyaṃ nāmadheyaṃ kṛtaṃ /
analyzed: tena me maudgalyāyanaḥ iti sāmānyam nāmadheyam kṛtam
translated: Therefore, a general name was made for me, Maudgalyāyana.

original: kaścin me jano kaulitamiti saṃjānāti /
analyzed: kaścid me jano kaulitam iti saṃjānāti
translated: Some people know me as Kauṇḍinya,

original: kaścin maudgalyāyana iti //
analyzed: kaścid maudgalyāyanaḥ iti
translated: some as Maudgalyāyana.

original: abhyanujñāto 'haṃ pūrvaṃ mātāpitṛbhyāṃ pravrajyāyai //
analyzed: abhyanujñātaḥ ham pūrvam mātā pitṛbhyām pravrajyāyai
translated: I have been previously permitted by my parents to go forth.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: caratāṃ śāriputramaudgalyāyanau saparivārau mamāntike brahmacaryam iti /
analyzed: caratām śāriputra maudgalyāyanau sa parivārau mama antike brahmacaryam iti
translated: Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, together with their retinues, have practiced the holy life in my presence.

original: saiva tayoḥ pravrajyā upasaṃpad bhikṣubhāvaś ca /
analyzed: sā eva tayoḥ pravrajyā upasaṃpad bhikṣu bhāvaḥ ca
translated: That itself is their going forth, their full ordination, and their state of being a monk.

original: acirapravrajitau ca śāriputramaudgalyāyanau saparivārau //
analyzed: acira pravrajitau ca śāriputra maudgalyāyanau sa parivārau
translated: And Śāriputra and Maudgalyāyana, together with their retinues, have gone forth not long ago.

original: atha māraḥ pāpīmān maheśvararūpeṇa bhagavataḥ purataḥ sthitvaivam āha //
analyzed: atha māraḥ pāpīmān maheśvara rūpeṇa bhagavataḥ puratas sthitvā evam āha
translated: Then Māra, the evil one, in the form of Maheśvara, stood in front of the Blessed One and said this:

original: ye śāstrārthaparicariyāsu nipuṇā vidyāsu pāraṃgatāḥ
analyzed: ye śāstra artha paricariyāsu nipuṇāḥ vidyāsu pāraṃgatāḥ
translated: Those who are skilled in the practice of the meaning of the treatises, who have mastered the sciences,

original: te sarve praṇamaṃti matsucaraṇau teṣām ahaṃ nāyakaḥ /
analyzed: te sarve praṇamanti mad su caraṇau teṣām aham nāyakaḥ
translated: all of them bow to my good feet, I am their leader.

original: kṣipraṃ maccharaṇaṃ saśiṣyapariṣaṃ gacchādya bho gautama
analyzed: kṣipram mad śaraṇam sa śiṣya pariṣam gaccha adya bho gautama
translated: Go quickly today to my refuge, along with your disciples and retinue, O Gautama,

original: sphītaṃ nirvṛti taṃ vakṣyāmi mārgaṃ tava // /
analyzed: sphītam nirvṛti       tam vakṣyāmi mārgam tava  /
translated: I will tell you the path to complete tranquility and bliss.

original: bhagavān āha /🔽Kurumiya
analyzed: bhagavān āha  kurumiya
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: tvanmārgo jagato 'sya durgativaho duḥkhārṇavaprāpako
analyzed: tvad mārgaḥ jagataḥ durgati vahaḥ duḥkha arṇava prāpakaḥ
translated: Your path, O Kuruṃbīja, is the carrier of this world to the lower realms, leading to the ocean of suffering,

original: mārgo me sa carācarasya jagato duḥkhārṇavocchoṣakaḥ /
analyzed: mārgaḥ me sa carācarasya jagataḥ duḥkha arṇava ucchoṣakaḥ
translated: My path, however, is the one that dries up the ocean of suffering for the world of moving and unmoving beings.

original: kiṃ bhūyo lapasi pragalbhamukharo dhṛṣṭaṃ sṛgālasvaraḥ
analyzed: kim bhūyas lapasi pragalbha mukharaḥ dhṛṣṭam sṛgāla svaraḥ
translated: What more do you prattle, speaking boldly and impudently with the voice of a jackal?

original: vyābhagno 'si na mārakarma iha me śakto 'si kartuṃ punaḥ // /
analyzed: vyābhagnaḥ si na māra karma iha me śaktaḥ si kartum punar
translated: You are defeated, you cannot do the work of Māra to me again.

original: atha māraḥ pāpīmān maheśvararūpam aṃtardhāya brahmaveṣeṇa punar bhagavataḥ purataḥ sthitvaivam āha //
analyzed: atha māraḥ pāpīmān maheśvara rūpam aṃtardhāya brahma veṣeṇa punar bhagavataḥ puratas sthitvā evam āha
translated: Then the evil Māra, having disappeared in the form of Maheśvara, appeared in the form of Brahmā in front of the Blessed One and said:

original: karmakleśabhavāṃkurapramathanaṃ yat te kṛtaṃ prajñayā
analyzed: karma kleśa bhava aṃkura pramathanam yat te kṛtam prajñayā
translated: The sprout of karma and afflictions has been destroyed by your wisdom,

original: duḥkhāny utsahasīha kiṃ punar itas sattvārtham evaṃ mune /
analyzed: duḥkhāni utsahasi iha kim punar itas sattva artham evam mune
translated: Why do you endure suffering here again for the sake of beings, O Sage?

original: nāsty asmiṃ jagati prabho kvacid api tvatpātrabhūto janaḥ
analyzed: nā asti asmin jagati prabho kvacid api tvad pātra bhūtaḥ janaḥ
translated: There is no one in this world, O Lord, who is a worthy recipient for you anywhere.

original: kasmāt tvaṃ vigatāmayo na tvaritaṃ nirvāsi kālo hy ayam // /
analyzed: kasmāt tvam vigata āmayaḥ na tvaritam nirvāsi kālaḥ hi ayam
translated: Why do you not quickly attain nirvāṇa, free from afflictions? This is the time.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:🔽The sprout of karma and afflictions has been destroyed by my wisdom,

original: gaṃgāvālukasannibhān asadṛśān sattvān prapaśyāmy ahaṃ
analyzed: gaṃgā vāluka sannibhān a sadṛśān sattvān prapaśyāmi aham
translated: I see beings who are incomparable, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges,

original: ye me vainayikāḥ sthitāḥ karuṇayā te saṃpramokṣyā mayā /
analyzed: ye me vainayikāḥ sthitāḥ karuṇayā te saṃpramokṣyāḥ mayā
translated: who are established in my discipline out of compassion, they will be liberated by me.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: [Sanskrit text]

original: madhyotkṛṣṭajaghanyatām upagato nirmokṣya niṣṭhā jagat
analyzed: madhya utkṛṣṭa jaghanya tām upagataḥ nirmokṣya niṣṭhā jagat
translated: Having attained the state of middling, excellent, and inferior, I will liberate the world to the end.

original: nirvāsyāmi tato nimantrayasi māṃ śāṭhyena kiṃ durmate // /
analyzed: nirvāsyāmi tatas nimantrayasi mām śāṭhyena kim durmate
translated: Then, O evil-minded one, why do you invite me with deceit to attain nirvana?

original: atha punar api māraḥ pāpīmān duḥkhito durmanā vipratisārī tatraivāntardhāya svabhavanaṃ gatvā śokāgāraṃ praviśya niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: atha punar api māraḥ pāpīmān duḥkhitaḥ durmanāḥ vipratisārī tatra eva antardhāya sva bhavanam gatvā śokāgāram praviśya niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Then again, the evil Mara, sorrowful, dejected, and remorseful, disappeared right there and went to his own abode. Entering the house of sorrow, he sat down.

original: tatkṣaṇam eva ca sarvamārabhavananivāsinaś ca sattvāḥ parasparaṃ pṛcchaṃti sma /
analyzed: tad kṣaṇam eva ca sarva māra bhavana nivāsinaḥ ca sattvāḥ parasparam pṛcchaṃti sma
translated: At that very moment, all the beings dwelling in the abodes of Mara asked each other:

original: ko hetur yad ayam asmākaṃ mahārājaḥ śokāgāraṃ praviśya niṣaṇṇo na ca kaścij jānīte //🔽atha paṃca mārakanyāśatāni paramaprītikarāṇi puṣpamālyavilepanāni gṛhītvā paramamanojñair
analyzed: kaḥ hetuḥ yat ayam asmākam mahā rājaḥ śokāgāram praviśya niṣaṇṇaḥ na ca kaścid jānīte  atha paṃca māra kanyā śatāni parama prīti karāṇi puṣpa mālya vilepanāni gṛhītvā parama manojñaiḥ
translated: What is the reason that our great king has entered the house of sorrow and sat down, and no one knows why?🔽Then five hundred Mara's daughters, taking extremely pleasing flowers, garlands, and ointments, adorned themselves with extremely pleasing

original: vastrābharaṇair ātmānam alaṃkṛtya paramamanojñaharṣakarāṇi divyāni tūryāṇi pravādayaṃtyaḥ
analyzed: vastra ābharaṇaiḥ ātmānam alaṃkṛtya parama manojña harṣa karāṇi divyāni tūryāṇi pravādayaṃtyaḥ
translated: clothes and ornaments, and playing extremely pleasing and delightful divine musical instruments,

original: paramamanojñasvareṇa nṛtyaṃtyo gāyaṃtyo vādayaṃtyo mahatā divyena paṃcāṃgikena tūryeṇa
analyzed: parama manojña svareṇa nṛtyaṃtyaḥ gāyaṃtyaḥ vādayaṃtyaḥ mahatā divyena paṃcāṃgikena tūryeṇa
translated: with supremely delightful voices, dancing, singing, and playing, with a great divine five-part musical ensemble,

original: ratikrīḍāyuktena mārasya pāpīmataḥ purataḥ sthitāḥ /
analyzed: rati krīḍā yuktena mārasya pāpīm atas puratas sthitāḥ
translated: engaged in play and enjoyment, stood in front of the evil Māra.

original: sa ca māraḥ pāpīmān bāhūn pragṛhya prakrośitum ārabdhaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca māraḥ pāpīmān bāhūn pragṛhya prakrośitum ārabdhaḥ
translated: And that evil Māra, stretching out his arms, began to cry out,

original: mā śabdaṃ kuruta mā śabdaṃ kuruteti /
analyzed: mā śabdam kuruta mā śabdam kuruta iti
translated: Do not make a sound, do not make a sound!

original: evam uktāś ca muhūrtaṃ tā apsarasas tūṣṇīṃ tasthuḥ /
analyzed: evam uktāḥ ca muhūrtam tāḥ apsarasaḥ tūṣṇīm tasthuḥ
translated: Thus addressed, those celestial nymphs remained silent for a moment.

original: punar api pragāyaṃtyas tūryāṇi parājaghnuḥ /
analyzed: punar api pragāyaṃtyaḥ tūryāṇi parājaghnuḥ
translated: Again, singing, they played the musical instruments.

original: māraś ca pāpīmān punar api bāhudvayam utkṣipya prakrośitum ārabdho yāvat saptakṛtvas tā apsarasas tāṃ ratinibaddhanṛttavā / / / / / / / / / / punar
analyzed: māraḥ ca pāpīmān punar api bāhu dvayam utkṣipya prakrośitum ārabdhaḥ yāvat sapta kṛtvas tāḥ apsarasaḥ tām rati nibaddha nṛttavā punar
translated: And the evil Māra, again raising both arms, began to cry out, up to seven times. Those celestial nymphs, bound by attachment to pleasure, dancing, singing, and playing,🔽again

original: māraḥ pāpīmān tathaiva Kurumiya 🔽bāhudvayam unnāmyotkrośaṃ cakāra /
analyzed: māraḥ pāpīmān tathā eva  bāhu dvayam unnāmya utkrośam cakāra
translated: The evil Māra, in the same way, raised both arms🔽and cried out.

original: mā śabdaṃ kṛdhvaṃ mā śabdaṃ kṛdhvam iti /
analyzed: mā śabdam kṛdhvam mā śabdam kṛdhvam iti
translated: Do not make a sound, do not make a sound!

original: evam uktāś ca tā apsarasas tūṣṇīṃ tasthuḥ //
analyzed: evam uktāḥ ca tāḥ apsarasaḥ tūṣṇīm tasthuḥ
translated: Thus addressed, those celestial nymphs remained silent.

original: atha khalu vidyudvalgusvarā nāmāpsarā yena māraḥ pāpīmāṃs tenāṃjaliṃ praṇāmyaivam āha /
analyzed: atha khalu vidyudvalgusvarā nāma apsarāḥ yena māraḥ pāpīmān tena aṃjalim praṇāmya evam āha
translated: Then the celestial maiden named Lightning-Sweet-Voice, having bowed with folded hands to that wicked Mara, said this:

original: kiṃ te vibho cyutinimittam ihādya dṛṣṭaṃ
analyzed: kim te vibho cyuti nimittam iha adya dṛṣṭam
translated: What sign of your fall have you seen here today, lord?

original: kiṃ vā jagad dhutavahākulam adya jātaṃ /
analyzed: kim vā jagat hutavaha ākulam adya jātam
translated: Or has the world become filled with forest fires today?

original: śatrus tavādhikabalaḥ kim ihāsti kaścit
analyzed: śatruḥ tava adhika balaḥ kim iha asti kaścid
translated: Is there some enemy of yours with greater power here?

original: samāśrayase saśokaḥ // /
analyzed: samāśrayase sa śokaḥ
translated: You are taking refuge with sorrow...

original: māraḥ prāha //
analyzed: māraḥ prāha
translated: Mara said:

original: śatrur mamāsti balavān nigṛhītacetā
analyzed: śatruḥ mama asti balavān nigṛhīta cetāḥ
translated: I have an enemy who is powerful, his mind restrained,

original: māyāsu śikṣitamatir bhuvi śākyaputraḥ /
analyzed: māyāsu śikṣita matiḥ bhuvi śākya putraḥ
translated: whose mind is trained in illusions, a son of the Shakyas on earth.

original: tatprakṣayo yadi na cāsti kathaṃcid evaṃ
analyzed: tad prakṣayaḥ yadi na ca asti kathaṃcid evam
translated: If he cannot be destroyed in any way,

original: śūnyaṃ kariṣyati mameha sa kāmadhātum // /
analyzed: śūnyam kariṣyati mama iha sa kāmadhātum
translated: he will empty this desire realm of mine here.

original: sā apsarā provāca /
analyzed: sā apsarā provāca
translated: That celestial maiden said:

original: svāminn upāyabalavīryaparākramaiḥ kaiḥ
analyzed: svāmin upāya bala vīrya parākramaiḥ kaiḥ
translated: Lord, with what power, strength, vigor, and prowess

original: kartuṃ kṣayaṃ param aśeṣam ihādya tasya /
analyzed: kartum kṣayam param aśeṣam iha adya tasya
translated: can you destroy him completely here today?

original: Kurumiya 🔽kaḥ śaknuyāt tribhavabandhanadīrghatīraṃ
analyzed: kurumiya  kaḥ śaknuyāt tri bhava bandhana dīrgha tīram
translated: Kuru-mi-ya

original: tṛṣṇārṇavaṃ kṣapayituṃ valasā yuktaḥ // /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā arṇavam kṣapayitum valasā yuktaḥ
translated: Who is able to dry up the ocean of craving, with its long shores of bondage to the three realms of existence, with a current?

original: māraḥ prāha /
analyzed: māraḥ prāha
translated: Mara said:

original: dānavratāśayadayāpraṇidhānapāśaḥ
translated: The noose of generosity, vows, intention, compassion, and aspiration,

original: śūnyānimittaparamāstragṛhītacāpaḥ /
analyzed: śūnya a nimitta parama astra gṛhīta cāpaḥ
translated: holding the supreme weapon of emptiness and signlessness,

original: niḥśeṣato bhavanivṛttyupadeśakartā
translated: The teacher of the complete cessation of existence,

original: saṃsāraniḥsṛtapathapraśamānukūlaḥ // /🔽śūnyeṣu grāmanagareṣu vanāntareṣu
analyzed: śūnyeṣu grāma nagareṣu vana antareṣu
translated: Favorable to the pacification of the path that has emerged from samsara.🔽His disciples dwell in empty villages, towns, forests,

original: girikandareṣv api vasaṃti tasya śiṣyāḥ /
analyzed: giri kandareṣu api vasaṃti tasya śiṣyāḥ
translated: And in mountain caves.

original: dhyānābhiyuktamanasaḥ praviviktacārā
analyzed: dhyāna abhiyukta manasaḥ pravivikta cārā
translated: With minds devoted to meditation, living in seclusion,

original: doṣakṣayāya satataṃ vidhivat prayuktāḥ // /🔽ṛddhyā balaiḥ karuṇayā ca sahāyavantāv
analyzed: doṣa kṣayāya satatam vidhivat prayuktāḥ  ṛddhyā balaiḥ karuṇayā ca sahāyavantau
translated: Constantly and properly engaged for the destruction of faults.🔽With supernatural powers, strengths, and compassion as their companions,

original: upatiṣyakaulitav anau muninā vinītau /
analyzed: upatiṣya kaulitau anau muninā vinītau
translated: Upatiṣya and Kaulita were disciplined by the Sage.

original: trailokyasarvavidhinā suvinītadharmā
analyzed: trailokya sarva vidhinā su vinīta dharmā
translated: With the Dharma well-disciplined by the rules of the three worlds,

original: śūnyaṃ kariṣyati sa me kila kāmadhātuṃ // /
analyzed: śūnyam kariṣyati sa me kila kāmadhātum
translated: He will surely empty my realm of desire.

original: atha taiḥ paṃcabhir mārakanyāśatair mārasya pāpīmato 'ntikād bhagavato guṇavarṇaṃ śrutvā sarvair ākāravigatavidyun nāma bodhisattvasamādhiḥ 🔽pratilabdhā /
analyzed: atha taiḥ paṃcabhiḥ māra kanyā śataiḥ mārasya pāpīmataḥ ntikāt bhagavataḥ guṇa varṇam śrutvā sarvaiḥ ākāravigatavidyut nāma bodhisattva samādhiḥ  / pratilabdhā
translated: Then, having heard from the evil Mara the praise of the qualities of the Blessed One, all five hundred of Mara's daughters attained the bodhisattva samadhi called appearance-free lightning.

original: atha tāni paṃca mārakanyāśatāni divyāni tūryāṇi tāṃś ca Kurumiya
analyzed: atha tāni paṃca māra kanyā śatāni divyāni tūryāṇi tān ca
translated: Then all five hundred of Mara's daughters played divine musical instruments and sang songs to the Blessed One.

original: divyapuṣpagandhamālyavilepanābharaṇavibhūṣaṇālaṃkārān yena bhagavāṃs tenākṣipan bhagavataḥ pūjākarmaṇe /
analyzed: divya puṣpa gandha mālya vilepana ābharaṇa vibhūṣaṇa alaṃkārān yena bhagavān tena ākṣipan bhagavataḥ pūjā karmaṇe
translated: They scattered divine flowers, incense, garlands, ointments, garments, ornaments, and adornments in the direction of the Blessed One in order to worship him.

original: tāni ca divyāni tūryāṇi te ca yāvad alaṃkārā bhagavata ṛddhyanubhāvena veṇuvane vavarṣuḥ /
analyzed: tāni ca divyāni tūryāṇi te ca yāvat alaṃkārāḥ bhagavataḥ ṛddhi anubhāvena veṇu vane vavarṣuḥ
translated: And those divine musical instruments and ornaments rained down in the Bamboo Grove by the Blessed One's supernormal power.

original: tāś ca mārakanyāḥ svayam adrākṣuḥ saparivāraḥ /
analyzed: tāḥ ca māra kanyāḥ svayam adrākṣuḥ sa parivāraḥ
translated: And those daughters of Mara saw themselves and their retinues.

original: dṛṣtvā ca punar api tāḥ prasādapramodyajātā babhūvur yad veṇuvane evaṃrūpaṃ puṣpavarṣaṃ pravṛṣṭam iti //
analyzed: dṛṣtvā ca punar api tāḥ prasāda pramodya jātāḥ babhūvuḥ yat veṇu vane evaṃrūpam puṣpa varṣam pravṛṣṭam iti
translated: And having seen, they were filled with faith and joy, thinking, Such a rain of flowers has fallen in the Bamboo Grove.

original: te ca bhikṣavaḥ saṃśayajātā bhagavantaṃ papracchuḥ /
analyzed: te ca bhikṣavaḥ saṃśaya jātāḥ bhagavantam papracchuḥ
translated: And those monks, having become doubtful, asked the Blessed One:

original: yad bhagavann anayoḥ śāriputramaudgalyāyanoḥ saparivārayor idam evaṃrūpaṃ mahāścaryādbhutādṛṣṭāśrutapūrvaṃ varṣaṃ pravṛṣṭam /
analyzed: yat bhagavan anayoḥ śāriputra maudgalyāyanoḥ sa parivārayoḥ idam evaṃrūpam mahā āścarya adbhuta adṛṣṭa aśruta pūrvam varṣam pravṛṣṭam
translated: Blessed One, what is the cause, what is the reason for this great wonder, this great marvel, this great marvel never seen or heard before, this rain that has fallen on these two, Shariputra and Maudgalyayana, along with their retinues?

original: ko nv atra bhagavan hetuḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ nu atra bhagavan hetuḥ
translated: Blessed One, what is the cause here?

original: kaḥ pratyayaḥ /
analyzed: kaḥ pratyayaḥ
translated: What is the reason?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: nānayoḥ kulaputrayor anubhāvaḥ /
analyzed: na anayoḥ kula putrayoḥ anubhāvaḥ
translated: This is not the power of these two noble sons.

original: mārasya tu pāpīmataḥ paṃcamātraiḥ paricārikāśatais tato mārabhavanād idam evaṃrūpaṃ mahāpuṣpavarṣaṃ yāvad alaṃkāravarṣam utsṛṣṭaṃ mama pūjākarmaṇe
analyzed: mārasya tu pāpīmataḥ paṃca mātraiḥ paricārikā śataiḥ tatas māra bhavanāt idam evaṃrūpam mahā puṣpa varṣam yāvat alaṃkāra varṣam utsṛṣṭam mama pūjā karmaṇe
translated: But the five hundred attendants of Mara, the evil one, from that palace of Mara, released such a great rain of flowers, up to a rain of ornaments, for the sake of making offerings to me.

original: acirāt tā atrāgatā mamāntikād vyākaraṇaṃ pratilapsyante 'nuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau //
analyzed: acirāt tāḥ atra āgatāḥ mama antikāt vyākaraṇam pratilapsyante nuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: They will soon come here and receive a prophecy from me of the highest complete enlightenment.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuru

original: atha tāni paṃcamātrāṇi mārakanyāśatāni svayam eva bhagavato vākśrutaghoṣavyāhāram
analyzed: atha tāni paṃca mātrāṇi māra kanyā śatāni svayam eva bhagavataḥ vāc śruta ghoṣa vyāhāram
translated: Then those five hundred Mara's daughters, having heard with their own ears the Blessed One's speech,

original: abhiśrutya bhūyasya mātrayā ca bhagavato 'ntike prasādajātās tās tena prasādapramodyena
analyzed: abhiśrutya bhūyasya mātrayā ca bhagavataḥ ntike prasāda jātāḥ tāḥ tena prasāda pramodyena
translated: and having become even more full of faith in the Blessed One, by that faith and joy

original: bodhicittāsaṃpramoṣaṃ nāma samādhiṃ pratilebhire //
analyzed: bodhi citta asaṃpramoṣam nāma samādhim pratilebhire
translated: they attained the samadhi called not forgetting the thought of enlightenment.

original: atha khalu tā mārakanyās tatra mārabhavane ekāṃsaṃ cīvaraṃ prāvṛtya dakṣiṇaṃ jānumaṇḍalaṃ
analyzed: atha khalu tāḥ māra kanyāḥ tatra māra bhavane eka aṃsam cīvaram prāvṛtya dakṣiṇam jānu maṇḍalam
translated: Then those Mara's daughters, in that palace of Mara, having put on their upper robes over one shoulder,🔽having placed their right knees on the ground,

original: pṛthivyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpyāṃjaliṃ kṛtvā yasyāṃ diśi bhagavān viharati tāṃ diśaṃ nirīkṣamāṇā evam ūcuḥ //🔽tṛṣṇāsarinnikhilaśoṣaka sarvalokam
analyzed: pṛthivyām pratiṣṭhāpya aṃjalim kṛtvā yasyām diśi bhagavān viharati tām diśam nirīkṣamāṇāḥ evam ūcuḥ 🔽tṛṣṇā sarit nikhila śoṣaka sarva lokam
translated: having made the gesture of supplication, looking in the direction where the Blessed One was, said this:

original: ālokya netravikalaṃ jagad ekacakṣuḥ /
analyzed: ālokya netra vikalam jagat eka cakṣuḥ
translated: Seeing the world blind, without eyes, you are the one eye

original: tvaṃ tārako 'dya jagataḥ sanarāmarasya
analyzed: tvam tārakaḥ dya jagataḥ sa nara amarasya
translated: You are the star today for the world with its gods and humans

original: buddhā vayaṃ katham ihāśu mune bhavema // /
analyzed: buddhāḥ vayam katham iha āśu mune bhavema  /
translated: How can we quickly become Buddhas here, O Sage?

original: naradevapūjya bhagavan paramārthavādin
analyzed: bhagavan parama artha vādin
translated: Honored by gods and men, Blessed One, speaker of the ultimate truth,

original: strītvaṃ jugupsitam apohya vayaṃ samagrāḥ /
analyzed: strī tvam jugupsitam apohya vayam samagrāḥ
translated: Having abandoned this despised womanhood, we all together,

original: ṛddhyā tavottamamate tvaritaṃ samīpe
analyzed: ṛddhyā tava uttama mate tvaritam samīpe
translated: By your power, O one of excellent mind, quickly going near,

original: gatvā munīndravacanaṃ śruṇuyāma evaṃ // /
analyzed: gatvā muni indra vacanam śruṇuyāma evam
translated: May we hear the words of the Lord of Sages in this way.

original: nairātmyavādi bhagavan paramārthadarśin
analyzed: nairātmya vādi bhagavan parama artha darśin
translated: Speaker of non-self, Blessed One, seer of the ultimate truth,

original: bodhyaṃgaratnadhara nirmalavākpradīpa /
translated: Holder of the jewel of the factors of enlightenment, lamp of pure speech,

original: ākramya mārabalam apratima tvam asmān
analyzed: ākramya māra balam apratima tvam asmān
translated: Having conquered the incomparable power of Mara, you for us

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: bodhāya śīghram adhunā samaṃ vyākuruṣva // /
analyzed: bodhāya śīghram adhunā samam vyākuruṣva
translated: Quickly teach now for enlightenment.

original: atha khalu mārakanyā utthāyāsanād ekakaṇṭhena māraṃ pāpīmantam etad ūcuḥ //
analyzed: atha khalu māra kanyāḥ utthāya āsanāt eka kaṇṭhena māram pāpīmantam etat ūcuḥ
translated: Then the daughters of Mara, rising from their seats, with one voice said this to Mara, the evil one:

original: tvaṃ nāma duṣkṛtamate bhagavatsakāśe
analyzed: tvam nāma duṣkṛtamate bhagavat sakāśe
translated: You, of evil thoughts, in the presence of the Blessed One,

original: duṣṭaḥ kathaṃ śṛyam avāpya calām asārām /
analyzed: duṣṭaḥ katham śṛyam avāpya calām asārām
translated: Evil one, how, having obtained fickle and worthless glory,

original: jātyādiduḥkhasamupadrutasarvamūrtiḥ
analyzed: jāti ādi duḥkha samupadruta sarva mūrtiḥ
translated: With your whole body afflicted by the suffering of birth and so on,

original: ghorāṃ daśām upagato 'si madāvaliptaḥ // /
analyzed: ghorām daśām upagataḥ si mada avaliptaḥ
translated: You have come to a terrible state, intoxicated with pride.

original: śraddhāṃ jine kuru tathā vyapanīya roṣaṃ
analyzed: śraddhām jine kuru tathā vyapanīya roṣam
translated: Have faith in the Victorious One, and give up anger,

original: saṃsāradoṣamadapaṃkasamuddhṛtātmā /
analyzed: saṃsāra doṣa mada paṃka samuddhṛta ātmā
translated: With a mind freed from the mire of faults and pride of cyclic existence,

original: eṣa svayaṃ viditasarvajagasvabhāva
analyzed: eṣa svayam vidita sarva jaga svabhāva
translated: He who knows the nature of all beings by himself,

original: āgaccha kāruṇikam āśu gatiṃ prayāmaḥ // /
analyzed: āgaccha kāruṇikam āśu gatim prayāmaḥ
translated: Come, let us quickly go to the compassionate one.

original: atha khalu mārasya pāpīmataḥ paramaduṣṭamanasaḥ etad abhūt /
analyzed: atha khalu mārasya pāpīmataḥ parama duṣṭa manasaḥ etat abhūt
translated: Then, the evil Mara, with a supremely wicked mind, thought this:

original: yan nv ahaṃ tādṛśaṃ mārabalaviṣayavegaṃ samanusmareyaṃ yad etāni paṃca paricārikāśatāni paṃcapāśabandhanabaddhām ātmāna saṃpaśyeyur ihaiva
analyzed: yat nu aham tādṛśam māra bala viṣaya vegam samanusmareyam yat etāni paṃca paricārikā śatāni paṃca pāśa bandhana baddhām saṃpaśyeyuḥ iha eva
translated: Suppose I were to recollect the power and force of Mara's army, so that these five hundred attendants would see themselves bound by the five fetters, and

original: nivarteran na punar gantuṃ śaknuyuḥ /
analyzed: nivarteran na punar gantum śaknuyuḥ
translated: would turn back right here, and would not be able to go any further.

original: sa ca māras tāni banddhuṃ na śaktaḥ /
analyzed: sa ca māraḥ tāni banddhum na śaktaḥ
translated: But Mara was not able to bind them.

original: tat kutas tathā hi tāni paṃca paricārikāśatāni tathāgatādhiṣṭhānāni //
analyzed: tat kutas tathā hi tāni paṃca paricārikā śatāni tathāgata adhiṣṭhānāni
translated: How is it that those five hundred attendants were empowered by the Tathagata?

original: atha khalu tāḥ paṃcaśataparicārikā mārasya pāpīmato 'ntikāt pracakramuḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu tāḥ paṃcaśata paricārikāḥ mārasya pāpīmataḥ ntikāt pracakramuḥ
translated: Then, those five hundred attendants of Mara set out from the presence of the evil Mara.

original: Kurumiya atha māraḥ pāpīmān bhūyasyā mātrayā ruṣṭaḥ /
analyzed: atha māraḥ pāpīmān bhūyasyā mātrayā ruṣṭaḥ
translated: Then, the evil Mara became even more angry.

original: tasyaitad abhavat /
analyzed: tasya etat abhavat
translated: He thought this:

original: yan nv ahaṃ punar api tādṛśaṃ mārabalaviṣayavegaṃ samanusmareyaṃ yat sarvam idam
analyzed: yat nu aham punar api tādṛśam māra bala viṣaya vegam samanusmareyam yat sarvam idam
translated: What if I were to recollect again that kind of power and force of Māra's domain, by which all this

original: ākāśavairaṃbhasaṃghātair mahākālameghair mahākālavāyubhiś cāvṛtaṃ yathā tā eva paricārikāḥ
analyzed: ākāśa vairambha saṃghātaiḥ mahākāla meghaiḥ mahākāla vāyubhiḥ ca āvṛtam yathā tāḥ eva paricārikāḥ
translated: would be covered by great black clouds and great black winds, like those very attendants,

original: sarvā digvidikṣu saṃbhrāntāḥ śramaṇaṃ gautamaṃ na paśyeyuḥ /
analyzed: sarvāḥ diś vidikṣu saṃbhrāntāḥ śramaṇam gautamam na paśyeyuḥ
translated: and they would be confused in all directions and intermediate directions, and would not see the monk Gautama,

original: punar eva me bhavanam āgaccheyuḥ /
analyzed: punar eva me bhavanam āgaccheyuḥ
translated: and would return to my abode again?

original: tathāpi buddhādhiṣṭānabalena kiyantam api vāyuṃ na śaknoty utpādayituṃ yo 'ntato bālāgram api kaṃpayet prāg eva bahutaram /
analyzed: tathā api buddha adhiṣṭāna balena kiyantam api vāyum na śaknoti utpādayitum yaḥ bālāgram api kaṃpayet prāk eva bahutaram
translated: Still, by the power of the Buddha's blessing, he was not able to produce even a little wind that would move even the tip of a hair, much less a lot.

original: atha māraḥ pāpīmān bhūyasya mātrayā duṣṭaduḥkhito durmanā vipratisārī rudan mahāsvareṇa svaputragaṇapāriṣadyān vikrośan sarvaṃ mārabhavanaṃ
analyzed: atha māraḥ pāpīmān bhūyasya mātrayā duṣṭa duḥkhitaḥ durmanāḥ vipratisārī rudan mahā svareṇa sva putra gaṇa pāriṣadyān vikrośan sarvam māra bhavanam
translated: Then the evil Māra, even more wicked, miserable, dejected, remorseful, crying, and with a loud voice, lamenting to his own sons, followers, and retinue, filled the entire Māra's abode

original: śabdena pūrayām āsa /
analyzed: śabdena pūrayām āsa
translated: with sound.

original: āgacchatha priyasutā gaṇapāriṣadyā
analyzed: āgacchatha priya sutāḥ gaṇa pāriṣadyā
translated: Come, dear sons, followers, and retinue!

original: bhraṣṭā vayaṃ svaviṣayāt svabalāc ca riddheḥ /
analyzed: bhraṣṭāḥ vayam sva viṣayāt sva balāt ca riddheḥ
translated: We have fallen from our own domain, our own power, and our own prosperity.

original: jāto 'tra eṣa viṣavṛkṣa ivāntarātmā
analyzed: jātaḥ u tras eṣa viṣa vṛkṣaḥ iva antarātmā
translated: This one has arisen here, like a poisonous tree from within,

original: māyāśaṭho madhuravāg iha śākyaputraḥ // /
analyzed: māyā śaṭhaḥ madhura vāc iha śākyaputraḥ
translated: The son of the Śākyas here is deceitful, cunning, and speaks sweetly.

original: atha tena śabdena sarvās tā mārakanyāḥ māraduhitarāś ca sarve ca māraputrā Kurumiya
analyzed: atha tena śabdena sarvāḥ tāḥ māra kanyāḥ māra duhitarāḥ ca sarve ca māra putrā
translated: Then, by that sound, all those daughters of Māra, all the sons of Māra, and all the Kurumika

original: gaṇapārṣadyāś ca tvaritamānarūpāḥ śīghram upagamya mārasya pāpīmataḥ puratas tasthuḥ /
analyzed: gaṇa pārṣadyāḥ ca tvarita māna rūpāḥ śīghram upagamya mārasya pāpīmataḥ puratas tasthuḥ
translated: attendants quickly and swiftly approached and stood in front of the evil Māra.

original: tasyāṃ ca pariṣadi jayamatir nāma māraputraḥ /
analyzed: tasyām ca pariṣadi jayamatiḥ nāma māra putraḥ
translated: And in that assembly, there was a son of Māra named Jayamati.

original: sa prāṃjalir bhūtvaivam āha /
analyzed: sa prāṃjaliḥ bhūtvā evam āha
translated: He, with folded hands, said this:

original: kiṃ durmanāḥ paramakopaviduṣṭacetā🔽no kalpadāha iha na cyutir adya te 'smāt /
analyzed: kim durmanāḥ parama kopa viduṣṭa cetāḥ  no kalpa dāhaḥ iha na cyutiḥ adya te smāt
translated: Why are you so unhappy, with your mind extremely angry and disturbed?🔽Is there no great fire here, or are you not falling from here today?

original: śatrur na cāsti tava kaścid iha pravṛddho
analyzed: śatruḥ na ca asti tava kaścid iha pravṛddhaḥ
translated: And do you have no powerful enemy here at all?

original: mohaṃ gato 'si kim ivānyamatir va kasmāt // /
analyzed: moham gataḥ si kim iva anya matiḥ kasmāt
translated: Why are you so confused, or why do you have another mind?

original: māraḥ prāha /
analyzed: māraḥ prāha
translated: Māra said:

original: na tvaṃ paśyasi śākyaputraviṣalañ chāyāniṣaṇṇaṃ drume
analyzed: na tvam paśyasi śākyaputra viṣalam chāyā niṣaṇṇam drume
translated: You do not see the son of the Śākyas sitting in the shade of a tree,

original: yad vākyaṃ vadasīha nāsti balavāñ chatrus tavety agrataḥ /
analyzed: yat vākyam vadasi iha na asti balavān śatruḥ tava iti agratas
translated: The one in front of whom you say these words: 'You have no powerful enemy.'

original: sarve tena śaṭhena caikabalinā saṃbhrāmitā naikaśo
analyzed: sarve tena śaṭhena ca eka balinā saṃbhrāmitāḥ na ekaśas
translated: All of us have been deceived many times by that single powerful deceiver.

original: aṅgāreṇa vayaṃ sutāś ca camavaḥ yadvad vidahyāmahe // /
analyzed: aṅgāreṇa vayam sutāḥ ca camavaḥ yadvat vidahyāmahe
translated: We and our sons and grandsons will be burned, as if by a coal.

original: vidvāṃso bahuśāstrakāvyaracanāvyagrāḥ samagrā drutam /
analyzed: vidvāṃsaḥ bahu śāstra kāvya racanā vyagrāḥ samagrāḥ drutam
translated: The wise ones, fully engaged in composing many treatises and poems, quickly

original: etaṃ śākyasutaṃ gatā dya śaramaṃ dharmāṅkuśenoddhṛtā
analyzed: etam śākya sutam gatā śaramam dharma aṅkuśena uddhṛtā
translated: Went to this son of the Śākyas, lifted up by the goad of the Dharma,

original: tatv eṣa priyavigrahaḥ śaṭhamatiḥ śatrur mamātyuddhataḥ // /🔽Kurumiya
analyzed: eṣa priya vigrahaḥ śaṭha matiḥ śatruḥ mama ati uddhataḥ  kurumiya
translated: This enemy of mine, of deceitful mind, is extremely arrogant.🔽[He] is very dear to [his] friends, [but] deceitful, [and] [his] mind is very arrogant.🔽[He] is very dear to [his] friends, [but] deceitful, [and] [his] mind is very arrogant.

original: etā vai paricārikāḥ priyatamāḥ protsṛjya māṃ niṣkṛpāḥ
analyzed: etāḥ vai paricārikāḥ priyatamāḥ protsṛjya mām niṣkṛpāḥ
translated: These are the most beloved attendants, having abandoned me without compassion,

original: bho bhos taṃ śramaṇaṃ gatā dya śaraṇaṃ kṛtvāpi māṃ sākṣiṇam /
analyzed: bho bhoḥ tam śramaṇam gatāḥ dya śaraṇam kṛtvā api mām sākṣiṇam
translated: Having made me a witness, they have gone today to that ascetic for refuge.

original: kuryāt kṛtsnam idaṃ bhavatrayam ataḥ śūnyaṃ śaṭho māyayā
analyzed: kuryāt kṛtsnam idam bhava trayam atas śūnyam śaṭhaḥ māyayā
translated: By his deceit, he would make this entire triple world empty through his magic.

original: bhasmīkurma ihādya yady atibalaṃ nāśu prayatnād vayaṃ // /
analyzed: bhasmīkurmaḥ iha adya yadi atibalam na āśu prayatnāt vayam
translated: If we do not quickly reduce him to ashes through our great strength, we will fail.

original: atha te sarve māraputrāḥ sagaṇapārṣadyāḥ prāñjalayo bhūtvaivam āhuḥ /
analyzed: atha te sarve māra putrāḥ sa gaṇa pārṣadyāḥ prāñjalayaḥ bhūtvā evam āhuḥ
translated: Then all those sons of Māra, together with their retinues and followers, with folded hands, said this:

original: evam astu yad asmākam ṛddhibalaviṣayānubhāvavikurvitaṃ sarvaṃ darśayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: evam astu yat asmākam ṛddhi bala viṣaya anubhāva vikurvitam sarvam darśayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Let it be so. We will show all our magical power, strength, and miraculous transformations.

original: yadi śakṣyāma etaṃ śākyaputraṃ bhasmīkartum ity evaṃ kuśalam /
analyzed: yadi śakṣyāmaḥ etam śākyaputram bhasmīkartum iti evam kuśalam
translated: If we are able to reduce that son of the Śākyas to ashes, then it will be good.

original: yady evaṃ na śakṣyāmas taṃ śaraṇaṃ gamiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yadi evam na śakṣyāmaḥ tam śaraṇam gamiṣyāmaḥ
translated: If we are not able to do so, then we will go for refuge to him.🔽[They said:]

original: svayam eva tāta pratyakṣo 'si yad vayaṃ mahāsainyaparivṛtāḥ prāg eva ekākinādvitīyenānena śākyaputreṇarddhibalena parājitāḥ kiṃ punar etarhy
analyzed: svayam eva tāta pratyakṣaḥ si yat vayam mahā sainya parivṛtāḥ prāk eva ekākinā advitīyena anena śākyaputreṇa ṛddhi balena parājitāḥ kim punar etarhi
translated: Father, you yourself are a witness to how we, surrounded by a great army, were previously defeated by this Śākyaputra alone, without a second, through his supernormal powers and strength, let alone now,

original: anekaparivāraparivṛtena /
analyzed: aneka parivāra parivṛtena
translated: when he is surrounded by a retinue of many.

original: māraḥ pāpīmān evam āha /
analyzed: māraḥ pāpīmān evam āha
translated: The evil Māra said this:

original: gacchata tāvad bhadramukhāḥ /
analyzed: gacchata tāvat bhadra mukhāḥ
translated: Go ahead, good sirs.

original: yadi śaknutainaṃ śramaṇaṃ gautamaṃ ghātayituṃ punar āgacchata //
analyzed: yadi śaknuta enam śramaṇam gautamam ghātayitum punar āgacchata
translated: If you can kill that monk Gautama, then come back.

original: atha na śaktās tathāpy āgacchata /
analyzed: atha na śaktāḥ tathā api āgacchata
translated: But if you can't, then come back anyway.

original: svabhavanaṃ punaḥ paripālayiṣyāmaḥ //
analyzed: sva bhavanam punar paripālayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will protect our own abode again.

original: atha māraparṣaddvādaśabiṃbarāṇi tato 'tikramya ita ūrdhvaṃ yāvac Kurumiya
analyzed: atha māra parṣad dvādaśa biṃbarāṇi tikramyaḥ itas ūrdhvam yāvat
translated: Then the assembly of Māra, twelve billion strong, surpassing that, from here upward to Kuru

original: caturāśītiṃ yojanasahasrāṇi spharitvā tādṛśaṃ mārabalariddhivegaṃ darśayām āsuḥ /
analyzed: catura aśītim yojana sahasrāṇi spharitvā tādṛśam māra bala ṛddhi vegam darśayām āsuḥ
translated: and extending to eighty-four thousand yojanas, displayed such a force of Māra's supernormal powers and speed.

original: sarvacāturdvīpikāyām ākāśaṃ mahākālameghair āpūrayām āsuḥ /
analyzed: sarva cāturdvīpikāyām ākāśam mahākāla meghaiḥ āpūrayām āsuḥ
translated: They filled the sky over the entire four-continent world with great black clouds.

original: mahākālavāyubhiś colkāpātaiś ca sumeruṃ parvatarājānaṃ pāṇibhiḥ parājaghnuḥ /
analyzed: mahākāla vāyubhiḥ ca ulkā pātaiḥ ca sumerum parvata rājānam pāṇibhiḥ parājaghnuḥ
translated: And with great black winds and falling meteors, they struck Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, with their hands.

original: sarvaṃ cāturdvīpikāṃ prakampayām āsuḥ /
analyzed: sarvam cāturdvīpikām prakampayām āsuḥ
translated: They made the entire four-continent world tremble.

original: paramabhairavāṃś ca śabdān samutsasarjuḥ /
analyzed: parama bhairavān ca śabdān samutsasarjuḥ
translated: And they let out the most terrifying sounds.

original: yato nāgā mahānāgāḥ yato yakṣā mahāyakṣāḥ sarvāvantyā mahāpṛthivyāḥ sagiriśailaparvatāyāḥ
analyzed: yatas nāgāḥ mahā nāgāḥ yatas yakṣāḥ mahā yakṣāḥ sarva avantyāḥ mahā pṛthivyāḥ sa giri śaila parvatāyāḥ
translated: From where the nāgas, great nāgas, from where the yakṣas, great yakṣas, from the entire great earth with its mountains, cliffs, and peaks,

original: sumeroś ca parvatarājñaḥ kaṃpaṃ viditvā sarasāṃ mahāsarasāṃ nadīkunadīmahānadīnāṃ
analyzed: sumeroḥ ca parvata rājñaḥ kaṃpam viditvā sarasām mahā sarasām nadī kunadī mahā nadīnām
translated: and from Mount Sumeru, the king of mountains, having sensed the trembling, and having known the agitation of the great lakes, rivers, small rivers, and great rivers,

original: mahāsamudrāṇāṃ ca saṃkṣobhaṃ jñātvā gaganatale tasthuḥ /
analyzed: mahā samudrāṇām ca saṃkṣobham jñātvā gagana tale tasthuḥ
translated: and of the great oceans, they stood in the sky.

original: sā ca māraparṣat sumerumūrdhani sthitvā yojanapramāṇāṃ vṛṣṭim abhinirmimīyāṃgamagadheṣu samutsasarja /
analyzed: sā ca māra parṣad sumeru mūrdhani sthitvā yojana pramāṇām vṛṣṭim samutsasarja
translated: And that assembly of Māra, having stood on the peak of Mount Sumeru, created a rain of the size of yokes, and let it fall on Magadha.

original: mahāntaṃ cāsimusalapāṣāṇatomarabhiṇḍipālanārācakṣuraprakṣuramukhakṣurakalpavāsimukhavāsidhārakarālacakravikarālacakradṛḍhakharaparuṣarūkṣavarṣaṃ
analyzed: mahāntam ca asi musala pāṣāṇa tomara bhiṇḍipāla nārāca kṣura prakṣura mukhakṣura kalpavāsi mukha vāsi dhāra karāla cakra vikarāla cakra dṛḍha khara paruṣa rūkṣa varṣam
translated: And having created a great rain of swords, clubs, stones, spears, javelins, arrows, razors, razor-mouths, razor-like grass, and sharp-edged weapons,

original: nirmāyotsasarja //
analyzed: nirmāya utsasarja
translated: they created and let it fall.

original: atha bhagavāṃś tasmin samaye māramaṇḍalavidhvaṃsanaṃ nāma samādhiṃ samāpade /
analyzed: atha bhagavān tasmin samaye māra maṇḍala vidhvaṃsanam nāma samādhim samāpade
translated: Then the Blessed One, at that time, entered the samādhi called Destroying the Circle of Māra.

original: yat sarvāṃ śilāpraharaṇavṛṣṭiṃ divyotpalapadmakumudapuṇḍarīkamāndāravamahāmāndāravapuṣpavṛṣṭim adhyatiṣṭhat /
analyzed: yat sarvām śilā praharaṇa vṛṣṭim divya utpala padma kumuda puṇḍarīka māndārava mahāmāndārava puṣpa vṛṣṭim adhyatiṣṭhat
translated: He transformed the entire rain of weapons into a rain of divine flowers such as utpala, padma, kumuda, pundarika, mandara, and great mandara flowers.

original: Kurumiya tāṃś ca śabdān nānāvādyān adhyatiṣṭhat /
analyzed: tān ca śabdān nānā vādyān adhyatiṣṭhat
translated: He transformed those sounds into the sounds of various musical instruments.

original: yad uta buddhaśabdaṃ dharmaśabdaṃ saṃghaśabdaṃ pāramitāśabdaṃ abhijñāśabdaṃ avaivartikaśabdaṃ
analyzed: yat uta buddha śabdam dharma śabdam saṃgha śabdam pāramitā śabdam abhijñā śabdam a vaivartika śabdam
translated: Namely, the sound of the Buddha, the sound of the Dharma, the sound of the Saṅgha, the sound of the perfections, the sound of the superknowledges, the sound of irreversibility,

original: abhiṣekaśabdaṃ caturmāraparājayaśabdaṃ bodhimaṇḍopasaṃkramaṇaśabdaṃ yāvat sopādānanirupādānaśabdān adhyatiṣṭhat //
analyzed: abhiṣeka śabdam catur māra parājaya śabdam bodhimaṇḍa upasaṃkramaṇa śabdam yāvat sa upādāna nirupādāna śabdān adhyatiṣṭhat
translated: the sound of consecration, the sound of the defeat of the four māras, the sound of approaching the seat of enlightenment, up to the sounds of those with appropriation and those without appropriation.

original: sarvā rajondhakāravāyavaḥ praśemuḥ /
analyzed: sarvāḥ rajaḥ ndhakāra vāyavaḥ praśemuḥ
translated: All dust, darkness, and winds were pacified.

original: ye kecid iha cāturdvīpike tṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatikṣitiśailaparvatās tān sarvān saptaratnamayān adhyatiṣṭhat //
analyzed: ye kecid iha cāturdvīpike tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspati kṣiti śaila parvatāḥ tān sarvān sapta ratna mayān adhyatiṣṭhat
translated: Whatever grasses, bushes, herbs, forests, earth, rocks, and mountains there are in this four-continent world, he transformed them all into the seven precious substances.

original: anavalokyamūrdhno bhagavān yāvad brahmalokaṃ kāyena vaśaṃ vartayām āsa /
analyzed: anavalokya mūrdhnaḥ bhagavān yāvat brahma lokam kāyena vaśam vartayām āsa
translated: The Blessed One, without looking up, brought his body under control up to the Brahma world.

original: ekaikasmāc ca lakṣaṇād bhagavatas tādṛśī prabhā niścacāra yayā prabhayā tṛsāhasramahāsāhasrī lokadhātur udāreṇāvabhāsena sphuṭo 'bhūt /
analyzed: ekaikasmāt ca lakṣaṇāt bhagavataḥ tādṛśī prabhā niścacāra yayā prabhayā lokadhātuḥ udāreṇa avabhāsena sphuṭaḥ bhūt
translated: And from each of these marks, such a radiance issued forth that the great trichiliocosm was filled with a vast light.

original: ye cāsyāṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasryāṃ lokadhātau devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragapretapiśācakumbhāṇḍamanuṣyāmanuṣyā
analyzed: ye ca asyām tri sāhasra mahā sāhasryām lokadhātau deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga preta piśāca kumbhāṇḍa manuṣya amanuṣyā
translated: And all the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, pretas, piśācas, kumbhāṇḍas, humans, and non-humans

original: nairayikā vā tairyagyonikā vā yāmalaukikā vā te sarve bhagavaṃtam adrākṣuḥ /
analyzed: nairayikāḥ vā tairyagyonikāḥ vā yāmalaukikāḥ vā te sarve bhagavaṃtam adrākṣuḥ
translated: in this great trichiliocosm, as well as those in the hells, animal realms, and worlds of Yama, all saw the Blessed One.

original: bahūni ca devanāgayakṣamanuṣyāmanuṣyaśatasahasrāṇi gaganasthāḥ puṣpair avakīrya pradakṣiṇaṃ cakruḥ stuvaṃto namaś cakruḥ /
analyzed: bahūni ca deva nāga yakṣa manuṣya amanuṣya śata sahasrāṇi gagana sthāḥ puṣpaiḥ avakīrya pradakṣiṇam cakruḥ stuvaṃtaḥ namaḥ cakruḥ
translated: And many hundreds of thousands of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, humans, and non-humans dwelling in the sky scattered flowers, circumambulated, praised, and made offerings.

original: bahūni ca nairayikatairyagyonikayāmalaukikākṣobhyakoṭīśatasahasrāṇi smṛtiṃ pratilebhire /
analyzed: bahūni ca nairayika tairyagyonika yāmalaukika akṣobhya koṭī śata sahasrāṇi smṛtim pratilebhire
translated: And many hundreds of thousands of millions of beings in the hells, animal realms, and worlds of Yama regained mindfulness.

original: pūrvāvaropitakuśalamūlam anusmṛtya namo buddhāyeti kṛtvā tebhyo Kurumiya
analyzed: pūrva avaropita kuśala mūlam anusmṛtya namaḥ buddhāya iti kṛtvā tebhyaḥ
translated: Remembering the roots of virtue planted in the past, saying Homage to the Buddha, they passed away from those lower realms

original: 'pāyebhyaś cavitvā deveṣūpapannāḥ //
analyzed: pāyebhyaḥ cavitvā deveṣu upapannāḥ
translated: and were reborn among the gods.

original: tataś ca mārasainyā dvāviṃśatimāraputraśatasahasrāṇi sagaṇapārṣadyāni bhagavata evaṃrūpaṃ
analyzed: tatas ca māra sainyāḥ dvāviṃśati māraputra śata sahasrāṇi sa gaṇa pārṣadyāni bhagavataḥ evaṃrūpam
translated: Then, the armies of Māra, the two hundred and twenty thousand sons of Māra with their retinues and attendants, having seen such a

original: prātihāryaṃ dṛṣṭvā bhagavato 'ntike 'tīva prasādaṃ pratilabdhvā yena bhagavāṃs tenopajagmuḥ /
analyzed: prātihāryam dṛṣṭvā bhagavataḥ ntike tīva prasādam pratilabdhvā yena bhagavān tena upajagmuḥ
translated: miracle of the Blessed One, having attained great faith in the Blessed One, approached the Blessed One.

original: upetya sārdhaṃ taiḥ paṃcabhir mārakanyāśatair bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandyāṃjalīn pragṛhyābhir gāthābhir adhibhāṣaṃte sma //
analyzed: upetya sārdham taiḥ paṃcabhiḥ māra kanyā śataiḥ bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya aṃjalīn pragṛhyābhiḥ gāthābhiḥ adhibhāṣaṃte sma
translated: Having approached, together with those five hundred daughters of Māra, they bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One, raised their joined palms, and addressed him with these verses:

original: viśuddhamūrte paramābhirūpa jñānodadhe kāṃcanamerutulya /
analyzed: viśuddha mūrte parama abhirūpa jñāna udadhe kāṃcana meru tulya
translated: O you of pure form, supremely handsome, ocean of knowledge, equal to the golden Mount Meru,

original: vitatya lokaṃ yaśasā vibhāsi tvām eva nāthaṃ śaraṇaṃ vrajāmaḥ // /
analyzed: vitatya lokam yaśasā vibhāsi tvām eva nātham śaraṇam vrajāmaḥ  /
translated: you shine with glory, illuminating the world. We go to you alone, O Lord, for refuge.

original: praṇaṣṭamārge vinimīlitākṣe ulkāyase tvaṃ jagatīva sūryaḥ /
analyzed: praṇaṣṭa mārge vinimīlita akṣe ulkāyase tvam jagatī iva sūryaḥ
translated: When the path is lost and the eyes are closed, you shine like the sun in the world.

original: aparājitaprāṇabhṛd ekabandho tvāṃ sārthavāhaṃ śaraṇaṃ vrajāmaḥ // /
analyzed: aparājita prāṇabhṛt ekabandho tvām sārthavāham śaraṇam vrajāmaḥ
translated: O unconquered one, sole friend of living beings, we go to you, O caravan leader, for refuge.

original: susaṃbhṛtajñānasamṛddhakośa nabhaḥsvabhāvādivimuktacitta /
analyzed: su saṃbhṛta jñāna samṛddha kośa nabhaḥ svabhāva ādi vimukta citta
translated: O you whose treasure of knowledge is well-accumulated, whose mind is liberated like the sky,

original: karuṇāśaya snigdhamanojñavākya sarvārthasiddhaṃ śaraṇaṃ vrajāmaḥ // /
analyzed: karuṇa āśaya snigdha manojña vākya sarva artha siddham śaraṇam vrajāmaḥ
translated: O you whose intention is compassion, whose speech is affectionate and pleasing, we go for refuge to you, O Siddhārtha.

original: saṃsārakāntāravimokṣaks tvaṃ sāmagrito hetuphalapradarśakaḥ /🔽Kurumiya
analyzed: saṃsāra kāntāra vimokṣakaḥ tvam sāmagritaḥ hetu phala pradarśakaḥ  kurumiya
translated: You are the liberator from the wilderness of saṃsāra, showing the causes and effects in their entirety.

original: maitrāvihārī paramavidhijña karuṇāvihārīṃś charaṇam vrajāmaḥ // /
analyzed: maitrāvihārī parama vidhi jña karuṇā vihārīn śaraṇam vrajāmaḥ
translated: [You are] the one who abides in loving-kindness, knowing the supreme method, we go for refuge to the one who abides in compassion.

original: māyāmarīcidagacandrasannibhe bhave 'prasaktāviṣayāśrayeṇa /
analyzed: māyā marīci daga candra sannibhe bhave prasakta a viṣaya āśrayeṇa
translated: In existence, which is like an illusion, a mirage, or the moon in water, we are not attached to objects,

original: ajñānarugnāśaka lokanātha tvāṃ vaidyarājaṃ śaraṇaṃ vrajāmaḥ // /
analyzed: ajñāna ruj nāśaka lokanātha tvām vaidya rājam śaraṇam vrajāmaḥ
translated: we go for refuge to you, the king of physicians, the lord of the world, who cures the illness of ignorance.

original: tvaṃ setubhūtaś caturaughamadhyād uttārakaḥ saptadhanāryavṛttaiḥ /
analyzed: tvam setu bhūtaḥ catur augha madhyāt uttārakaḥ sapta dhana ārya vṛttaiḥ
translated: You are the bridge in the middle of the four currents, the liberator through the seven riches and noble conduct,

original: sanmārgasandarśaka lokabandho kṛpānvitaṃ tvām iha pūjayāmaḥ // /
analyzed: sat mārga sandarśaka loka bandho kṛpā anvitam tvām iha pūjayāmaḥ
translated: we worship you here, the compassionate one, the friend of the world who shows the true path.

original: kṣamyāmahe tvāṃ vayam agrabudddhim āsaṃ praduṣṭās tvayi yad vayaṃ tu /
analyzed: kṣamyāmahe tvām vayam agra buddhim āsam praduṣṭāḥ tvayi yat vayam tu
translated: We forgive you, O foremost of beings, that we were hostile towards you.

original: tam atyayaṃ vīra gṛhāṇa nātha tvam ekabandhur jagati pradhānaḥ // /
analyzed: tam atyayam vīra gṛhāṇa nātha tvam eka bandhuḥ jagati pradhānaḥ
translated: Hero, lord, accept that transgression, you are the sole kinsman and chief in the world.

original: vayaṃ samutsṛjya hi mārapakṣam utpādayāmo varabodhicittam
analyzed: vayam samutsṛjya hi māra pakṣam utpādayāmaḥ vara bodhi cittam
translated: Having abandoned the side of Māra, we arouse the supreme mind of awakening,

original: nimaṃtrayāmaḥ kila sarvasattvān Kurumiya
analyzed: nimaṃtrayāmaḥ kila sarva sattvān
translated: we invite all beings, [saying]

original: bodhiṃ labhemo vayam uttamātu // /
analyzed: bodhim labhemaḥ vayam
translated: May we attain the supreme awakening.

original: nidarśayāsmākam udāracaryāṃ yathā vayaṃ pāramitāś carema /
analyzed: nidarśaya asmākam udāra caryām yathā vayam pāramitāḥ carema
translated: Show us the conduct of the great beings, so that we may practice the perfections.

original: ananyavādaiḥ katibhis tu dharmaiḥ samanvitā bodhim avāpnuvaṃti // /
analyzed: ananya vādaiḥ katibhiḥ tu dharmaiḥ samanvitāḥ bodhim avāpnuvanti
translated: By how many other teachings, not mentioned, do those endowed with them attain enlightenment?

original: puṣpāṇi yat te 'bhimukhaṃ kṣipāmaś chatrāṇi tāny eva tu sarvadikṣu /
analyzed: puṣpāṇi yat te bhimukham kṣipāmaḥ chatrāṇi tāni eva tu sarva dikṣu
translated: The flowers we scatter before you become parasols in all directions.

original: tiṣṭhaṃtu mūrdhni dvipadottamānāṃ kṣetreṣu sarvartusukhākareṣu // /
analyzed: tiṣṭhantu mūrdhni dvipada uttamānām kṣetreṣu sarva ṛtu sukha ākareṣu
translated: May they remain above the heads of the best of two-legged beings, in all the fields that are sources of happiness in all seasons.

original: atha khalu te sarve māraputrā mārakanyāḥ sagaṇapārṣadyā bhagavantaṃ muktakusumair abhyavākiran /
analyzed: atha khalu te sarve māra putrāḥ māra kanyāḥ sa gaṇa pārṣadyāḥ bhagavantam mukta kusumaiḥ abhyavākiran
translated: Then all those sons and daughters of Mara, together with their retinues and followers, scattered loose flowers over the Blessed One.

original: tāni ca muktakusumāni bhagavata riddhyanubhāvenānekāni koṭīniyutasahasrāṇi gaṃgānadīvālukādhikāni puṣpacchatrāṇi saṃtiṣṭhaṃte sma /
analyzed: tāni ca mukta kusumāni bhagavataḥ ṛddhi anubhāvena anekāni koṭī niyuta sahasrāṇi gaṃgā nadī vālukā adhikāni puṣpa chatrāṇi saṃtiṣṭhaṃte sma
translated: And by the Blessed One's power of supernormal knowledge, those loose flowers became many koṭis of niyutas of thousands of parasols, more than the sands of the Ganges river.

original: tāni puṣpacchatrāṇi daśasu dikṣu sarvabuddhānāṃ tiṣṭhatāṃ yāpayatāṃ mūrdhasandhāv upary antarīkṣe tasthuḥ /
analyzed: tāni puṣpa chatrāṇi daśasu dikṣu sarva buddhānām tiṣṭhatām yāpayatām mūrdha sandhau upari antarīkṣe tasthuḥ
translated: Those flower parasols remained in the sky above the crowns of all the Buddhas in the ten directions who were present and living.

original: svayaṃ ca tā mārakanyāḥ sagaṇapārṣadyāḥ adrākṣuḥ /
analyzed: svayam ca tāḥ māra kanyāḥ sa gaṇa pārṣadyāḥ adrākṣuḥ
translated: And those daughters of Mara, together with their retinues and followers, saw

original: daśasu dikṣu sarvabuddhakṣetreṣv asaṃkhyeyeṣv Kurumiya
analyzed: daśasu dikṣu sarva buddhakṣetreṣu asaṃkhyeyeṣu
translated: in the innumerable Buddha-fields in the ten directions, in the world systems of a billion worlds, in the eastern direction alone,

original: aprameyeṣu buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ tiṣṭhatāṃ yāpayatāṃ dharmaṃ deśayatāṃ pariṣadā parivṛtānāṃ
analyzed: aprameyeṣu buddhānām bhagavatām tiṣṭhatām yāpayatām dharmam deśayatām pariṣadā parivṛtānām
translated: In the immeasurable buddha-fields of the blessed buddhas who abide, live, and teach the Dharma, surrounded by their assemblies,

original: bhāṣatāṃ tapatāṃ virocatāṃ sanniṣaṇṇānāṃ tāni puṣpacchatrāṇy upary antarīkṣe mūrdhasandhau saṃsthitāni /
analyzed: bhāṣatām tapatām virocatām sanniṣaṇṇānām tāni puṣpa chatrāṇi upari antarīkṣe mūrdha sandhau saṃsthitāni
translated: those flower parasols were seen suspended in the sky above the crowns of their heads.

original: te ca buddhā bhagavantaḥ samavarṇāḥ samaliṃgāḥ samarūpāḥ samadarśanāḥ /
analyzed: te ca buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ sama varṇāḥ sama liṃgāḥ sama rūpāḥ sama darśanāḥ
translated: And those blessed buddhas were of the same color, the same characteristics, the same form, and the same appearance.

original: kevalaṃ teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ siṃhāsananānātvaṃ pariṣadānānātvaṃ buddhakṣetraguṇavyūhanānātvaṃ dadṛśuḥ /
analyzed: kevalam teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām siṃhāsana nānātvam pariṣadā nānātvam buddhakṣetra guṇa vyūha nānātvam dadṛśuḥ
translated: They only saw the difference in the lion thrones, the difference in the assemblies, and the difference in the arrays of qualities in the buddha-fields of those blessed buddhas.

original: te ca teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ svaramaṇḍalapādavyāhāram aśrauṣuḥ /
analyzed: te ca teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām svara maṇḍala pāda vyāhāram aśrauṣuḥ
translated: And they heard the melodious speech of those blessed buddhas.

original: sā ca māraparṣad bhagavato 'nubhāvenaivaṃrūpaṃ prātihāryaṃ dṛṣṭvā paramaprītiprasādajātā bhagavataḥ pādau śirobhir vanditvā purato niṣaṇṇā
analyzed: sā ca māra parṣad bhagavataḥ nubhāvena evaṃrūpam prātihāryam dṛṣṭvā parama prīti prasāda jātā bhagavataḥ pādau śirobhiḥ vanditvā puratas niṣaṇṇā
translated: And that assembly of Māra, having seen such a marvelous display through the power of the Blessed One, became filled with supreme joy and faith. They bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One and sat down in front of him.

original: atha khalu teṣāṃ māraputrāṇāṃ sagaṇapārṣadyānāṃ daśabiṃbarāṇi pratinivartya mārabhavane evaṃ vṛttāntaṃ mārāya pāpīmate vistareṇāvocann iti
analyzed: atha khalu teṣām māra putrāṇām sa gaṇa pārṣadyānām daśa biṃbarāṇi pratinivartya māra bhavane evam vṛttāntam mārāya pāpīmate vistareṇa avocan iti
translated: Then those sons of Māra, together with their retinues and followers, turned back from the ten bimbaras and told Māra, the evil one, in detail about what had happened in his abode:

original: ekaromakūpam api vayaṃ tasya śravaṇasya gautamasya na śaktā vidhvaṃsayitum iti //
analyzed: eka romakūpam api vayam tasya śravaṇasya gautamasya na śaktāḥ vidhvaṃsayitum iti
translated: We are not able to destroy even a single pore of that Śramana Gautama's skin.

original: bhūyaś ca viṃśatisahasrāṇi tam eva śaraṇaṃ jagmuḥ tasyaiva cāgrato niṣaṇṇā dharmaśravaṇāya //
analyzed: bhūyas ca viṃśati sahasrāṇi tam eva śaraṇam jagmuḥ tasya eva ca agratas niṣaṇṇāḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: And again, twenty thousand of them went for refuge to him alone and sat down in front of him to listen to the Dharma.

original: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīmān bhūyasyā mātrayā caṇḍībhūto duḥkhito durmanā vipratisāry evam āha //
analyzed: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīmān bhūyasyā mātrayā caṇḍībhūtaḥ duḥkhitaḥ durmanāḥ vipratisārī evam āha
translated: Then Māra, the evil one, became even more angry, miserable, and distressed, and said this with regret:

original: lakṣmī gatā mama punar na paraiti tāvad yāvat kṛto 'sya na śākyasutasya nāśaḥ
analyzed: lakṣmī gatā mama punar na paraiti tāvat yāvat kṛtaḥ sya na śākya sutasya nāśaḥ
translated: My glory has departed and does not return as long as this son of the Śākyas is not destroyed.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: tūṣṇīṃ sthitā vayam ananyamanaḥpratarkāḥ śākyātmajaṃ kathaṃ im' /
analyzed: tūṣṇīm sthitāḥ vayam an anya manaḥ pratarkāḥ śākya ātmajam katham im
translated: We remain silent, with our minds not thinking of anything else, how can we kill the son of the Śākyas?

original: adya tu ghātayema // /
analyzed: adya tu ghātayema
translated: But today we will kill him.

original: atha māraḥ pāpīmān durmanaska eva śokāgāre niṣaṇṇaḥ //
analyzed: atha māraḥ pāpīmān durmanaskaḥ eva śokāgāre niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: Then Māra, the evil one, sat down in the house of sorrow, being unhappy.

original: mahāyānasūtrād ratnaketumārajihmīkaraṇaparivarto nāma prathamaḥ //
analyzed: mahāyāna sūtrāt ratnaketumārajihmīkaraṇaparivartaḥ nāma prathamaḥ
translated: From the Mahāyāna Sūtra, the first chapter named Dimming the Splendor of Māra in the Ratnaketu Sūtra.

original: Kurumiya II /
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃyi II.

original: atha tā mārakanyā māraputrāś ca sagaṇapāriṣadyā bhagavantam evam āhuḥ /🔽arthikā vayaṃ bhagavann anenaivaṃrūpeṇa yānena ca jñānena ca riddhyā kṛpayopāyena pratibhānena ca āścaryaṃ bhagavan yāvad upāyajñānasamanvāgatas
analyzed: atha tāḥ māra kanyāḥ māra putrāḥ ca sa gaṇa pāriṣadyāḥ bhagavantam evam āhuḥ  arthikāḥ vayam bhagavan anena evaṃrūpeṇa yānena ca jñānena ca riddhyā kṛpayā upāyena pratibhānena ca āścaryam bhagavan yāvat upāya jñāna samanvāgataḥ
translated: Then those daughters of Māra, the sons of Māra, together with their retinues, said this to the Blessed One:

original: tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: tathāgataḥ
translated: Blessed One, we are desirous of this kind of vehicle, and of this knowledge, of this magical power, of this compassion, of this skillful means, and of this eloquence. It is amazing, Blessed One, how the Tathāgata is endowed with the knowledge of skillful means.

original: katamair bhagavan dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ puruṣapudgalo na ca pāpamitrahastaṃ gacchati /
analyzed: katamaiḥ bhagavan dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ puruṣa pudgalaḥ na ca pāpa mitra hastam gacchati
translated: Blessed One, what are the qualities possessed by a person who does not fall into the hands of evil friends,

original: kṣipraṃ cānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate //
analyzed: kṣipram ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: and who quickly awakens to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment?

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: caturbhir dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ kulaputrā ihaikatyapuruṣapudgalo na pāpamitrahastaṃ gacchati /
analyzed: caturbhiḥ dharmaiḥ samanvāgataḥ kula putrāḥ iha ekatya puruṣa pudgalaḥ na pāpa mitra hastam gacchati
translated: Noble sons, a certain person who is endowed with four qualities does not fall into the hands of evil friends,

original: kṣipraṃ cānuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate /
analyzed: kṣipram ca anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim abhisaṃbudhyate
translated: and quickly awakens to unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: katamaiś caturbhiḥ /
analyzed: katamaiḥ caturbhiḥ
translated: And what are the four?

original: iha bhadramukhāḥ kulaputraḥ sarvadharmān na parāmārṣṭi /
analyzed: iha bhadra mukhāḥ kula putraḥ sarva dharmān na parāmārṣṭi
translated: Here, good sirs, a noble son does not grasp at any dharma,

original: na ca kvacid dharmam udgṛhṇāti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati na kalpayati na vikalpayati
analyzed: na ca kvacid dharmam udgṛhṇāti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati na kalpayati na vikalpayati
translated: does not accept any dharma, does not stand in any dharma, does not imagine any dharma, does not discriminate any dharma,

original: yad uta dānapāramitāyāṃ caran na dānaphalaṃ riñcati nodgṛhṇāti nopādatte nādhitiṣṭhati
analyzed: yat uta dāna pāramitāyām caran na dāna phalam riñcati na udgṛhṇāti na upādatte na adhitiṣṭhati
translated: That is to say, while practicing the perfection of generosity, he does not abandon the fruit of generosity, does not grasp it, does not accept it, does not abide in it,

original: na kalpayati na vikalpayati yāvat prajñāpāramitāyām api caran yāvan na kalpayati na vikalpayati //🔽punar aparaṃ bhadramukhāḥ sa kulaputro na sattvavādī bhavati na jīvavādī na poṣavādī Kurumiya
analyzed: na kalpayati na vikalpayati yāvat prajñāpāramitāyām api caran yāvat na kalpayati na vikalpayati  punar aparam bhadra mukhāḥ sa kula putraḥ na sattva vādī bhavati na jīva vādī na poṣa vādī
translated: does not conceptualize it, and does not discriminate it, up to while practicing the perfection of wisdom, he does not conceptualize it and does not discriminate it.

original: na pudgalavādī na sattvadhātuṃ manasā parāmārṣṭi yāvan na kalpayati na vikalpayati //
analyzed: na pudgala vādī na sattvadhātum manasā parāmārṣṭi yāvat na kalpayati na vikalpayati
translated: Moreover, O good sirs, that noble son does not speak of beings, does not speak of life, does not speak of nourishment, does not speak of a person, and does not mentally touch the realm of beings, up to he does not conceptualize and does not discriminate.

original: punar aparaṃ bhadramukhāḥ sa kulaputro na rūpaśabdagandharasaspraṣṭavyāni parāmārṣṭi yāvan na kalpayati na vikalpayati //🔽punar aparaṃ bhadramukhāḥ sa kulaputraḥ sarvatryadhvatraidhātukaskandhadhātvāyatanānāṃ
analyzed: punar aparam bhadra mukhāḥ sa kula putraḥ na rūpa śabda gandha rasa spraṣṭavyāni parāmārṣṭi yāvat na kalpayati na vikalpayati  punar aparam bhadra mukhāḥ sa kula putraḥ sarva tri adhva traidhātuka skandha dhātu āyatanānām
translated: Moreover, O good sirs, that noble son does not touch forms, sounds, smells, tastes, and tactile objects, up to he does not conceptualize and does not discriminate.🔽Moreover, O good sirs, that noble son does not touch the causes, supports, and results of the arising of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases of the entire three times and three realms, up to he does not conceptualize and does not discriminate.

original: hetupratyālaṃbanaphalavipākasamutthānāśrayotpādān na parāmārṣṭi yāvan na kalpayati na vikalpayati //
analyzed: hetu pratyālaṃbana phala vipāka samutthāna āśraya utpādān na parāmārṣṭi yāvat na kalpayati na vikalpayati
translated: Moreover, O good sirs, that noble son does not touch the causes, supports, and results of the arising of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases of the entire three times and three realms, up to he does not conceptualize and does not discriminate.

original: tat kutaḥ / sarvajñajñānaṃ sarvacaryādhiṣṭhānaviṣayakalpavikalparahitam anupalambhayogena ca kartavyaṃ //
analyzed: tat kutas sarvajña jñānam sarva caryā adhiṣṭhāna viṣaya kalpa vikalpa rahitam anupalambha yogena ca kartavyam
translated: Why is that? The knowledge of the Omniscient One should be made without conceptualization or discrimination regarding the basis and object of all practices, and by the yoga of non-apprehension.

original: abhāvā bhadramukhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ sarvajñatā ca yāvad aghoṣānimittānakṣarāpraṇihitānutpādānirodhālakṣaṇāsaṃgānupalaṃbhanādarśanā
analyzed: abhāvāḥ bhadra mukhāḥ sarva dharmāḥ sarvajña tā ca yāvat a ghoṣa a nimitta anakṣara apraṇihita anutpāda anirodha alakṣaṇa asaṃga anupalaṃbhana adarśanā
translated: Good friends, all phenomena and omniscience are non-existent, nameless, signless, without vows, unborn, unceasing, without characteristics, unattached, non-apprehended,

original: viviktā nirātmā alakṣaṇāpagatākṣaṇavyupaśāntā atamānālokāsthānāviṣayānīśvarāpakṣāpratipakṣā
analyzed: viviktā nirātmā alakṣaṇa apagata akṣaṇa vyupaśāntā atamāna aloka asthāna aviṣaya anīśvara apakṣa apratipakṣā
translated: unseen, isolated, without self, without characteristics, devoid of characteristics, pacified, without darkness or light, without location, without domain, without an opposing side, without a counteragent,

original: acintyānāhārāmatsarāprapañcārajāvirajaniravayavā niṣkiṃcanākārakāvedakānāśrayāgrāhyāvijñaptikāpratibhāsākṣaṇikā
analyzed: acintya anāhāra amatsara aprapañca araja aviraja niravayavā niṣkiṃcana akārakā avedakā anāśrayā agrāhyā avijñaptikā apratibhāsā akṣaṇikā
translated: inconceivable, without food, without stinginess, without conceptual proliferation, without birth or defilement, without parts, worthless, without an agent or experiencer, without a basis, ungraspable, imperceptible, insubstantial,

original: bhadramukhāḥ sarvajñatā gaganasamā śūnyānupalambhayogenānadhiṣṭhānayogenāparāmārśayogenākalpāvikalpayogena
analyzed: bhadra mukhāḥ sarvajña tā gagana samā śūnyā anupalambha yogena anadhiṣṭhāna yogena aparāmārśa yogena akalpa avikalpa yogena
