original: tena yūyaṃ kāyavāṅmanoduścaritena karmaṇā pūrvaṃ tṛṣv apāyeṣv aneke kalpāḥ duḥkhāny anubhūtavantaḥ /
analyzed: tena yūyam kāya vāc manaḥ duścaritena karmaṇā pūrvam tṛṣu apāyeṣu aneke kalpāḥ duḥkhāni anubhūtavantaḥ
translated: Therefore, you have experienced suffering for many eons in the three lower realms due to that unwholesome bodily, verbal, and mental action.

original: tenaiva karmāvaraṇenaitarhi mārasya pāpīmato bhavane upapannā iti //
analyzed: tena eva karma āvaraṇena etarhi mārasya pāpīmataḥ bhavane upapannāḥ iti
translated: By that very karmic obscuration, you have now been reborn in the abode of the evil Mara.

original: asmiṃ khalu punā ratnaketudhāraṇīpūrvayoge bhāṣyamāṇe bhagavatā śākyamuninā tathāgatena
analyzed: asmin khalu punar ratnaketu dhāraṇī pūrva yoge bhāṣyamāṇe bhagavatā śākyamuninā tathāgatena
translated: When this past life of the Ratnaketu Dharani was being spoken by the Blessed One, the Tathagata Shakyamuni,

original: teṣāṃ paṃcānāṃ mārakanyāśatānāṃ strībhāvam antardhāya puruṣabhāvaḥ saṃvṛtto 'nutpattikadharmakṣāntipratilaṃbhāś cābhūvan /
analyzed: teṣām paṃcānām māra kanyā śatānām strī bhāvam antardhāya puruṣa bhāvaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ nutpattikadharmakṣānti pratilaṃbhāḥ ca abhūvan
translated: the female forms of those five hundred daughters of Mara disappeared and they became men, and they attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: apramāṇānām asaṃkhyeyānāṃ sattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇāṃ sadevamānuṣāyāḥ Kurumiya
analyzed: apramāṇānām asaṃkhyeyānām sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇām sa deva mānuṣāyāḥ
translated: Innumerable, countless hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of beings, together with the devas, humans, and asuras of this Jambudvipa,

original: prajāyā anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittāny utpannāny avaivartyāś cābhūvann anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau /
analyzed: prajāyāḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittāni utpannāni avaivartyāḥ ca abhūvan anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: generated the mind of unexcelled perfect enlightenment and became irreversible from unexcelled perfect enlightenment.

original: evam aprameyāsaṃkhyeyāni sattvakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi śrāvakapratyekabuddhayāne 'vaivartya abhūvan /
analyzed: evam aprameya asaṃkhyeyāni sattva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi śrāvaka pratyekabuddha yāne abhūvan
translated: In the same way, innumerable, countless hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of beings became irreversible from the Hearer and Solitary Realizer vehicles.

original: aprameyāsaṃkhyeyānāṃ devamānuṣyakanyānāṃ mātṛgrāmabhāvo vinivṛttaḥ puruṣabhāvāśrayapratilābhaś cābhūt //
analyzed: aprameya asaṃkhyeyānām deva mānuṣya kanyānām mātṛgrāma bhāvaḥ vinivṛttaḥ puruṣa bhāva āśraya pratilābhaḥ ca abhūt
translated: The state of being a woman for innumerable, countless gods and humans ceased, and they attained the state of being a man.

original: ratnaketuparivartād dvitīyaḥ pūrvayogaparivartaḥ samāptaḥ //
analyzed: ratnaketu parivartāt dvitīyaḥ pūrva yoga parivartaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: The second chapter on past connections is concluded from the chapter on the Ratnaketu dhāraṇī.

original: Kurumiya III /
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya III.

original: atha khalv asyāṃ ratnaketudhāraṇyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ śākyamuninā tathāgatenaitarhi sarvāvatīyaṃ sahālokadhātur udāreṇāvabhāsena sphuṭābhūt /
analyzed: atha khalu asyām ratnaketudhāraṇyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām śākyamuninā tathāgatena etarhi sarvāvatī iyam sahā lokadhātuḥ udāreṇa avabhāsena sphuṭā abhūt
translated: Now, when this Ratnaketu dhāraṇī was being taught by the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, this entire Sahā world realm was filled with a vast light.

original: yac ceha buddhakṣetre koṭīśataṃ cāturdvīpikānāṃ teṣu koṭīśataṃ kāmeśvarāṇāṃ māratvaṃ kārayaṃti /
analyzed: yat ca iha buddhakṣetre koṭī śatam cāturdvīpikānām teṣu koṭī śatam kāmeśvarāṇām māratvam kārayaṃti
translated: And in this Buddha-field, in the hundred koṭīs of four-continent worlds, the hundred koṭīs of Kāmeśvaras were acting as Māras.

original: te buddhānubhāvena saṃvignā imāṃ cāturdvīpikāṃ vyavalokayaṃti sma /
analyzed: te buddha anubhāvena saṃvignāḥ imām cāturdvīpikām vyavalokayaṃti sma
translated: Through the Buddha's power, they were alarmed and looked down upon this four-continent world.

original: kuto 'yam avabhāsa utpannaḥ /
analyzed: kutas yam avabhāsaḥ utpannaḥ
translated: From where did this light arise?

original: nūnaṃ pāpīmān nāma māro yas tatra cāturdvīpikāyāṃ prativasati tasyaiṣa prabhāvaḥ so 'smatto balavattara īśvarataro mahaujaskataraś ca /
analyzed: nūnam pāpīmān nāma māraḥ yaḥ tatra cāturdvīpikāyām prativasati tasya eṣa prabhāvaḥ saḥ smattaḥ balavattaraḥ īśvarataraḥ mahaujaskataraḥ ca
translated: Surely it is the Māra named Pāpīyān who resides in that four-continent world. This is his power. He is stronger than us, more powerful, and has greater splendor.

original: atha khalu te mārā vyavalokayanto 'drākṣuḥ taṃ māraṃ pāpīmantaṃ śokāgāre niṣaṇṇaṃ paramadurmanasthaṃ //
analyzed: atha khalu te mārāḥ vyavalokayantaḥ drākṣuḥ tam māram pāpīmantam śokāgāre niṣaṇṇam parama durmana stham
translated: Then those Māras, looking around, saw that evil Māra sitting in a house of sorrow, extremely unhappy.

original: atha tat koṭīśataṃ mārāṇāṃ yeneyaṃ cāturdvīpikā yena mārasya pāpīmato bhavanaṃ tenopajagāmopetya māraṃ pāpīmantam evam āha /
analyzed: atha tat koṭī śatam mārāṇām yena iyam cāturdvīpikā yena mārasya pāpīmataḥ bhavanam tena upajagāma upetya māram pāpīmantam evam āha
translated: Then that hundred koṭis of Māras approached this four-continent world, to the abode of the evil Māra. Having approached, they said this to the evil Māra:

original: kiṃ bho kāmeśvara sarvāvatīyaṃ lokadhātur avabhāsitā tvaṃ ca śokāgāraṃ praviśya niṣaṇṇaḥ //
analyzed: kim bho kāmeśvara sarvāvatī iyam lokadhātuḥ avabhāsitā tvam ca śokāgāram praviśya niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: What is it, O Lord of Desire, that this entire world sphere is illuminated, and you, having entered a house of sorrow, are sitting?

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: atha kāmeśvaro māras teṣāṃ mārakoṭīśatānāṃ vistareṇārocayati sma /
analyzed: atha kāmeśvaraḥ māraḥ teṣām māra koṭī śatānām vistareṇa ārocayati sma
translated: Then the Lord of Desire, Māra, in detail informed those hundred koṭis of Māras:

original: yat khalu mārṣā jānīyur iha bho śramaṇa utpannaḥ śākyavaṃśāt paramaśaṭhaḥ māyāvī /
analyzed: yat khalu mārṣāḥ jānīyuḥ iha bho śramaṇaḥ utpannaḥ śākya vaṃśāt parama śaṭhaḥ māyāvī
translated: You should know, friends, that here, a Śramaṇa has arisen, extremely deceitful and deceptive, from the Śākya family.

original: tenotpannamātreṇa sarvāvatīyaṃ sahālokadhātur avabhāsitā prakaṃpitā kṣobhitā /
analyzed: tena utpanna mātreṇa sarvāvatī iyam sahā lokadhātuḥ avabhāsitā prakaṃpitā kṣobhitā
translated: As soon as he was born, this entire Sahā world sphere was illuminated, shaken, and agitated.

original: ye kecid iha kṛtsnalokadhātuvidvāṃso brahmendrā vā nāgendra vā yakṣendrā vāsurendrā
analyzed: ye kecid iha kṛtsna lokadhātu vidvāṃsaḥ brahma indrāḥ vā nāga indra vā yakṣa indrāḥ vā asura indrāḥ
translated: Whatever wise ones there are in this entire world sphere, whether Brahmā lords, Nāga lords, Yakṣa lords, Asura lords,

original: vā mahoragendrā vā garuḍendrā vā kinnarendrā vā yāvad anye 'pi kecin manuṣyāmanuṣyā
analyzed: vā mahoraga indrāḥ vā garuḍa indrāḥ vā kinnara indrāḥ vā yāvat anye kecid manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ
translated: or great nāga kings, or great Garuḍa kings, or great kinnara kings, or whatever other humans or non-humans

original: vidvāṃsas te sarve tam upāgatāḥ pūjākarmaṇe yāvat ṣaḍvarṣāṇy ekākyadvitīyā niṣadyālakṣaṇāṃ māyaṃ sādhitavān /
analyzed: vidvāṃsaḥ te sarve tam upāgatāḥ pūjā karmaṇe yāvat ṣaṣ varṣāṇi ekākī advitīyāḥ niṣadyā lakṣaṇām mā ayam sādhitavān
translated: there are, all those wise ones approached him to perform worship, and for six years he sat alone, without a second, and accomplished the illusion with characteristics.

original: ahaṃ ca svabalasaṃdarśanaṃ cikīrṣur evaṃ ṣaṭtriṃśatkoṭīsainyaparivāra upasaṃkramya🔽samaṃtato 'nuparivārya sarvamārabalavikurvaṇarddhivīryaparākramaṃ saṃdarśitavān ekaromakūpam
analyzed: aham ca sva bala saṃdarśanam cikīrṣuḥ evam ṣaṭtriṃśat koṭī sainya parivāraḥ upasaṃkramya  samaṃtataḥ nu parivārya sarva māra bala vikurvaṇa ṛddhi vīrya parākramam saṃdarśitavān eka romakūpam
translated: And I, desiring to show my own power, surrounded by an army of thirty-six koṭis, approached🔽and surrounded him on all sides, and displayed all the magic, power, strength, and valor of Māra's army, but I was not able to frighten or terrify even one hair on his body.

original: apy aham aśakto 'sya saṃtrāsayituṃ vā bhīṣayituṃ vā kim aṃga punas tasmād āsanāt
analyzed: api aham aśaktaḥ sya saṃtrāsayitum vā bhīṣayitum vā kim aṃga punar tasmāt āsanāt
translated: How much less could I shake him from his seat,

original: kaṃpayituṃ kiṃ vā punar anyaṃ vighātaṃ kartum ity atha cet tena vṛṣalena tādṛśī māyā
analyzed: kaṃpayitum kim vā punar anyam vighātam kartum iti atha ced tena vṛṣalena tādṛśī māyā
translated: or do any other harm? But then, if that low-caste man displayed such an illusion

original: pradarśitā pṛthivīkaṃpaś ca kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: pradarśitā pṛthivī kaṃpaḥ ca kṛtaḥ
translated: and caused the earth to quake,

original: yat sasainyo 'haṃ parājitaḥ chinnavṛkṣa iva dharaṇītale nipatitaḥ /
analyzed: yat sa sainyaḥ ham parājitaḥ chinna vṛkṣaḥ iva dharaṇī tale nipatitaḥ
translated: I was defeated with my army, and fell to the ground like a tree cut down.

original: tena ca tatraiva Kurumiya
analyzed: tena ca tatra eva kurumiya
translated: And there, in that very place, he made a vow:🔽If I am a Bodhisattva, may the earth quake six times.

original: niṣaṇṇena tādṛśī alakṣaṇā māyā sādhitā yat sarvamāraviṣayam abhibhūya sādhitavidyas tasmād utthāya sattvebhyaḥ saṃprakāśayām āsa /
analyzed: niṣaṇṇena tādṛśī alakṣaṇā māyā sādhitā yat sarva māra viṣayam abhibhūya sādhita vidyaḥ tasmāt utthāya sattvebhyaḥ saṃprakāśayām āsa
translated: While sitting, he accomplished such a magical creation without characteristics that he overpowered the entire domain of Māra. Having accomplished the knowledge, he arose from that and taught it to beings.

original: ye ca kecid iha cāturdvīpikāyāṃ lokadhātau paṇḍitā vijñāḥ sattvās tathā māyayāvarjitā yathā cittam apy ahaṃ teṣāṃ na prajānāmi gatyupapattiṃ
analyzed: ye ca kecid iha cāturdvīpikāyām lokadhātau paṇḍitāḥ vijñāḥ sattvāḥ tathā māyayā āvarjitāḥ yathā cittam api aham teṣām na prajānāmi gati upapattim
translated: And whatever wise and learned beings there are in this four-continent world-system, they were so captivated by that magic that I do not even know their minds, their destiny, or rebirth.

original: vā ṣaṭsu gatiṣu /
analyzed: vā ṣaṭsu gatiṣu
translated: Or in the six destinies.

original: ye ca taccharaṇagatās teṣām ekaromakūpam api na śaknomi saṃtrāsayituṃ vā saṃkṣobhayituṃ vā kim aṃga punas tasmād visaṃvādayituṃ vā kaṃpayituṃ
analyzed: ye ca tad śaraṇa gatāḥ teṣām eka romakūpam api na śaknomi saṃtrāsayitum vā saṃkṣobhayitum vā kim aṃga punar tasmāt visaṃvādayitum vā kaṃpayitum
translated: And those who went for refuge to him, I am not able to frighten or disturb even a single hair on their bodies, let alone deceive them or make them tremble.

original: vā śaknuyām /
analyzed: vā śaknuyām
translated: Or make them move.

original: adyaiva ca me paṃca paricārikāśatāni viṃśatiś ca putrasahasrāṇi sagaṇapārṣadyāni vṛṣalaṃ gautamaṃ taṃ śramaṇaṃ śaraṇaṃ gatās tasya purato niṣaṇṇāḥ
analyzed: adyā eva ca me paṃca paricārikā śatāni viṃśatiḥ ca putra sahasrāṇi sa gaṇa pārṣadyāni vṛṣalam gautamam tam śramaṇam śaraṇam gatāḥ tasya puratas niṣaṇṇāḥ
translated: And today, five hundred of my attendants and twenty thousand of my sons, together with their retinues and followers, have gone for refuge to that Gautama, the ascetic, and are sitting in his presence.

original: na cāhaṃ bhūyas tāni śaktas tasmād vivecayituṃ /
analyzed: na ca aham bhūyas tāni śaktaḥ tasmāt vivecayitum
translated: And I am no longer able to separate them from him.

original: tena hi yūyaṃ balavantaḥ puṇyavanto jñānavantaḥ aiśvaryavantaḥ suhṛdo bhavata /
analyzed: tena hi yūyam balavantaḥ puṇyavantaḥ jñānavantaḥ aiśvaryavantaḥ suhṛdaḥ bhavata
translated: Therefore, you who are powerful, meritorious, wise, and wealthy, be friendly.

original: taṃ śākyaputraṃ vṛṣalaṃ jīvitād vyavaropayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tam śākyaputram vṛṣalam jīvitāt vyavaropayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will deprive that Śākya son, the low-caste one, of life.

original: ye ca sattvās taccharaṇagatās tāṃ sarvāṃ vidhvaṃsayiṣyāmaḥ /🔽Kurumiya kṛṣṇaṃ māyāśaṭhaṃ śramaṇapakṣaṃ parājeṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: ye ca sattvāḥ tad śaraṇa gatāḥ tām sarvām vidhvaṃsayiṣyāmaḥ  kṛṣṇam māyā śaṭham śramaṇa pakṣam parājeṣyāmaḥ
translated: And all the beings who have taken refuge in him, we will destroy them all.🔽We will defeat the dark, deceitful, mendicant faction of Kuruṃbīja.

original: śuklaṃ mārapakṣam uddyotayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: śuklam māra pakṣam uddyotayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will illuminate the bright faction of Māra.

original: tataḥ paścāt sukhaṃ phāṣaṃ vihariṣyāmaḥ //
analyzed: tatas paścāt sukham phāṣam vihariṣyāmaḥ
translated: Then we will live happily and at ease.

original: atha jyotiṣprabho māraḥ imaṃ jaṃbudvīpaṃ vyavalokayām āsa yatra tathāgato niṣaṇṇo dharmaṃ deśayati /
analyzed: atha jyotiṣprabhaḥ māraḥ imam jaṃbudvīpam vyavalokayām āsa yatra tathāgataḥ niṣaṇṇaḥ dharmam deśayati
translated: Then Māra Jyotiṣprabha surveyed this Jambudvīpa where the Tathāgata was sitting and teaching the Dharma.

original: atha jyotiṣprabho māro bhagavataḥ kāyam adrākṣīt /
analyzed: atha jyotiṣprabhaḥ māraḥ bhagavataḥ kāyam adrākṣīt
translated: Then Māra Jyotiṣprabha saw the Blessed One's body.

original: svaraghoṣayuktāṃ dharmadeśanām aśrauṣīt /
analyzed: svara ghoṣa yuktām dharma deśanām aśrauṣīt
translated: He heard the Dharma teaching endowed with melodious speech.

original: atha tāvad eva tasya romaharṣaṇaḥ saṃtrāsa utpannaḥ /
analyzed: atha tāvat eva tasya romaharṣaṇaḥ saṃtrāsaḥ utpannaḥ
translated: Then fear and terror arose in him, making his hair stand on end.

original: atha sa māraṃ pāpīmantam evam āha //🔽kṛtsne kṣetre hy eṣa viśiṣṭo vararūpaḥ
analyzed: atha sa māram pāpīmantam evam āha  kṛtsne kṣetre hi eṣa viśiṣṭaḥ vara rūpaḥ
translated: Then he said this to Māra, the evil one:🔽In this entire realm, he is the most distinguished, of excellent form,

original: puṇyajñānair āśrayaśuddhaś cirakālaṃ /
analyzed: puṇya jñānaiḥ āśraya śuddhaḥ cira kālam
translated: His body is pure through merit and wisdom, and he has practiced for a long time.

original: kleśān mukto mārgasuyuktaś cirarātraṃ
analyzed: kleśāt muktaḥ mārga su yuktaḥ cirarātram
translated: Freed from afflictions and well-connected with the path for a long time,

original: kṣīṇāḥ sarve tasya bhavā śokavimuktaḥ // /
analyzed: kṣīṇāḥ sarve tasya bhava śoka vimuktaḥ
translated: all his existences are exhausted, he is liberated from sorrow.

original: mā tvaṃ bhūyaḥ krodhavaśaṃ gaccha na yuktam
analyzed: mā tvam bhūyas krodha vaśam gaccha na yuktam
translated: Do not again come under the sway of anger, it is not proper,

original: agro hy eṣa śreṣṭha śaraṇyas tribhavesmiṃ /
analyzed: agraḥ hi eṣa śreṣṭha śaraṇyaḥ
translated: for he is the foremost, the best, the refuge in the three worlds.

original: yasyāsmi vidveṣalavo 'pi pratibhāti
analyzed: yasya asmi vidveṣa lavaḥ pi pratibhāti
translated: For whom even a trace of hatred appears,

original: vyāmūḍho 'sau saukhyavinaṣṭo bhavatīha // /
analyzed: vyāmūḍhaḥ sau saukhya vinaṣṭaḥ bhavati iha
translated: he is deluded and loses happiness here.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: athāparo māraḥ sannimiko nāma taṃ māraṃ pāpīmantam evam āha /
analyzed: atha aparaḥ māraḥ sannimikaḥ nāma tam māram pāpīmantam evam āha
translated: Then another Māra named Sannimika said this to that evil Māra:

original: maharddhiko 'sau varapuṇyalakṣaṇo hy anāśṛtaḥ sarvagatipramuktaḥ /
analyzed: maharddhikaḥ sau vara puṇya lakṣaṇaḥ hi sarva gati pramuktaḥ
translated: He is of great power, endowed with the excellent marks of merit, not dependent, released from all destinies,

original: aśeṣaduḥkhakṣayamārgadeśako vihiṃsituṃ māraśatair na śakyam // /
analyzed: aśeṣa duḥkha kṣaya mārga deśakaḥ vihiṃsitum māra śataiḥ na śakyam
translated: the one who shows the path to the end of all suffering, he cannot be harmed by hundreds of Māras.

original: pāpīmān āha /
analyzed: pāpīmān āha
translated: The evil one said:

original: vaśaṃ madīyā janatā kṛtā hi yuṣmajjanas tasya vaśānugo 'yaṃ /
analyzed: vaśam madīyā janatā kṛtā hi yuṣmad janaḥ tasya vaśa anugaḥ yam
translated: The people have been brought under my control, and this people of yours is obedient to him.

original: na cirāt sa śūnyaṃ viṣayaṃ kariṣyati asmadgatiḥ kutra punar bhaviṣyati // /
analyzed: na cirāt sa śūnyam viṣayam kariṣyati asmad gatiḥ kutra punar bhaviṣyati
translated: Before long he will empty our realm. Where will our destination be again?

original: atha navarajo nāma māraḥ sa māraṃ pāpīmantam evam āha /
analyzed: atha navarajaḥ nāma māraḥ sa māram pāpīmantam evam āha
translated: Then a Māra named Navaraja said this to that evil Māra:

original: yadā tavāsīt paramā samṛddhis tadā tvayā darśitam ātmaśauryaṃ /
analyzed: yadā tava āsīt paramā samṛddhiḥ tadā tvayā darśitam ātma śauryam
translated: When you had supreme prosperity, then you showed your personal courage.

original: balapranaṣṭo 'sy adhunā nirāśaḥ kiṃ spardhase sarvavidā sahādya // /
analyzed: bala pranaṣṭaḥ si adhunā nirāśaḥ kim spardhase sarva vidā saha adya
translated: Now that your strength is lost, you are hopeless, why do you compete with the Omniscient One today?🔽 Kṣitigarbha

original: khaḍgasomo māraḥ prāha /
analyzed: khaḍga somaḥ māraḥ prāha
translated: The demon Khaḍgasoma said:

original: kvacin na tasyāsti manaḥpradoṣaṃ bhāvena śuddho hi nirāśrayo 'sau /
analyzed: kvacid na tasya asti manaḥ pradoṣam bhāvena śuddhaḥ hi nirāśrayaḥ sau
translated: He has no mental hostility towards anyone, for he is pure in nature and without support.

original: traidhātukān muktagatipracāro nāsau parair ghātayituṃ hi śakyam // /
analyzed: traidhātukāt mukta gati pracāraḥ na asau paraiḥ ghātayitum hi śakyam
translated: He is liberated from the three realms and his conduct is free, he cannot be killed by others.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃci

original: pāpīmān āha /
analyzed: pāpīmān āha
translated: The evil one said:

original: ye santisattvā iha kāmadhātau kāmaprasaktā madamānamūrcchitāḥ /
analyzed: ye santi sattvāḥ iha kāmadhātau kāma prasaktāḥ mada māna mūrcchitāḥ
translated: Those beings who are here in the desire realm, attached to desire, intoxicated by pride and conceit,

original: sadānuvṛttā mama kiṃkarās te kathaṃ na śakyaṃ hanituṃ samagraiḥ // /
analyzed: sadā anuvṛttāḥ mama kiṃkarāḥ te katham na śakyam hanitum samagraiḥ
translated: They are always my obedient servants, why can't we all kill him?

original: kṣititoyo nāma māraḥ sa evam āha /
analyzed: kṣititoyaḥ nāma māraḥ saḥ evam āha
translated: The demon Kṣitigarbha said this:

original: māyāmarīcipratimān asārān bhāvān parijñāya vinītatṛṣṇaḥ /
analyzed: māyā marīci pratimān asārān bhāvān parijñāya vinīta tṛṣṇaḥ
translated: Having fully understood that things are like illusions and mirages, without essence, with diminished craving,

original: bhaveṣv asakto gaganasvabhāvaḥ śakyaṃ vighātaḥ katham asya kartum // /
analyzed: bhaveṣu asaktaḥ gagana svabhāvaḥ śakyam vighātaḥ katham asya kartum
translated: Unattached to existences, with the nature of space, how can he be harmed?

original: pāpīmān āha /
analyzed: pāpīmān āha
translated: The evil one said:

original: ihaiva tasyāsti vaśo triloke mṛṣṭānnapānāsanavastrasevitaḥ /
analyzed: iha eva tasya asti vaśo triloke mṛṣṭa anna pāna āsana vastra sevitaḥ
translated: He has power right here in the three worlds, served with fine food, drink, seats and clothes.

original: tṛvedanā cāsya matau pratiṣṭhitā kṣayaṃ praṇetuṃ sa kathaṃ na śakyam // /
analyzed: tṛ vedanā ca asya matau pratiṣṭhitā kṣayam praṇetum sa katham na śakyam
translated: And the three kinds of suffering are firmly established in his mind - how can he be made to perish?

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: [Mara] Kuru-mi-ya

original: tṛṣṇājaho nāma māraḥ sa evam āha /
analyzed: tṛṣṇājahaḥ nāma māraḥ saḥ evam āha
translated: The Mara named Trishna-jaha said this:

original: yā ṛddhir asmadviṣaye 'sti kācit pāpīmatāṃ caiva mahoragāṇāṃ /
analyzed: yāḥ ṛddhiḥ asmad viṣaye sti kācid pāpīmatām ca eva mahā uragāṇām
translated: Whatever prosperity there is in our realm, and that of the great serpents, the evil ones,

original: siddhārthaṛddher na kalāṃ spṛśaṃti kṣayaṃ praṇetuṃ sa kathaṃ hi śakyam // /
analyzed: siddhārtha ṛddheḥ na kalām spṛśaṃti kṣayam praṇetum sa katham hi śakyam
translated: They do not touch even a fraction of the prosperity of the one who has accomplished his purpose - how can he be made to perish?

original: pāpīmān āha /🔽bhaktacchedo mayāsmai hi kāritas tacchilā punaḥ /
analyzed: pāpīmān āha  bhakta chedaḥ mayā asmai hi kāritaḥ tad śilā punar
translated: [Mara] Papaya said:🔽I have caused him to be deprived of food, and that stone was thrown by me,

original: kṣiptā dattās tathākrośā āśramāt kaṃpito 'pi na // /
analyzed: kṣiptāḥ dattāḥ tathā ākrośāḥ āśramāt na
translated: And the curses were given by me, and the hermitage was shaken by me, but not by him.

original: bodhākṣo nāma māraḥ sa evam āha /
analyzed: bodhākṣaḥ nāma māraḥ saḥ evam āha
translated: [Mara] Bodhaksha said this:

original: yadā tvayā tasya kṛto vighātaḥ kaścit pradoṣaḥ kupitena tena /
analyzed: yadā tvayā tasya kṛtaḥ vighātaḥ kaścid pradoṣaḥ kupitena tena
translated: When you caused him harm, did you become angry with him?

original: saṃdarśitas te bhṛkuṭī mukhe vā kiṃ tasya sākṣād avacaḥ śrutaṃ te // /
analyzed: saṃdarśitaḥ te bhṛkuṭī mukhe vā kim tasya sākṣāt avacaḥ śrutam te
translated: Did you show a frown on your face? Did you hear his words directly?

original: pāpīyān āha /
analyzed: pāpīyān āha
translated: [Mara] Papaya said:

original: pratisaṃkhyayā so kṣamate ca nityaṃ prahīṇarāgo gatadoṣamohaḥ /
analyzed: pratisaṃkhyayā saḥ kṣamate ca nityam prahīṇa rāgaḥ gata doṣa mohaḥ
translated: He always forbears with discernment, his passion is destroyed, and he is free from hatred and delusion.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: [Mara] Kuru-mi-ya

original: sarveṣu sattveṣu sa maitracittaḥ saṃsargacaryā punar asya nityam // /
analyzed: sarveṣu sattveṣu sa maitra cittaḥ saṃsarga caryā punar asya nityam
translated: He has a mind of loving-kindness towards all beings, and his conduct is always in association with them.🔽[Mara] Papaya said:🔽He is always in the company of the virtuous, and he is always free from the company of the non-virtuous.

original: durdharṣo nāma māraḥ sa evam āha /
analyzed: durdharṣaḥ nāma māraḥ saḥ evam āha
translated: The Mara named Durdharsha said this:

original: ye ca trisaṃyojanapāśabaddhās teṣāṃ vighātāya vayaṃ yatema /
analyzed: ye ca trisaṃyojana pāśa baddhāḥ teṣām vighātāya vayam yatema
translated: We will strive to create obstacles for those bound by the three fetters and snares.

original: sa tu prahīṇāmayamohapāśaḥ kṣayaṃ praṇetuṃ sa kathaṃ hi śakyam // /
analyzed: sa tu prahīṇa āmaya moha pāśaḥ kṣayam praṇetum sa katham hi śakyam
translated: But how can we possibly lead to destruction one who has severed the snares of afflictions and delusion?

original: pāpīmān āha /
analyzed: pāpīmān āha
translated: Pāpīyān said:

original: yūyaṃ mama prāptabalāḥ sahāyāḥ sadyo bhavanto bhavathāpramattāḥ /
analyzed: yūyam mama prāpta balāḥ sahāyāḥ sadyas bhavantaḥ bhavatha apramattāḥ
translated: You are my powerful allies. Be quick, be diligent!

original: apo 'dhitiṣṭhāmi mahīm aśeṣāṃ sarvā diśaḥ parvatamālinī ca // /🔽gaganāt pracaṇḍaṃ ghanaśailavarṣaṃ samutsṛjāmy āyasacūrṇarāśim /
analyzed: apaḥ dhitiṣṭhāmi mahīm aśeṣām sarvāḥ diśaḥ parvata mālinī ca  gaganāt pracaṇḍam ghana śaila varṣam samutsṛjāmi āyasa cūrṇa rāśim
translated: I will control the waters, the entire earth, and all the directions with their mountain ranges.🔽From the sky I will release a fierce rain of dense mountain-like clouds, a mass of iron dust.

original: nārācaśaktikṣuratomarāṃś ca kṣipāmi kāye 'sya vicūrṇanārthaṃ // /
analyzed: nārāca śakti kṣura tomarān ca kṣipāmi kāye vicūrṇana artham
translated: I will hurl iron arrows, spears, razors, and javelins to reduce his body to dust.

original: ebhiḥ prayogair abhighātadīptais taṃ śākyasiṃhaṃ prakaromi bhasma // /
analyzed: ebhiḥ prayogaiḥ abhighāta dīptaiḥ tam śākyasiṃham prakaromi bhasma
translated: By these violent and burning methods I will reduce that Lion of the Shakyas to ashes.

original: peyālam / yāvan mārakoṭībhir gāthākoṭī bhāṣitā iti /
analyzed: peyālam yāvat māra koṭībhiḥ gāthā koṭī bhāṣitā iti
translated: The text continues up to the point where millions of verses were spoken by millions of Maras.

original: atha sarve mārā ekakaṇṭhenaivam āhuḥ /
analyzed: atha sarve mārāḥ eka kaṇṭhena evam āhuḥ
translated: Then all the Maras said with one voice:

original: evam astu /
analyzed: evam astu
translated: So be it!

original: gamiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: gamiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will go.

original: svakasvakebhyo bhavanebhyaḥ sannāhaṃ baddhvā sasainyaparivārā āgamiṣyāmo Kurumiya
analyzed: svaka svakebhyaḥ bhavanebhyaḥ sannāham baddhvā sa sainya parivārāḥ āgamiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will put on our armor in our own abodes and come with our armies and retinues to Kuru-mīy.

original: yad asmākam ṛddhibalaviṣayaṃ tat sarvam ādarśayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yat asmākam ṛddhi bala viṣayam tat sarvam ādarśayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will display all of our power, strength, and domain.

original: atha tvaṃ svayam eva jñāsyase yādṛśaṃ śauryaṃ sa śramaṇo gautamas tatkṣaṇe pradarśayiṣyati /
analyzed: atha tvam svayam eva jñāsyase yādṛśam śauryam sa śramaṇaḥ gautamaḥ tad kṣaṇe pradarśayiṣyati
translated: Then you will know for yourself what kind of heroism the ascetic Gautama will display at that moment.

original: atha tā mārakoṭyaḥ svabhavanāni gatvā sannāhabandhaṃ kṛtvā ekaiko māraḥ koṭīsahasraparivāro vividhāni varmāṇi prāvṛtya te nānāpraharaṇayuktā
analyzed: atha tāḥ māra koṭyaḥ sva bhavanāni gatvā sannāha bandham kṛtvā ekaikaḥ māraḥ koṭī sahasra parivāraḥ vividhāni varmāṇi prāvṛtya te nānā praharaṇa yuktā
translated: Then those millions of Māras went to their own abodes, put on their armor, and each Māra, surrounded by a retinue of a thousand millions, put on various armors and, equipped with various weapons,

original: vividhasannāhasannaddhāḥ /
analyzed: vividha sannāha sannaddhāḥ
translated: put on various armors.

original: tasyām eva rātryām atyayenemaṃ jaṃbudvīpam anuprāptaḥ aṅgamagadhasandhau gagane tasthuḥ
analyzed: tasyām eva rātryām atyayena imam jaṃbudvīpam anuprāptaḥ aṅga magadha sandhau gagane tasthuḥ
translated: Having arrived in this Jambudvīpa at the end of that very night, they stood in the sky at the junction of Aṅga and Magadha.

original: yāvad ye cāsmiṃś cāturdvīpike devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragapretapiśācakumbhāṇḍā
analyzed: yāvat ye ca asmin cāturdvīpike deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga preta piśāca kumbhāṇḍā
translated: As far as the gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, pretas, piśācas, and kumbhāṇḍas in this four-continent world-system

original: bhagavato 'ntike aprasannacittā alabdhagauravamanaskārā dharme saṃghe cāprasannacittās
analyzed: bhagavataḥ ntike a prasanna cittāḥ a labdha gaurava manaskārāḥ dharme saṃghe ca a prasanna cittāḥ
translated: who had not developed a clear mind towards the Blessed One, who had not developed a sense of respect and reverence for the Dharma and the Saṅgha,

original: te sarve māreṇa pāpīmatā bhagavato 'ntike vadhāyodyojitāḥ /
analyzed: te sarve māreṇa pāpīmatā bhagavataḥ ntike vadhāya udyojitāḥ
translated: they were all urged by the evil Māra to kill the Blessed One.

original: te 'pi nānāpraharaṇavarmaprāvṛtāḥ tatraiva tasthuḥ /
analyzed: te pi nānā praharaṇa varma prāvṛtāḥ tatra eva tasthuḥ
translated: They too, clad in various weapons and armor, remained there.

original: māro 'pi pāpīmān anuhimavataḥ pārśvaṃ gatvā yatra jyotīraso ṛṣiḥ prativasati maheśvarabhaktiko
analyzed: māraḥ pi pāpīmān anu himavataḥ pārśvam gatvā yatra jyotīrasaḥ ṛṣiḥ prativasati maheśvara bhaktikaḥ
translated: Then Māra, the evil one, went to the side of the Himalayas, where the sage Jyotiska, a devotee of Maheśvara,

original: aṣṭādaśasu vidyāsthāneṣv ṛddhiviṣayapāramiprāptaḥ paṃcaśataparivāraḥ tasya maheśvararūpeṇa
analyzed: aṣṭādaśasu vidyā sthāneṣu ṛddhi viṣaya pārami prāptaḥ paṃcaśata parivāraḥ tasya maheśvara rūpeṇa
translated: had attained perfection in the eighteen branches of knowledge, the sphere of spiritual power, and had a retinue of five hundred. Māra, in the form of Maheśvara,

original: purataḥ sthitvaivam āha /
analyzed: puratas sthitvā evam āha
translated: stood before him and said this:

original: nityaṃ gautamagotrajo ṛṣivaro vijñān' /
analyzed: nityam gautama gotra jaḥ ṛṣi varaḥ vijñān
translated: The best of sages, born in the Gautama clan, always has knowledge,

original: abhijñāśrito
analyzed: abhijñā āśritaḥ
translated: relies on the superknowledges,

original: magadhe saṃvasatīha so 'dya carate piṇḍāya rājñogṛham /
analyzed: magadhe saṃvasati iha saḥ dya carate piṇḍāya rājñogṛham
translated: and lives in Magadha. He is now going for alms to the house of the king.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: O Kuruṃmiya!

original: tena tvaṃ saha saṃlapasva viśadaṃ nānākathābhiḥ sthiraḥ
analyzed: tena tvam saha saṃlapasva viśadam nānā kathābhiḥ sthiraḥ
translated: You should converse with him in clear and various stories, firmly.

original: tatraive tvam atīva paṃca niyataṃ prāpsyasy abhijñāvaśim // /
analyzed: tatra eve tvam atīva paṃca niyatam prāpsyasi abhijñā vaśim
translated: There you will certainly attain the five superknowledges.

original: atha māraḥ pāpīmān imāṃ gāthāṃ bhāṣitvā tatraivāntarhitaḥ /
analyzed: atha māraḥ pāpīmān imām gāthām bhāṣitvā tatra eva antarhitaḥ
translated: Then Māra, the evil one, having spoken this verse, disappeared right there.

original: svabhavanaṃ ca gatvā svapārṣadyānāṃ mārāṇām ārocayati sma //
analyzed: sva bhavanam ca gatvā sva pārṣadyānām mārāṇām ārocayati sma
translated: And having gone to his own abode, he announced to his retinue of Māras:

original: matto bho śṛṇutādya yādṛg atulā buddhir mayā cintitā
analyzed: mattaḥ bho śṛṇuta adya yādṛś atulā buddhiḥ mayā cintitā
translated: Listen to me, friends, to what kind of incomparable idea I have thought of today:

original: svairaṃ śākyasutaṃ samālapata yedṛddhiprabhāvānvitāḥ /
analyzed: svairam śākya sutam samālapata ye id ṛddhi prabhāva anvitāḥ
translated: Those who possess such miraculous powers, speak freely to the son of the Śākyas,

original: tāṃ māyāṃ na vidarśayet svaviṣayīṃ mārorudarpāpahāṃ
analyzed: tām māyām na vidarśayet sva viṣayīm māroḥ udarpa apahām
translated: Those who possess such miraculous powers, speak freely to the son of the Śākyas, We will not display that illusion which is our own domain, which removes the great pride of Māra,

original: nityaṃ snigdhavacāḥ sa śiṣyanirato māteva putreṣv iva // /
analyzed: nityam snigdha vacāḥ sa śiṣya nirataḥ mātā iva putreṣu iva
translated: always speaking kindly, devoted to disciples, like a mother to her children.

original: śiṣyās tasya hi ye prahīṇamadanāś caryāṃ caraṃti dhruvaṃ
analyzed: śiṣyāḥ tasya hi ye prahīṇa madanāḥ caryām caranti dhruvam
translated: For his disciples, who have abandoned desire and certainly practice the conduct,

original: pūrvāhṇe nagaraṃ krameṇa nibhṛtāḥ svaireṇa tāvad vayaṃ /
analyzed: pūrvāhṇe nagaram krameṇa nibhṛtāḥ svaireṇa tāvat vayam
translated: in the morning, we will slowly enter the city, just for fun.

original: gṛhṇīmo druta nṛtyagītamadhuraprādhānyabhāvair yathā
analyzed: gṛhṇīmaḥ nṛtya gīta madhura prādhānya bhāvaiḥ yathā
translated: We will quickly take up the main things, such as singing and dancing sweetly,

original: śrutvaitāṃ prakṛtiṃ manovirasatāṃ yāyāt sa śākyarṣabhaḥ // /
analyzed: śrutvā etām prakṛtim manaḥ virasa tām yāyāt sa śākya ṛṣabhaḥ
translated: so that when the bull of the Śākyas hears this, his mind will become dispassionate.

original: aparo māra evam āha /🔽siṃhavyāghragajoṣṭracaṇḍamahoṣīṅ kṣipraṃ purasyāsya hi
analyzed: aparaḥ māraḥ evam āha  siṃha vyāghra gaja uṣṭra caṇḍa mahā uṣīn kṣipram purasya asya hi
translated: Another Māra said:🔽Quickly outside this city, let there be many fierce sounds of lions, tigers, elephants, camels, and bulls,

original: prāvṛṅmeghaninādinaḥ khararavān nirmāya naikāṃ bahiḥ /
analyzed: prāvṛṣ megha ninādinaḥ khara ravān nirmāya nā ekām bahis
translated: like the rumbling of rain clouds,

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: tiṣṭhemo vayam āyudhapraharaṇāḥ sākṣāt sa dṛṣṭvādbhutān
analyzed: tiṣṭhemaḥ vayam āyudha praharaṇāḥ sākṣāt sa dṛṣṭvā adbhutān
translated: we will stand with weapons and implements, and when he sees those wonders,

original: bhrānto ṛddhim apāsya yāsyati tato nānādiśo vismṛtaḥ // /
analyzed: bhrāntaḥ ṛddhim apāsya yāsyati tatas nānā diśaḥ vismṛtaḥ
translated: confused, he will abandon his psychic powers and go away in various directions, forgotten.

original: aparo māraḥ prāha /
analyzed: aparaḥ māraḥ prāha
translated: Another Māra said:

original: vīthīcatvaratoraṇeṣu bahuśaḥ sthitvā virūpair mukhair
analyzed: vīthī catvara toraṇeṣu bahuśas sthitvā virūpaiḥ mukhaiḥ
translated: Having stood many times in the streets, crossroads, and archways with many disfigured faces,

original: nānādyāyudhatīkṣṇatomaraśaraprāsāsikhaḍgāśritaiḥ /
analyzed: nānā ādi āyudha tīkṣṇa tomara śara prāsa asi khaḍga āśritaiḥ
translated: Holding various weapons, sharp spears, arrows, javelins, swords, and scimitars,

original: ākāśād ghanarāvasupraharaṇair meghāsaniṃ muṃcata
analyzed: ākāśāt ghana rāva su praharaṇaiḥ megha āsanim muṃcata
translated: From the sky, with loud roars and sharp weapons, release the thunderbolt-wielding one.

original: kṣipraṃ sa pralayaṃ prayāsyati tato bhūkaṃpabhīto 'vaśaḥ // /
analyzed: kṣipram sa pralayam prayāsyati tatas bhū kaṃpa bhītaḥ vaśaḥ
translated: He will quickly perish, frightened and helpless by the earthquake.

original: vistareṇa yathāsau mārāṇāṃ mārabalaviṣayavikurvāṃ tāṃ sarvāṃ tathaiva cakruḥ //
analyzed: vistareṇa yathā asau mārāṇām māra bala viṣaya vikurvām tām sarvām tathā eva cakruḥ
translated: In detail, they did all that, just as the Māras had transformed the Māra army and domain.

original: bhagavāṃś ca punaḥ sarvāvatīm imāṃ trisāhasramahāsāhasrīṃ lokadhātuṃ vajramayīm adhyatiṣṭhat /
analyzed: bhagavān ca punar sarvāvatīm imām tri sāhasra mahā sāhasrīm lokadhātum vajra mayīm adhyatiṣṭhat
translated: And the Blessed One again stood in this entire great trichiliocosm, making it adamantine.

original: na ca punar bhūyo mārāḥ rāvāṃś cakrur na caturdiśam agniparvatās tasthuḥ na kṛṣṇābhrā nākālavāyavo na ca kaścin nāgo 'bhipravarṣati smāntaśaḥ
analyzed: na ca punar bhūyas mārāḥ rāvān cakruḥ na caturdiśam agni parvatāḥ tasthuḥ na kṛṣṇa abhrāḥ na akāla vāyavaḥ na ca kaścid nāgaḥ abhipravarṣati sma antaśas
translated: And the Māras no longer made loud noises, the fiery mountains in the four directions did not stand, the black clouds did not appear, the untimely winds did not blow, and no nāga rained down even a single drop,

original: ekabindur api buddhabalādhiṣṭhānena //
analyzed: ekabinduḥ api buddha bala adhiṣṭhānena
translated: by the power of the Buddha's blessing.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena catvāro mahāśrāvakāḥ pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātracīvaram ādāya rājagṛhaṃ mahānagaraṃ piṇḍāya praviviśuḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena catvāraḥ mahāśrāvakāḥ pūrvāhṇe nivāsya pātra cīvaram ādāya rājagṛham mahā nagaram piṇḍāya praviviśuḥ
translated: At that time, the four great disciples, having dressed in the morning, took their bowls and robes and entered the great city of Rājagṛha for alms.

original: āyuṣmāñ chāriputro dakṣiṇena nagaradvāreṇa rājagṛhaṃ mahānagaraṃ piṇḍāya praviveśa /
analyzed: āyuṣmān śāriputraḥ dakṣiṇena nagara dvāreṇa rājagṛham mahā nagaram piṇḍāya praviveśa
translated: The Venerable Śāriputra entered the great city of Rājagṛha through the southern gate for alms.

original: Kurumiya tatra ca nagare paṃcāśan mārakumārakāḥ paramayauvanasurūpā mahātmaputraveśasadṛśā nṛtyaṃto gāyantaḥ saṃceruḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca nagare paṃcāśat māra kumārakāḥ parama yauvana surūpāḥ mahātma putra veśa sadṛśāḥ nṛtyaṃtaḥ gāyantaḥ saṃceruḥ
translated: And in that city, fifty Māra youths, supremely youthful and handsome, dressed like the sons of great beings, were dancing and singing.

original: ta āyuṣmantaṃ śāriputram ubhābhyāṃ pāṇibhyāṃ gṛhītvā vīthyāṃ dhāvanti sma /
analyzed: te āyuṣmantam śāriputram ubhābhyām pāṇibhyām gṛhītvā vīthyām dhāvanti sma
translated: They grabbed the Venerable Śāriputra with both hands and ran through the streets.

original: nṛtyanto gāyantaḥ śāriputram evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: nṛtyantaḥ gāyantaḥ śāriputram evam āhuḥ
translated: Dancing and singing, they said to Śāriputra:

original: nartasva śramaṇa gāyasva śramaṇa /
analyzed: nartasva śramaṇa gāyasva śramaṇa
translated: Dance, monk! Sing, monk!

original: śāriputra āha /🔽śṛṇuta yūyaṃ mārṣāḥ svayam /
analyzed: śāriputraḥ āha  śṛṇuta yūyam mārṣāḥ svayam
translated: Śāriputra said:

original: aśrutapūrvāṃ gītikāṃ śrāvayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: a śruta pūrvām gītikām śrāvayiṣyāmi
translated: Listen, friends, to a song you have never heard before.

original: te ca sarve mārakumārakā dhāvanto gītasvareṇa saha śāriputreṇaivam āhuḥ /🔽alam eva hi āyatanehi vaṃcite ā vayam āyatanehi /🔽āghatanāni hi āyatanāni antu karomy ahu āyatanānām // /
analyzed: te ca sarve māra kumārakāḥ dhāvantaḥ gītasvareṇa saha śāriputreṇa evam āhuḥ  alam eva hi āyatanehi vaṃcite ā vayam āyatanehi  āghatanāni hi āyatanāni antu karomi ahu āyatanānām
translated: And all those Māra youths, running with the sound of singing along with Śāriputra, said:🔽Enough with the sense-spheres, deceived by the sense-spheres!🔽The sense-spheres are killers, I will put an end to the sense-spheres.

original: alam eva hi skandhakṛtehi vaṃcite ā vaya skandhakṛtehi /
analyzed: alam eva hi skandha kṛtehi
translated: Enough with the aggregates, deceived by the aggregates!

original: āghatanāni hi skandhakṛtāni antu karomy ahu skandhakṛtānām // /
analyzed: āghatanāni hi skandha kṛtāni antu karomi ahu skandha kṛtānām
translated: For the aggregates are the cause of injury. I will put an end to the aggregates that are the cause of injury.

original: tadyathā
analyzed: tat yathā
translated: Namely:

original: bahara bahara bhāra baha marīcibaha satyabaha āmabaha svāhā //
analyzed: bahara bahara bhāra baha marīcibaha satyabaha āmabaha svāhā
translated: Bahar, bahar, bhāra, bah, marīcibah, satyabah, āmabah, svāhā.

original: sthaviraḥ śāriputro dhāvan gītasvareṇeme gāthe imāni ca mantrapadāni bhāṣate sma /
analyzed: sthaviraḥ śāriputraḥ dhāvan gīta svareṇa ime gāthe imāni ca mantra padāni bhāṣate sma
translated: The elder Śāriputra, running, spoke these verses and these mantra words in a singing voice.

original: atha te paṃcāśan mārakumārakāḥ paramahṛṣṭāḥ suprasannamanasa evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: atha te paṃcāśat māra kumārakāḥ parama hṛṣṭāḥ su prasanna manasaḥ evam āhuḥ
translated: Then those fifty Māra youths, extremely delighted, with very joyful minds, said this:

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kurumīya

original: kṣamāpayāmo vayam adya nāthaṃ tvām eva bandhuṃ jagataḥ sudeśakaṃ /
analyzed: kṣamāpayāmaḥ vayam adya nātham tvām eva bandhum jagataḥ su deśakam
translated: We today ask for forgiveness from you, the protector, the kinsman, the good teacher of the world.

original: skandhā yathā te sabhayāḥ pradiṣṭhās tathā vayaṃ sākṣiṇa eṇu nityam // /
analyzed: skandhāḥ yathā te sa bhayāḥ pradiṣṭhāḥ tathā vayam sākṣiṇaḥ eṇu nityam
translated: Just as you have shown that the aggregates are dangerous, so we are always the witnesses.

original: sarve ca te śāriputrasya vīthīmadhye pādau śirasābhivandya purato nyaṣedur dharmaśravaṇāya //
analyzed: sarve ca te śāriputrasya vīthī madhye pādau śirasā abhivandya puratas nyaṣeduḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: And they all bowed their heads at Śāriputra's feet in the middle of the street and sat down in front of him to listen to the Dharma.

original: atha khalv āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ pūrveṇa nagaradvāreṇa rājagṛhe mahānagare piṇḍāya prāviśat /
analyzed: atha khalu āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ pūrveṇa nagara dvāreṇa rājagṛhe mahā nagare piṇḍāya prāviśat
translated: Then the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana entered the great city of Rājagṛha through the eastern city gate for alms.

original: tathāpi paṃcāśan mārakumārakāḥ yāvad gītasvareṇaivam āhuḥ /
analyzed: tathā api paṃcāśat māra kumārakāḥ yāvat gīta svareṇa evam āhuḥ
translated: Still, the fifty Māra youths, up to in a singing voice, said this:

original: alam eva hi dhātumayehi vaṃcite ā vaya dhātumayehi /
analyzed: alam eva hi dhātu mayehi vaṃcite ā vaya dhātu mayehi
translated: Enough with the elements, deceived by them, I will go beyond the elements.

original: āghatanāni hi dhātumayāni antu karomy ahu dhātumayānām // /
analyzed: āghatanāni hi dhātu mayāni antu karomi ahu dhātu mayānām
translated: The elements are killers; I will put an end to the elements.

original: alam eva hi vedayitebhi vaṃcite ā vaya vedayitebhi /🔽āghatanāni hi vedayitāni antu karomy ahu vedayitānām // /
analyzed: alam eva hi vedayitebhi vaṃcite ā vaya vedayitebhi  āghatanāni hi vedayitāni antu karomi ahu vedayitānām
translated: Enough with the feelings, deceived by them, I will go beyond the feelings.🔽The feelings are killers; I will put an end to the feelings.

original: alam eva hi cetayitehi vaṃcite ā vaya cetayitehi /
analyzed: alam eva hi cetayitehi vaṃcite ā vaya cetayitehi
translated: Enough with the perceptions, deceived by them, I will go beyond the perceptions.

original: āghatanāni hi cetayitāni antu karomy ahu cetayitānām // /🔽alam eva hi saṃjñakṛtehi vaṃcite yā vaya saṃjñakṛtehi /
analyzed: āghatanāni hi cetayitāni antu karomi ahu cetayitānām  alam eva hi saṃjña kṛtehi saṃjña kṛtehi
translated: The perceptions are killers; I will put an end to the perceptions.🔽Enough with the mental formations, deceived by them, I will go beyond the mental formations.

original: āghatanāni hi saṃjñakṛtāni antu karomy ahu saṃjñakṛtānām // /
analyzed: āghatanāni hi saṃjña kṛtāni antu karomi ahu saṃjña kṛtānām
translated: The mental formations are killers; I will put an end to the mental formations.

original: Kurumiya 🔽alam eva hi saṃsaritehi vaṃcite yā vaya saṃsaritehi /
analyzed: kurumiya  alam eva hi saṃsaritehi vaṃcite
translated: Kuruṃiya🔽Enough with the wanderings, deceived by them, I will go beyond the wanderings.

original: āghatanāni hi saṃsaritāni antu karomy ahu saṃsaritānām // /
analyzed: āghatanāni hi saṃsaritāni antu karomi ahu saṃsaritānām
translated: The wanderings are killers; I will put an end to the wanderings.

original: tadyathā
analyzed: tat yathā
translated: Just as

original: āmava āmava āmava āmava /
analyzed: āmava āmava āmava
translated: Āmava āmava āmava āmava.

original: āraja ranajaha /
analyzed: āraja
translated: Āraja rañajah.

original: śamyatha śamyatha śamyatha /
analyzed: śamyatha śamyatha śamyatha
translated: Shamyatha shamyatha shamyatha.

original: gaganavama svāhā //
analyzed: gaganavama svāhā
translated: Gagana-vamasvāhā.

original: dhāvan gītasvareṇāyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyano māraputrebhya imā gāthā imāni ca mantrapadāni bhāṣate sma /
analyzed: dhāvan gīta svareṇa āyuṣmān mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ māra putrebhyaḥ imāḥ gāthāḥ imāni ca mantra padāni bhāṣate sma
translated: As he ran, the Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana spoke these verses and these mantra words to the sons of Māra in a singing voice:

original: atha te paṃcāśan mārakumārakāḥ paramahṛṣṭāḥ suprasannamanasa evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: atha te paṃcāśat māra kumārakāḥ parama hṛṣṭāḥ su prasanna manasaḥ evam āhuḥ
translated: Then those fifty young Māras, extremely delighted, with very joyful minds, said this:

original: ṛddhyānvitāryapathagupta munīndrasūno
analyzed: ṛddhyā anvita ārya patha gupta muni indra sūno
translated: Endowed with miraculous powers, son of the lord of sages, protector of the path,

original: saṃsāradoṣasamadarśaka dharmadīpa /
translated: Seeing the faults of saṃsāra, lamp of the Dharma,

original: pāpaṃ prahāya vayam ādarabhaktijātā
analyzed: pāpam prahāya vayam ādara bhakti jātā
translated: Having abandoned evil, we have become full of respectful devotion,

original: buddhaṃ gatā dya śaraṇaṃ varadharmasaṃghaṃ // /
analyzed: buddham gatāḥ śaraṇam vara dharma saṃgham
translated: We have gone to the Buddha for refuge, to the supreme Dharma and Saṅgha.

original: sarve te paṃcāśan mārakumārakā vīthīmadhye āyuṣmato maudalyāyanasya pādau śirasābhivandya tasyaiva purato nyaṣedur dharmaśravaṇāya //
analyzed: sarve te paṃcāśat māra kumārakāḥ vīthī madhye āyuṣmataḥ maudalyāyanasya pādau śirasā abhivandya tasya eva puratas nyaṣeduḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: All those fifty young Māras bowed their heads to the feet of the Venerable Maudgalyāyana in the middle of the street and sat down in front of him to listen to the Dharma.

original: athāyuṣmān pūrṇo maitrāyaṇiputra uttareṇa nagaradvāreṇa piṇḍāya Kurumiya prāviśat /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān pūrṇaḥ maitrāyaṇiputraḥ uttareṇa nagara dvāreṇa piṇḍāya prāviśat
translated: Then the Venerable Pūrṇa Maitrāyaṇīputra entered Kuru for alms through the northern gate of the city.

original: yāvad gītasvareṇaivam āhuḥ /🔽alam eva hi sparśakṛtehi vaṃcite yā vaya sparśakṛtehi /
analyzed: yāvat gīta svareṇa evam āhuḥ  alam eva hi sparśa kṛtehi
translated: As far as (he went), he said this in a singing voice:🔽Enough indeed with the deceptions created by contact, we who are deceived by the deceptions created by contact,

original: āghatanāni hi sparśakṛtāni antu karomy ahu sparśakṛtānām // /
analyzed: āghatanāni hi sparśa kṛtāni antu karomi ahu sparśa kṛtānām
translated: For the deceptions created by contact are destructive. I will put an end to the deceptions created by contact.

original: alam eva hi ādhipatehi vaṃcite yā vayam ādhipatehi /
analyzed: alam eva hi ādhipatehi vaṃcite yā vayam ādhipatehi
translated: Enough with the lordships, we have been deceived by the lordships.

original: āghatanāni hi ādhipatīni antu karomy ahu ādhipatīnām // /
analyzed: āghatanāni hi ādhipatīni antu karomi ahu ādhipatīnām
translated: For the lordships are killers; I will put an end to the lordships.

original: alam eva hi saṃsaritehi vaṃcite yā vaya saṃsaritehi /
analyzed: alam eva hi saṃsaritehi vaṃcite
translated: Enough with the wanderings, we have been deceived by the wanderings.

original: āghatanāni hi saṃsaritāni antu karomy ahu saṃsaritānām // /🔽alam eva hi sarvabhavehi vaṃcite yā vaya sarvabhavehi /
analyzed: āghatanāni hi saṃsaritāni antu karomi ahu saṃsaritānām  alam eva hi sarva bhavehi sarva bhavehi
translated: For the wanderings are killers; I will put an end to the wanderings.🔽Enough with all existences, we have been deceived by all existences.

original: āghatanāni hi sarvabhavāni antu karomy ahu sarvabhavānām // /
analyzed: āghatanāni hi sarva bhavāni antu karomi ahu sarva bhavānām
translated: For all existences are killers; I will put an end to all existences.

original: laghu gacchati āyu mārṣāḥ salilā śīghrajavena veginī /
analyzed: laghu gacchati āyu mārṣāḥ salilā śīghra javena veginī
translated: Life passes quickly, friends, like a river's current.

original: na ca jānati bāliśo jano abudho rūpamadena mattakaḥ // /
analyzed: na ca jānati bāliśaḥ janaḥ abudhaḥ rūpa madena mattakaḥ
translated: But the foolish, ignorant people do not know, intoxicated by the intoxication of form.

original: peyālam /🔽abudhaḥ śabdamadena mattakaḥ // /
analyzed: peyālam  abudhaḥ śabda madena mattakaḥ
translated: The same should be said.🔽intoxicated by the intoxication of sound.

original: abudho gandhamadena mattakaḥ // /🔽abudho rasamadena mattakaḥ // /
analyzed: abudhaḥ gandha madena mattakaḥ  abudhaḥ rasa madena mattakaḥ
translated: intoxicated by the intoxication of smell.🔽intoxicated by the intoxication of taste.

original: abudhaḥ sparśamadena mattakaḥ // /
analyzed: abudhaḥ sparśa madena mattakaḥ
translated: intoxicated by the intoxication of touch.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: laghu gacchati āyu mārṣāḥ salilā śīghrajavena veginī /
analyzed: laghu gacchati āyu mārṣāḥ salilā śīghra javena veginī
translated: Life passes quickly, friends, like a river's current.

original: na ca paśyati bāliśo jano abudho dharmamadena mattakaḥ // /🔽abudhaḥ skandhamadena mattakaḥ // /
analyzed: na ca paśyati bāliśaḥ janaḥ abudhaḥ dharma madena mattakaḥ  abudhaḥ skandha madena mattakaḥ
translated: But the foolish people do not see, intoxicated by the pride of the Dharma, ignorant.🔽The ignorant, intoxicated by the pride of the aggregates...

original: abudho dhātumadena mattakaḥ // /🔽abudho bhogamadena mattakaḥ // /
analyzed: abudhaḥ dhātu madena mattakaḥ  abudhaḥ bhoga madena mattakaḥ
translated: The ignorant, intoxicated by the pride of the elements...🔽The ignorant, intoxicated by the pride of wealth...

original: abudhaḥ saukhyamadena mattakaḥ // /🔽abudho jātimadena mattakaḥ // /
analyzed: abudhaḥ saukhya madena mattakaḥ  abudhaḥ jāti madena mattakaḥ
translated: The ignorant, intoxicated by the pride of happiness...🔽The ignorant, intoxicated by the pride of birth...

original: abudhaḥ kāmamadena mattakaḥ // /
analyzed: abudhaḥ kāma madena mattakaḥ
translated: The ignorant, intoxicated by the pride of desire...

original: laghu gacchati āyu mārṣāḥ salilā śīghrajavena veginī /
analyzed: laghu gacchati āyu mārṣāḥ salilā śīghra javena veginī
translated: Life passes quickly, friends, like a river's swift current.

original: na ca jānati bāliśo jano abudhaḥ sarvamadena mattakaḥ // /
analyzed: na ca jānati bāliśaḥ janaḥ abudhaḥ sarva madena mattakaḥ
translated: But the foolish people do not know, ignorant, intoxicated by all pride...

original: tadyathā
analyzed: tat yathā
translated: It is as follows:

original: khargava khargava khargava mujñini /
analyzed: khargava khargava khargava mujñini
translated: Khargawa, Khargawa, Khargawa, Mujgini.

original: āvarta vivarta /
analyzed: āvarta vivarta
translated: Avarta, Vivarta.

original: khavarta bramārtha jyotivarta / svāhā //
analyzed: kha varta brama artha jyoti varta svāhā
translated: Khavart, Brahma-artha, Jyotivart. Svâhâ.

original: athāyuṣmān pūrṇo dhāvan gītasvareṇa māraputrebhyaḥ imā gāthā imāni ca mantrapadāni bhāṣate sma /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān pūrṇaḥ dhāvan gīta svareṇa māra putrebhyaḥ imāḥ gāthāḥ imāni ca mantra padāni bhāṣate sma
translated: Then the Venerable Pûrnâ, running, spoke these verses and these mantra words to the sons of Mâra in a singing voice.

original: atha te paṃcāśan mārakumārakāḥ paramahṛṣṭāḥ suprasannamanasa evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: atha te paṃcāśat māra kumārakāḥ parama hṛṣṭāḥ su prasanna manasaḥ evam āhuḥ
translated: Then those fifty young Mâras, exceedingly delighted, with very joyful minds, said this:

original: tvayopadiṣṭaḥ khalu śāntimārgo māyāmarīcipratimāś ca dhātavaḥ /
analyzed: tvayā upadiṣṭaḥ khalu śānti mārgaḥ māyā marīci pratimāḥ ca dhātavaḥ
translated: The path to peace has indeed been taught by you, and the elements are like an illusion, a mirage.

original: saṃkalpamātrajanito vata jīvaloko ratnatrayaṃ hi śaraṇaṃ varadaṃ vrajāmaḥ // /
analyzed: saṃkalpa mātra janitaḥ vata jīva lokaḥ ratnatrayam hi śaraṇam vara dam vrajāmaḥ
translated: The world of living beings is born from mere intention. We go for refuge to the Three Jewels, the granters of boons.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: sarve te paṃcāśan mārakumārakāḥ āyuṣmataḥ pūrṇasya pādau śirasābhivandya vīthīmadhye tasya purato niṣaṇṇā dharmaśravaṇāya //
analyzed: sarve te paṃcāśat māra kumārakāḥ āyuṣmataḥ pūrṇasya pādau śirasā abhivandya vīthī madhye tasya puratas niṣaṇṇāḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: All those fifty Māra youths bowed their heads to the feet of the Venerable Pūrṇa, and sat down in the middle of the street in front of him to listen to the Dharma.

original: tena ca samayenāyuṣmān subhūtiḥ paścimena nagaradvāreṇa rājagṛhaṃ mahānagaraṃ piṇḍāya prāviśat /
analyzed: tena ca samayena āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ paścimena nagara dvāreṇa rājagṛham mahā nagaram piṇḍāya prāviśat
translated: At that time, the Venerable Subhūti entered the great city of Rājagṛha for alms through the western city gate.

original: tatra ca nagaradvāre paṃcāśan mārakumārakāḥ paramayauvanasurūpā mahātmaputraveṣadhāriṇo nṛtyaṃto gāyanto viceruḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca nagara dvāre paṃcāśat māra kumārakāḥ parama yauvana surūpāḥ mahātma putra veṣa dhāriṇaḥ nṛtyaṃtaḥ gāyantaḥ viceruḥ
translated: There, at that city gate, fifty Māra youths, supremely youthful and handsome, dressed in the attire of great sons, were wandering about dancing and singing.

original: ta āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim ubhābhyāṃ pāṇibhyāṃ gṛhya vīthyāṃ dhāvanta āyuṣmantaṃ subhūtim evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: te āyuṣmantam subhūtim ubhābhyām pāṇibhyām gṛhya vīthyām dhāvantaḥ āyuṣmantam subhūtim evam āhuḥ
translated: They grabbed the Venerable Subhūti with both hands, ran through the streets, and said to the Venerable Subhūti:

original: nartasva śramaṇa gāyasva śramaṇa /
analyzed: nartasva śramaṇa gāyasva śramaṇa
translated: Dance, monk! Sing, monk!

original: subhūtir āha /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ āha
translated: Subhūti said:

original: śṛṇuta mārṣā yūyam aśrutapūrvāṃ gītikāṃ śrāvayiṣyāmi /
analyzed: śṛṇuta mārṣāḥ yūyam a śruta pūrvām gītikām śrāvayiṣyāmi
translated: Listen, friends, I will make you hear a song you have never heard before.

original: sarve cālpaśabdā abhūvan /
analyzed: sarve ca alpa śabdāḥ abhūvan
translated: And all became silent.

original: dhāvan gītasvareṇāyuṣmān subhūtir evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: dhāvan gīta svareṇa āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ evam āhuḥ
translated: While running, the Venerable Subhūti sang in a singing voice:🔽The world is impermanent, all conditioned things are suffering,🔽all dharmas are without self, nirvāṇa is peace.

original: anitya sarvabhāva māyabudbudopama
analyzed: anitya sarva bhāva māya budbuda upama
translated: All things are impermanent, like an illusion or a bubble.

original: anityam asti saṃskṛte kvacic calātmake /
analyzed: anityam asti saṃskṛte kvacid cala ātmake
translated: There is impermanence in any conditioned thing that has a wavering nature.

original: yathā marīci dṛṣṭanaṣṭa nāsti tatra śāśvataṃ
analyzed: yathā marīci dṛṣṭa naṣṭa na asti tatra śāśvatam
translated: Just as a mirage is seen and then disappears, there is no permanence there.

original: laghuvyayā hi sarvadharma buddhimān prajānate // /🔽Kurumiya
analyzed: laghu vyayāḥ hi sarva dharma buddhimān prajānate  kurumiya
translated: The wise one understands that all phenomena are quickly destroyed.

original: sarvasparśa duḥkhabhāra vedanā nirātmikā
translated: All contacts are the burden of suffering, and feelings are without self.

original: yatra prasakta sarvabāla duḥkhadharmapīḍitā /
analyzed: yatra
translated: Where all foolish people are attached, they are afflicted by the dharma of suffering.

original: mitraṃ na kaścid asti sarvaduḥkhamocaka
analyzed: mitram na kaścid asti sarva duḥkha mocaka
translated: There is no friend at all who liberates from all suffering.

original: yathā hi śraddha bodhimārga bhāvanā ca sevitā // /
analyzed: yathā hi śraddha bodhi mārga bhāvanā ca sevitā
translated: Just as faith, the cultivation of the path to enlightenment, and service are practiced.

original: ekalakṣa sarvadharma saṃjñavarjitāḥ śubhā
analyzed: śubhā
translated: All phenomena are one, free from the conception of beauty.

original: nirātmayoga sarvacarya 'dravyalakṣaṇātmikā /
analyzed: dravya lakṣaṇa ātmikā
translated: The yoga of selflessness is the practice of the nature of the characteristics of substances.

original: na jīvapoṣa pudgalo 'pi kārako na vidyate
analyzed: na kārakaḥ na vidyate
translated: There is no living being, nourishment, or person, and no creator is found.

original: tyajitva māraśāṭhya bodhi citta nāmaye // /
analyzed: tyajitva māra śāṭhya bodhi citta na āmaye
translated: Having abandoned the deceit of Mara, one should turn towards the mind of enlightenment.

original: vijñānu vartate 'ndriyeṣu vidyutā yathā nabhe
analyzed: vijñānu vartate ndriyeṣu vidyutā yathā nabhe
translated: Consciousness moves among the faculties, like lightning in the sky.

original: anātmakāś ca sarvasparśavedanā pi cetanā /
analyzed: anātmakāḥ ca sarva sparśa vedanā pi cetanā
translated: All contacts, feelings, and intentions are without self.

original: yoniśo nirīkṣa kiṃcid asti naiva dravyataḥ
analyzed: yoniśas nirīkṣa kiṃcid asti nā eva dravyataḥ
translated: When examined properly, nothing exists as a substance at all.

original: saṃmohito hi bālavargu yaṃtravat pravartate // /
analyzed: saṃmohitaḥ hi bāla vargu yaṃtra vat pravartate
translated: For the assembly of fools is deluded and acts like a machine.

original: skandha sarve yoniśo vibhāvya kārako na labhyate
analyzed: skandha sarve yoniśas vibhāvya kārakaḥ na labhyate
translated: Having fully contemplated all the aggregates, no agent is found.

original: bhūtakoṭi śānta śūnya sarvaantavarjitā /
translated: The limit of reality is peaceful, empty, and free from all extremes.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃi

original: amohadharmataiṣa ukta bodhimārgacārikā
analyzed: a moha dharma tā eṣa bodhi mārga cārikā
translated: This is said to be the Dharma of non-delusion, the practice of the path to enlightenment.

original: nayāhi nāyakena bodhi prāpta tāyina // /
analyzed: nayāhi nāyakena bodhi prāpta tāyina
translated: The Jina, the Leader, has attained enlightenment through these methods.

original: tadyathā /
analyzed: tat yathā
translated: They are as follows:

original: sumunde vimunde munda jahi /
analyzed: sumunde vimunde munda jahi
translated: Sumunde vimunde munde jahi.

original: sili sili sili /
analyzed: sili sili
translated: Sili sili sili.

original: avasili tathātvasili bhūtakoṭisili svāhā //
analyzed: ava sili tathātva sili bhūtakoṭi sili svāhā
translated: Avasi sili tathatāsi bhūtakoṭisi svāhā.

original: athāyuṣmān subhūtir dhāvan gītasvareṇemā gāthā imāni ca mantrapadāni bhāṣate sma /
analyzed: atha āyuṣmān subhūtiḥ dhāvan gīta svareṇa imāḥ gāthāḥ imāni ca mantra padāni bhāṣate sma
translated: Then the Venerable Subhūti, running, spoke these verses and these mantra words in a singing voice:

original: atha te paṃcāśan mārakumārakāḥ paramahṛṣṭāḥ prasannamanasaḥ evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: atha te paṃcāśat māra kumārakāḥ parama hṛṣṭāḥ prasanna manasaḥ evam āhuḥ
translated: Then those fifty young Māras, extremely delighted, with joyful minds, said this:

original: aśrutvā hīdṛśān dharmān pāpamitravaśānugaiḥ /
analyzed: a śrutvā hi īdṛśān dharmān pāpa mitra vaśa anugaiḥ
translated: Having not heard such teachings, under the influence of evil friends,

original: yat kṛtaṃ pāpakaṃ karmamohāvidyānvitendriyaiḥ // /
analyzed: yat kṛtam pāpakam karma moha avidyā anvita indriyaiḥ
translated: Whatever evil deeds were done by us, with faculties afflicted by delusion and ignorance,

original: pratideśya tad adyaiva vayaṃ sākṣāj jinātmajā /
analyzed: pratideśya tat adyā eva vayam sākṣāt jina ātmajā
translated: Having confessed that today itself, we, the true sons of the Victorious Ones,

original: praṇidhānaṃ śubhaṃ kurmo buddhatvāya jagaddhitāḥ // /
analyzed: praṇidhānam śubham kurmaḥ buddha tvāya jagat hitāḥ
translated: Make a pure aspiration for Buddhahood, for the benefit of the world.

original: sarve te paṃcāśan mārakumārakā āyuṣmataḥ subhūteḥ pādau śirasābhivandya tasyaiva purato vīthīmadhye nyaṣīdur dharmaśravaṇāya //
analyzed: sarve te paṃcāśat māra kumārakāḥ āyuṣmataḥ subhūteḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya tasya eva puratas vīthī madhye nyaṣīduḥ dharma śravaṇāya
translated: All those fifty Māra youths bowed their heads to the feet of the Venerable Subhūti and sat down in the middle of the street in front of him to listen to the Dharma.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena sā vīthī buddhānubhāvena yojanaśatavistīrṇāvakāśaṃ saṃdṛśyate sma /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena sā vīthī buddha anubhāvena yojana śata vistīrṇa avakāśam saṃdṛśyate sma
translated: At that time, by the Buddha's power, that street appeared to be a hundred yojanas wide.

original: tatra ca vīthīmadhye sthaviraḥ śāriputra uttarāmukho Kurumiya niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca vīthī madhye sthaviraḥ śāriputraḥ niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: In the middle of that street, the elder Śāriputra sat facing north,

original: mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ paścāmukho niṣaṇṇaḥ /🔽pūrṇo dakṣiṇāmukhaḥ /
analyzed: mahāmaudgalyāyanaḥ paścāmukhaḥ niṣaṇṇaḥ  pūrṇaḥ dakṣiṇā mukhaḥ
translated: Mahāmaudgalyāyana sat facing west,🔽Pūrṇa sat facing south,

original: subhūtiḥ pūrvāmukhaḥ /
analyzed: subhūtiḥ pūrvāmukhaḥ
translated: and Subhūti sat facing east.

original: parasparam ardhayojanapramāṇena tasthuḥ /
analyzed: parasparam ardha yojana pramāṇena tasthuḥ
translated: They sat half a yojana apart from each other.

original: teṣāṃ ca caturṇāṃ mahāśrāvakāṇāṃ madhye pṛthivīpradeśasya padmaṃ prādur abhavat paṃcāśad
analyzed: teṣām ca caturṇām mahāśrāvakāṇām madhye pṛthivī pradeśasya padmam prādur abhavat paṃcāśat
translated: In the middle of the area of those four great disciples, a lotus appeared,🔽fifty yojanas in diameter, with a stalk of gold from the Jambu River, petals of blue lapis lazuli,

original: dhastavistāraṃ jāṃbūnadamayena daṇḍena nīlavaiḍūryamayaiḥ partaiḥ śrīgarbhamayena
analyzed: dhasta vistāram jāṃbūnada mayena daṇḍena nīla vaiḍūrya mayaiḥ partaiḥ śrī garbha mayena
translated: a pericarp of Śrīgarbha,

original: kesareṇa muktāmayyā karṇikayā /
analyzed: kesareṇa muktā mayyā karṇikayā
translated: and a pericarp of pearls.

original: tataś ca padmān mahān avabhāso 'bhavat /
analyzed: tatas ca padmāt mahān avabhāsaḥ bhavat
translated: And from that lotus, a great light appeared.

original: tasyāṃ ca vīthyāṃ tat padmaṃ tṛpauruṣam uccatvena saṃdṛśyate sma yāvac caturmahārājakāyikeṣu deveṣu tat padmaṃ divyāni paṃcāśad yojanāny uccatvena
analyzed: tasyām ca vīthyām tat padmam tṛ pauruṣam ucca tvena saṃdṛśyate sma yāvat caturmahārājakāyikeṣu deveṣu tat padmam divyāni paṃcāśat yojanāni ucca tvena
translated: And in that street, that lotus was seen to be four men's heights in height, and up to the gods of the realm of the Four Great Kings, that lotus was seen to be fifty divine leagues in height.

original: saṃdṛśyate sma /
analyzed: saṃdṛśyate sma
translated: It was seen.

original: trayastriṃśatsu tat padmaṃ yojanaśatam uccatvena saṃdṛśyate sma yāvad akaniṣṭheṣu deveṣu tat padmam ardhayojanam uccatvena saṃdṛśyate sma /
analyzed: trayastriṃśatsu tat padmam yojana śatam ucca tvena saṃdṛśyate sma yāvat akaniṣṭheṣu deveṣu tat padmam ardha yojanam ucca tvena saṃdṛśyate sma
translated: In the Heaven of the Thirty-Three, that lotus was seen to be a hundred leagues in height, and up to the Akaniṣṭha gods, that lotus was seen to be half a league in height.

original: tasya ca padmasya patrebhyo nānārthapadāḥ ślokā niśceruḥ /
analyzed: tasya ca padmasya patrebhyaḥ nānā artha padāḥ ślokāḥ niśceruḥ
translated: And from the petals of that lotus, verses with various meanings and words emerged.

original: ye sattvā iha bhūmau sthitās tā imāṃ chlokāñ chuśruvuḥ //
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ iha bhūmau sthitāḥ tāḥ imām ślokām śuśruvuḥ
translated: Those beings who were on this earth heard these verses:

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: ekapudgala utpanno buddhakṣetra ihānaghaḥ /
analyzed: eka pudgalaḥ utpannaḥ buddhakṣetre iha anaghaḥ
translated: One person has arisen in this buddha-field, sinless.

original: nihato māra ekena sasainyabalavāhanaḥ // /
analyzed: nihataḥ māraḥ ekena sa sainya bala vāhanaḥ
translated: Alone he has defeated Māra, with his armies, forces, and mounts.

original: ekena buddhavīryeṇa dharmacakraṃ pravartitaṃ /
analyzed: ekena buddha vīryeṇa dharmacakram pravartitam
translated: By the heroism of one buddha, the wheel of the Dharma has been set in motion.

original: ekākīha jagaddhetor āyāsyati na saṃśayaḥ // /
analyzed: ekākī iha jagat hetoḥ āyāsyati na saṃśayaḥ
translated: Alone, for the sake of the world, he will come here, without a doubt.

original: vidvāṃsau bahunītiśāstrakuśalau dharmārthamokṣārthikau
analyzed: vidvāṃsau bahu nīti śāstra kuśalau dharma artha mokṣa arthikau
translated: The wise ones, skilled in many treatises on ethics, seeking liberation for the sake of Dharma and wealth,

original: nītijñāv upatiṣyakaulitavarau śāstrā vinītāv iha /
analyzed: nīti jñau upatiṣya kaulitavarau śāstrā vinītau iha
translated: The two skilled in conduct, Upatiṣya and Kaulita, trained in the scriptures here,

original: vidvāṃ sarvajagaddhitārthakuśalaḥ saddharmavādī mahān
analyzed: vidvān sarva jagat hita artha kuśalaḥ saddharma vādī mahān
translated: The wise one, skilled in the welfare of the whole world, the great expounder of the true Dharma,

original: neṣyaty adya sa sarvalokamahito vādipradhāno muniḥ // /
analyzed: neṣyati adya sa sarva loka mahitaḥ vādi pradhānaḥ muniḥ
translated: The sage, honored by all the world, the foremost in debate, will lead today.

original: tryadhvajñānasudeśakaḥ śramaṇarāṭ chikṣātrayodbhāvakas
translated: The king of ascetics, who teaches the knowledge of the three times well, who proclaims the three trainings,

original: trātā vai sanarāmarasya jagato dharmāprameyārthavit /
analyzed: trātā vai sa nara amarasya jagataḥ dharma aprameya artha vid
translated: The protector, who knows the immeasurable meaning of the Dharma for the benefit of the world of humans and gods,

original: lokasyārthahitapracārakuśalo jñānapradīpo mahān
analyzed: lokasya artha hita pracāra kuśalaḥ jñāna pradīpaḥ mahān
translated: The great lamp of knowledge, skilled in the practice of what is beneficial for the world,

original: sadvādī tṛmalaprahīṇa iha so adyaiva saṃgāsyati // /
analyzed: sat vādī tṛ mala prahīṇaḥ iha saḥ adya eva saṃgāsyati
translated: The true speaker, who has abandoned the three defilements, will enter into final nirvana here today.

original: lokārtham aśrāntamatiś cacāra duḥkhārditaṃ sarvajagad vimocayan /
analyzed: loka artham a śrānta matiḥ cacāra duḥkha arditam sarva jagat vimocayan
translated: With tireless mind for the sake of the world, he practiced, liberating the entire afflicted world from suffering.

original: avidyayā nīvṛtalocanānāṃ saddharmacakṣuḥ pradadau yathāvat // /
analyzed: avidyayā nīvṛta locanānām saddharma cakṣuḥ pradadau yathāvat
translated: He gave the eye of the true Dharma as it is to those whose eyes were covered by ignorance.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: sarvāvatīyaṃ pariṣat samāgatā na cirād ihāyāsyati vādisiṃhaḥ /
analyzed: sarvāvatī iyam pariṣad samāgatā na cirāt iha āyāsyati vādi siṃhaḥ
translated: This entire assembly has gathered. The lion of debaters will come here soon.

original: paramārthadarśī paramaṃ surūpo balair upeto hi parāparajñaḥ // /
analyzed: parama artha darśī paramam surūpaḥ balaiḥ upetaḥ hi para apara jñaḥ
translated: He sees the ultimate truth, has the highest beauty, is endowed with powers, and knows the highest and the lower.

original: dṛṣṭvā jagad duḥkhamahārṇavastham āhaṃtum āyāsyati dharmadundubhim /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā jagat duḥkha mahā arṇava stham āhaṃtum āyāsyati dharma dundubhim
translated: Seeing the world dwelling in the great ocean of suffering, he will come to beat the drum of Dharma.

original: ṣaḍindriyair uttamasaṃvarasthaḥ ṣaḍāśrayaś ca ṣaḍabhijñakovidaḥ // /
analyzed: ṣaṣ indriyaiḥ uttama saṃvara sthaḥ ṣaṣ āśrayaḥ ca ṣaṣ abhijña kovidaḥ
translated: Abiding in the supreme restraint of the six senses, the one skilled in the six higher knowledges and the six bases,

original: ṣaṭsāradharmottamadeśanāyai ṣaḍbīja āyāsyati vādisiṃhaḥ /
analyzed: ṣaṣ sāra dharma uttama deśanāyai ṣaṣ bīje āyāsyati vādi siṃhaḥ
translated: The lion of speakers, the seed of the six, will come to teach the supreme six essential dharmas.

original: ṣaḍindriyagrāmaviheṭanāya ṣaḍuttamārthasmṛtisārathīndraḥ // /
analyzed: ṣaṣ indriya grāma viheṭanāya ṣaṣ uttama artha smṛti sārathi indraḥ
translated: The lord of the six supreme essential recollections, to destroy the village of the six senses,

original: yāvat ṣaṭsu kāmāvacareṣu deveṣu tataḥ padmād imā gāthā niśceruḥ /
analyzed: yāvat ṣaṭsu kāmāvacareṣu deveṣu tatas padmāt imāḥ gāthāḥ niśceruḥ
translated: Up to the six desire realm heavens, from that lotus these verses emerged:

original: yūyaṃ samagrā ratim adya bhuṃjatha pramattacittāḥ madatṛṣṇasaṃvṛtāḥ /
analyzed: yūyam samagrāḥ ratim adya bhuṃjatha pramatta cittāḥ mada tṛṣṇa saṃvṛtāḥ
translated: You all, united, enjoy pleasures today, with distracted minds, covered by the thirst for intoxication.

original: sadā vimūḍhā ratipānamattā na pūjayadhvaṃ sugataṃ pramādāt // /
analyzed: sadā vimūḍhāḥ rati pāna mattāḥ na pūjayadhvam sugatam pramādāt
translated: Always deluded, intoxicated by the drink of pleasures, you do not make offerings to the Sugata out of heedlessness.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kurumiya

original: kāmā anityā dagacandrasannibhāḥ saṃsārapāśo 'tidṛḍhaḥ prajāyāḥ /
analyzed: kāmāḥ anityāḥ daga candra sannibhāḥ saṃsāra pāśaḥ ti dṛḍhaḥ prajāyāḥ
translated: Desires are impermanent, like a firefly or the moon, the noose of cyclic existence is very strong for beings.

original: aniḥsṛtānāṃ ratiṣu pramādināṃ na nirvṛtir jātu punar bhaviṣyati // /
analyzed: a niḥsṛtānām ratiṣu pramādinām na nirvṛtiḥ jātu punar bhaviṣyati
translated: For those who have not escaped, heedless in pleasures, there will never be liberation.

original: sadā pramattā na śamāya yuktā na paśyata prāksukṛtaṃ śubhāśubhaṃ /
analyzed: sadā pramattāḥ na śamāya yuktāḥ na paśyata prāk sukṛtam śubha aśubham
translated: Always heedless, not devoted to peace, you do not see the good and bad of past good deeds.

original: jarārujāmṛtyubhayaiḥ parītā apāyabhūmiprasṛtāś ca yūyaṃ // /
analyzed: jarā rujā mṛtyu bhayaiḥ parītāḥ apāya bhūmi prasṛtāḥ ca yūyam
translated: Surrounded by the dangers of old age, sickness, and death, and set out for the realms of the unfortunate.

original: dānaṃ damaṃ saṃyamam apramādaṃ niṣevata prāksukṛtaṃ ca rakṣata /
analyzed: dānam damam saṃyamam apramādam niṣevata prāk sukṛtam ca rakṣata
translated: Practice generosity, self-control, restraint, and heedfulness, and protect your past good deeds.

original: utsṛjya kāmān aśucīn durantān upasaṃkramadhvaṃ sugataṃ śaraṇyaṃ // /
analyzed: utsṛjya kāmān aśucīn durantān upasaṃkramadhvam sugatam śaraṇyam
translated: Abandon impure desires that lead to misfortune, and go for refuge to the Sugata, the protector.

original: gatvā ca tasmād vacanaṃ śṛṇudhvaṃ subhāṣitaṃ tad dhi mahārthikaṃ ca /
analyzed: gatvā ca tasmāt vacanam śṛṇudhvam su bhāṣitam tat hi mahārthikam ca
translated: Having gone, listen to his words, for they are well-spoken and of great meaning.

original: prajñāvimuktipraśamāya hetuḥ saddharmayuktaṃ śravaṇe mahārthaṃ // /
analyzed: prajñā vimukti praśamāya hetuḥ saddharma yuktam śravaṇe mahārtham
translated: They are the cause for the peace of liberation through wisdom, and listening to the true Dharma is of great meaning.

original: yāvat ṣoḍaśasu devanikāyeṣu tasya padmasya patrebhyaḥ imā evaṃrūpā gāthā niśceruḥ //
analyzed: yāvat ṣoḍaśasu devanikāyeṣu tasya padmasya patrebhyaḥ imāḥ evaṃrūpāḥ gāthāḥ niśceruḥ
translated: And so on, up to the sixteen classes of gods, from the leaves of that lotus, these kinds of verses emerged:

original: Kurumiya 🔽dharmaṃ prayatnena vibhāvayadhvaṃ samāhitadhyānaratā anaṅganāḥ /
analyzed: kurumiya  dharmam prayatnena vibhāvayadhvam samāhita dhyāna ratāḥ an aṅganāḥ
translated: Kuru-mi-ya🔽With effort, contemplate the Dharma, delighting in concentrated meditation, free from desire.

original: abhrāntacittāś ca vimokṣakāṃkṣiṇo dveṣaprahāṇāya matiṃ ca kṛdhvaṃ // /
analyzed: a bhrānta cittāḥ ca vimokṣa kāṃkṣiṇaḥ dveṣa prahāṇāya matim ca kṛdhvam
translated: With undeluded minds, longing for liberation, set your minds on abandoning hatred.

original: trayodaśākāranimittadīpikāṃ vibhāvayadhvaṃ paraṃāṃ hi kṣāntim /
analyzed: trayodaśa ākāra nimitta dīpikām vibhāvayadhvam paraṃām hi kṣāntim
translated: Contemplate the supreme patience, which illuminates the signs with thirteen aspects.

original: tayaiva cātyantavimokṣam āśu saṃprāpsyatha vyādhijarāviyuktam // /
analyzed: tayā eva ca atyanta vimokṣam āśu saṃprāpsyatha vyādhi jarā viyuktam
translated: By that alone, you will quickly attain the highest liberation, free from sickness and old age.

original: śraddhās tu ye rūpavikalpasaṃcaye nityaṃ dhruvātmasthirabhāvadṛṣṭayaḥ /
analyzed: śraddhāḥ tu ye rūpa vikalpa saṃcaye nityam dhruva ātma sthira bhāva dṛṣṭayaḥ
translated: But those who have faith in the accumulation of conceptual forms, who always see things as permanent, stable, and having an inherent nature,

original: teṣāṃ na janmapravahasya hānir apāyabhūmipravaṇā hi te vai // /
analyzed: teṣām na janma pravahasya hāniḥ apāya bhūmi pravaṇāḥ hi te vai
translated: They do not have the loss of the flow of birth, for they are inclined towards the realm of no-misery.

original: traidhātukaṃ vīkṣya sadā nirātmam nirdravyam asvaṃvaśikaṃ nirīhaṃ /
analyzed: traidhātukam vīkṣya sadā nirātmam nirdravyam asvaṃvaśikam nirīham
translated: Always seeing the three realms as selfless, without substance, without self, without control, and without effort,

original: kṣāntiṃ vibhāventi ya ānulomikīṃ bhavaṃti te sarvi gatipramuktāḥ // /
analyzed: kṣāntim ye ānulomikīm bhavanti te gati pramuktāḥ
translated: Those who cultivate the favorable acceptance become completely free from existence.

original: teṣāṃ na mṛtyur na jarā na rogo na durgatir nāpriyasaṃprayogaḥ /
analyzed: teṣām na mṛtyuḥ na jarā na rogaḥ na durgatiḥ na apriya saṃprayogaḥ
translated: For them there is no death, no old age, no disease, no bad rebirth, no association with what is unpleasant.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kurumiya

original: ākāśatulyān iha sarvadharmān ye bhāvayaṃte vyayabhāvayuktān // /
analyzed: ākāśa tulyān iha sarva dharmān ye bhāvayaṃte vyaya bhāva yuktān
translated: Those who contemplate all phenomena here as equal to space, as connected with the arising and ceasing of existence,

original: atyantaśuddho hi varaḥ sa mārgo yeṣām asaṃgaṃ mana indriyeṣu /
analyzed: atyanta śuddhaḥ hi varaḥ sa mārgaḥ yeṣām asaṃgam manaḥ indriyeṣu
translated: For them the supreme path is completely pure, for their minds are unattached to the senses.

original: mārān vidhunvanti catuṣprakārān yathā hy ayaṃ saṃprati śākyasimḥaḥ // /
analyzed: mārān vidhunvanti catuṣprakārān yathā hi ayam saṃprati
translated: They shake off the four types of Mara, just as this Shakyasimha does now.

original: ekaṃ nayaṃ ye tu vibhāvayaṃti niṣkiṃcanaṃ sarvanimittavarjitaṃ /
analyzed: ekam nayam ye tu vibhāvayaṃti niṣkiṃcanam sarva nimitta varjitam
translated: Those who contemplate the one principle, which is devoid of anything, free from all signs,

original: dvayaprahāṇāya vinītaceṣṭās teṣām ayaṃ mārgavaraḥ praṇītaḥ // /
analyzed: dvaya prahāṇāya vinīta ceṣṭāḥ teṣām ayam mārga varaḥ praṇītaḥ
translated: With their striving subdued for the sake of abandoning duality, for them this supreme path is well-taught.

original: vibhāvya śūnyān iha sarvadharmān asvāmikāṅ kārakajātivṛttān /
analyzed: vibhāvya śūnyān iha sarva dharmān kāraka jāti vṛttān
translated: Having contemplated that all phenomena here are empty, without an owner, and the nature of birth and occurrence,

original: spṛśaṃti bodhiṃ gaganasvabhāvān niruttamāṃ prārthanayā vivarjitām // /
analyzed: spṛśaṃti bodhim gagana svabhāvāt niruttamām prārthanayā vivarjitām
translated: They will attain enlightenment, the nature of space, which is unsurpassed and free from desire.

original: ebhir evaṃrūpair arthapadadharmaśabdair niścaradbhir ya iha lokadhātau manuṣyāmanuṣyās te samāgamya vīthīmadhye samantatas tasya padmasya nyaṣeduḥ
analyzed: ebhiḥ evaṃrūpaiḥ artha pada dharma śabdaiḥ niścaradbhiḥ ye iha lokadhātau manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ te samāgamya vīthī madhye samantataḥ tasya padmasya nyaṣeduḥ
translated: When these words of the Dharma, which are meaningful phrases, emerged, the humans and non-humans in this world realm gathered together and sat down all around in the middle of the street, surrounding that lotus.

original: yāvad aprameyāsaṃkhyeyā akaniṣṭhā devā akaniṣṭhabhavanād avatīrya tasya padmasya samantato nyaṣīdan dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: yāvat aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ akaniṣṭhāḥ devāḥ akaniṣṭha bhavanāt avatīrya tasya padmasya samantataḥ nyaṣīdan dharma śravaṇāya
translated: And so on up to the gods of the Akaniṣṭha realm, who descended from the Akaniṣṭha realm and sat down all around that lotus in order to hear the Dharma.

original: aśrauṣīn māraḥ pāpīmān etañ chlokān /
analyzed: aśrauṣīt māraḥ pāpīmān etam ślokān
translated: The evil Māra heard these verses:

original: samantataṃ ca vyavalokyādrākṣīt rājagṛhe mahānagare vīthīmadhye padmaṃ /
analyzed: samantatam ca vyavalokya adrākṣīt rājagṛhe mahā nagare vīthī madhye padmam
translated: And looking all around, he saw the lotus in the middle of the street in the great city of Rājagṛha.

original: tataś ceme ślokā niśceruḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca ime ślokāḥ niśceruḥ
translated: Then these verses emerged:

original: Kurumiya tadā padmaṃ parivārya aprameyāsaṃkhyeyāni manuṣyakoṭīnayutaśatashasrāṇi sanniṣaṇṇāni dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: tadā padmam parivārya aprameya asaṃkhyeyāni manuṣya koṭī nayuta śata shasrāṇi sanniṣaṇṇāni dharma śravaṇāya
translated: At that time, the lotus was surrounded by innumerable, countless hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of humans who had sat down in order to hear the Dharma.

original: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīmān ūrdhvaṃ vyavalokitavān adrākṣīt ṣaṭsu kāmāvacareṣu deveṣu sarvatra devabhavane tat padmaṃ /
analyzed: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīmān ūrdhvam vyavalokitavān adrākṣīt ṣaṭsu kāmāvacareṣu deveṣu sarvatra deva bhavane tat padmam
translated: Then the evil Māra looked up and saw that lotus in all the divine palaces of the six classes of gods in the desire realm.

original: tad eva cānuparivāryāprameyāsaṃkhyeyāni devakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi sanniṣaṇṇāni dharmaśravaṇāya /
analyzed: tat eva ca anuparivārya aprameya asaṃkhyeyāni deva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi sanniṣaṇṇāni dharma śravaṇāya
translated: And immeasurable, countless hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devas, surrounding it, were seated to listen to the Dharma.

original: atha bhūyasyā matrayā māraḥ pāpīmān duḥkhito durmanā vipratisārī saṃhṛṣṭaromakūpaḥ
analyzed: atha bhūyasyā matrayā māraḥ pāpīmān duḥkhitaḥ durmanāḥ vipratisārī saṃhṛṣṭa romakūpaḥ
translated: Then Māra, the evil one, became even more miserable, dejected, remorseful, with his hair standing on end,

original: prasvinnagātraḥ saṃprakaṃpitaśarīro gagane pradhāvan mahatā svareṇāparān mārān prakrośann evam āha /
analyzed: prasvinna gātraḥ saṃprakaṃpita śarīraḥ gagane pradhāvan mahatā svareṇa aparān mārān prakrośan evam āha
translated: with his body sweating and trembling, running through the sky, with a loud voice he cried out to the other Māras, saying:

original: śṛṇu girim asamāṃ samavahitamanā
analyzed: śṛṇu girim asamām samavahita manāḥ
translated: Listen to the unequalled words with a focused mind,

original: na me vaśo svaviṣaye na ca balam iha me /
analyzed: na me sva viṣaye na ca balam iha me
