translated: I have no power over my own realm, nor any strength here.

original: idam iha munibalam atiguṇaviśadaṃ
analyzed: idam iha muni balam ati guṇa viśadam
translated: This power of the sage, very clear with excellent qualities,

original: prasarati jagati sthirajanakaraṇam // /
analyzed: prasarati jagati sthira jana karaṇam
translated: Spreads in the world, causing steadfast people to be firm.

original: kamalam iha punar udayati nar'amaru dayitum
analyzed: kamalam iha punar udayati nara maru dayitum
translated: Here the lotus is rising to delight the gods and humans,

original: upagata nikhilato sujanata niyatā /
analyzed: upagata
translated: The assembly of good people has come with determination.

original: paritṛṣitasugatasuvacananiratā
analyzed: paritṛṣita sugata suvacana niratā
translated: Delighting in the well-spoken words of the thirsty Sugata,

original: vrajati śamathapatham atiguṇaparamā // /
analyzed: vrajati śamatha patham atiguṇa paramā
translated: They proceed on the path of tranquility, supreme with excellent qualities.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: māyeyaṃ śramaṇena vartita iha trailokyasaṃmohanī
analyzed: māyā iyam śramaṇena vartite iha trailokya saṃmohanī
translated: This illusion is being performed here by the ascetic, deluding the three worlds,

original: sarve 'nanyamanā narāmaragaṇāḥ padmaṃ vitanya sthitāḥ /
analyzed: sarve nara amara gaṇāḥ padmam vitanya sthitāḥ
translated: All the hosts of humans and gods, with single-pointed minds, are seated, spreading out the lotus.

original: kṣipraṃ muṃcatha śailavṛṣṭim abhunā bhīṣmasvaraṃ rāviṇo
analyzed: kṣipram muṃcatha śaila vṛṣṭim bhīṣma svaram rāviṇo
translated: Quickly release a rain of rocks and make a terrifying sound,

original: gacchen nāśam ayaṃ yathādya nihato mārograsainyāyudhaiḥ // /
analyzed: gacchet nāśam ayam yathā adya nihataḥ māra ugra sainya āyudhaiḥ
translated: So that today he will be destroyed and killed by Māra's great army and weapons.

original: athāparo māraḥ pāpīmaṃtam evam āha /
analyzed: atha aparaḥ māraḥ evam āha
translated: Then another Māra said to the evil one:

original: śṛṇv asmākam idaṃ vaco hitakaraṃ vijñātadharmo 'si kiṃ
analyzed: śṛṇu asmākam idam vacaḥ hita karam vijñāta dharmaḥ si kim
translated: Listen to these beneficial words of ours. You know the Dharma, don't you?

original: yat paśyann api mārasainyavilayaṃ nāyāsi śāntiṃ tataḥ /
analyzed: yat paśyan api māra sainya vilayam na āyāsi śāntim tatas
translated: Seeing the destruction of Māra's army, why do you not attain peace?

original: bhrāntāḥ smaḥ prasamīkṣya saugatam idaṃ tejovapuḥ śrīdhanaṃ
analyzed: bhrāntāḥ smaḥ prasamīkṣya saugatam idam tejaḥ vapuḥ śrīdhanam
translated: We are confused, seeing this glorious body of the Sugata's splendor and wealth.

original: rūpaṃ nānyad ihottamaṃ suśaraṇaṃ buddhād ṛte nāyakāt // /
analyzed: rūpam na anyat iha uttamam su śaraṇam buddhāt ṛte nāyakāt
translated: There is no other supreme form like the Buddha, the leader, the good refuge.

original: athāparo māraḥ prarudan paramakrodhāviṣṭavadano māraṃ pāpīmantam eva āha /🔽kumārgasaṃprasthita mārgahīna prajānase na svabalaṃ na śaktiṃ /
analyzed: atha aparaḥ māraḥ prarudan parama krodha āviṣṭa vadanaḥ māram pāpīmantam eva āha  ku mārga saṃprasthita mārga hīna prajānase na sva balam na śaktim
translated: Then another Māra, weeping with a face full of extreme anger, said to the evil Māra:🔽You are on the wrong path, devoid of the path. You do not know your own strength and ability.

original: na lajjase 'patrapase na caiva yat tvaṃ saha spardhasi nāyakena // /
analyzed: na lajjase patrapase na ca eva yat tvam saha spardhasi nāyakena
translated: You are not ashamed or embarrassed, yet you compete with the leader.

original: asmadbalaṃ yad vilayaṃ prayātaṃ buddhasya śaktyā tu jagat samagram /
analyzed: asmad balam yat vilayam prayātam buddhasya śaktyā tu jagat samagram
translated: Our army has been destroyed, but by the Buddha's power, the entire world

original: upāgamat padmasamīpam āśu dharmaśravāpyāyitaśuddhadehaṃ // /
analyzed: upāgamat padma samīpam āśu dharma śrava āpyāyita śuddha deham
translated: Quickly approached the lotus, to the one with a pure body nourished by the nectar of the Dharma.

original: vayaṃ tu bībhatsatarāḥ prayātā durgandhakāyā balavīryanaṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: vayam tu bībhatsatarāḥ prayātāḥ durgandha kāyāḥ bala vīrya naṣṭāḥ
translated: But we have become even more disgusted, our bodies foul-smelling, our strength and vigor lost.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: We are like a heap of chaff,

original: yāvan na yātā vilayaṃ kṣaṇena tāvad vrajāmaḥ śaraṇaṃ munīndram // /
analyzed: yāvat na yātāḥ vilayam kṣaṇena tāvat vrajāmaḥ śaraṇam muni indram
translated: As long as we do not perish in an instant, let us go for refuge to the Lord of Sages.

original: athāpare mārāḥ kṛtāṃjalayaḥ evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: atha apare mārāḥ kṛtāṃjalayaḥ evam āhuḥ
translated: Then other Maras, with palms joined, said this:

original: pāpīmaṃs tvam apetadharmacaraṇaḥ pāpakriyāyāṃ rato
analyzed: tvam apeta dharma caraṇaḥ pāpa kriyāyām
translated: You, Pāpīyān, have abandoned the practice of Dharma and delight in evil deeds.

original: nātho hy eṣa jagaddhitārthakuśalo buddhaḥ satām agraṇī /
analyzed: nāthaḥ hi eṣa jagat hita artha kuśalaḥ buddhaḥ satām agraṇī
translated: This Buddha is the protector, skilled in benefiting the world, the foremost of the virtuous.

original: āyāmo nagaraṃ drutaṃ vayam iha prītiprasannekṣaṇāḥ
analyzed: āyāmaḥ nagaram drutam vayam iha prīti prasanna īkṣaṇāḥ
translated: Let us quickly go to the city here with eyes of joy and delight.

original: gacchāmaḥ śaraṇaṃ trilokamahitaṃ sarvauṣadhaṃ prāṇināṃ // /
analyzed: gacchāmaḥ śaraṇam triloka mahitam sarva auṣadham prāṇinām
translated: We go for refuge to the one who is honored in the three worlds, the medicine for all living beings.

original: atha tatraiva gagane ghoṣavatir nāma māraḥ sa uccasvareṇaivam āha /
analyzed: atha tatra eva gagane ghoṣavatiḥ nāma māraḥ saḥ ucca svareṇa evam āha
translated: Then in that very sky, a Mara named Ghoṣavat said in a loud voice:

original: sarve yūyaṃ samagrāḥ śṛṇuta mama vaco bhaktitaḥ prītiyuktāḥ🔽pāpād dṛṣṭiṃ nivārya praṇatatanu manovāksamācāraceṣṭāḥ /
analyzed: sarve yūyam samagrāḥ śṛṇuta mama vacaḥ bhaktitaḥ prīti yuktāḥ  pāpāt dṛṣṭim nivārya praṇata tanu manaḥ vāc samācāra ceṣṭāḥ
translated: All of you together, listen to my words with devotion and joy.🔽Turn away from evil views, with body, mind, speech, and conduct subdued.

original: tyaktakrodhāḥ prahṛṣṭā munivaravacane sphītabhaktiprasādā
analyzed: tyakta krodhāḥ prahṛṣṭāḥ muni vara vacane sphīta bhakti prasādā
translated: Abandon anger, be joyful, with abundant devotion and faith in the words of the excellent sage.

original: gatvā buddhaṃ samakṣaṃ śaraṇam asulabhaṃ pūjayāmo 'dya bhaktyā // /
analyzed: gatvā buddham samakṣam śaraṇam a sulabham pūjayāmaḥ bhaktyā
translated: Having gone to the Buddha's presence, we shall today worship him with devotion, difficult to obtain.

original: atha tatkṣaṇam eva sarve mārā gaganatalād avatīrya rājagṛhanagaradvārāṇi saptaratnamayāni cakruḥ /
analyzed: atha tad kṣaṇam eva sarve mārāḥ gagana talāt avatīrya rājagṛha nagara dvārāṇi sapta ratna mayāni cakruḥ
translated: Then, at that very moment, all the Māras descended from the sky and made the gates of Rājagṛha's city out of the seven precious substances.

original: kecin mārāś cakravartirājaveṣam ātmānam abhinirmīya bhagavataḥ pūjāparās tasthuḥ /
analyzed: kecid mārāḥ cakravarti rāja veṣam ātmānam abhinirmīya bhagavataḥ pūjā parāḥ tasthuḥ
translated: Some Māras, having manifested themselves in the form of universal monarchs, remained intent on worshipping the Blessed One.

original: kecid brāhmaṇaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid brāhmaṇa veṣam
translated: Some in the form of brahmins.

original: kecid vaśavartiveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid vaśavarti veṣam
translated: Some in the form of Vaśavartin.

original: kecin maheśvaraveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid maheśvara veṣam
translated: Some in the form of Maheśvara.

original: kecin nārāyaṇaveṣaṃ /🔽kecit tuṣitaveṣaṃ Kurumiya
analyzed: kecid nārāyaṇa veṣam  kecid tuṣita veṣam
translated: Some in the form of Nārāyaṇa.🔽Some in the form of Tuṣita.

original: kecid yāmaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid yāmaveṣam
translated: Some in the form of Yāma.

original: kecic chakraveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid śakra veṣam
translated: Some in the form of Śakra.

original: kecit trayastriṃśaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid trayastriṃśa veṣam
translated: Some in the form of the Thirty-Three.

original: kecit kumāraveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid kumāra veṣam
translated: Some in the form of Kumāra.

original: kecid vaiśravaṇaveṣaṃ /🔽kecid virūḍhaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid vaiśravaṇa veṣam  kecid virūḍha veṣam
translated: Some in the form of Vaiśravaṇa.🔽Some in the form of Virūḍhaka.

original: kecid virūpākṣaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid virūpākṣa veṣam
translated: Some in the form of Virūpākṣa.

original: kecid dhṛtarāṣṭraveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid dhṛtarāṣṭra veṣam
translated: Some in the form of Dhṛtarāṣṭra.

original: kecit prākṛtacaturmahārājaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid prākṛta catur mahārāja veṣam
translated: Some in the form of the ordinary Four Great Kings.

original: kecit sūryaveṣaṃ /🔽kecic candraveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid sūrya veṣam  kecid candra veṣam
translated: Some in the form of the sun.🔽Some in the form of the moon.

original: kecit tārakaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid tāraka veṣam
translated: Some in the form of the stars.

original: kecid asuraveṣaṃ /🔽kecid garuḍaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid asura veṣam  kecid garuḍa veṣam
translated: Some in the form of asuras.🔽Some in the form of garuḍas.

original: kecit kinnaraveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid kinnara veṣam
translated: Some in the form of kinnaras.

original: kecin mahoragaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid mahā uraga veṣam
translated: Some in the form of mahoragas.

original: kecid ratnaparvataveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid ratna parvata veṣam
translated: Some had the appearance of jewel mountains.

original: kecin niṣkaveṣaṃ /🔽kecin nānāratnaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid niṣka veṣam  kecid nānā ratna veṣam
translated: Some had the appearance of gold coins.🔽Some had the appearance of various jewels.

original: kecid ratnavṛkṣaveṣaṃ /🔽kecit kṣatriyaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid ratna vṛkṣa veṣam  kecid kṣatriya veṣam
translated: Some had the appearance of jewel trees.🔽Some had the appearance of kshatriyas.

original: kecid anyatīrthikaveṣaṃ /🔽kecic cakraratnaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid anya tīrthika veṣam  kecid cakra ratna veṣam
translated: Some had the appearance of other tīrthikas.🔽Some had the appearance of the precious wheel.

original: kecin maṇiratnaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid maṇi ratna veṣam
translated: Some had the appearance of the precious jewel.

original: kecid airāvaṇaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid airāvaṇa veṣam
translated: Some had the appearance of Airāvaṇa.

original: kecid bālāhāśvarājaveṣaṃ /🔽kecit strīratnaveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid bālāha aśva rāja veṣam  kecid strī ratna veṣam
translated: Some had the appearance of the king of horses Bālāha.🔽Some had the appearance of the precious woman.

original: kecic chreṣṭhiveṣaṃ /
analyzed: kecid śreṣṭhi veṣam
translated: Some had the appearance of a merchant.

original: kecid rājāmātyaveṣaṃ ātmānam abhinirmīya tasthur bhagavataḥ pūjākarmaṇe /
analyzed: kecid rāja amātya veṣam ātmānam abhinirmīya tasthuḥ bhagavataḥ pūjā karmaṇe
translated: Some had the appearance of a king's minister. Having manifested themselves in this way, they remained there to perform worship of the Blessed One.

original: kecin nīlā nīlavarṇāḥ śvetālaṃkārālaṃkṛtam ātmānam abhinirmīya bhagavataḥ pūjākarmaṇe
analyzed: kecid nīlāḥ nīla varṇāḥ śveta alaṃkāra alaṃkṛtam ātmānam abhinirmīya bhagavataḥ pūjā karmaṇe
translated: Some, blue in color, adorned with white ornaments, having manifested themselves in this way, remained there to perform worship of the Blessed One.

original: lohitāṃ chatradhvajapatākāmuktāhārān dhārayantas tālapramāṇamātram uccatvena gaganatale tasthuḥ /
analyzed: lohitām chatra dhvaja patākā muktā hārān dhārayantaḥ tāla pramāṇa mātram ucca tvena gagana tale tasthuḥ
translated: Holding red parasols, banners, flags, and pearl necklaces, they remained in the sky, as tall as a palm tree.

original: kecid avadātā avadātavarṇābharaṇā maṃjiṣṭhavarṇābharaṇavibhūṣaṇāḥ pītāṃ chatradvajapatākān Kurumiya 🔽dhārayantas tasthuḥ /
analyzed: kecid avadātāḥ avadāta varṇa ābharaṇāḥ maṃjiṣṭha varṇa ābharaṇa vibhūṣaṇāḥ pītām chatra dvaja patākān 🔽dhārayantaḥ tasthuḥ
translated: Some, pure in color, with pure ornaments, adorned with vermilion-colored ornaments, holding yellow parasols, banners, flags, and pearl necklaces, remained there.

original: kecin maṃjiṣṭhā maṃjiṣṭhavarṇāḥ suvarṇābharaṇavibhūṣaṇā nīlāñ chatradhvajapatākān dhārayantas tasthuḥ /🔽kecil lohitā lohitavarṇāḥ śvetamuktavarṣaṃ vavarṣuḥ /
analyzed: kecid maṃjiṣṭhāḥ maṃjiṣṭha varṇāḥ suvarṇa ābharaṇa vibhūṣaṇāḥ nīlām chatra dhvaja patākān dhārayantaḥ tasthuḥ  kecid lohitāḥ lohita varṇāḥ śvetam ukta varṣam vavarṣuḥ
translated: Some, the color of coral, with golden ornaments and decorations, held blue parasols, flags, and banners.🔽Some, red in color, rained down white pearls.

original: kecic chvetāḥ śvetavarṇāḥ lohitamuktavarṣaṃ vavarṣuḥ /
analyzed: kecid śvetāḥ śveta varṇāḥ lohita mukta varṣam vavarṣuḥ
translated: Some, white in color, rained down red pearls.

original: kecid devarṣivarṇam ātmānam abhinirmīya gaganāt puṣpavarṣam abhipravavarṣuḥ /
analyzed: kecid devarṣi varṇam ātmānam abhinirmīya gaganāt puṣpa varṣam abhipravavarṣuḥ
translated: Some, manifesting themselves in the form of celestial sages, rained down flowers from the sky.

original: kecid bhagavataḥ śrāvakaveṣaṃ ātmānam abhinirmīya nānādivyagandhavarṣaṃ gaganād vavarṣuḥ /🔽kecid gandharvavarṇā nānādivyatūryāṇi parājaghnuḥ /
analyzed: kecid bhagavataḥ śrāvaka veṣam ātmānam abhinirmīya nānā divya gandha varṣam gaganāt vavarṣuḥ  kecid gandharva varṇāḥ nānā divya tūryāṇi parājaghnuḥ
translated: Some, manifesting themselves in the form of the Blessed One's disciples, rained down various celestial fragrances from the sky.🔽Some, in the form of gandharvas, played various celestial instruments.

original: kecid amarakanyāvarṇā nānāratnabhājaneṣu gandhodakaṃ dhārayaṃtaḥ pṛthivīṃ siṃciṣuḥ /
analyzed: kecid amara kanyā varṇāḥ nānā ratna bhājaneṣu gandha udakam dhārayaṃtaḥ pṛthivīm
translated: Some, in the form of celestial maidens, sprinkled the earth with perfumed water in various jeweled vessels.

original: kecit kācakṛṣṇavarṇā nānāgandhān pradhūpayām āsuḥ /
analyzed: kecid kāca kṛṣṇa varṇāḥ nānā gandhān pradhūpayām āsuḥ
translated: Some, in the form of black glass, burned various fragrances.

original: kecid devaputraveṣeṇa nṛtyagītasvarān mumucuḥ /
analyzed: kecid deva putra veṣeṇa nṛtya gīta svarān mumucuḥ
translated: Some, in the form of celestial sons, let loose the sounds of dancing, singing, and music.

original: kecin nānāvarṇā yena bhagavāṃs tena prāñjalayo bhagavantaṃ tuṣṭuvuḥ /
analyzed: kecid nānā varṇāḥ yena bhagavān tena prāñjalayaḥ bhagavantam tuṣṭuvuḥ
translated: Some, of various colors, with palms joined, praised the Blessed One.

original: kecin mārā mārapārṣadyā api yasyān diśi bhagavāṃs tad abhimukhā nānādyāni maṇiratnāni dadhrire bhagavataḥ pūjākarmaṇe /
analyzed: kecid mārāḥ māra pārṣadyāḥ api yasyān diśi bhagavān tat abhimukhāḥ nānādyāni maṇi ratnāni dadhrire bhagavataḥ pūjā karmaṇe
translated: Some Māras and Māra’s retinue, in whatever direction the Blessed One was, faced that direction and held various precious jewels for the purpose of worshipping the Blessed One.

original: kecid vīthīgṛhaśaraṇagavākṣatoraṇaharmyacatvaraśṛṅgāṭakakūṭāgāradvāravṛkṣavimāneṣu sthitvā prāṃjalayo nyaṣedur bhagavataḥ pūjākarmaṇe /
analyzed: kecid vīthī gṛha śaraṇa gavākṣa toraṇa harmya catvara śṛṅgāṭaka kūṭāgāra dvāra vṛkṣa vimāneṣu sthitvā prāṃjalayaḥ nyaṣeduḥ bhagavataḥ pūjā karmaṇe
translated: Some, standing in the streets, houses, shelters, windows, archways, palaces, crossroads, junctions, towers, doors, trees, and celestial mansions, with palms joined, bowed down for the purpose of worshipping the Blessed One.

original: atha sa māro yadādrākṣīt sarvāṃs tān mārān saparivārāṃ chramaṇaṃ gautamaṃ śaraṇam gatān tadā bhūyasyā mātrayā kṣubdhas trasto bhrāntaḥ prarudann
analyzed: atha sa māraḥ yadā adrākṣīt sarvān tān mārān sa parivārām śramaṇam gautamam śaraṇam gatān tadā bhūyasyā mātrayā kṣubdhaḥ trastaḥ bhrāntaḥ prarudan  /
translated: Then that Māra, seeing all those Māras with their retinues gone for refuge to the ascetic Gautama, became even more agitated, frightened, confused, and weeping,

original: evam āha /
analyzed: evam āha
translated: he said this:

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: kurumiya

original: na bhūyo me sahāyo 'sti naṣṭā śrīr me 'dya sarvataḥ /
analyzed: na bhūyas me sahāyaḥ u sti naṣṭā śrīḥ me dya sarvatas
translated: I have no companion anymore, my glory has now vanished completely.

original: bhraṣṭo 'smi māraviṣayāt kuryāṃ vīryaṃ hi paścimam // /
analyzed: bhraṣṭaḥ smi māra viṣayāt kuryām vīryam hi paścimam
translated: I have fallen from Māra's domain, I should exert my last strength.

original: mūlāc chindyām ahaṃ padmaṃ sattvā yena diśo 'vrajan /
analyzed: mūlāt chindyām aham padmam sattvāḥ yena diśaḥ vrajan
translated: I would cut the lotus from the root, by which beings have gone in the directions.

original: chedāt padmasya saṃbhrāntā etat syāt paścimaṃ balaṃ // /
analyzed: chedāt padmasya saṃbhrāntāḥ etat syāt paścimam balam
translated: From the cutting of the lotus, they would be confused, this would be the last strength.

original: iti saṃcintya māraḥ pāpīmāṃ vāyuvad avatīrya gaganād yena tat padmaṃ vīthīgataṃ tena prasṛtya tat padmam ā daṇḍād icchaty uddhartuṃ spraṣṭum
analyzed: iti saṃcintya māraḥ pāpi imām vāyu vat avatīrya gaganāt yena tat padmam vīthī gatam tena prasṛtya tat padmam ā daṇḍāt icchati uddhartum spraṣṭum
translated: Thinking this, the evil Māra descended from the sky like the wind, approached that lotus in the street, and tried to pull it out by the stalk, to touch it,

original: api na śaśāka /🔽patrāṇi cchetum icchati na ca tāni dadarśa /
analyzed: api na śaśāka  patrāṇi chetum icchati na ca tāni dadarśa
translated: but he could not even touch it.🔽He tried to tear off the petals, but he could not see them.

original: padmakarṇikām api pāṇinā parāhaṃtum icchati tām api naivopalebhe //
analyzed: padma karṇikām api pāṇinā parāhaṃtum icchati tām api nā eva upalebhe
translated: He tried to strike the lotus calyx with his hand, but he could not even reach it.

original: tadyathā vidyud dṛśyate na copalabhyate /🔽tadyathā vā cchāyā dṛśyate na copalabhyate /
analyzed: tat yathā vidyut dṛśyate na ca upalabhyate  tat yathā vā chāyā dṛśyate na ca upalabhyate
translated: Just as lightning is seen but not apprehended,🔽or just as a shadow is seen but not apprehended,

original: evam eva tat padmaṃ dṛśyate na copalabhyate /
analyzed: evam eva tat padmam dṛśyate na ca upalabhyate
translated: in the same way that lotus was seen but not apprehended.

original: yadā ca māraḥ pāpīmāṃs tat padmaṃ dadarśa na copalebhe na pasparśa /🔽atha punaḥ sarvaparṣatsaṃtrāsanārtham uccair mahābhairavaṃ svaraṃ moktum icchati tadāpi na śaśāka /
analyzed: yadā ca māraḥ pāpīmān tat padmam dadarśa na ca upalebhe na pasparśa  atha punar sarva parṣad saṃtrāsana artham uccais mahā bhairavam svaram moktum icchati tadā api na śaśāka
translated: And when the evil Māra saw that lotus but could not apprehend it,🔽then again, in order to frighten the entire assembly, he tried to let loose a loud, extremely terrifying cry, but he could not do so.

original: sa punar mahābalavegenobhābhyāṃ pāṇibhyām icchati mahāpṛthivīṃ parāhaṃtuṃ kaṃpayituṃ tām api spraṣṭum api na śaśāka naivopalebhe /
analyzed: sa punar mahā bala vegena ubhābhyām pāṇibhyām icchati mahā pṛthivīm parāhaṃtum kaṃpayitum tām api spraṣṭum api na śaśāka na eva upalebhe
translated: Then, with great strength and force, he tried to strike the great earth with both hands, to make it tremble, but he could not even touch it, he could not apprehend it at all.

original: tadyathāpi nāma kaścid ākāśam icchet parāmarṣṭuṃ na copalebhe /
analyzed: tat yathā api nāma kaścid ākāśam icchet parāmarṣṭum na ca upalebhe
translated: Just as someone might wish to grasp space, but would not touch it,

original: evam eva māraḥ pāpīmāṃ dadarśa pṛthivīṃ na ca pasparśa nopalebhe /
analyzed: evam eva māraḥ pāpī imām dadarśa pṛthivīm na ca pasparśa na upalebhe
translated: in the same way, Māra, the evil one, saw the earth, but did not touch it, did not grasp it.

original: tasyaitad abhavat /
analyzed: tasya etat abhavat
translated: This occurred to him:

original: yan nv ahaṃ yathā sannipatitānāṃ sattvānāṃ prahārāṃ dadyāṃ cittavikṣepaṃ vā kuryām iti dadarśa tān sattvān na caikasattvam apy upalebhe na
analyzed: yat nu aham yathā sannipatitānām sattvānām dadyām citta vikṣepam vā kuryām iti dadarśa tān sattvān na ca eka sattvam api upalebhe na
translated: If I were to give blows to the assembled beings, or cause confusion in their minds, he saw those beings, but did not grasp even a single being.

original: atha bhūyasyā mātrayā māraḥ pāpīmān ruroda /
analyzed: atha bhūyasyā mātrayā māraḥ pāpīmān ruroda
translated: Then Māra, the evil one, wept even more.

original: buddhānubhāvena cāsya sarvaṃ śarīraṃ vṛkṣavac Kurumiya cakaṃpe /
analyzed: buddha anubhāvena ca asya sarvam śarīram vṛkṣa vat cakaṃpe
translated: And by the Buddha's power, his whole body trembled like a tree,

original: sāśrumukhaś caturdiśaṃ ca vyavalokayann evam āha /
analyzed: sa aśru mukhaḥ caturdiśam ca vyavalokayan evam āha
translated: and with a tearful face, looking in the four directions, he said this:

original: māyaiṣā śramaṇena sarvajagato 'dyāvarjanārthaṃ kṛtā
analyzed: māyā eṣā śramaṇena sarva jagataḥ dyā varjana artham kṛtā
translated: This is an illusion created by the ascetic to attract the whole world today,

original: yenāhaṃ purato vimohita iva bhrāntiṃ gato 'smi kṣaṇāt /
analyzed: yena aham puratas vimohitaḥ iva bhrāntim gataḥ smi kṣaṇāt
translated: by which I, as if deluded, have gone astray in an instant.

original: bhraṣṭo 'haṃ viṣayāt svapuṇyabalataḥ kṣīṇaṃ ca me jīvitaṃ
analyzed: bhraṣṭaḥ ham viṣayāt sva puṇya balataḥ kṣīṇam ca me jīvitam
translated: I have fallen from my domain, my merit and power are exhausted, my life is over,

original: śīghraṃ yāmi nirākṛtaḥ svabhavanaṃ yāvan na yāmi kṣayam // /
analyzed: śīghram yāmi nirākṛtaḥ sva bhavanam yāvat na yāmi kṣayam
translated: I quickly go, rejected, to my own abode, lest I perish.

original: svabhavanam api gaṃtum icchati na tatrāpi śaśāka gantuṃ /
analyzed: sva bhavanam api gaṃtum icchati na tatra api śaśāka gantum
translated: He wanted to go to his own abode, but he was not able to go there either.

original: sa bhūyasyā mātrayā trasto ruroda /
analyzed: sa bhūyasyā mātrayā trastaḥ ruroda
translated: He became even more frightened and cried.

original: evaṃ cāsyodapādi /
analyzed: evam ca asya udapādi
translated: And this occurred to him:

original: parikṣīṇo 'ham ṛddhibalāt /
analyzed: parikṣīṇaḥ ham ṛddhi balāt
translated: I am exhausted from the power of my magical abilities.

original: mā haivāhaṃ śramaṇasya gautamasya vaśam āgaccheyaṃ /
analyzed: mā ha eva aham śramaṇasya gautamasya vaśam āgaccheyam
translated: May I not come under the power of the ascetic Gautama.

original: mā vā me 'sya śatror agrato jīvitakṣayaḥ syād yan nv aham ato 'ntardhāyeyaṃ /
analyzed: mā vā me sya śatroḥ agratas jīvita kṣayaḥ syāt yat nu aham atas ntardhāyeyam
translated: Or may I not lose my life in the presence of this enemy. What if I were to disappear from here?

original: sahabuddhakṣetrasya bahirdhā kālaṃ kuryāṃ /
analyzed: saha buddhakṣetrasya bahirdhā kālam kuryām
translated: I will die outside the Buddha-field.

original: yathaikasattvo 'pi me sahabuddhakṣetre vā kālaṃ kurvantaṃ na paśyet /
analyzed: yathā eka sattvaḥ pi me saha buddhakṣetre vā kālam kurvantam na paśyet
translated: So that not even one being in my Buddha-field will see me dying.

original: tathāpi na śaknoty antardhātuṃ na digvidikṣu palāyituṃ vā /
analyzed: tathā api na śaknoti antardhātum na diś vidikṣu palāyitum vā
translated: Still, he was not able to disappear, nor to flee in the directions or intermediate directions.

original: tatraiva kaṇṭhe paṃcabandhanabaddham ātmānaṃ dadarśa /
analyzed: tatra eva kaṇṭhe paṃcabandhana baddham ātmānam dadarśa
translated: He saw himself bound in five places by the neck,

original: bhūyasyā mātrayā kupitas trasta uccasvareṇa prarudann evam āha /
analyzed: bhūyasyā mātrayā kupitaḥ trastaḥ ucca svareṇa prarudan evam āha
translated: and became even more angry, frightened, and crying out in a loud voice, he said this:

original: hā priyaputrabāndhavajanā na bhūyo drakṣyāma iti //
analyzed: hā priya putra bāndhava janāḥ na bhūyas drakṣyāmaḥ iti
translated: Alas, I will not see again my dear sons, relatives, and friends.

original: atha ghoṣavatir nāma māraś cakravartiveṣeṇa niṣaṇṇabhūto māraṃ pāpīmantam evam āha /
analyzed: atha ghoṣavatiḥ nāma māraḥ cakravarti veṣeṇa niṣaṇṇa bhūtaḥ māram pāpīmantam evam āha
translated: Then a Mara named Ghoshavat, seated in the attire of a universal monarch, said this to the evil Mara:

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuru-mi-ya

original: kiṃ bho śokamanās tvam adya rudiṣi vyākrośavaktrasvaraḥ
analyzed: kim bho śoka manāḥ tvam adya rudiṣi vyākrośa vaktra svaraḥ
translated: Why are you, sir, weeping today with a face and voice of lamentation?

original: kṣipraṃ sarvajagadvaraṃ munivaraṃ nirbhī śaraṇyaṃ vraja /
analyzed: kṣipram sarva jagat varam muni varam nirbhī śaraṇyam vraja
translated: Quickly go for refuge to the best of sages, the best in the world, the fearless protector.

original: trāṇaṃ lokagatiś ca dīpaśaraṇaṃ nāthas triduḥkhāpaho
analyzed: trāṇam loka gatiḥ ca dīpa śaraṇam nāthaḥ tri duḥkha apahaḥ
translated: He is the protector, the course of the world, the light and refuge, the lord who removes the three sufferings.

original: nanv etaṃ samupāsyasi ḥḥ ḥ ḥḥ śamaṃ saukhyaṃ ca saṃprāpsyasi // /
analyzed: nanu etam samupāsyasi śamam saukhyam ca saṃprāpsyasi
translated: If you attend upon him, you will attain peace and happiness.

original: atha mārasya pāpīmata etad abhavat /
analyzed: atha mārasya pāpīmataḥ etat abhavat
translated: Then this occurred to the evil Māra:

original: yan nv ahaṃ santoṣavacanena śramaṇaṃ gautamaṃ śaraṇaṃ vrajeyaṃ yad aham ebhyo bandhanebhyaḥ parimucyeyam //
analyzed: yat nu aham santoṣa vacanena śramaṇam gautamam śaraṇam vrajeyam yat aham ebhyaḥ bandhanebhyaḥ parimucyeyam
translated: What if I were to go for refuge to the ascetic Gautama with words of satisfaction, so that I might be freed from these bonds.

original: atha māraḥ pāpīmān yasyāṃ diśi bhagavāṃ vijahāra tenāṃjaliṃ praṇāmyaivam āha /
analyzed: atha māraḥ pāpīmān yasyām diśi vijahāra tena aṃjalim praṇāmya evam āha
translated: Then the evil Māra, in the direction where the Blessed One was, bowed with palms joined and said this:

original: namas tasmai varapudgalāya jarāvyādhimaraṇaparimocakāya /
analyzed: namaḥ tasmai vara pudgalāya jarā vyādhi maraṇa parimocakāya
translated: Homage to that best of beings, the liberator from old age, sickness, and death.

original: eṣo 'haṃ taṃ buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ śaraṇaṃ gacchāmi / evam cāha /
analyzed: eṣaḥ ham tam buddham bhagavantam śaraṇam gacchāmi evam ca āha
translated: I go for refuge to that Buddha, the Blessed One. And he said:

original: asmān nātha mahābhayāt suviṣamāt kṣipraṃ muner bandhanān
analyzed: asmāt nātha mahā bhayāt su viṣamāt kṣipram muneḥ bandhanān
translated: O Lord, quickly from the bonds of the sage, from this great fear and terrible danger,

original: mucyeyaṃ śaraṇagato 'smi sugatasyādya prabhrtyāgraṇī /
analyzed: mucyeyam śaraṇa gataḥ smi sugatasya adya
translated: I shall be freed, having gone for refuge. From today onward, I am the foremost of the well-gone ones.

original: mohāndhena mayā tvayi prakupitenoccaiḥ pradośaḥ kṛtaḥ
analyzed: moha andhena mayā tvayi prakupitena uccais pradośaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: By me, blinded by delusion, angry with you, a great insult was committed,

original: tat sarvaṃ pratideśayāmi puratas tvāṃ sākṣiṇaṃ sthāpya tu // /
analyzed: tat sarvam pratideśayāmi puratas tvām sākṣiṇam sthāpya tu
translated: I confess all that in your presence, having established you as a witness.

original: yadā ca māraḥ pāpīmān saṃtoṣavacanena buddhaṃ bhagavantaṃ śaraṇaṃ gatas tadā muktam ātmānaṃ saṃjānīte /
analyzed: yadā ca māraḥ pāpīmān saṃtoṣa vacanena buddham bhagavantam śaraṇam gataḥ tadā muktam ātmānam saṃjānīte
translated: And when Māra the evil one, through the words of satisfaction, had gone for refuge to the Blessed Buddha, he considered himself released.

original: yadā punar asyaivaṃ bhavati /
analyzed: yadā punar asya evam bhavati
translated: But when he again thought,

original: prakrameyam itaḥ parṣada iti /
analyzed: prakrameyam itas parṣadaḥ iti
translated: I will leave this assembly,

original: punar eva kaṇṭhe paṃcabandhanabaddham Kurumiya
analyzed: punar eva kaṇṭhe paṃcabandhana baddham kurumiya
translated: he again saw himself bound at the neck with five bonds,

original: ātmānaṃ saṃjānīte /
analyzed: ātmānam saṃjānīte
translated: and considered himself bound.

original: yadā punar na kvacid gantuṃ śaśāka tadā bhagavato 'ntike trāṇaśaraṇacittam utpādayām āsa /
analyzed: yadā punar na kvacid gantum śaśāka tadā bhagavataḥ ntike trāṇa śaraṇa cittam utpādayām āsa
translated: But when he was no longer able to go anywhere, he produced the thought of refuge and protection in the Blessed One.

original: punar muktam ātmānaṃ saṃjānīte yāvat saptakṛtvo baddhamuktam ātmānaṃ saṃjānīte sma /
analyzed: punar muktam ātmānam saṃjānīte yāvat sapta kṛtvas baddha muktam ātmānam saṃjānīte sma
translated: Again he considered himself released, up to seven times he considered himself bound and released.

original: tatraiva niṣaṇṇa iti //
analyzed: tatra eva niṣaṇṇaḥ iti
translated: He remained seated right there.

original: mahāsannipātād ratnaketusūtrāt tṛtīyo māradamanaparivartaḥ smāptaḥ //
analyzed: mahā sannipātāt ratnaketusūtrāt tṛtīyaḥ māradamana parivartaḥ sma āptaḥ
translated: The third chapter of the Ratnaketu Sūtra from the Great Assembly, called The Subjugation of Māra, is concluded.

original: Kurumiya IV /
analyzed: kurumiyaḥ iv
translated: Kuruṃiya IV.

original: yāvat pūrvoktaṃ te catvāro mahāśrāvakās tad rājagṛhaṃ mahānagaraṃ piṇḍāya praviśantas tair mārakumārakair anācāreṇādhiṣṭhāḥ /
analyzed: yāvat pūrva uktam te catvāraḥ mahāśrāvakāḥ tat rājagṛham mahā nagaram piṇḍāya praviśantaḥ taiḥ māra kumārakaiḥ anācāreṇa adhiṣṭhāḥ
translated: As previously mentioned, those four great disciples, while entering the great city of Rajagriha for alms, were cursed by those Mara youths with improper behavior.

original: nartasva śramaṇa gāyasva śramaṇeti /
analyzed: na ṛtasva śramaṇa gāyasva śramaṇa iti
translated: Dance, ascetic! Sing, ascetic!

original: taiś ca mahāśrāvakair vīthīmadhye pradhāvadbhir nirvāṇamārgapadapratisaṃyuktena gītasvareṇa yadā gāthā bhāṣitā tadā mahāpṛthivī pracakaṃpe
analyzed: taiḥ ca mahāśrāvakaiḥ vīthī madhye pradhāvadbhiḥ nirvāṇa mārga pada pratisaṃyuktena gīta svareṇa yadā gāthā bhāṣitā tadā mahā pṛthivī pracakaṃpe
translated: And when those great disciples, running in the middle of the street, spoke the verse in a singing voice connected with the path and words of nirvana, at that time the great earth trembled.

original: tatkṣaṇaṃ bahūni devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragaśatasahasrāṇi bhagavacchāsanābhiprasannāni sāsrumukhāny evam āhuḥ //
analyzed: tad kṣaṇam bahūni deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga śata sahasrāṇi bhagavat śāsana abhiprasannāni sa asru mukhāni evam āhuḥ
translated: At that moment, many hundreds of thousands of devas, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, asuras, garudas, kinnaras, and mahoragas who were devoted to the Bhagavat's teachings, with tearful faces, said this:

original: tiṣṭhaty aśoke varadharmasārathir eṣā hy avasthā jinavaraśāsanasya /
analyzed: tiṣṭhati aśoke vara dharma sārathiḥ eṣā hi avasthā jinavara śāsanasya
translated: The one who guides the supreme Dharma remains in Ashoka. This is the state of the supreme Jina's teachings.

original: tacchrāvakānāṃ janatā dya dṛṣṭvā viḍambitaṃ kena manaḥ prasādayet // /
analyzed: tat śrāvakānām janatā dṛṣṭvā viḍambitam kena manaḥ prasādayet
translated: Seeing the people of his disciples in this way, by whom would the mind be delighted?

original: atha tāni bahūni devanāgayakṣarākṣasakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi sāsrumukhāni yena bhagavāṃs tenopajagmuḥ /
analyzed: atha tāni bahūni deva nāga yakṣa rākṣasa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi sa asru mukhāni yena bhagavān tena upajagmuḥ
translated: Then those many hundreds of thousands of millions of devas, nagas, yakshas, and rakshasas, with tearful faces, approached the Bhagavat.

original: upetya bhagavataḥ purataḥ sthitvaivam āhuḥ /
analyzed: upetya bhagavataḥ puratas sthitvā evam āhuḥ
translated: Having approached, they stood in front of the Blessed One and said this:

original: avasthāṃ śāsanasyāsya bhagavan vīkṣya sāṃprataṃ /
analyzed: avasthām śāsanasya asya bhagavan vīkṣya sāṃpratam
translated: Blessed One, seeing the present state of this teaching,

original: mopekṣāṃ kuru sarvajña śāsanācāraguptaye // /
analyzed: mā upekṣām kuru sarvajña śāsana ācāra guptaye
translated: do not be indifferent, O Omniscient One, for the sake of protecting the conduct of the teaching.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuru-m-i-ya

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: evaṃ gatvā svayaṃ tatra māraṃ jitvā savāhanam /
analyzed: evam gatvā svayam tatra māram jitvā sa vāhanam
translated: Having gone there myself, having defeated Māra along with his mount,

original: karomi janatāṃ sarvāṃ nirvāṇapuragāminīm // /
analyzed: karomi janatām sarvām nirvāṇa pura gāminīm
translated: I will make all the people go to the city of Nirvāṇa.

original: atha te sarve evaikakaṇṭhenaivam āhuḥ /
analyzed: atha te sarve eva eka kaṇṭhena evam āhuḥ
translated: Then they all said with one voice:

original: mā bhagavaṃ gaccha //
analyzed: mā bhagavan gaccha
translated: Do not go, Blessed One!

original: nanūktaṃ bhagavatā /
analyzed: nanu uktam bhagavatā
translated: Has it not been said by the Blessed One:

original: acintyo buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ buddhaviṣayo 'cintyo māraviṣayaḥ acintyo nāgaviṣayo 'cintyaḥ karmaṇāṃ karmaviṣayaḥ iti /
analyzed: acintyaḥ buddhānām bhagavatām cintyaḥ māra viṣayaḥ acintyaḥ nāga viṣayaḥ cintyaḥ karmaṇām karma viṣayaḥ iti
translated: The sphere of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, is inconceivable; the sphere of Māra is inconceivable; the sphere of the nāgas is inconceivable; the sphere of karma is inconceivable.

original: sarvaviṣayāṇāṃ buddhaviṣaya eṣa viśiṣṭataraḥ /
analyzed: sarva viṣayāṇām buddha viṣayaḥ eṣa viśiṣṭataraḥ
translated: Among all the spheres, this sphere of the Buddhas is the most distinguished.🔽The Blessed One is able, while sitting on this very seat, to defeat many quintillions of Māras,

original: śakto bhagavān ihaivāsane niṣaṇṇo mārakoṭīnayutāni parājetuṃ dharmaskandhakoṭīnayutāni
analyzed: śaktaḥ bhagavān iha eva āsane niṣaṇṇaḥ māra koṭī nayutāni parājetum dharma skandha koṭī nayutāni
translated: to illuminate many quintillions of aggregates of the Dharma,

original: prakāśayituṃ kleśasāgaram ucchoṣayituṃ dṛṣṭijālaṃ samuddhartuṃ sattvakoṭīnayutāni
analyzed: prakāśayitum kleśa sāgaram ucchoṣayitum dṛṣṭi jālam samuddhartum sattva koṭī nayutāni
translated: to dry up the ocean of afflictions, to uproot the net of views, to lead many quintillions of beings

original: jñānasāgareṇāvatārayituṃ /
analyzed: jñāna sāgareṇa avatārayitum
translated: into the ocean of knowledge.

original: nādya bhagavato gamanakālo yuktaḥ /
analyzed: na adya bhagavataḥ gamana kālaḥ yuktaḥ
translated: The time has not yet come for the Blessed One to go.

original: bhagavān āha /
analyzed: bhagavān āha
translated: The Blessed One said:

original: yāvantaḥ sattvadhātau sattvās te sarve mārā bhaveyur yāvaṃti ca pṛthivīparamāṇurajāṃsi tāvanty ekaikasya mārabalādhiṣṭhānāni bhaveyuḥ /
analyzed: yāvantaḥ sattvadhātau sattvāḥ te sarve mārāḥ bhaveyuḥ yāvanti ca pṛthivī paramāṇu rajāṃsi tāvanti ekaikasya māra bala adhiṣṭhānāni bhaveyuḥ
translated: As many beings as there are in the realm of beings, all of them could become Māras, and each Māra could have at his disposal as many powers and magical creations as there are atoms in the earth.

original: te sarve mama vadhāya parākrameyur ekaromakūpasyāpi me na śaktā vighātayituṃ /
analyzed: te sarve mama vadhāya parākrameyuḥ eka romakūpasya api me na śaktāḥ vighātayitum
translated: All of them could strive to kill me, but they would not be able to harm even a single hair on me.

original: śaktaś cāham ihaiva niṣaṇṇo mārakoṭīnayutāni parājetuṃ sthāpyainaṃ saparivāraṃ māraṃ /
analyzed: śaktaḥ ca aham iha eva niṣaṇṇaḥ māra koṭī nayutāni parājetum sthāpya enam sa parivāram māram
translated: And I, sitting right here, could defeat many quintillions of Māras, except for this Māra and his retinue.

original: gamiṣyāmi punar ahaṃ yan mama pūjākarmaṇa ebhir māraiḥ sarvaṃ rājagrhaṃ mahānagaraṃ
analyzed: gamiṣyāmi punar aham yat mama pūjā karmaṇaḥ ebhiḥ māraiḥ sarvam rājagrham mahā nagaram
translated: But I will go again, because these Māras have adorned the entire city of Rājagṛha

original: mārabalarddhivikurvaṇādhiṣṭhānavyūhair alaṃkṛtaṃ tad anukaṃpāyai paribhokṣye yat
analyzed: māra bala ṛddhi vikurvaṇa adhiṣṭhāna vyūhaiḥ alaṃkṛtam tat anukaṃpāyai paribhokṣye yat
translated: with the magical displays of the powers and transformations of Māra's army for the sake of worshipping me. Out of compassion for them, I will enjoy it.

original: te mārāḥ paramaprītiprasādajātāḥ kuśalamūlabījam avaropayiṣyaṃty anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau //
analyzed: te mārāḥ parama prīti prasāda jātāḥ kuśala mūla bījam avaropayiṣyanti anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau
translated: Because those Māras, having become extremely joyful and faithful, will plant the seeds of the roots of goodness for unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: yadā ca bhagavān āsanād utthātukāmo 'tha tāvad eva prabhāvaśobhanā nāma veṇuvanaparipālikā devatā sā bhagavataḥ purato 'srumukhī sthitvaivam 🔽āha /
analyzed: yadā ca bhagavān āsanāt utthātu kāmaḥ tāvat eva prabhāvaśobhanā nāma veṇuvana paripālikā devatā sā bhagavataḥ puratas sru mukhī sthitvā evam  āha
translated: And when the Blessed One was about to rise from his seat, at that very moment a deity named Prabhāvaśobhanā, the guardian of the Bamboo Grove, stood in front of the Blessed One with a tearful face and said:

original: naivādya kālo bhagavan praveṣtuṃ puraṃ samaṃtād iha mārapūrṇaṃ /
analyzed: na eva adya kālaḥ bhagavan praveṣtum puram samaṃtāt iha māra pūrṇam
translated: Today is not the time, Blessed One, to enter the city, for it is filled with Māras all around.

original: ekaika evaṃ paramapracaṇḍaḥ koṭīvṛtas tiṣṭhati vadisiṃhaḥ // /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ evam parama pracaṇḍaḥ koṭī vṛtaḥ tiṣṭhati vadi siṃhaḥ
translated: Each one of them, extremely fierce, stands surrounded by a koṭi, a lion among speakers.

original: dveṣapradīptā niśitāstradhāriṇo vadhāya te vyākulacetasaḥ sthitāḥ /
analyzed: dveṣa pradīptāḥ niśita astra dhāriṇaḥ vadhāya te vyākula cetasaḥ sthitāḥ
translated: Inflamed with hatred, holding sharp weapons, their minds agitated, they stand ready to kill you.

original: mā sarvathādya praviśasva nātha mā saṃkṣyaṃ yāsyasi lokabandho // /
analyzed: mā sarvathā adya praviśasva nātha mā saṃkṣyam yāsyasi lokabandho
translated: Do not enter at all today, O Lord, do not perish, O friend of the world.

original: yadā ca bhagavān āsanād abhyutthitas tadā dyutimatir nāma vihāradevatā sā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandyaivam āha /
analyzed: yadā ca bhagavān āsanāt abhyutthitaḥ tadā dyutimatiḥ nāma vihāra devatā sā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya evam āha
translated: And when the Blessed One rose from his seat, then a deity named Dyutīmatī, the guardian of the monastery, bowed her head at the feet of the Blessed One and said:

original: pāpīmmatāṃ sahasrāṇi paṃca tiṣṭhanti sāyudhāḥ /
analyzed: sahasrāṇi paṃca tiṣṭhanti sa āyudhāḥ
translated: Five thousand wicked ones stand ready with weapons,

original: tvāṃ pratīkṣaṃti nistriṃśā vraja mādya mahāmune // /
analyzed: tvām pratīkṣaṃti nistriṃśāḥ vraja mā adya mahā mune
translated: holding swords, they await you. Go today, great sage.

original: yadā bhagavāṃ vihārād viniścakrāma tadā siddhimatir nāmauṣadhidevatā sā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandyaivam āha /
analyzed: yadā vihārāt viniścakrāma tadā siddhimatiḥ nāma oṣadhi devatā sā bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya evam āha
translated: When the Blessed One emerged from the monastery, a medicinal plant deity named Siddhimati bowed her head to the Blessed One's feet and said this:

original: hā kaṣṭaṃ naśyate mārgo dharmanetrī pralujyate /🔽dharmanaur yāti saṃbhedaṃ lokadīpe kṣayaṃ gate // /
analyzed: hā kaṣṭam naśyate mārgaḥ dharma netrī pralujyate  dharma nauḥ yāti saṃbhedam loka dīpe kṣayam gate
translated: Alas, the path is perishing, the Dharma eye is being destroyed,🔽The Dharma ship is breaking up, when the light of the world is about to pass away.

original: dharmarasa udāro hīyate sarvaloke
analyzed: dharma rasaḥ udāraḥ hīyate sarva loke
translated: The sublime taste of the Dharma is disappearing from the whole world,

original: jagad idam atipūrṇaṃ kleśadhūrtaiḥ pracaṇḍaiḥ /
analyzed: jagat idam ati pūrṇam kleśa dhūrtaiḥ pracaṇḍaiḥ
translated: This world is greatly afflicted by fierce and violent afflictions,

original: nanu mama bhuvi śaktiḥ kācid asti pralopaṃ
analyzed: nanu mama bhuvi śaktiḥ kācid asti
translated: Do I have any power on earth to prevent this destruction?

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: kurumiya

original: sugatasutavarāṇāṃ saṃpradhartuṇ kathaṃcit // /🔽atibahava ihāsmiṃ tvadvināśāya raudrā
analyzed: sugata suta varāṇām saṃpradhartum kathaṃcid  ati bahavaḥ iha asmin tvad vināśāya raudrā
translated: How can I somehow support the best sons of the Sugata?🔽Here in this world, there are many fierce ones intent on your destruction,

original: niśitaparaśukhaḍgāḥ saṃsthitāḥ pāpadharmāḥ /
analyzed: niśita paraśu khaḍgāḥ saṃsthitāḥ pāpa dharmāḥ
translated: Standing with sharp axes and swords, evil-minded.

original: kuru sugata mamājñāṃ lokasaṃrakṣaṇārthaṃ
analyzed: kuru sugata mama ājñām loka saṃrakṣaṇa artham
translated: O Sugata, for the sake of protecting the world,

original: praviśa daśabalādre mā puraṃ siddhayātra // /
analyzed: praviśa daśabala adre mā puram siddha yātra
translated: O one with the ten powers, enter the city, O Siddhayatra.

original: atha bhagavān vihārāṃganād abhipratasthe /
analyzed: atha bhagavān vihāra aṃganāt abhipratasthe
translated: Then the Blessed One set out from the courtyard of the monastery.

original: dyutindharā ca nāma tatra vṛkṣadevatā sā karuṇakaruṇaṃ rudaṃtī bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandyaivam āha /🔽sarvan nātha bhaviṣyati tribhuvanaṃ naṣṭekṣaṇaṃ sāmprataṃ
analyzed: dyutindharā ca nāma tatra vṛkṣa devatā sā karuṇa karuṇam rudaṃtī bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya evam āha  sarvat nātha bhaviṣyati tribhuvanam naṣṭa īkṣaṇam sāmpratam
translated: And the tree deity named Dyutidhara, weeping piteously, bowed her head to the Blessed One's feet and said:

original: nāśaṃ pūrṇamanorathe tvayi gate sarvārthasiddhe munau /🔽etasmin gagane bhujaṃgarasanās tīkṣṇāsivāṇāyudhās
analyzed: nāśam pūrṇa manorathe tvayi gate sarva artha siddhe munau  etasmin gagane bhujaṃga rasanāḥ tīkṣṇa asi vāṇa āyudhāḥ
translated: Lord, when you, the sage who has accomplished all goals, have gone, the three worlds will be destroyed and their eyes blinded.

original: tvannāśāya caranti vahnivadanā mā gaccha tatrādhunā // /🔽yadā ca bhagavāṃ dvārakoṣṭhakemavatatārātha jyotivaruṇā nāma dvārakoṣṭhakadevatā sā uccasvareṇa rudaṃtī bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandyaivam
analyzed: tvad nāśāya caranti vahni vadanāḥ mā gaccha tatra adhunā  yadā ca bhagavān dvāra koṣṭhakem avatatāra atha jyotivaruṇā nāma dvāra koṣṭhaka devatā sā ucca svareṇa rudaṃtī bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya evam
translated: In this sky, snakes with tongues like sharp swords and arrows as weapons, with faces like fire, move about for your destruction. Do not go there now.

original: āha /
analyzed: āha
translated: When the Blessed One descended into the doorway, the doorway deity named Jyotivaruna, weeping in a loud voice, bowed her head to the Blessed One's feet and said:

original: ete brāhmaṇasaṃjñināṃ puravare viṃśatsahasrāṇy atho
analyzed: ete brāhmaṇa saṃjñinām pura vare viṃśat sahasrāṇi atho
translated: Here in the best of cities, there are twenty thousand who consider themselves Brahmins,

original: dīptāsikṣurasāyakapraharaṇāḥ prekṣaṃti te nirdayāḥ /
analyzed: dīpta asi kṣura sāyaka praharaṇāḥ prekṣaṃti te nirdayāḥ
translated: who look on mercilessly with weapons of sharp swords, arrows, and missiles.

original: anyonyāpy atiraudranirdayavatāṃ viṃśatasahasrāṇy atas
analyzed: anyonya api ati raudra nirdayavatām viṃśata sahasrāṇi atas
translated: Beyond them, there are twenty thousand who are extremely fierce and merciless,

original: tiṣṭhantīha vināśanāya tava he mā gaccha śuddhānana // /
analyzed: tiṣṭhanti iha vināśanāya tava he mā gaccha śuddha ānana
translated: who stand here for your destruction. O pure-faced one, do not go.

original: atha bhagavāṃ dvāraśālāṃ praviveśa /
analyzed: atha bhagavān dvāra śālām praviveśa
translated: Then the Blessed One entered the gateway.

original: tatra ca tamālasārā nāma rājagṛhanagaraparipālikā Kurumiya
analyzed: tatra ca tamālasārā nāma rājagṛha nagara paripālikā
translated: There, the divine protector of the city of Rājagṛha named Tamālasārā, a Kurumiga

original: devatā sā nabhasy uccasvareṇa rudaṃtī bhagavataḥ sakāśaṃ tvarayopajagāmopetya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasābhivandyaivam āha /
analyzed: devatā sā nabhasi ucca svareṇa rudaṃtī bhagavataḥ sakāśam tvarayā upajagāma upetya bhagavataḥ pādau śirasā abhivandya evam āha
translated: goddess, wept with a loud voice in the sky and quickly approached the Blessed One. Having approached, she bowed her head at the feet of the Blessed One and said this:

original: mārgo 'yaṃ bhagavaṃ punaḥ parivṛtaḥ siṃhoṣṭramattadvipair
analyzed: mārgaḥ yam punar parivṛtaḥ siṃha uṣṭra matta dvipaiḥ
translated: This path, O Blessed One, is again surrounded by lions, camels, and crazed elephants,

original: bhikṣūṇāṃ ca viheṭhanāya bahudhā mārair vighātaḥ kṛtaḥ /
analyzed: bhikṣūṇām ca viheṭhanāya bahudhā māraiḥ vighātaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: and the monks have been harmed in many ways by Māra, who has created obstacles.

original: udyuktās tava cānyatīrthacaraṇāḥ śāstur vadhārthaṃ bhuvi
analyzed: udyuktāḥ tava ca anya tīrtha caraṇāḥ śāstuḥ vadha artham bhuvi
translated: Your other disciples on earth are ready to kill the Teacher.

original: tvaṃ meghasvara devanāgakṛpayā mā gaccha dīptaprabha // /
analyzed: tvam megha svara deva nāga kṛpayā mā gaccha dīpta prabha
translated: O you whose voice is like thunder, out of compassion for the gods and nāgas, do not go, O you of brilliant light!

original: dṛṣṭvā narāmarabhujaṃgamakinnarendrās
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā nara amara bhujaṃgama kinnara indrāḥ
translated: Having seen the destruction of your teaching, the lords of men, gods, serpents, and Kinnaras,

original: tvacchāsanasya vilayaṃ vyathitāḥ sametya /
analyzed: tvad śāsanasya vilayam vyathitāḥ sametya
translated: having assembled, are distressed.

original: bhītā dravaṃti bhagavaṃ jitamāra mārān
analyzed: bhītāḥ dravanti bhagavan jita māra mārān
translated: They flee in fear, O Blessed One, O you who have conquered Māra, from the Māras

original: māyākṛtān ativirūpamukhāṃś ca bhūyaḥ // /
analyzed: māyā kṛtān ati virūpa mukhān ca bhūyas
translated: who have created illusions and have extremely ugly faces.

original: saddharmasya vilopanāṃ ca mahatīṃ lokasya copaplavaṃ
analyzed: saddharmasya vilopanām ca mahatīm lokasya ca upaplavam
translated: The great destruction of the true Dharma and the calamity of the world

original: nakṣatradyutināśitaṃ ca gaganaṃ candrārkayor vibhramaṃ /
analyzed: nakṣatra dyuti nāśitam ca gaganam candra arkayoḥ vibhramam
translated: The sky, its luster destroyed by the stars, the moon and sun confused,

original: saṃpaśyan vata sajjano 'dya virasaḥ proccaiḥ śiras tāḍito
analyzed: saṃpaśyan vata sat janaḥ virasaḥ proccais śiraḥ
translated: Seeing this, good people today are dispassionate, loudly beating their heads,

original: hā kaṣṭaṃ kathayaty atīva sugatabhraṃśaṃ samāśaṃkayan // /
analyzed: hā kaṣṭam kathayati atīva sugata bhraṃśam samāśaṃkayan
translated: Alas, they say, greatly fearing the fall of the Sugata.

original: naśyate dṛṣṭisūryo 'yaṃ dharmolkā yāti saṃkṣayam /
analyzed: naśyate dṛṣṭi sūryaḥ yam dharma ulkā yāti saṃkṣayam
translated: This sun of vision is perishing, the torch of Dharma is being extinguished,

original: mṛdnāti mṛtyu saṃbuddhaṃ dharmatoyaṃ viśuṣyate // /
analyzed: mṛdnāti mṛtyu saṃbuddham dharma toyam viśuṣyate
translated: Death is crushing the Fully Enlightened One, the water of Dharma is drying up.

original: saddharmacāriṇāṃ loke vināśe pratyupasthite /
analyzed: saddharma cāriṇām loke vināśe pratyupasthite
translated: When the destruction of those who practice the true Dharma is imminent in the world,

original: prādurbhāvo 'satām eva mārāṇāṃ bhavatīha tam // /
analyzed: satām eva mārāṇām bhavati iha tam
translated: The appearance of evil Māras occurs here.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: atha sā devatā bhagavataḥ pratinivartanam adṛṣṭvā sāsrumukhī bhūya evam āha /
analyzed: atha sā devatā bhagavataḥ pratinivartanam a dṛṣṭvā sa asru mukhī bhūyas evam āha
translated: Then that goddess, not seeing the Blessed One turn back, with a tearful face, said this again:

original: lokan nirīkṣasva mune samagraṃ mā gaccha vādipravarādya saṃkṣayaṃ /
analyzed: nirīkṣasva mune samagram mā gaccha vādi pravara adya saṃkṣayam
translated: Look at the world, O Sage, in its entirety. Do not go to destruction today, O Foremost of Speakers.

original: mā matpure nāśam upāgate tvayi trilokanindyā satataṃ bhaveyaṃ // /
analyzed: mā mad pure nāśam upāgate tvayi triloka nindyā satatam bhaveyam
translated: Let me not always be blamed in the three worlds, when you, having come to destruction in my city,

original: śṛṇu me vaco nāyaka sattvasāra mā matpure gaccha vināśam adya /
analyzed: śṛṇu me vacaḥ nāyaka sattva sāra mā mad pure gaccha vināśam adya
translated: Listen to my words, O Leader, O Essence of Beings. Do not go to destruction in my city today.

original: sattvānukaṃpārtham iha pratīkṣa sattvāṃś ca janmārtibhayād vimokṣaya // /
analyzed: sattva anukaṃpā artham iha pratīkṣa sattvān ca janma ārti bhayāt vimokṣaya
translated: Out of compassion for beings, wait here, and liberate beings from the suffering and fear of birth.

original: smara pratijñāṃ hi purā tahāgata prāpyottamaṃ tārayitā bhavetaṃ /
analyzed: smara pratijñām hi purā prāpya uttamam tārayitā
translated: Remember your vow, O Tathagata, having attained the highest, you will be the liberator.

original: sattvān anekān bahuduḥkhataptān āśvāsaya prāṇabhṛtāṃ variṣṭha // /
analyzed: sattvān anekān bahu duḥkha taptān āśvāsaya prāṇabhṛtām variṣṭha
translated: Comfort the many beings tormented by much suffering, O best of living beings.

original: tiṣṭhāgramūrte bahukalpakoṭyaḥ kāmeṣu sakto vata bālavargaḥ /
analyzed: tiṣṭha agra mūrte bahu kalpa koṭyaḥ kāmeṣu saktaḥ vata bāla vargaḥ
translated: Remain, O supreme being, for many millions of eons. The class of foolish beings is indeed attached to desires.

original: tacchāntaye deśaya dharmamārgaṃ svabhāvaśūnyāyatanendriyārtham // /
analyzed: tad śāntaye deśaya dharma mārgam svabhāva śūnya āyatana indriya artham
translated: For their peace, teach the path of Dharma, the realm of the sense bases and sense objects that are empty of intrinsic nature.

original: tato bhagavāṃ dvāraśālāyām avatatāra /
analyzed: tatas bhagavān dvāra śālāyām avatatāra
translated: Then the Blessed One descended to the porch.

original: atha tāvad devatā dṛḍhā nāma pṛthivīdevatā daśabhiḥ mahaujaskamahaujaskābhir devatāsahasraiḥ
analyzed: atha tāvat devatā dṛḍhā nāma pṛthivī devatā daśabhiḥ mahaujaska mahaujaskābhiḥ devatā sahasraiḥ
translated: Then at that time, the earth goddess named Dṛdhā, together with ten thousand goddesses of great splendor,

original: sārdham asrumukhī prakīrṇakeśī bhagavataḥ purataḥ prāṃjaliḥ sthitvaivam Kurumiya āha /
analyzed: sārdham asru mukhī prakīrṇa keśī bhagavataḥ puratas prāṃjaliḥ sthitvā evam āha
translated: with tearful faces and disheveled hair, stood in front of the Blessed One with palms joined, and spoke this way:

original: smara pradānaṃ rudhiraprapūrṇā yat te pradattāś caturāḥ samudrāḥ /
analyzed: smara pradānam rudhira prapūrṇāḥ yat te pradattāḥ caturāḥ samudrāḥ
translated: Remember the gift, filled with blood, the four oceans that were given by you,

original: śirāṃsi cāsthīni ca cakravāḍavan netrāṇi gaṅgāsikatāsamāni // /
analyzed: śirāṃsi ca asthīni ca cakravāḍa vat netrāṇi gaṅgā sikatā samāni
translated: and the heads and bones like Cakravāḍa, and the eyes equal to the sands of the Ganges.

original: ratnāni caivaṃ vividhāni pūrvaṃ putrāś ca dārā dviradās tathāśvāḥ /
analyzed: ratnāni ca evam vividhāni pūrvam putrāḥ ca dārāḥ dviradāḥ tathā aśvāḥ
translated: And various jewels like this, previously: sons, wives, elephants, and horses,

original: āvāsavastraśayanānnapānaṃ bhaiṣajyam iṣṭaṃ ca tathāturāṇām // /
analyzed: āvāsa vastra śayana anna pānam bhaiṣajyam iṣṭam ca tathā āturāṇām
translated: Dwelling places, clothes, bedding, food, drink, and the desired medicine for the sick,

original: kṛtā ca pūjā pravarā svayaṃbhuvāṃ śīlaṃ tvayā rakṣitam apramādinā /
analyzed: kṛtā ca pūjā pravarā svayaṃbhuvām śīlam tvayā rakṣitam apramādinā
translated: And the excellent worship of the self-existent ones has been performed by you, and morality has been guarded by you without negligence,

original: kṣāntiśrutaṃ sevitam eva nityaṃ mātṛjñatā caiva pitṛjñatā ca // /
analyzed: kṣānti śrutam sevitam eva nityam mātṛ jña tā ca eva pitṛ jña tā ca
translated: And patience and learning have always been attended to by you, and filial piety and parental respect have been practiced by you,

original: cīrṇāny anaṃtāni ca duṣkarāṇi sattvā hy anekavyasanāt pramokṣitāḥ /
analyzed: cīrṇāni anaṃtāni ca duṣkarāṇi sattvāḥ hi aneka vyasanāt pramokṣitāḥ
translated: And countless difficult practices have been performed by you, and beings have been liberated from many calamities,

original: yat pūrvam ādau praṇidhiḥ kṛtas te buddho bhaveyaṃ paramārthadeśakaḥ // /
analyzed: yat pūrvam ādau praṇidhiḥ kṛtaḥ te buddhaḥ bhaveyam parama artha deśakaḥ
translated: The vow that was made by you in the beginning, 'May I become a Buddha, the teacher of the highest truth,'

original: uttārayeyaṃ janatāṃ mahaughāl lokāya dharmaṃ vata deśayeyaṃ /
analyzed: uttārayeyam janatām mahā oghān lokāya dharmam vata deśayeyam
translated: I would deliver the multitude from the great flood, and I would teach the Dharma to the world,

original: tṛṣṇāvimūlāni mahābhayāni duḥkhāny aśeṣāṇi ca śoṣayeyam // /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā vimūlāni mahā bhayāni duḥkhāni aśeṣāṇi ca śoṣayeyam
translated: I would dry up all the great fears and sorrows, and all the sufferings without exception,

original: abhaye pure sattvagaṇaṃ praveśaye niveśya tān vai varabodhimārge /
analyzed: abhaye pure sattva gaṇam praveśaye niveśya tān vai vara bodhi mārge
translated: I would lead the multitude of beings into the city of fearlessness, and having settled them on the excellent path of enlightenment,

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: vimocayeyaṃ bahuduḥkhapīḍitān tāṃ sattvadhātuṃ paripūrṇa kuryām // /
analyzed: vimocayeyam bahu duḥkha pīḍitān tām sattvadhātum paripūrṇa kuryām
translated: I would liberate the many who are afflicted by suffering, and I would fulfill that realm of beings.

original: mārgacyutānām iha pāpacāriṇāṃ kṣamasva nātha śrutaśīlanāśināṃ /
analyzed: mārga cyutānām iha pāpa cāriṇām kṣamasva nātha śruta śīla nāśinām
translated: For those who have fallen from the path, who engage in evil conduct here, who destroy learning and morality, have mercy, O Lord.

original: nistārayaitāṃ smaraya pratijñāṃ vadasva dharmaṃ bahukalpakoṭyaḥ // /
analyzed: nistāraya etām smaraya pratijñām vadasva dharmam bahu kalpa koṭyaḥ
translated: Deliver them, remember your vow, speak the Dharma for many millions of eons.

original: oghāt samuttāraya nātha lokaṃ saṃsnāpayāṣṭāṃgajalena cainaṃ /
analyzed: oghāt samuttāraya nātha lokam saṃsnāpaya aṣṭāṃga jalena ca enam
translated: Deliver the world from the flood, O Lord, and sprinkle it with the water of the eight branches.

original: nehāsti sattvaḥ sadṛśas triloke tvayā hi nātha pravaro na kaścit // /
analyzed: na iha asti sattvaḥ sadṛśaḥ triloke tvayā hi nātha pravaraḥ na kaścid
translated: There is no being equal to you in the three worlds. There is no one superior to you, O Lord.

original: muktaḥ svayaṃ lokam imaṃ ca mocaya pratārayasva tribhavārṇavāj jagat /
analyzed: muktaḥ svayam lokam imam ca mocaya pratārayasva tri bhava arṇavāt jagat
translated: Liberated yourself, liberate this world, deliver the world from the ocean of the three existences.

original: tvam eva buddho jagadekabāndhavo tiṣṭhasva nityaṃ vibhajasva dharmam // /
analyzed: tvam eva buddhaḥ jagat eka bāndhavaḥ tiṣṭhasva nityam vibhajasva dharmam
translated: You alone are the Buddha, the world's sole kinsman. Remain forever, and distribute the Dharma.

original: atha bahagavāṃ dvāraśālāyām avatatāra /
analyzed: atha bahagavām dvāra śālāyām avatatāra
translated: Then the Blessed One descended to the porch.

original: tatkṣaṇād eva ca bahūni devanāgayakṣarākṣasakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi gagane vicaramāṇāni sāsrumukhāny evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: tad kṣaṇāt eva ca bahūni deva nāga yakṣa rākṣasa koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi gagane vicaramāṇāni sa asru mukhāni evam āhuḥ
translated: Immediately many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of devas, nāgas, yakṣas, and rākṣasas roaming in the sky said with tearful faces:

original: asmābhir ādau sugatā hi dṛṣṭāḥ praśāntakāle suvinītaśiṣyāḥ /
analyzed: asmābhiḥ ādau sugatāḥ hi dṛṣṭāḥ praśānta kāle su vinīta śiṣyāḥ
translated: In the beginning we saw the Sugatas, in the time of peace, with well-disciplined disciples,

original: dharmopadeśaṃ vipulaṃ ca kurvatas teṣāṃ vighāto na sa īdṛśo 'bhūt // /
analyzed: dharma upadeśam vipulam ca kurvataḥ teṣām vighātaḥ na saḥ īdṛśaḥ bhūt
translated: giving extensive Dharma teachings, and they had no such obstacles.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: eṣo hi śāstātinihīnakāle prāptaḥ svayaṃbhūtvam udārabuddhiḥ /
analyzed: eṣaḥ hi śāstā ati nihīna kāle prāptaḥ svayaṃbhū tvam udāra buddhiḥ
translated: For this one, the teacher, of vast intellect, has attained self-existence at this very low time,

original: kleśāvṛte dharmam uvāca loke paripācanārthaṃ jagatāṃ munīndraḥ // /
analyzed: kleśa āvṛte dharmam uvāca loke paripācana artham jagatām muni indraḥ
translated: The lord of sages, in a world obscured by afflictions, has spoken the Dharma for the sake of ripening the world.

original: asmiṃ punas tiṣṭhati vādisiṃhe pāpīmatāṃ naikasahasrakoṭyaḥ /
analyzed: asmin punar tiṣṭhati vādi siṃhe pāpīmatām na eka sahasra koṭyaḥ
translated: But while this lion of speakers remains, many thousands of koṭis of wicked ones

original: kuruvaṃti dharmasya vināśam evaṃ mā buddhavīrādya pure viśasva // /
analyzed: kuruvaṃti dharmasya vināśam evam mā buddha vīra adya pure viśasva
translated: Are destroying the Dharma. Do not enter the city of the Buddha-hero today!

original: athāparā devataivam āha /
analyzed: atha aparā devatā evam āha
translated: Then another deity said this:

original: cakraṃ jinair vartitam ekadeśe taiḥ pūrvakair lokahitaprayuktaiḥ /
analyzed: cakram jinaiḥ vartitam eka deśe taiḥ pūrvakaiḥ loka hita prayuktaiḥ
translated: The wheel has been turned in one place by the victorious ones of the past, engaged in the welfare of the world.

original: ayaṃ punar gacchati yatra tatra mā khalv avasthāṃ samavāpsyate 'dya // /
analyzed: ayam punar gacchati yatra tatra mā khalu avasthām samavāpsyate
translated: But this one goes here and there. May he not come to ruin today!

original: athāparāpi devataivam āha /
analyzed: atha aparā api devatā evam āha
translated: Then another deity also said this:

original: kāruṇyahetor iha sārthavāhaś cacāra sattvārtham atīva kurvan /
analyzed: kāruṇya hetoḥ iha sārthavāhaḥ cacāra sattva artham atīva kurvan
translated: For the sake of compassion, the caravan leader has been wandering here, greatly acting for the sake of beings.

original: sa kevalaṃ tv adya pure 'tra mā vai nāśaṃ prayāyād iti me vitarkaḥ // /
analyzed: sa kevalam tu adya pure tra mā vai nāśam prayāyāt iti me vitarkaḥ
translated: But today, I think, he will not perish in this city.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena tāni bahūni devanāgayakṣarākṣasāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena tāni bahūni deva nāga yakṣa rākṣasa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi
translated: Then at that time, many hundreds of thousands of niyutas of koṭis of devas, nāgas, yakṣas, rākṣasas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas,

original: sāsrudurdinavadanāni gaganatalapathād avatīrya bhagavataḥ purataḥ sthitvānekaprakārān
analyzed: sa asru durdina vadanāni gagana tala pathāt avatīrya bhagavataḥ puratas sthitvā aneka prakārān
translated: With tearful, rain-like faces, they descended from the path of the sky and stood in front of the Blessed One, and made various

original: ātmano viprakārāṃś cakruḥ /🔽kecit keśān vilumpanti sma /
analyzed: ātmanaḥ viprakārān cakruḥ  kecid keśān vilumpanti sma
translated: kinds of self-humiliations.🔽Some pulled out their hair.

original: kecid ābharaṇāni mumucuḥ /
analyzed: kecid ābharaṇāni mumucuḥ
translated: Some cast off their ornaments.

original: kecic Kurumiya
analyzed: kecid kurumiya
translated: Some let loose their

original: chatradhvajapatākān prapātayām āsuḥ /
analyzed: chatra dhvaja patākān prapātayām āsuḥ
translated: elephants, horses, chariots, and troops.🔽Some let fall their parasols, banners, flags, and canopies.

original: kecit svaśarīreṇa bhūmau nipetuḥ /
analyzed: kecid sva śarīreṇa bhūmau nipetuḥ
translated: Some fell to the ground with their own bodies.

original: kecid bhagavataś caraṇau jagṛhuḥ /🔽kecid atikaṣṭaṃ ruruvuḥ /
analyzed: kecid bhagavataḥ caraṇau jagṛhuḥ  kecid ati kaṣṭam ruruvuḥ
translated: Some took hold of the Blessed One's feet.🔽Some wailed exceedingly.

original: kecid urāṃsi pāṇibhiḥ parājaghnuḥ /🔽kecid bhagavataḥ pādamūle sthitvā madguvat parāvartante sma /
analyzed: kecid urāṃsi pāṇibhiḥ parājaghnuḥ  kecid bhagavataḥ pāda mūle sthitvā madgu vat parāvartante sma
translated: Some struck their chests with their hands.🔽Some, standing at the Blessed One's feet, rolled around like a dog.

original: kecid bhagavataḥ purataḥ prāṃjalayo bhūtvā stutinamaskārāṃś cakruḥ /
analyzed: kecid bhagavataḥ puratas prāṃjalayaḥ bhūtvā stuti namaskārān cakruḥ
translated: Some, with palms joined in front of the Blessed One, made praises and prostrations.

original: kecid bhagavantaṃ puṣpadhūpagandhamālyavilepanavastrābharaṇasuvarṇasūtramuktāhāraduṣyair avakiraṃti sma /
analyzed: kecid bhagavantam puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya vilepana vastra ābharaṇa suvarṇa sūtra muktā hāra duṣyaiḥ avakiraṃti sma
translated: Some scattered flowers, incense, garlands, ointments, clothes, ornaments, golden threads, pearl necklaces, and silk garments over the Blessed One.

original: athāparā bahvyo devakoṭya uccair ekaṇṭhenaivam āhuḥ /
analyzed: atha aparāḥ bahvyaḥ deva koṭyaḥ uccais ekaṇṭhena evam āhuḥ
translated: Then many other millions of gods said with one voice:

original: tvayā pracīrṇāni hi duṣkarāṇi atīva lokārtham ito bahūni /
analyzed: tvayā pracīrṇāni hi duṣkarāṇi atīva loka artham itas bahūni
translated: You have practiced austerities for the sake of the world, for the benefit of many, for the happiness of many, for the sake of compassion for the world, for the benefit and happiness of gods and humans.

original: kṣīṇe tvam utpanna ihādya kāle upekṣakas tiṣṭha ca mā tyajasva // /
analyzed: kṣīṇe tvam utpannaḥ iha adya kāle upekṣakaḥ tiṣṭha ca mā tyajasva
translated: You have arisen in this world at this time when it is declining. Remain impartial, do not abandon us.

original: alpaṃ kṛtaṃ te 'nagha buddhakāryaṃ sākṣīkṛtāś cālpatarā nṛdevāḥ /
analyzed: alpam kṛtam te nagha buddha kāryam sākṣīkṛtāḥ ca alpatarāḥ nṛdevāḥ
translated: O sinless one, you have accomplished little of the Buddha's work, and even fewer gods and men have been made witnesses.

original: tvaṃ tiṣṭha dharmān suciraṃ prakāśayan uttārayāsmat tribhavārṇavāj jagat // /
analyzed: tvam tiṣṭha dharmān su ciram prakāśayan uttāraya asmat tri bhava arṇavāt jagat
translated: Remain, O Buddha, teaching the Dharma for a long time, and deliver the world from the ocean of the three existences.

original: sattvā hy aneke śubhakarmacāriṇaḥ paripakvabījā amṛtasya bhājanāḥ /
analyzed: sattvāḥ hi aneke śubha karma cāriṇaḥ paripakva bījāḥ amṛtasya bhājanāḥ
translated: For many beings who practice good actions, whose seeds are ripe, are vessels for immortality.

original: karuṇāṃ janasva pratidarśayārtham oghebhya uttāraya lokam ārtam // /
analyzed: karuṇām janasva pratidarśaya artham oghebhyaḥ uttāraya lokam ārtam
translated: Arouse compassion and show them the meaning. Deliver the afflicted world from the floods.

original: gatyāṭavīmadhyagatā bhramaṃti saṃsārakāntāravinaṣṭamārgāḥ /
analyzed: gatya aṭavī madhya gatāḥ bhramaṃti saṃsāra kāntāra vinaṣṭa mārgāḥ
translated: They wander in the middle of the forest of existence, lost on the path in the wilderness of saṃsāra.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: kurumiya

original: teṣāṃ sumārgaṃ pratidarśayasva pramokṣayāryottamadharmavāgbhiḥ // /
analyzed: teṣām su mārgam pratidarśayasva pramokṣaya ārya uttama dharma vāgbhiḥ
translated: Show them the good path with your noble Dharma speech, to liberate them.

original: etat tavāścaryataraṃ kṛpādbhutaṃ pravartitaṃ yad varadharmacakraṃ /
analyzed: etat tava āścaryataram kṛpā adbhutam pravartitam yat vara dharma cakram
translated: This is your even more wondrous and marvelous act of compassion, that you have turned the wheel of the supreme Dharma.

original: ciraṃ hi tiṣṭha tvam udārabuddhe mā khalv anāthā janatā bhaveta // /
analyzed: ciram hi tiṣṭha tvam udāra buddhe mā khalu anāthā janatā bhaveta
translated: Remain for a long time, O Buddha of vast wisdom, so that the people may not be helpless.

original: athāparāpi devataivam āha /
analyzed: atha aparā api devatā evam āha
translated: Then another god said this:

original: nāśaṃ prayāsyaty atha yad vināyako lokas tathāndho nikhilo bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: nāśam prayāsyati atha yat vināyakaḥ lokaḥ tathā andhaḥ nikhilaḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: And if the obstacle-maker perishes, the entire world will become blind.

original: aṣṭāṃgamārgas trivimokṣahetuḥ sarveṇa sarvaṃ na bhaviṣyatīha // /
analyzed: aṣṭāṃga mārgaḥ tri vimokṣa hetuḥ sarveṇa sarvam na bhaviṣyati iha
translated: The eightfold path, the cause of the three liberations, will completely disappear in this world.

original: asmābhir asmiṃ chubhabījam uptaṃ vākkāyacetodbhavam apramatttaiḥ /
analyzed: asmābhiḥ asmin śubha bījam uptam vāc kāya cetaḥ udbhavam apramatttaiḥ
translated: We have sown the auspicious seed of speech, body, and mind here, being heedful.

original: tato vayaṃ sarvasukhaiḥ samanvitāḥ puṇyākarasyāsya hi mā bhavet kṣayaḥ // /
analyzed: tatas vayam sarva sukhaiḥ samanvitāḥ puṇya ākarasya asya hi mā bhavet kṣayaḥ
translated: Therefore, may we all be endowed with all happiness, and may there be no destruction of this source of merit.

original: tena ca samayena bahūni śuddhāvāsadevakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi tatraiva sannipatitāny abhūvan //
analyzed: tena ca samayena bahūni śuddhāvāsa deva koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi tatra eva sannipatitāni abhūvan
translated: And at that time, many hundreds of thousands of millions of billions of gods from the Pure Abodes assembled right there.

original: tāny apy evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: tāni api evam āhuḥ
translated: They also said this:

original: mā bhaiṣṭa yūyaṃ na muner avasthā bhaviṣyate kācid udārabuddheḥ /
analyzed: mā bhaiṣṭa yūyam na muneḥ avasthā bhaviṣyate kācid udāra buddheḥ
translated: Do not be afraid. There will be no change in the state of the Sage, the one of vast wisdom.

original: pratyakṣapūrvā vayam asya sādhor upāgatā yad bhuvi mārakoṭyaḥ // /
analyzed: pratyakṣa pūrvāḥ vayam asya sādhoḥ upāgatāḥ yat bhuvi māra koṭyaḥ
translated: O virtuous one, we have seen with our own eyes how millions of Maras have come to this earth and have been defeated.

original: ṣaṭtriṃśadyojanāni drutarabhasaparā yat samantād vitatya
analyzed: ṣaṭtriṃśat yojanāni druta rabhasa parā yat samantāt vitatya
translated: The army of Mara, which had spread out in all directions for thirty-six leagues,

original: prāsāsisphītakhaḍgapracurakhararavā bhīṣaṇī mārasenā /
analyzed: prāsa asi sphīta khaḍga pracura khara ravā bhīṣaṇī māra senā
translated: with its spears, swords, and abundant sharp-sounding scimitars, terrifying,

original: saṃprāptā bodhimaṇḍe vilayam upagatā tatkṣaṇād eva bhītā
analyzed: saṃprāptā bodhimaṇḍe vilayam upagatā tad kṣaṇāt eva bhītā
translated: had come to the Bodhi tree, but was instantly frightened and destroyed.

original: prāptārthasyādya kiṃ svit prasṛtayaśaso vighnam eṣa prakuryāt // /
analyzed: prāpta arthasya adya kim svid prasṛta yaśasaḥ vighnam eṣa prakuryāt
translated: What obstacle could he create now for one who has attained his goal and whose fame has spread?

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: [Kuru-mīya]

original: athāparā devatā prarudantī evam āha /
analyzed: atha aparā devatā prarudantī evam āha
translated: Then another deity, weeping, said this:

original: mārasyaikasya sā senā prāg āsin na mahābalā /
analyzed: mārasya ekasya sā senā prāk āsin na mahā balā
translated: This was formerly the single, not very powerful army of Māra.

original: mārakoṭīsahasrāṇām iyaṃ senā mahābalā // /
analyzed: māra koṭī sahasrāṇām iyam senā mahā balā
translated: This is now the powerful army of thousands of koṭis of Māras.

original: niḥsaṃśayam iha prāpto nāśaṃ lokavināyakaḥ /
analyzed: niḥsaṃśayam iha prāptaḥ nāśam loka vināyakaḥ
translated: There is no doubt that the world's guide will perish here,

original: yadvināśād ayaṃ loko nirāloko bhramiṣyati // /
analyzed: yad vināśāt ayam lokaḥ nirālokaḥ bhramiṣyati
translated: by whose destruction the world will wander without a light.

original: atha khalu te śakrabrahmalokapālā bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ pariṣvajyaivam āhuḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu te śakra brahma lokapālāḥ bhagavataḥ pādayoḥ pariṣvajya evam āhuḥ
translated: Then indeed those Śakra, Brahmā, and Lokapāla [gods] embraced the feet of the Blessed One and said this:

original: tiṣṭheha sādho kuru mandadhīnām asmadvacaḥ kāruṇikapradhāna /
analyzed: tiṣṭha iha sādho kuru manda dhīnām asmad vacaḥ kāruṇika pradhāna
translated: Stay here, good one, do the word of us, the slow-witted ones, O chief of the compassionate ones.

original: bahudevakoṭyo ghanaśokataptās tāḥ sāmprataṃ dharmarasena siṃca // /
analyzed: bahu deva koṭyaḥ ghana śoka taptāḥ tāḥ sāmpratam dharma rasena siṃca
translated: Many millions of gods are tormented by thick sorrow, now sprinkle them with the nectar of the Dharma.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃs tāṃ sarvāvatīṃ parṣadaṃ maitrāviśālābhyāṃ nayanābhyām avalokya brāhmeṇa svareṇa tāṃ samāśvāsayann evam āha /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tām sarvāvatīm parṣadam maitra aviśālābhyām nayanābhyām avalokya brāhmeṇa svareṇa tām samāśvāsayan evam āha
translated: Then indeed the Blessed One, having looked at the entire assembly with his eyes of loving-kindness and compassion, comforting them with his Brahmā voice, said this:

original: mā bhaiṣṭa yūyaṃ bhavathādya nirbhayāḥ sarve 'pi mārā yugapat savāhanāḥ /
analyzed: mā bhaiṣṭa yūyam bhavatha adya nirbhayāḥ sarve mārāḥ yugapad sa vāhanāḥ
translated: Do not be afraid, be fearless today, all of you, even all the Māras together with their mounts.

original: śaktā na me bhīṣayituṃ samagrā romāpy athaikaṃ kim u sarvadeham // /
analyzed: śaktāḥ na me bhīṣayitum samagrāḥ romā api athā ekam kim sarva deham
translated: All together are not able to frighten me, not even a single hair, how much less my whole body.

original: āśvāsayāmy adya tu sarvalokaṃ dharmaṃ sadāhaṃ bhuvi deśayiṣye /
analyzed: āśvāsayāmi adya tu sarva lokam dharmam sadā aham bhuvi deśayiṣye
translated: But today I will comfort the whole world, I will always teach the Dharma on earth.

original: mārgacyutānām aham eva samyaṅ mārgopadeśaṃ viśadaṃ kariṣye // /
analyzed: mārga cyutānām aham eva samyak mārga upadeśam viśadam kariṣye
translated: I will clearly give the right teaching of the path to those who have fallen from the path.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: kṛtāni pūrvaṃ bahuduṣkarāṇi mayānnapānaṃ vipulaṃ pradattaṃ /
analyzed: kṛtāni pūrvam bahu duṣkarāṇi mayā anna pānam vipulam pradattam
translated: Many difficult tasks were done by me in the past, I have given abundant food and drink,

original: āvāsabhaiṣajyam analpakaṃ ca kartuṃ vighātaṃ mama ko 'dya śakyaḥ // /
analyzed: āvāsa bhaiṣajyam analpakam ca kartum vighātam mama kaḥ śakyaḥ
translated: And much shelter and medicine. Who is able to harm me now?

original: tyaktā mayā hy aśvarathā gajāś ca vibhūṣaṇāny ābharaṇāni caivam /
analyzed: tyaktāḥ mayā hi aśva rathāḥ gajāḥ ca vibhūṣaṇāni ābharaṇāni ca evam
translated: Horses, chariots, and elephants were abandoned by me, and ornaments and adornments as well,

original: dāsāś ca dāsyo nigamāś ca rāṣṭrāḥ kartuṃ vighātaṃ mama kaḥ samarthaḥ // /
analyzed: dāsāḥ ca dāsyaḥ nigamāḥ ca rāṣṭrāḥ kartum vighātam mama kaḥ samarthaḥ  /
translated: And slaves, male and female, and cities and kingdoms. Who is able to harm me?

original: bhāryāsutāduhitṛkaḍatravargam aiśvaryam iṣṭaṃ bhuvi rājavaṃśaḥ /
analyzed: bhāryā sutā duhitṛka ḍatra vargam aiśvaryam iṣṭam bhuvi rāja vaṃśaḥ
translated: Wife, sons, daughters, and relatives, desired sovereignty on earth, and the royal lineage,

original: datto mayā sattvahitāya kasmāc charīranāśo 'dya bhaviṣyati me // /
analyzed: dattaḥ mayā sattva hitāya kasmāt śarīra nāśaḥ dya bhaviṣyati me
translated: Given by me for the benefit of beings. Why will there be destruction of my body today?

original: śiraś ca netre ubhe karṇanāse hastau ca pādau tanucarmalohitaṃ /
analyzed: śiraḥ ca netre ubhe karṇa nāse hastau ca pādau tanu carma lohitam
translated: Head, two eyes, two ears and nose, hands and feet, body, skin and blood,🔽 And flesh, marrow, and bones, and the internal organs, all of these I will give to those who ask for them. What will remain of my body?

original: svajīvitaṃ tyaktam apīha dehināṃ kartuṃ vihiṃsāṃ mama kaḥ samarthaḥ // /
analyzed: sva jīvitam tyaktam api iha dehinām kartum vihiṃsām mama kaḥ samarthaḥ
translated: What man is able to harm me, who have abandoned even my own life for the sake of embodied beings?

original: bahvyo mayātīva hi buddhakoṭyaḥ saṃpūjitā bhaktimatā svahastaṃ /
analyzed: bahvyaḥ mayā atīva hi buddha koṭyaḥ saṃpūjitāḥ bhaktimatā sva hastam
translated: Many, many millions of Buddhas have I worshipped with devotion, with my own hands,

original: śīlaśrutikṣāntiratena nityaṃ kartuṃ vilopaṃ mama kaḥ samarthaḥ // /
analyzed: śīla śruti kṣānti ratena nityam kartum vilopam mama kaḥ samarthaḥ
translated: Always delighting in morality, learning, and patience. What man is able to destroy me?

original: pūrvaṃ mayā vai bahuduṣkarāṇi kṛtāni me 'tīva samāhitena /
analyzed: pūrvam mayā vai bahu duṣkarāṇi kṛtāni me tīva samāhitena
translated: Formerly, by me, very difficult things were done, by me, with great concentration.

original: saṃchinnagātreṇa na roṣitaṃ manaḥ kartuṃ vihiṃsāṃ mama ko 'dya śaktaḥ // /
analyzed: saṃchinna gātreṇa na roṣitam manaḥ kartum vihiṃsām mama kaḥ śaktaḥ
translated: Even when my body was cut, my mind was not angered. Who is able today to harm me?

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kurumiya

original: kleśā jitā me niyato 'smi buddhaḥ sarveṣu sattveṣu ca maitracittaḥ /
analyzed: kleśāḥ jitāḥ me niyataḥ smi buddhaḥ sarveṣu sattveṣu ca maitra cittaḥ
translated: My afflictions are conquered, I am destined to be a Buddha, and I have a loving mind towards all beings.

original: īrṣyā ca me nāsti khilaṃ ca roṣo na me samarthaḥ purato 'dya kaścit // /
analyzed: īrṣyā ca me nā asti khilam ca roṣaḥ na me samarthaḥ puratas kaścid
translated: I have no envy, malice, or anger. No one is able to stand before me today.

original: jitaṃ mayā mārabalaṃ samagraṃ parājitā me bahumārakoṭyaḥ /
analyzed: jitam mayā māra balam samagram parājitāḥ me bahu māra koṭyaḥ
translated: I have conquered the entire power of Mara. Many millions of Maras have been defeated by me.

original: yuṣmadvimokṣaṃ niyataṃ kariṣye mā bhaiṣṭa kasmān na puraṃ pravekṣye // /
analyzed: yuṣmad vimokṣam niyatam kariṣye mā bhaiṣṭa kasmāt na puram pravekṣye
translated: I will certainly liberate you all. Do not be afraid. Why should I not enter the city?

original: ye keci diśāsu daśasv apīha buddhā hi tiṣṭhaṃti tu sattvahetoḥ /
analyzed: ye diśāsu daśasu api iha buddhāḥ hi tiṣṭhanti tu sattva hetoḥ
translated: Those who are Buddhas, for the sake of beings, in the ten directions of the world,

original: tāṃ sarvabuddhān iha yojayiṣye maharddhikāṃś cāpy atha bodhisattvān // /
analyzed: tām sarva buddhān iha yojayiṣye maharddhikān ca api atha bodhisattvān
translated: I will connect all the Buddhas here, and also the powerful Bodhisattvas.

original: kṣetraṃ prapūrṇaṃ sakalaṃ kariṣye jñānena puṇyena ca vāsayiṣye /
analyzed: kṣetram prapūrṇam sakalam kariṣye jñānena puṇyena ca vāsayiṣye
translated: I will make the entire realm completely full, and I will cause it to be inhabited by wisdom and merit.

original: tair eva buddhaiḥ saha netri saṃsthitā kariṣya buddhānumataṃ ca kāryam // /
analyzed: taiḥ eva buddhaiḥ saha netri saṃsthitā kariṣya buddha anumatam ca kāryam
translated: Together with those very Buddhas, I will stand in the middle and do what is approved by the Buddhas.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayenāprameyāsaṃkhyeyāni devanāgayakṣarākṣasāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragamanuṣyāmanuṣyakoṭīnayutaśatasahasrāṇi bhagavate sādhukāraṃ 🔽pradaduḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena aprameya asaṃkhyeyāni deva nāga yakṣa rākṣasa asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga manuṣya amanuṣya koṭī nayuta śata sahasrāṇi bhagavate sādhukāram  pradaduḥ
translated: Then at that time, immeasurable and countless hundreds of thousands of niyutas of kotis of gods, nagas, yakshas, rakshasas, asuras, garudas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans gave the Blessed One the praise of Excellent!

original: evaṃ cāhuḥ /🔽nama āścaryādbhutāsaṃkhyeyavīryasamanvāgatāya /
analyzed: evam ca āhuḥ  namaḥ āścarya adbhuta asaṃkhyeya vīrya samanvāgatāya
translated: And they said:🔽Homage to the one endowed with wondrous, inconceivable, and immeasurable diligence!

original: namo namo mahāścaryādbhutāsaṃkhyeyavīryasamanvāgatāya buddhāya bhagavate /
analyzed: namaḥ namaḥ mahā āścarya adbhuta asaṃkhyeya vīrya samanvāgatāya buddhāya bhagavate
