translated: Homage, homage to the Buddha, the Blessed One, endowed with wondrous, inconceivable, and immeasurable diligence!

original: āśvāsito bhagavatā sadevako lokaḥ /
analyzed: āśvāsitaḥ bhagavatā sa devakaḥ lokaḥ
translated: The world with its gods has been comforted by the Blessed One.

original: parājito bhagavatā mārapakṣaḥ /
analyzed: parājitaḥ bhagavatā māra pakṣaḥ
translated: The faction of Mara has been defeated by the Blessed One.

original: vidhūtaṃ sattvānāṃ sandhikleśakāluṣyaṃ /
analyzed: vidhūtam sattvānām sandhi kleśa kāluṣyam
translated: The defilements and impurities of the knots of suffering of beings have been removed.

original: Kurumiya prabhinnaḥ sattvānāṃ mānaparvataḥ /
analyzed: kurumiya prabhinnaḥ sattvānām māna parvataḥ
translated: The mountain of pride of beings has been shattered by the Blessed One.

original: chinno janmavṛkṣaḥ /
analyzed: chinnaḥ janma vṛkṣaḥ
translated: The tree of birth has been cut down.

original: vicūrṇito mṛtyusūryaḥ /
analyzed: vicūrṇitaḥ mṛtyu sūryaḥ
translated: The sun of death has been crushed.

original: vidhūto 'vidyāndhakāraḥ /
analyzed: vidhūtaḥ vidyā andhakāraḥ
translated: The darkness of ignorance has been dispelled.

original: prasāditā anyatīrthyāḥ /
analyzed: prasāditāḥ anya tīrthyāḥ
translated: Other tīrthikas have been satisfied.

original: saṃśoṣitāś catvāra oghāḥ /
analyzed: saṃśoṣitāḥ catvāraḥ oghāḥ
translated: The four floods have been dried up.

original: prajvālitā dharmolkāḥ /
analyzed: prajvālitāḥ dharma ulkāḥ
translated: The torch of the Dharma has been lit.

original: nidarśito bodhimārgaḥ /🔽niyojitāḥ kṣāṇtisoratye /
analyzed: nidarśitaḥ bodhi mārgaḥ  niyojitāḥ kṣāṇti soratye
translated: The path to enlightenment has been shown.🔽They have been engaged in patience and gentleness.

original: krīḍāpitā dhyānasaukhye /
translated: They have been made to play in the happiness of meditation.

original: avabodhitāni catvāry āryasatyāni /
analyzed: avabodhitāni catvāri ārya satyāni
translated: The four noble truths have been realized.

original: samuttārito bhagavatā mahākāruṇikena śāstrā janmasamudrāt sadevako lokaḥ /
analyzed: samuttāritaḥ bhagavatā mahā kāruṇikena śāstrā janma samudrāt sa devakaḥ lokaḥ
translated: The world with its gods has been rescued from the great ocean of birth by the Blessed One, the greatly compassionate teacher.

original: praveśitās sattvā 'bhayapuraṃ //
analyzed: praveśitāḥ sattvāḥ bhayapuram
translated: Beings have been brought to the city of fearlessness.

original: atha te devamanuṣyā nānāpuṣpadhūpagandhamālyālaṅkāravibhūṣaṇair bhagavantam abhyarcayitvā bhagavato 'rthāya te mārgaṃ śobhayām āsuḥ /
analyzed: atha te deva manuṣyāḥ nānā puṣpa dhūpa gandha mālya alaṅkāra vibhūṣaṇaiḥ bhagavantam abhyarcayitvā bhagavataḥ rthāya te mārgam śobhayām āsuḥ
translated: Then those gods and humans, having worshipped the Blessed One with various flowers, incense, garlands, ornaments, and decorations, and having adorned the road for the sake of the Blessed One,

original: divyavastrapuṣpaduṣyaiś ca bhagavantaṃ saṃchādayanti sma /
analyzed: divya vastra puṣpa duṣyaiḥ ca bhagavantam saṃchādayanti sma
translated: they covered the Blessed One with divine garments and flowers.

original: divyaiś ca māndāravamahāmāndāravapāruṣakamahāpāruṣakamaṃjuṣakamahāmaṃjuṣakarocamahārocotpalakumudapuṇḍarīkaiḥ saṃchādayām āsuḥ /
analyzed: divyaiḥ ca māndārava mahāmāndārava pāruṣaka mahāpāruṣaka maṃjuṣaka mahāmaṃjuṣaka roca mahāroca utpala kumuda puṇḍarīkaiḥ saṃchādayām āsuḥ
translated: They covered him with divine coral tree flowers, great coral tree flowers, spider lily flowers, great spider lily flowers, white water lily flowers, night-blooming jasmine flowers, and blue lotus flowers.

original: yatra bhagavāṃs tau caraṇau niścikṣepa tasmiṃś ca mārge ubhayoḥ pārśvayor divyāṃ saptaratnamayān vṛkṣān abhinirmimīya divyavastraduṣyahastakarṇaśīrṣābharaṇair
analyzed: yatra bhagavān tau caraṇau niścikṣepa tasmin ca mārge ubhayoḥ pārśvayoḥ divyām sapta ratna mayān vṛkṣān abhinirmimīya divya vastra duṣya hasta karṇa śīrṣa ābharaṇaiḥ
translated: Wherever the Blessed One placed his feet, on both sides of the road he manifested divine trees made of the seven precious substances, adorned with divine garments,

original: alaṃcakruḥ /
analyzed: alaṃcakruḥ
translated: and with earrings, head ornaments, and ornaments for the hands.

original: teṣu ca vṛkṣāntareṣu divyāḥ puṣkiriṇīr māpayaṃti sma /
analyzed: teṣu ca vṛkṣa antareṣu divyāḥ puṣkiriṇīḥ māpayanti sma
translated: Between those trees they created divine lotus ponds,

original: śītāḥ svādūdakā viprasannā anāvilāḥ /
analyzed: śītāḥ svādu udakāḥ viprasannāḥ anāvilāḥ
translated: with cool, sweet water, clear and undisturbed,

original: aṣṭāṃgopetavāriparipūrṇāḥ samantāt saptaratnālaṃkārālaṃkṛtāḥ /
analyzed: aṣṭāṃga upeta vāri paripūrṇāḥ samantāt sapta ratna alaṃkāra alaṃkṛtāḥ
translated: filled with water possessing the eight qualities, adorned all around with the seven precious substances.

original: antarikṣe ca saptaratnamayāni cchatrāṇi dadhrire /🔽dhvajapatākāsuvarṇasūtramuktāhārāṃś ca suvarṇacūrṇavarṣāṃś ca vavarṣuḥ /
analyzed: antarikṣe ca sapta ratna mayāni chatrāṇi dadhrire  dhvaja patākā suvarṇa sūtra muktā hārān ca suvarṇa cūrṇa varṣān ca vavarṣuḥ
translated: In the sky they held up parasols made of the seven precious substances,🔽and rained down flags, banners, golden threads, pearl necklaces, and golden dust.

original: rūpyavaiḍūryacūrṇāgarutagaracandanakālānusāritamālapatravarṣāṇi Kurumiya
analyzed: rūpya vaiḍūrya cūrṇa agaru tagara candana kāla anusāri tamāla patra varṣāṇi
translated: They released a rain of silver, beryl, agaru, tagara, sandalwood, black agarwood, and tamala leaf powder,

original: samutsasarjuḥ /
analyzed: samutsasarjuḥ
translated: and kṛṣṇa agaru.

original: gośīrṣoragasāracandanacūrṇañ ca tasmin mārge vavarṣuḥ /
analyzed: gośīrṣa uraga sāra candana cūrṇam ca tasmin mārge vavarṣuḥ
translated: They rained down gośīrṣa and uragasāra sandalwood powder on that road.

original: suvarṇasūtramuktāhāramaṇimuktibhiś ca sarvaṃ gaganatalaṃ nānādivyālaṅkārair alañcakruḥ /
analyzed: suvarṇa sūtra muktā hāra maṇi muktibhiḥ ca sarvam gagana talam nānā divya alaṅkāraiḥ alañcakruḥ
translated: They adorned the entire sky with golden threads, pearl necklaces, jewels, and pearls, and with various divine ornaments.

original: nagarasya ca bahirdhā devamanuṣyāḥ bhagavataḥ pūjākarmaṇe mārgaśobhāñ cakrire /
analyzed: nagarasya ca bahirdhā deva manuṣyāḥ bhagavataḥ pūjā karmaṇe mārga śobhām cakrire
translated: And outside the city, gods and humans made preparations for the worship of the Blessed One.

original: antarnagarañ ca mārā mārapārṣadyāś ca śobhāvyūhair vyūhayām āsur bhagavataḥ pūjākarmaṇe //
analyzed: antar nagaram ca mārāḥ māra pārṣadyāḥ ca śobhā vyūhaiḥ vyūhayām āsuḥ bhagavataḥ pūjā karmaṇe
translated: And inside the city, Māra and his retinue made preparations with various adornments for the worship of the Blessed One.

original: atha khalu bhagavāṃs tasmiṃ samaye śūraṃgaman nāma samādhiṃ samāpede /
analyzed: atha khalu bhagavān tasmin samaye śūraṃgamat nāma samādhim samāpede
translated: Then the Blessed One, at that time, entered the concentration called Heroic March.

original: tena ca samādhinā yathā samāpanna eva mārgaṃ jagāma /
analyzed: tena ca samādhinā yathā samāpannaḥ eva mārgam jagāma
translated: And by that concentration, he went on the path as if he were already in concentration.

original: tena khalu punas samayena nānādyaiḥ kāyarūpaliṅgeryāpathair bhagavāṃs taṃ mārgam abhipratasthe /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena nānā ādyaiḥ kāya rūpa liṅga īryāpathaiḥ bhagavān tam mārgam abhipratasthe
translated: At that time, the Blessed One went on that path with various bodies, forms, signs, and deportments.

original: tatra ye sattvā brahmabhaktikā brahmavainayikās te brahmarūpeṇa bhagavantaṃ mārgaṃ vrajantam adrākṣuḥ /🔽yāvad ye śakravainayikā ye nārāyaṇavainayikā ye maheśvaravainayikā ye caturmahārājavainayikā
analyzed: tatra ye sattvāḥ brahmabhaktikāḥ brahma vainayikāḥ te brahma rūpeṇa bhagavantam mārgam vrajantam adrākṣuḥ  yāvat ye śakra vainayikāḥ ye nārāyaṇa vainayikāḥ ye maheśvara vainayikāḥ ye catur mahārāja vainayikā
translated: There, those beings who were devoted to Brahmā and were to be guided by Brahmā saw the Blessed One going on the path in the form of Brahmā.🔽Up to those who were to be guided by Śakra, those who were to be guided by Nārāyaṇa, those who were to be guided by Maheśvara, those who were to be guided by the Four Great Kings,

original: ye cakravartivainayikā ye koṭṭarājavainayikā ye maharṣivainayikā ye śramaṇavainayikā
analyzed: ye cakravarti vainayikāḥ ye koṭṭarāja vainayikāḥ ye mahā ṛṣi vainayikāḥ ye śramaṇa vainayikā
translated: those who were to be guided by the wheel-turning kings, those who were to be guided by the provincial kings, those who were to be guided by the great sages, those who were to be guided by the ascetics,

original: ye kumāravainayikā ye strīvainayikā ye siṃhavainayikā ye gajavainayikā ye nāgavainayikā
analyzed: ye kumāra vainayikāḥ ye strī vainayikāḥ ye siṃha vainayikāḥ ye gaja vainayikāḥ ye nāga vainayikā
translated: Those who were disciplined like young men, like women, like lions, like elephants, like nāgas,

original: ye asuravainayikā ye śaśabhaktikāḥ śaśavainayikāḥ śaśarūpaliṃgeryāpathena bhagavantaṃ
analyzed: ye asura vainayikāḥ ye śaśabhaktikāḥ śaśavainayikāḥ śaśarūpaliṃga īryāpathena bhagavantam
translated: like asuras, like rabbits, those who were disciplined like rabbits, saw the Blessed One

original: mārgaṃ vrajantam adrākṣuḥ /
analyzed: mārgam vrajantam adrākṣuḥ
translated: going on the road with the gait, form, and appearance of a rabbit.

original: ye sattvā buddhavainayikās te buddharūpaliṃgeryāpathenaiva bhagavantaṃ mārgaṃ vrajantam adrākṣuḥ /
analyzed: ye sattvāḥ buddha vainayikāḥ te buddha rūpa liṃga īryāpathena eva bhagavantam mārgam vrajantam adrākṣuḥ
translated: Those beings who were disciplined by the Buddha saw the Blessed One going on the road with the gait, form, and appearance of the Buddha.

original: sarve ca te sattvāḥ prāṃjalayo bhūtvā samabhiṣṭuvaṃto namaskurvantaḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ pṛṣṭhataḥ samanubaddhā jagmuḥ //
analyzed: sarve ca te sattvāḥ prāṃjalayaḥ bhūtvā samabhiṣṭuvaṃtaḥ namaskurvantaḥ pṛṣṭhatas pṛṣṭhatas samanubaddhāḥ jagmuḥ
translated: And all those beings, with palms joined, praising and paying homage, followed behind him.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena yo 'sāv anuhimavannivāsī jyotīsaro nāmarṣir Kurumiya
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena yaḥ sau anu himavat nivāsī jyotīsaraḥ nāma ṛṣiḥ
translated: At that time, there was a sage named Jyotiṣprabha who lived in the Himalayas.

original: māreṇa pāpīmatā udyojitaḥ sa paṃcaśataparivāro rājagṛhasya mahānagaradvārasamīpe
analyzed: māreṇa pāpīmatā udyojitaḥ sa paṃca śata parivāraḥ rājagṛhasya mahā nagara dvāra samīpe
translated: He was urged by the evil Māra, and with a retinue of five hundred, near the gate of the great city of Rājagṛha,

original: folios to are missing /
analyzed: folios to are missing
translated: The folios are missing.

original: text according to Dutt /
analyzed: text according to dutt
translated: Text according to Dutt.

original: pratīkṣya bhagavato rūpaliṅgeryāpatham apaśyat tathā mārge cāsaṃkhyeyā vṛkṣadevatā pūjākarmaṇe udyuktāḥ /
analyzed: pratīkṣya bhagavataḥ rūpa liṅga īryā patham apaśyat tathā mārge ca asaṃkhyeyāḥ vṛkṣa devatā pūjā karmaṇe udyuktāḥ
translated: Waiting, he saw the Blessed One's form, characteristics, and deportment, and likewise on the path, countless tree deities were ready to perform worship.

original: dṛṣṭvedaṃ tasyaitad abhavat /
analyzed: dṛṣṭvā idam tasya etat abhavat
translated: Seeing this, he thought:

analyzed: satya vādī mahā ṛṣiḥ ayam mahā anubhāvaḥ pūjā arhaḥ
translated: This great sage is truthful, of great power, worthy of worship, and so on.

original: folios to are very fragmentary
analyzed: folios to are very fragmentary
translated: The folios are very fragmentary

original: atha jyotīraso ṛṣiḥ saparivāraḥ buddharūpaliṃgeryāpathasthitaṃ bhagavantaṃ dṛṣṭvā / / / / / / / / / / / / si ratnaketuṃ nāma bodhisattvasamādhiṃ pratilebhe
analyzed: atha jyotīrasaḥ ṛṣiḥ sa parivāraḥ buddha rūpa liṃga īryāpatha sthitam bhagavantam dṛṣṭvā si ratnaketum nāma bodhisattva samādhim pratilebhe
translated: Then the sage Jyotis, together with his retinue, seeing the Blessed One abiding in the form, characteristics, and deportment of a Buddha, attained the bodhisattva concentration called Ratnaketu.

analyzed: yasya samādheḥ bhavati asaṃhāryaḥ sarva samāpattibhiḥ
translated: By attaining that concentration, he became unassailable by all other concentrations.

original: atha jyotīraso maharṣir bhagavataḥ prāṃjalibhūtaḥ puṣpaṃ dattvā stutvā ca abhyastāvīt //
analyzed: atha jyotīrasaḥ mahā ṛṣiḥ bhagavataḥ prāṃjali bhūtaḥ puṣpam dattvā stutvā ca abhyastāvīt
translated: Then the great sage Jyotis, with palms joined, offered a flower to the Blessed One, praised him, and extolled him:

original: tatra vayam ekakāle ekasamayaikabuddhakṣetrenaprameyāsaṃkhyeyān buddhān bhagavataḥ tiṣṭhato dhriyato yāpayato pūjayiṣyāmaḥ tebhyo dharmam
analyzed: tatra vayam eka kāle eka samaya eka buddhakṣetrena aprameya asaṃkhyeyān buddhān bhagavataḥ tiṣṭhataḥ dhriyataḥ yāpayataḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ tebhyaḥ dharmam
translated: There, at one time, in one Buddha-field, we will worship immeasurable, incalculable Buddhas, Bhagavāns, who abide, endure, and remain,

original: api śroṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: api śroṣyāmaḥ
translated: and we will hear the Dharma🔽from them.'

original: tatra ca vayaṃ caturbhī ṛddhiviṣayavyūhais tāṃ sahāṃ lokadhātuṃ samalaṃkṛtāṃ drakṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tatra ca vayam caturbhiḥ ṛddhi viṣaya vyūhaiḥ tām sahām lokadhātum samalaṃkṛtām drakṣyāmaḥ
translated: And there, with four kinds of displays of miraculous powers, we will see that Sahā world realm well adorned.

original: tāṃś ca mahāsannipātavyūhān drakṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: tān ca mahā sannipāta vyūhān drakṣyāmaḥ
translated: And we will see those great assemblies gathered together.

original: saced vayaṃ tatra buddhakṣetre tasyāṃ dhāṛaṇyāṃ bhāṣyamāṇāyāṃ sthānaṃ lapsyāmahe
analyzed: saced vayam tatra buddhakṣetre tasyām dhāṛaṇyām bhāṣyamāṇāyām sthānam lapsyāmahe
translated: If we obtain a place there in that buddha realm, when that discourse is being spoken in that assembly,

original: tāṃś ca buddhāṃ bhagavato vandituṃ śakṣyāmaḥ paryupāsituṃ pūjayituṃ dharmaṃ ca śrotuṃ
analyzed: tān ca buddhām bhagavataḥ vanditum śakṣyāmaḥ paryupāsitum pūjayitum dharmam ca śrotum
translated: and if we are able to pay homage to those Buddha Bhagavats, to attend on them, to make offerings to them, and to hear the Dharma,

original: tāṃś ca yathāsannipatitān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān iti //
analyzed: tān ca yathā sannipatitān bodhisattvān mahāsattvān iti
translated: and if we are able to see those bodhisattva mahāsattvas assembled there, just as they are.”

original: atha te buddhā bhagavantaḥ pratipratibuddhakṣetre tān svān bodhisattvāṃ mahāsattvāṃs tāṃś ca mahāśrāvakān evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: atha te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ pratipratibuddhakṣetre tān svān bodhisattvām mahāsattvān tān ca mahāśrāvakān evam āhuḥ
translated: Then those Buddha Bhagavats, in each of their buddha realms, said to their own bodhisattva mahāsattvas and their great śrāvakas,

original: mā yūyaṃ kulaputrā evaṅ kāṅkṣata maivaṃ vicikitsadhvaṃ cātra lokadhātau praveśasthānāvakāśaṃ prati /
analyzed: mā yūyam kula putrāḥ evam kāṅkṣata mā evam vicikitsadhvam ca atra lokadhātau praveśa sthāna avakāśam prati
translated: “Do not doubt, noble ones, do not have uncertainty about the entry, location, and space in that world realm.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: ananto buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ buddhaviṣayāvatārasamatājñānakauśalyasattvaparipākaḥ /
analyzed: anantaḥ buddhānām bhagavatām buddha viṣaya avatāra samatā jñāna kauśalya sattva paripākaḥ
translated: The Buddhas, the Bhagavats, have infinite skill in the knowledge of entering into the domain of the Buddhas. They ripen beings.

original: vistīrṇāvakāśaḥ sa kulaputrā śākyamunis tathāgato mahopāyakauśalyena samanvāgataḥ /
analyzed: vistīrṇa avakāśaḥ sa kula putrā śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ mahā upāya kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ
translated: The Tathāgata Śākyamuni, O sons of noble family, has a vast scope and is endowed with great skillful means.

original: ye kecit kulaputrāḥ sattvāḥ sattvadhātusaṃgrahasaṃgṛhītāḥ dhātvāyatanasaṃniśṛtās Kurumiya
analyzed: ye kecid kula putrāḥ sattvāḥ sattvadhātu saṃgraha saṃgṛhītāḥ dhātu āyatana saṃniśṛtāḥ
translated: O sons of noble family, whatever beings are included in the realm of beings, included in the aggregate of beings, belonging to the elements and sense bases,

original: teṣāṃ sattvānāṃ saced ekaikasya sumerupramāṇa ātmabhāvo bhavet parikalpam upādāya
analyzed: teṣām sattvānām saced ekaikasya sumeru pramāṇaḥ ātma bhāvaḥ bhavet parikalpam upādāya
translated: if those beings were to have a body the size of Mount Sumeru, counting from the top of the head,

original: śaktaḥ sa śākyamunis tathāgatas tān sarvasattvān evaṃrūpātmabhāvān ekasmin sarṣapaphale praveśayituṃ /
analyzed: śaktaḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tān sarva sattvān evaṃrūpa ātmabhāvān ekasmin sarṣapa phale praveśayitum
translated: that Tathāgata Śākyamuni would be able to make all those beings enter a single mustard seed, in such a form.

original: ekaikaś ca sattvo vistīrṇaviṣayāvakāśaḥ syān na ca parasparaṃ te cakṣuṣa ābhāsam āgaccheran /
analyzed: ekaikaḥ ca sattvaḥ vistīrṇa viṣaya avakāśaḥ syāt na ca parasparam te cakṣuṣaḥ ābhāsam āgaccheran
translated: And each being would have a vast scope of perception, and they would not come into the range of vision of each other.

original: na caikasyaikasya sarṣapaphalasya sarvasattvamahātmabhāvapraveśenonatvaṃ vā pūrṇatvaṃ vā prajñāyeta /
analyzed: na ca ekasya ekasya sarṣapa phalasya sarva sattva mahātma bhāva praveśena ūna tvam vā pūrṇa tvam vā prajñāyeta
translated: And by the entry of all the great bodies of beings into each single mustard seed, there would be no decrease or fullness perceived.

original: evaṃrūpeṇa kulaputrā upāyakauśalyena samanvāgataḥ sa śākyamunis tathāgata iti //
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa kula putrāḥ upāya kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ iti
translated: O sons of noble family, the Tathāgata Śākyamuni is endowed with such skillful means.

original: punar aparaṃ kulaputrā yāvat karkaśatvaṃ tat sarvaṃ pṛthivīdhātu /
analyzed: punar aparam kula putrāḥ yāvat karkaśa tvam tat sarvam pṛthivī dhātu
translated: Moreover, O sons of noble family, all that is coarse, that is all the earth element.

original: śaktaḥ sa śākyamunis tathāgatas taṃ sarvapṛthivīdhātum ekarajāgre praveśayituṃ /
analyzed: śaktaḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tam sarva pṛthivī dhātum eka raja agre praveśayitum
translated: The Tathagata Shakyamuni is able to place that entire earth element in a single atom.

original: na ca tasyaikarajāgrasya sarvapṛthivīdhātupraveśenonatvaṃ vā pūrṇatvaṃ vā prajñāyeta /
analyzed: na ca tasya eka raja agrasya sarva pṛthivī dhātu praveśena ūna tvam vā pūrṇa tvam vā prajñāyeta
translated: And by that single atom's inclusion of the entire earth element, neither its decrease nor its fullness would be known.

original: evaṃrūpeṇopāyakauśalyena samanvāgataḥ sa śākyamunis tathāgataḥ //
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa upāya kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathagata Shakyamuni possesses such skillful means.

original: punar aparaṃ kulaputrā yat kiṃcid ārdratvaṃ vā prajñāyate tat sarvaṃ abdhātu /
analyzed: punar aparam kula putrāḥ yat kiṃcid ārdra tvam vā prajñāyate tat sarvam ap dhātu
translated: Moreover, noble sons, whatever moisture is known, all that is the water element.

original: śaktaḥ sa śākyamunis tathāgatas taṃ sarvam abdhātum ekavālāgre praveśayituṃ /
analyzed: śaktaḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tam sarvam ap dhātum eka vāla agre praveśayitum
translated: The Tathagata Shakyamuni is able to place that entire water element in a single hair-tip.

original: na ca tasyaikasya vālāgrasya sarvābdhātupraveśenonatvaṃ vā pūrṇatvaṃ vā prajñāyeta //
analyzed: na ca tasya ekasya vāla agrasya sarva ap dhātu praveśena ūna tvam vā pūrṇa tvam vā prajñāyeta
translated: And by that single hair-tip's inclusion of the entire water element, neither its decrease nor its fullness would be known.

original: punar aparaṃ kulaputrā yaḥ kaścid vāyudhātuḥ prajñāyate śaktaḥ sa śākyamunis tathāgatas taṃ sarvaṃ vāyudhātum ekasmin romakūpe prakṣeptuṃ /
analyzed: punar aparam kula putrāḥ yaḥ kaścid vāyu dhātuḥ prajñāyate śaktaḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ tam sarvam vāyu dhātum ekasmin romakūpe prakṣeptum
translated: Moreover, noble sons, whatever wind element is known, the Tathagata Shakyamuni is able to expel that entire wind element into a single pore.

original: tatra ca sarvo vāyudhātus tasmin ekaromakūpe Kurumiya
analyzed: tatra ca sarvaḥ vāyu dhātuḥ tasmin eka romakūpe
translated: And there, the entire wind element in that single pore would not be able to move even a single atom.

original: praveśito 'pi vistīrṇāvakāśaḥ svaviṣayavat saṃcaret //
analyzed: praveśitaḥ pi vistīrṇa avakāśaḥ sva viṣaya vat saṃcaret
translated: Even if it were to enter, it would move about with ample space, just like its own domain.

original: punar aparaṃ kulaputrā yāvad uṣṇatvaṃ prajñāyate tat sarvaṃ tejodhātu /
analyzed: punar aparam kula putrāḥ yāvat uṣṇa tvam prajñāyate tat sarvam tejaḥ dhātu
translated: Moreover, noble sons, all that is known as heat is the fire element.

analyzed: u t gataḥ
translated: It is all gone.

original: sa ca sarvas tejodhātus tasmin paramāṇurajasi vistīrṇāvakāśaḥ svaviṣayavat saṃcaret //
analyzed: sa ca sarvaḥ tejaḥ dhātuḥ tasmin paramāṇu rajasi vistīrṇa avakāśaḥ sva viṣaya vat saṃcaret
translated: And that entire fire element would move about with ample space in that atomic particle, just like its own domain.

original: punar aparaṃ kulaputrā yāni kānicid daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetrāṇi tāni sarvāṇi sārdhaṃ
analyzed: punar aparam kula putrāḥ yāni kānicid daśasu dikṣu buddhakṣetrāṇi tāni sarvāṇi sārdham
translated: Moreover, noble sons, all those buddha-fields in the ten directions, together with

original: taiḥ sarvasattvais taiś catubhir mahābhūtaiḥ śaktaḥ sa śākyamunis tathāgata ekarajāgre praveśayituṃ /
analyzed: taiḥ sarva sattvaiḥ taiḥ catubhiḥ mahābhūtaiḥ śaktaḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ eka raja agre praveśayitum
translated: all those beings and those four great elements, the Tathagata Shakyamuni is able to cause them to enter a single hair-tip.

original: śaktas tasmiṃś ca paramāṇurajasi te sarvasattvāḥ saha tair mahābhūtaiḥ svaviṣayakarmāntacāriṇo vistīrṇāvakāśā vicareyuḥ /
analyzed: śaktaḥ tasmin ca paramāṇu rajasi te sarva sattvāḥ saha taiḥ mahābhūtaiḥ sva viṣaya karmānta cāriṇaḥ vistīrṇa avakāśāḥ vicareyuḥ
translated: And in that atomic particle, all those beings together with those great elements, acting in their own domains and realms, would move about with ample space.

original: na ca parasparaṃ viheṭhā bhaven na ca tasyaikarajāgrasyonatvaṃ vā pūrṇatvaṃ vā prajñāyeta /
analyzed: na ca parasparam viheṭhā bhavet na ca tasya eka rajāgrasya ūna tvam vā pūrṇa tvam vā prajñāyeta
translated: And there would be no mutual harm, and there would be no perception of decrease or fullness in that single hair-tip.

original: evaṃrūpeṇopāyakauśalyena samanvāgataḥ sa śākyamunis tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa upāya kauśalyena samanvāgataḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathagata Shakyamuni possesses such skillful means.

original: punar aparaṃ kulaputrā yāvanti sarvatryadhvānugatānāṃ sattvānāṃ ṣaḍāyatanacaryopādānapraṇidhānādhiṣṭhānavākpatharutākṣaravāgvyāhāratṛsaṃskārakarmāntakṛyāskandhavicāropacayanānopacaraṇāni
analyzed: punar aparam kula putrāḥ yāvanti sarva tri adhva anugatānām sattvānām ṣaṣ āyatana caryā upādāna praṇidhāna adhiṣṭhāna vākpatha ruta akṣara vāc vyāhāra tṛ saṃskāra karmānta kṛyā skandha vicāra upacaya nānā upacaraṇāni
translated: Furthermore, noble ones, all the six sense bases, conduct, appropriation, aspirations, bases of supernormal powers, paths of speech, sounds, syllables, verbal expressions, three types of formations, actions, activities, aggregates, considerations, accumulations, and various practices of beings throughout the three times,

original: yā ca sarva / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / krāntā yāvantaś ca sarvasattvānāṃ tryadhvānugatā upabhogaparibhogāḥ
analyzed: yā ca krāntā yāvantaḥ ca sarva sattvānām tri adhva anugatāḥ upabhoga paribhogāḥ
translated: and all the enjoyments and possessions of all beings throughout the three times,

original: sukhaduḥkhapratisaṃvedanīyāḥ tān sarvān ekakṣaṇe sa śākyamunis tathāgataḥ prajānāti /
analyzed: sukha duḥkha pratisaṃvedanīyāḥ tān sarvān eka kṣaṇe sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ prajānāti
translated: which are to be experienced as happiness and suffering, in a single moment that Shakyamuni Tathagata knows them all.

original: evaṃrūpeṇa lakṣaṇavikurvājñānena sa Kurumiya
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa sa
translated: With such a form of knowledge of characteristics and transformations, that Shakyamuni

original: śākyamunis tathāgato 'kalpo nirvikalpo 'nābhogaḥ tryadhvakoṭīparijñātāvī /
analyzed: śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ kalpaḥ nirvikalpaḥ na ābhogaḥ tri adhva koṭī parijñātāvī
translated: Tathagata is free from conceptualization, free from discrimination, free from effort, and has fully cognized the three times.

original: evaṃrūpeṇa kulaputrā aprameyena buddhaviṣayāvatārajñānakauśalyasamatāsattvaparipākopāyaiḥ samanvāgataḥ sa śākyamunis tathāgata iti //
analyzed: evaṃrūpeṇa kula putrāḥ aprameyena buddha viṣaya avatāra jñāna kauśalya samatā sattva paripāka upāyaiḥ samanvāgataḥ sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ iti
translated: Noble ones, the Shakyamuni Tathagata is endowed with such immeasurable skillful means for entering the domain of the buddhas, for knowing equality, and for ripening beings.

original: asmiṃ khalu punar lakṣaṇāni / / / / / / / / / / / / / / / tathāgatānāṃ pratipratiparṣado 'prameyāsaṃkhyeyāni bodhisattvaśatasahasrāṇi praṇidhānarddhiviṣayajñānapāraṃgatāny
analyzed: asmin khalu punar lakṣaṇāni tathāgatānām prati prati parṣadaḥ prameya asaṃkhyeyāni bodhisattva śata sahasrāṇi praṇidhāna ṛddhi viṣaya jñāna pāraṃgatāni
translated: In this very chapter of the characteristics of the Tathāgatas, in each assembly there were immeasurable and incalculable hundreds of thousands of bodhisattvas who had perfected the knowledge of the domain of vows and supernatural powers,

original: abhavan //
analyzed: abhavan
translated: and who had attained the perfection of the knowledge of the domain of vows and supernatural powers.

original: mahāsannipātān mahāyānasūtrād ratnaketuparivartāt paṃcamo lakṣaṇaparivartaḥ samāptaḥ //
analyzed: mahā sannipātāt mahāyāna sūtrāt ratnaketu parivartāt paṃcamaḥ lakṣaṇa parivartaḥ samāptaḥ
translated: The fifth chapter on characteristics is concluded from the chapter on Ratnaketu in the Mahāsaṃnipāta Mahāyāna Sūtra.

original: Kurumiya VI /
analyzed: kurumiya vi
translated: Kuruṃiya VI.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena pūrvadigbhāgād abhiratyāḥ lokadhātor akṣobhyo nāma tathāgato
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena pūrva digbhāgāt abhiratyāḥ lokadhātoḥ akṣobhyaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ
translated: At that time, from the east, from the Abhirati world system, the Tathāgata named Akṣobhya,

original: 'prameyāsaṃkhyeyair bodhisattvair mahāsattvaiḥ sārdhaṃ buddhaviṣayavikurvaṇādhiṣṭhānabalena
analyzed: prameya asaṃkhyeyaiḥ bodhisattvaiḥ mahāsattvaiḥ sārdham buddha viṣaya vikurvaṇa adhiṣṭhāna balena
translated: together with immeasurable and incalculable bodhisattva mahāsattvas, by the power of the Buddha's domain, transformation, and consecration,

original: saṃprasthita ekakṣaṇamātreṇedaṃ buddhakṣetram anuprāpto madhyamāṃ cāturdvīpikāṃ lokadhātuṃ
analyzed: saṃprasthitaḥ eka kṣaṇa mātreṇa idam buddhakṣetram anuprāptaḥ madhyamām cāturdvīpikām lokadhātum
translated: set out and in a single instant arrived at this buddha field, in the middle of the world system of four continents,

original: yatra śākyamunis tathāgato viharaty arhān samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /
analyzed: yatra śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ viharati arhān samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ
translated: where the Tathāgata Śākyamuni, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One, was dwelling.

original: āgatya ca yathāprādurbhūte padmāsane 'sthāt /
analyzed: āgatya ca yathā prādurbhūte padmāsane sthāt
translated: Having arrived, he sat on the lotus seat that had appeared.

original: te 'pi bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ svarddhibalena yathāprādurbhūteṣu padmāsaneṣu tasthuḥ /
analyzed: te pi bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ sva ṛddhi balena yathā prādurbhūteṣu padmāsaneṣu tasthuḥ
translated: Those bodhisattva mahāsattvas also, by the power of their own supernatural knowledge, remained in the lotus seats that had appeared.

original: evaṃpramukhāprameyāsaṃkhyeyā buddhakṣetraparamāṇurajaḥsamā buddhā bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhaṃto
analyzed: evaṃpramukha aprameya asaṃkhyeyāḥ buddhakṣetra paramāṇu rajaḥ samāḥ buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhaṃtaḥ
translated: Thus, the foremost of immeasurable, incalculable buddhas, equal to the atoms in a buddha-field, the Blessed Ones, who were dwelling,

original: dhriyanto yāpayantas tena kṣaṇalavamuhūrtenedaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ madhyamāṃ cāturdvīpikāṃ
analyzed: dhriyantaḥ yāpayantaḥ tena kṣaṇa lava muhūrtena idam buddhakṣetram madhyamām cāturdvīpikām
translated: supporting, and maintaining themselves, in that very moment, instant, and second, arrived at this buddha-field, and at the central four-continent world-system.

original: lokadhātuṃ saṃprāptā ekaikas tathāgato 'prameyāsaṃkhyeyair bodhisattvamahāsattvaiḥ
analyzed: lokadhātum saṃprāptāḥ ekaikaḥ tathāgataḥ prameya asaṃkhyeyaiḥ bodhisattva mahāsattvaiḥ
translated: Each of those tathāgatas, together with immeasurable, incalculable bodhisattva mahāsattvas,

original: śrāvakakoṭīnayutaśatasahasraiś ca sārdhaṃ yatra sa śākyamunis tathāgato viharaty
analyzed: śrāvaka koṭī nayuta śata sahasraiḥ ca sārdham yatra sa śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ viharati
translated: and with many hundred thousand koṭis of niyutas of śrāvakas, where that tathāgata Śākyamuni,

original: arhān samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ /🔽āgatāgatāś ca yathāprādurbhūteṣu padmāsaneṣu nyaṣeduḥ /🔽tena khalu punaḥ samayena dakṣiṇadigbhāgād ratnadhvajo nāma tathāgata āgatya yāvad vistareṇa padmakesare nyaṣīdat /
analyzed: arhān samyaksaṃbuddhaḥ  āgata āgatāḥ ca yathā prādurbhūteṣu padmāsaneṣu nyaṣeduḥ  tena khalu punar samayena dakṣiṇa digbhāgāt ratnadhvajaḥ nāma tathāgataḥ āgatya yāvat vistareṇa padma kesare nyaṣīdat
translated: the arhat, the perfectly enlightened one, was dwelling.🔽And those who had come sat down on the lotus seats that had appeared.🔽At that time, from the southern direction, a tathāgata named Ratnadhvaja came and sat down on a lotus seat, and so on in detail.

original: evam uttaradigbhāgād Kurumiya
analyzed: evam uttara digbhāgāt
translated: In the same way, from the northern direction, a tathāgata named Kurumidhvaja came and sat down on a lotus seat, and so on in detail.

original: dundubhisvaro nāma tathāgata āgatya padmakesare nyaṣīdat /
analyzed: dundubhisvaraḥ nāma tathāgataḥ āgatya padma kesare nyaṣīdat
translated: The Tathagata named Dundubhisvara came and sat on a lotus calyx.

original: akuśalasamavadhānānāṃ sarvakuśalarahitānāṃ sarvavidvatparivarjitānām ānantaryakāriṇāṃ

translated: those who are associated with unwholesome actions, those who are completely devoid of virtue, those who are completely abandoned by the wise, those who have committed the crimes with immediate retribution,

original: saddharmaparikṣepakānām āryāpavādakānām akṛpāśayānāṃ sattvānāṃ kāruṇyārthaṃ mahākṛpāvīryabalodyogena
analyzed: saddharma parikṣepakānām ārya apavādakānām a kṛpā āśayānām sattvānām kāruṇya artham mahā kṛpā vīrya bala udyogena
translated: those who have rejected the true Dharma, those who slander the noble ones, those beings who have merciless intentions, for the sake of compassion, with the exertion of great compassion, the strength of effort,

original: śītoṣṇavātātapapraśamanāya / / / / / / / / /
analyzed: śīta uṣṇa vāta ātapa praśamanāya
translated: for the sake of pacifying cold, heat, wind, and sun,

original: grāmanagaranigamajanapadarājadhānīṃ padbhyām upasaṃkramāmi /
analyzed: grāma nagara nigama janapada rājadhānīm padbhyām upasaṃkramāmi
translated: I go on foot to villages, towns, cities, countries, and the capital.

original: sattvahitārthaṃ cālparūkṣavirasaparamajugupsitaṃ pratikūlam āhāraṃ bhunajmi /
analyzed: sattva hita artham ca alpa rūkṣa virasa parama jugupsitam pratikūlam āhāram bhunajmi
translated: And for the sake of the welfare of beings, I eat food that is little, rough, tasteless, extremely disgusting, and disagreeable.

original: karpāsa /ṃgacīvarapāṃsukūlāni prāvṛṇomi /
analyzed: karpāsaṃga cīvara pāṃsu kūlāni prāvṛṇomi
translated: I wear cotton robes and rags.🔽 And I have attained the supreme state of peace, the supreme state of coolness, the supreme state of happiness, the supreme state of the ultimate.

original: parvatagirikandaravanaṣaṇḍa / / / / / / / rśaṃ śayyāsanaṃ paribhunajmi /
analyzed: parvata giri kandara vana ṣaṇḍa śayyā āsanam paribhunajmi
translated: I enjoy the bed and seat in mountain caves and forest groves.

original: upāyakauśalyamahākaruṇāvīryasaṃnāhasaṃnaddho 'haṃ sattvebhyo nānādyāṃ kathāṃ kathayāmi /
analyzed: upāya kauśalya mahā karuṇā vīrya saṃnāha saṃnaddhaḥ ham sattvebhyaḥ nānādyām kathām kathayāmi
translated: I am armed with the armor of skillful means, great compassion, and diligence. I tell various stories to beings.

original: kṣatṛyebhyo rājaiśvaryakathāṃ kathayāmi /
analyzed: kṣatṛyebhyaḥ rāja aiśvarya kathām kathayāmi
translated: To the kshatriyas I tell stories of royal sovereignty.

original: brāhmaṇebhyo vedanakṣatrakathāṃ kathayāmi /
analyzed: brāhmaṇebhyaḥ veda nakṣatra kathām kathayāmi
translated: To the Brahmins I tell stories of the Vedas and astrology.

original: amātyebhyo Kurumiya 🔽janapadakarmāntakathāṃ vaidyebhyo dhātvauṣadhisādhanakathāṃ vaṇigbhyaḥ krayavikrayakathāṃ
analyzed: amātyebhyaḥ kurumiya  janapada karmānta kathām vaidyebhyaḥ dhātvā oṣadhi sādhana kathām vaṇigbhyaḥ kraya vikraya kathām
translated: To the ministers I tell stories of the affairs of the Kurus and🔽other countries. To the physicians I tell stories of the preparation of medicinal substances. To the merchants I tell stories of buying and selling.

original: kuṭuṃbibhyaḥ karmāntābhiniveśakathāṃ strībhyo varṇālaṃkāraputraiśvaryāsapatnakathāṃ
analyzed: kuṭuṃbibhyaḥ karmānta abhiniveśa kathām strībhyaḥ varṇa alaṃkāra putra aiśvarya a sapatna kathām
translated: To the householders I tell stories of dedication to work. To the women I tell stories of complexion, ornaments, sons, sovereignty, and rivals.

original: śramaṇebhyaḥ kṣāntisauratyatrikarmābhiyuktāṃ kathāṃ kathayāmi /
analyzed: śramaṇebhyaḥ kṣānti sauratya trikarma abhiyuktām kathām kathayāmi
translated: To the ascetics I tell stories of being engaged in the three actions of patience, gentleness, and work.

original: sattvaparipākāyāprāptasya prāptaye niyunajmi /🔽anadhigatasyādhigamāya /
analyzed: sattva paripākāya a prāptasya prāptaye niyunajmi  anadhigatasya adhigamāya
translated: For the maturation of beings, I strive for the attainment of what has not been attained.🔽For the realization of what has not been realized.

original: asākṣātkṛtasya sākṣātkriyāyai /
analyzed: a sākṣātkṛtasya sākṣātkriyāyai
translated: For the direct realization of what has not been directly realized.

original: amuktānāṃ pramocanāya nānādyāni duḥkhāny utsahāmi /
analyzed: amuktānām pramocanāya nānādyāni duḥkhāni utsahāmi
translated: I endure various kinds of suffering for the liberation of the unliberated.

original: sattvaparipākāya janapadacaryāṃ carāmi //
analyzed: sattva paripākāya janapada caryām carāmi
translated: For the maturation of beings, I wander through the countryside.

original: atha ca punar ime sattvās tatra mām ākrośaṃti paribhāṣanti / / / / / / / / / / / / dharmeṇābhūtenābhyākhyānti /
analyzed: atha ca punar ime sattvāḥ tatra mām ākrośanti paribhāṣanti dharmeṇa abhūtena abhyākhyānti
translated: And yet, these beings there insult me, abuse me, revile me with false accusations,

original: kuhanalapanamāyāśāṭhyamṛṣāvādapāruṣyaiḥ strīvacanair abhyākhyānti /
analyzed: kuhana lapana māyā śāṭhya mṛṣāvāda pāruṣyaiḥ strī vacanaiḥ abhyākhyānti
translated: with flattery, gossip, deceit, dishonesty, lies, and harsh words like a woman's speech.

original: pāṃsubhir mām avakiraṃti /🔽śastraviṣāgnicakratomaraśarakhaḍgaśaktiparaśvadhaśilāyudhavṛṣṭibhir mama vadhāya parākramaṃti /
analyzed: pāṃsubhiḥ mām avakiranti  śastra viṣa agni cakra tomara śara khaḍga śakti paraśvadha śilā āyudha vṛṣṭibhiḥ mama vadhāya parākramaṃti
translated: They throw dust on me.🔽They attack me to kill me with showers of weapons, poison, fire, wheels, spears, arrows, swords, javelins, axes, and stones.

original: hastyāśīviṣasiṃhavyāghravṛṣamahiṣavṛkamahānagnāṃś ca madvadhāyotsṛjanti /
analyzed: hasti āśīviṣa siṃha vyāghra vṛṣa mahiṣa vṛka mahānagnān ca mad vadhāya utsṛjanti
translated: They set loose elephants, venomous snakes, lions, tigers, bulls, buffaloes, wolves, and huge pythons to kill me.

original: mamāvāsavihārakūṭāgārān āśucinā durgandhenāpūrayanti /
analyzed: mama āvāsa vihāra kūṭāgārān āśucinā durgandhena āpūrayanti
translated: They fill my dwelling places and monasteries with filth and foul smells.

original: macchrāvakāṇāṃ cāntarnagaram Kurumiya
analyzed: mad śrāvakāṇām ca antar nagaram
translated: And my disciples, having entered the inner city,

original: anupraviṣṭānām ime anāryāḥ sattvā anācāreṇa nṛtyagītenānuvicārinaḥ /
analyzed: anupraviṣṭānām ime anāryāḥ sattvāḥ anācāreṇa nṛtya gītena anuvicārinaḥ
translated: these uncivilized beings are intent on following with unseemly dancing and singing.

original: anekaiḥ śatasahasropāyair madvadhāyodyuktāḥ /
analyzed: anekaiḥ śata sahasra upāyaiḥ mad vadhāya udyuktāḥ
translated: They are intent on killing me with many hundreds of thousands of methods.

original: śāsanāntardhānāya ca dharmanetrīpradīpanirvāṇāya dharmadhvajaprapātanāya dharmanauprabhedāya maddharmayajñāvakiraṇāyodyuktāḥ //
analyzed: śāsana antardhānāya ca dharma netrī pradīpa nirvāṇāya dharma dhvaja prapātanāya dharma nau prabhedāya mad dharma yajña avakiraṇāya udyuktāḥ
translated: They are dedicated to the disappearance of the teachings, the extinguishing of the lamp of the Dharma's way, the falling of the banner of the Dharma, the breaking of the ship of the Dharma, and the scattering of my Dharma sacrifice.

original: tat khalv etarhi sarve buddhā bhagavantaḥ teṣāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ dharmanetrīṃ vyavalokayanti /
analyzed: tat khalu etarhi sarve buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ teṣām buddhānām bhagavatām dharma netrīm vyavalokayanti
translated: Now all the Blessed Buddhas are looking at the Dharma's way of those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones,

original: yathā tair buddhair bhagavadbhir asmiṃ kliṣṭe paṃcakaṣāye buddhakṣetre mahāsannipātaṃ
analyzed: yathā taiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ asmin kliṣṭe paṃca kaṣāye buddhakṣetre mahā sannipātam
translated: In order to make a great assembly in this afflicted buddha-field with the five degenerations,

original: kṛtvā saddharmanetrīcirasthityarthaṃ sarvamārabalaviṣayapramardanārthaṃ triratnavaṃśasthityanupacchedārthaṃ
analyzed: kṛtvā saddharma netrī cira sthiti artham sarva māra bala viṣaya pramardana artham triratna vaṃśa sthiti an upaccheda artham
translated: For the sake of the long duration of the way of the true Dharma, for the destruction of the power and domain of all Māras, for the establishment and non-disruption of the lineage of the Three Jewels,

original: sattvānāṃ kuśalamūlavardhanārthaṃ sarvāmitraparapravādisahadharmanigrahārthaṃ sattvānāṃ
analyzed: sattvānām kuśala mūla vardhana artham sarva amitra para pravādi sahadharma nigraha artham sattvānām
translated: For the increase of beings' roots of virtue, for the subjugation of all enemies, adversaries, and those who dispute the Dharma,

original: kalikalahadurbhikṣarogaparacakrabandhanavigrahavivādākālaśītoṣṇavātavṛṣṭivāyukāyavāṅmanodoṣakudṛṣṭipraśamanārthaṃ
analyzed: kali kalaha durbhikṣa roga para cakra bandhana vigraha vivāda akāla śīta uṣṇa vāta vṛṣṭi vāyu kāya vāc manaḥ doṣa kudṛṣṭi praśamana artham
translated: For the pacification of quarrels, disputes, famine, disease, foreign invasions, bondage, strife, arguments, untimely cold and hot weather, wind and rain, and the faults of body, speech, and mind, as well as bad views,

original: sarvadevanāgayakṣamanuṣyāmanuṣyāvarjanārthaṃ sarvagṛhagrāmanigamarāṣṭrarakṣaṇārthaṃ🔽sarvaśāṭhyaviṣakākhordamohanaduḥsvapnadurnimittavināśanārthaṃ Kurumiya
analyzed: sarva deva nāga yakṣa manuṣya amanuṣya āvarjana artham sarva gṛha grāma nigama rāṣṭra rakṣaṇa artham  sarva śāṭhya viṣaka ākhoḥ da mohana duḥsvapna durnimitta vināśana artham
translated: For the purpose of attracting all gods, nāgas, yakṣas, humans, and non-humans, for the protection of all houses, villages, towns, and countries,

original: sarvadhānyauṣadhiphalapuṣparasasattvopajīvyārthaṃ kṣatriyabrāhmaṇaviṭchūdrakuśalacaryāniyojanārthaṃ
analyzed: sarva dhānya oṣadhi phala puṣpa rasa sattva upajīvya artham kṣatriya brāhmaṇa viś śūdra kuśala caryā niyojana artham
translated: For the destruction of all deceit, poison, and the bewitching of evil dreams and bad omens, for the sake of all grains, herbs, fruits, flowers, juices, and the livelihood of beings, for the purpose of engaging the virtuous conduct of kṣatriyas, brahmins, vaiśyas, and śūdras,

original: bodhicittotpādanārthaṃ pāramitāvatāraṇārthaṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām upāyajñānakauśalyasmṛtimatigatiśauryapratibhānavivṛddhyartham
analyzed: bodhi citta utpādana artham pāramitā avatāraṇa artham bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām upāya jñāna kauśalya smṛti mati gati śaurya pratibhāna vivṛddhi artham
translated: For the generation of the mind of enlightenment, for the purpose of entering the perfections, for the increase of the skillful means, knowledge, mindfulness, wisdom, understanding, courage, and eloquence of the bodhisattvas, the great beings,

original: abhiṣekabhūmisamāśvāsāvatārajñānapāraṃgamārthaṃ taiḥ pūrvakais tathāgatair arhadbhiḥ
analyzed: abhiṣeka bhūmi samāśvāsa avatāra jñāna pāraṃgama artham taiḥ pūrvakaiḥ tathāgataiḥ arhadbhiḥ
translated: For the sake of the attainment of the stage of consecration, comfort, and entry into knowledge, by those past tathāgatas, arhats,

original: samyaksaṃbuddhair ayaṃ vajradharmasamatāpratītyadharmahṛdayasamucchrayavidhvaṃsanīdhāraṇīmudrāpadaprabhedapraveśavyākaraṇo
analyzed: samyaksaṃbuddhaiḥ ayam vajra dharma samatā pratītya dharma hṛdaya samucchraya vidhvaṃsanī dhāraṇī mudrā pada prabheda praveśa vyākaraṇaḥ
translated: perfectly enlightened buddhas, this dhāraṇī of the vajra-dharma-equality-dependent-dharma-womb-destruction-destroyer-seal-word-discrimination-entry-prediction

original: dharmaparyāyo bhāṣito 'dhiṣṭhito 'nyonyam anumoditaḥ /
analyzed: dharmaparyāyaḥ bhāṣitaḥ dhiṣṭhitaḥ nyonyam anumoditaḥ
translated: dharma discourse was spoken, empowered, and mutually rejoiced in.

original: te sādhv evam evaitarhi ye daśasu dikṣu buddhā bhagavantas tiṣṭhaṃto dhriyanto yāpayaṃta
analyzed: te sādhu evam eva etarhi ye daśasu dikṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tiṣṭhaṃtaḥ dhriyantaḥ yāpayanta
translated: Those good people who are now the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, in the ten directions, abiding, upholding, and sustaining

original: iha mama buddhakṣetre paṃcakaṣāye pṛcchāsamāgatāḥ sanniṣaṇṇāḥ sannipatitās te sarve
analyzed: iha mama buddhakṣetre paṃca kaṣāye pṛcchā samāgatāḥ sanniṣaṇṇāḥ sannipatitāḥ te sarve
translated: in this my Buddha-field, having come together and assembled in the five degenerations, all of them

original: 'sya buddhakṣetrasyārakṣāyai imaṃ vajradharmasamatāpratītyadharmahṛdayasamucchrayavidhvaṃsanīdhāraṇīmudrāpadaprabhedapraveśavyākaraṇaṃ
analyzed: sya buddhakṣetrasya ārakṣāyai imam vajra dharma samatā pratītya dharma hṛdaya samucchraya vidhvaṃsanī dhāraṇī mudrā pada prabheda praveśa vyākaraṇam
translated: for the protection of this Buddha-field, should teach this dharani called the Heart of the Dharma of Dependent Origination, the Equality of the Indestructible, the Destroyer of the Arising of Aggregates, the Analysis of the Seals and Words of the Dharma,

original: dharmaparyāyaṃ bhāṣadhvam adhitiṣṭhatānyonyaṃ bhāṣitam anumodadhvaṃ saddharmanetrīcirasthitaye
analyzed: dharmaparyāyam bhāṣadhvam adhitiṣṭhata anyonyam bhāṣitam anumodadhvam saddharma netrī cira sthitaye
translated: the Dharma discourse, which is established by you all, and which you should rejoice in, for the sake of the long duration of the path of the true Dharma,

original: sarvamāraviṣayabalapramardanārthaṃ yathā pūrvoktaṃ vistareṇa yāvad anāvaraṇajñānapāraṃgamārtham
analyzed: sarva māra viṣaya bala pramardana artham yathā pūrva uktam vistareṇa yāvat anāvaraṇa jñāna pāraṃgama artham
translated: for the sake of crushing the power of the entire domain of Mara, as was previously stated in detail, up to the sake of perfecting unobstructed knowledge,

original: anukaṃpāyai mamādhyeṣaṇāya yad iha buddhakṣetre saddharmanetrī ciraṃ tiṣṭhed anatikramaṇī
analyzed: anukaṃpāyai mama adhyeṣaṇāya yat iha buddhakṣetre saddharma netrī ciram tiṣṭhet an atikramaṇī
translated: out of compassion, and in response to my request, so that the path of the true Dharma may remain for a long time in this Buddha-field without being transgressed,

original: sarvaparapravādibhir avipralopadharmiṇī syāt /
analyzed: sarva para pravādibhiḥ a vipralopa dharmiṇī syāt
translated: and may not be subject to destruction by any opposing doctrines.

original: triratnavaṃśānupacchedanārthāya ca dharmarasaḥ sarvasattvopajīvyaḥ Kurumiya syāt /
analyzed: tri ratna vaṃśa an upacchedana arthāya ca dharma rasaḥ sarva sattva upajīvyaḥ syāt
translated: And for the sake of not cutting off the lineage of the Three Jewels, the nectar of the Dharma should be the sustenance of all beings.

original: atha te buddhā bhagavaṃta evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: atha te buddhāḥ bhagavaṃtaḥ evam āhuḥ
translated: Then those Buddha Bhagavans said this:

original: evam etad avaśyam evāsmābhir buddhakāryaṃ karaṇīyam /
analyzed: evam etat avaśyam eva asmābhiḥ buddha kāryam karaṇīyam
translated: This is so! We must definitely do the Buddha's work.

original: iha buddhakṣetre dharmanetrīm adhiṣṭhāsyāmaś cirasthitaye sarvamāraviṣayabalapramardanāya🔽yāvad anāvaraṇajñānapāraṃgamāya yad imaṃ vajradharmasamatāpratītyadharmahṛdayasamucchrayavidhvaṃsanīdhāraṇīmudrāpadaprabhedapraveśavyākaraṇaṃ
analyzed: iha buddhakṣetre dharma netrīm adhiṣṭhāsyāmaḥ cira sthitaye sarva māra viṣaya bala pramardanāya  yāvat anāvaraṇa jñāna pāraṃgamāya yat imam vajra dharma samatā pratītya dharma hṛdaya samucchraya vidhvaṃsanī dhāraṇī mudrā pada prabheda praveśa vyākaraṇam
translated: Here, in this Buddha-field, we will bless the Dharma method for long-lasting existence, to crush the power of all the domains of Mara,

original: dharmaparyāyaṃ bhāṣiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: dharmaparyāyam bhāṣiṣyāmaḥ
translated: up to attaining unobstructed knowledge. We will teach this Dharma discourse called 'The Heart of Dependent Origination, the Equality of the Indestructible Dharma, the Destruction of the Arising of the Dharani Seal Words, the Analysis of Entry and Elucidation.'

original: śṛṇvantu sarvasattvā ye kecid iha buddhakṣetre 'ntargatāḥ // tadyathā /

original: mṛdusukhasaṃsparśe siṃhāsane 'bhiruhyemān dhāraṇīṃ saṃprakāśayet /
analyzed: mṛdu sukha saṃsparśe siṃhāsane bhiḥ uhya imān dhāraṇīm saṃprakāśayet
translated: Having ascended a lion throne with a soft and pleasant touch, he should teach this dhāraṇī.

original: na cāsya kaścic cittasaṃkṣobhaṃ dhātusaṃkṣobhaṃ kāyasaṃkṣobhaṃ manaḥsaṃkṣobhaṃ vā kariṣyati /🔽na cāsya kaścit kāye śvāsaṃ mokṣyati /
analyzed: na ca asya kaścid citta saṃkṣobham dhātu saṃkṣobham kāya saṃkṣobham manaḥ saṃkṣobham vā kariṣyati  na ca asya kaścid kāye śvāsam mokṣyati
translated: No one will disturb his mind, disturb his elements, disturb his body, or disturb his thoughts.🔽No one will exhale on his body.

original: śīrṣarogaṃ ca kartuṃ śakṣyati /
analyzed: śīrṣa rogam ca kartum śakṣyati
translated: No one will be able to cause a headache.

original: nedaṃ sthānaṃ vidyate /🔽na kāyarogaṃ vā na jihvārogaṃ na dantarogaṃ nāsthirogaṃ na grīvārogaṃ na bāhurogaṃ
analyzed: na idam sthānam vidyate  na kāya rogam vā na jihvā rogam na danta rogam na asthi rogam na grīvā rogam na bāhu rogam
translated: There is no such possibility.🔽No one will be able to cause a disease of the body, tongue, teeth, bones, neck, arms,

original: na pṛṣṭhirogaṃ nāntrarogaṃ nodararogaṃ na śroṇīrogaṃ norurogaṃ na jaṃghārogaṃ kaścit kartuṃ śakṣyati /
analyzed: na pṛṣṭhi rogam na antra rogam na udara rogam na śroṇī rogam na ūru rogam na jaṃghā rogam kaścid kartum śakṣyati
translated: back, intestines, stomach, hips, thighs, or calves.

original: na cāsya svarasaṃkṣobho bhaviṣyati yaś Kurumiya
analyzed: na ca asya svara saṃkṣobhaḥ bhaviṣyati yaḥ
translated: He will not have a hoarse voice.

original: ca tasya dharmabhāṇakasya pūrvāśubhakarmaṇā dhātusaṃkṣobhaḥ svarasaṃkṣobho vā syāt tasyemān dhāraṇīṃ vācayataḥ sarvo niḥśeṣaṃ praśamiṣyati
analyzed: ca tasya dharma bhāṇakasya pūrva aśubha karmaṇā dhātu saṃkṣobhaḥ svara saṃkṣobhaḥ vā syāt tasya imān dhāraṇīm vācayataḥ sarvaḥ niḥśeṣam praśamiṣyati
translated: If that Dharma teacher has a disturbance of elements or a hoarse voice due to previous unwholesome actions, all of that will be completely pacified by reciting this dhāraṇī.

original: karmaparikṣayāt svastir bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: karma parikṣayāt svastiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: With the exhaustion of karma, he will be well.

original: ye 'pi tatra dhārmaśrāvaṇikāḥ sannipatiṣyaṃti teṣām api na kaścid dhātusaṃkṣobhaṃ kariṣyati svarasaṃkṣobhaṃ vā /
analyzed: ye pi tatra dhārmaśrāvaṇikāḥ sannipatiṣyanti teṣām api na kaścid dhātu saṃkṣobham kariṣyati svara saṃkṣobham vā
translated: And for those who will gather there to listen to the Dharma, no one will disturb their elements or their voices.

original: ye ca tatremān dhāraṇīṃ śroṣyaṃti teṣāṃ yad aśubhena karmaṇā dīrghagailānyaṃ dhātusaṃkṣobho vā svarasaṃkṣobho vā syāt tat sarvaṃ parikṣayaṃ
analyzed: ye ca tatra imān dhāraṇīm śroṣyaṃti teṣām yat aśubhena karmaṇā dhātu saṃkṣobhaḥ vā svara saṃkṣobhaḥ vā syāt tat sarvam parikṣayam
translated: And for those who will hear this dharani there, whatever unwholesome karma they have that would lead to long illness, disturbance of the elements, or disturbance of the voice, all that will be completely exhausted.

original: yāsyati //
analyzed: yāsyati
translated: It will be destroyed.

original: atha khalu candraprabhaḥ kumārabhūtaḥ yena te buddhā bhagavanto gaṃgānadīvālukāsamā bodhisattvaparivārās tenāṃjaliṃ praṇamyaivam āha /
analyzed: atha khalu candraprabhaḥ kumāra bhūtaḥ yena te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ gaṃgā nadī vālukā samāḥ bodhisattva parivārāḥ tena aṃjalim praṇamya evam āha
translated: Then the youthful moon Candraprabha, bowing with folded hands to those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, equal to the sands of the Ganges River, surrounded by Bodhisattvas, said this:

original: samanvāharantu me buddhā bhagavanto 'syāṃ dhāraṇyāṃ chandaṃ dadantu // tadyathā /
analyzed: samanvāharantu me buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ syām dhāraṇyām chandam dadantu tat yathā
translated: May the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, consider me and grant their consent to this dharani. It is as follows:

original: kṣante asamārope /
analyzed: kṣante a samārope
translated: Kshante asamarophe.

original: metre somavate /
analyzed: metre somavate
translated: Metre somavate.

translated: Ehi navakunjave navakunjave navakunjave.

translated: Mula-shodhane.

analyzed: vaḍhaka vaḍhaka
translated: Vadhaka vadhaka.

analyzed: māravatathatā pariccheda baḍhase baḍhase
translated: Mara-vathatatha-pariccheda badhase badhase.

analyzed: khaga sura tṛṇe snava sura tṛṇe bhūta koṭī
translated: In the bird's grass, in the Snasa's grass, in the Bhūtakoṭi, in the Kuru

original: pariccheda /🔽jalakha /🔽jalakha /
analyzed: pariccheda  jalakha  jalakha
translated: Chapter on Distinctions.🔽Water-hole.🔽Water-hole.

original: amama /

analyzed: saṃskārāṇām bodhisa
translated: Nyamana, Khyamana, Samudra, Mudra, Distinguishing the Formations, Bodhi, Kṣiti, Vima.

analyzed: ākāśa śvāsa paricchede svāhā
translated: Mahāvima, Bhūtakoṭi, Ākāśa, Śvāsa, Distinguishing, Svāhā.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena sarvabuddhakṣetrāntargatā bodhisattvā mahāsattvās te ca
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena sarva buddhakṣetra antargatāḥ bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ te ca
translated: Then at that time, the bodhisattva mahāsattvas dwelling in all the buddha-fields, and those

original: mahāśrāvakāḥ śakrabrahmalokapāladevanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragendrās
analyzed: mahāśrāvakāḥ śakra brahma lokapāla deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga indrāḥ
translated: great śrāvakas, Śakra, Brahmā, the world guardians, devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, lords,

original: te ca mahaujaskamahaujaskāḥ sattvāḥ sarve sādhukāraṃ pradaduḥ /
analyzed: te ca mahā ojaska mahā ojaskāḥ sattvāḥ sarve sādhukāram pradaduḥ
translated: and those beings of great splendor, all gave their approval.

original: te ca buddhā bhagavanta evam āhuḥ /
analyzed: te ca buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ evam āhuḥ
translated: And those Buddha-Bhagavāns said this:

original: mahābalavegavatī sarvaśatrunivāraṇī bateyaṃ dhāraṇī sarvabhayavyādhiduḥsvapnadurnimittamokṣaṇī yāvad anāvaraṇajñānamahāpuṇyajñānasamuccayānuttarajñānaniṣyandeyaṃ
analyzed: mahā bala vegavatī sarva śatru nivāraṇī bata iyam dhāraṇī sarva bhaya vyādhi duḥsvapna durnimitta mokṣaṇī yāvat anāvaraṇa jñāna mahā puṇya jñāna samuccaya anuttara jñāna nisyandā iyam
translated: This dhāraṇī is called The Great Strength and Energy, the Repeller of All Enemies, the Liberator from All Fears, Illnesses, Bad Dreams, and Bad Omens, up to the Accumulation of Unhindered Knowledge, Great Merit, and Wisdom, the Ineffable Essence of Supreme Knowledge.

original: dhāraṇī bhāṣitā //
analyzed: dhāraṇī bhāṣitā
translated: This dhāraṇī has been spoken.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena bhūteśvaro nāma mahābrahmā mahābrahmabalaviṣayavyūhādhiṣṭhānena strīrūpeṇa bhagavato 'mitāyuṣaḥ purato niṣasāda /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena bhūteśvaraḥ nāma mahābrahmā mahābrahma bala viṣaya vyūha adhiṣṭhānena strī rūpeṇa bhagavataḥ mita āyuṣaḥ puratas niṣasāda
translated: At that time, a great Brahmā named Bhūteśvara, by the power of the array of the domain of the great Brahmā's strength, in the form of a woman, sat in front of the Blessed One Amitāyus.

original: paramavarṇapuṣkalatayā samanvāgataḥ divyātikrāntaiḥ paramodārair vastrālaṃkāraiḥ puṣpagandhamālyavilepanaiś cābhyālaṃkṛtaḥ /
analyzed: parama varṇa puṣkala tayā samanvāgataḥ divya atikrāntaiḥ parama udāraiḥ vastra alaṃkāraiḥ puṣpa gandha mālya vilepanaiḥ ca abhyālaṃkṛtaḥ
translated: Endowed with supreme beauty and excellence, adorned with divine, surpassing, extremely magnificent garments, ornaments, flowers, perfumes, garlands, and ointments.

original: atha bhūteśvaro mahābrahmā utthāyāsanād aṃjaliṃ praṇāmyaivam āha /
analyzed: atha bhūteśvaraḥ mahābrahmā utthāya āsanāt aṃjalim praṇāmya evam āha
translated: Then the great Brahmā Bhūteśvara, rising from his seat, with palms joined, said this:

original: adhitiṣṭhantu me buddhā bhagavantaḥ svaramaṇḍalavāgvyāhāraviniścayanirdeśaṃ yad aham idaṃ kṛtsnaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ svareṇābhivijñapayeyaṃ /
analyzed: adhitiṣṭhantu me buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ svara maṇḍala vāc vyāhāra viniścaya nirdeśam yat aham idam kṛtsnam buddhakṣetram svareṇa abhivijñapayeyam
translated: May the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, empower me to teach the definitive expression of the arrangement of the sphere of sound and speech, so that I may make this entire Buddha-field resound with my voice.

original: na ca me 'tra kaścid vighno Kurumiya bhavet /
analyzed: na ca me kaścid bhavet
translated: And may there be no obstacle or impediment for me in this.

original: yāvad aham etarhi dharmabhāṇakānāṃ dhārmaśravaṇikānāṃ cārthe tādṛśīṃ mantrapadarakṣāṃ bhāṣeta /🔽yathā yaḥ kaścit paścime kāle māro vā māraparṣad vā devo vā nāgo va nāgī vā nāgamahallako
analyzed: yāvat aham etarhi dharma bhāṇakānām dhārmaśravaṇikānām ca arthe tādṛśīm mantra pada rakṣām bhāṣeta  yathā yaḥ kaścid paścime kāle māraḥ vā māra parṣad vā devaḥ vā nāgaḥ nāgī vā
translated: I will now speak such a mantra spell for the protection of Dharma teachers and Dharma listeners,🔽so that in the future, whether it be Māra, or a member of Māra’s retinue, or a god, or a nāga, or a nāginī, or a great nāga,

original: vā nāgamahallikā vā nāgapārṣado nāgapārṣadi vā nāgapotako vā nāgapotikā vā vistareṇa kartavyam /
analyzed: vā nāga mahallikā vā nāga pārṣadaḥ nāga pārṣadi vā nāga potakaḥ vā nāga potikā vā vistareṇa kartavyam
translated: or a great nāginī, or a nāga attendant, or a nāginī attendant, or a young nāga, or a young nāginī, and so on, extensively as before,

original: yāvat piśāco vā piśācī vā piśācamahallako vā piśācamahallikā vā piśācapārṣado piśācapārṣadi🔽vā piśācapotako vā piśācapotikā vā manuṣyo vā amanuṣyo vā dharmabhāṇakānāṃ dhārmaśravaṇikānāṃ
analyzed: yāvat piśācaḥ vā piśācī vā piśāca mahallakaḥ vā piśāca mahallikā vā piśāca pārṣadaḥ piśāca pārṣadi  vā piśāca potakaḥ vā piśāca potikā vā manuṣyaḥ vā amanuṣyaḥ vā dharmabhāṇakānām dhārmaśravaṇikānām
translated: up to a piśāca, or a piśācī, or a great piśāca, or a great piśācī, or a piśāca attendant, or a piśācī attendant,

original: vā avatāraprekṣī avatāragaveṣī pratyarthikaḥ pratyamitro vā upasaṃkrametāṃtaśo dharmabhāṇakānāṃ
analyzed: vā avatāra prekṣī avatāra gaveṣī pratyarthikaḥ pratyamitraḥ vā upasaṃkrameta aṃtaśas dharma bhāṇakānām
translated: or a young piśāca, or a young piśācī, or a human, or a non-human, who seeks an opportunity, who seeks an entrance, who is an adversary, or an enemy, should approach the Dharma teachers or Dharma listeners,

original: dhārmaśravaṇikānāṃ vā ekaromakūpam api viheṭhayed vihiṃsayed vipralopayed ojo vāharec
analyzed: dhārmaśravaṇikānām vā eka romakūpam api viheṭhayet vihiṃsayet vipralopayet ojaḥ vā āharet
translated: and at least disturb, harm, or destroy even a single hair on their bodies, or rob them of their vital energy,🔽or

original: chvāsaṃ vā kāye prakṣiped duṣṭacitto vā prekṣetāntaśaḥ ekakṣaṇam api teṣām ahaṃ mārāṇāṃ
analyzed: chvāsam vā kāye prakṣipet duṣṭa cittaḥ vā prekṣeta antaśas eka kṣaṇam api teṣām aham mārāṇām
translated: Or if I were to direct my breath towards their bodies, or if I were to look at them with an evil mind, even for a moment, I would create an obstacle for those Māras

original: yāvan manuṣyāmanuṣyāṇāṃ pratiṣedhaṃ daṇḍaparigrahaṃ vā kuryāṃ jambhanaṃ mohanaṃ śapathaṃ dadyāṃ /
analyzed: yāvat manuṣya amanuṣyāṇām pratiṣedham daṇḍa parigraham vā kuryām jambhanam mohanam śapatham dadyām
translated: up to humans and non-humans, or take up a punishment or curse of binding, stupefying, or deluding them.

original: adhitiṣṭhaṃtu me buddhā bhagavantaḥ svaramaṇḍalavāgvyāhāraṃ yad aham idaṃ kṛtsnaṃ buddhakṣetraṃ svareṇāpūrayeyaṃ /
analyzed: adhitiṣṭhantu me buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ svara maṇḍala vāc vyāhāram yat aham idam kṛtsnam buddhakṣetram svareṇa āpūrayeyam
translated: May the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, bless my voice, my speech, so that I may fill this entire Buddha-field with my voice.

original: kaś cātra me sāhayo bhaviṣyatīti //
analyzed: kaḥ ca atra me sāhayaḥ bhaviṣyati iti
translated: And who will be my companion here?

original: atha khalu te buddhā bhagavantas tūṣṇīṃbhāvenādhivāsayām āsuḥ /
analyzed: atha khalu te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tūṣṇīṃbhāvena adhivāsayām āsuḥ
translated: Then those Buddha-Bhagavāns assented by remaining silent.

original: tatra Kurumiya
analyzed: tatra
translated: There, in the Kuru country,

original: ca śikhindharo nāma śakraḥ jāṃbūnadamayena niṣkāvabhāsenālaṃkṛtakāyo nātidūre niṣaṇṇaḥ /
analyzed: ca śikhindharaḥ nāma śakraḥ jāṃbūnada mayena niṣka avabhāsena alaṃkṛta kāyaḥ na atidūre niṣaṇṇaḥ
translated: and Śikhin, the Śakra named Indhradhara, whose body was adorned with the radiance of gold from the Jambu river, was sitting not far away.

original: atha śikhindharaś śakro bhūteśvaraṃ brahmāṇam evam āha /
analyzed: atha śikhindharaḥ śakraḥ bhūteśvaram brahmāṇam evam āha
translated: Then Śikhin, the Śakra, said this to Bhūteśvara, the Brahmā:

original: mā bhaginy amitāyuṣas tathāgatasya purato niṣīdasva /
analyzed: mā bhagini amitāyuṣaḥ tathāgatasya puratas niṣīdasva
translated: Sister, do not sit in front of the Tathāgata Amitāyus.

original: mā bhaginy atra pramadyasva /
analyzed: mā bhagini atra pramadyasva
translated: Sister, do not be heedless here.

original: mā bhagavantaṃ viheṭhaya /
analyzed: mā bhagavantam viheṭhaya
translated: Do not trouble the Blessed One.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: prapaṃcābhiratā bālā niṣprapaṃcās tathāgatāḥ /
analyzed: prapaṃca abhiratāḥ bālāḥ niṣprapaṃcāḥ tathāgatāḥ
translated: The childish delight in conceptual proliferation, while the Tathāgatas are free from conceptual proliferation.

original: saṃskāraṃ darśayante cotpādavyavalakṣaṇam // /
analyzed: saṃskāram darśayante ca utpāda vyavalakṣaṇam
translated: They demonstrate the conditioned, with the characteristics of arising and ceasing.

original: sarvarūpākṣarapadaprabhedatathatānayaprāptas tathāgataḥ /
analyzed: sarva rūpa akṣara pada prabheda tathatā naya prāptaḥ tathāgataḥ
translated: The Tathāgata has attained the method of the suchness that distinguishes all forms, sounds, words, and categories.

original: na bhagini tathāgatas tathatāṃ virodhayaty ekasamatayā tathatayā /
analyzed: na bhagini tathāgataḥ tathatām virodhayati eka sama tayā tathatayā
translated: Sister, the Tathāgata does not contradict suchness, which is the sameness of the one suchness,

original: yadutākāśasamatayā /
analyzed: yat uta ākāśa sama tayā
translated: namely, the sameness of space.

original: ākāśam apy asamāropatṛsaṃskāravyayalakṣaṇaṃ /
analyzed: ākāśam api a samāropatṛ saṃskāra vyaya lakṣaṇam
translated: Space also has the characteristic of the cessation of conditioned things without superimposition.

original: yathākāśam akalpam avikalpaṃ saṃskāreṣu /
analyzed: yathākāśam a kalpam a vikalpam saṃskāreṣu
translated: Just as space is inconceivable and nonconceptual in conditioned things,

original: evam eva tathāgataḥ kāmaguṇān na prapaṃcayati na kalpayati na vikalpayati nādhitiṣṭhati nābhiniviśati /
analyzed: evam eva tathāgataḥ kāma guṇān na prapaṃcayati na kalpayati na vikalpayati na adhitiṣṭhati na abhiniviśati
translated: in the same way, the Tathāgata does not proliferate, conceptualize, discriminate, cling to, or become attached to the sense objects.

original: evaṃ na jīvaṃ na jantuṃ na poṣaṃ na pudgalaṃ na skandhadhātvāyatanāni prapaṃcayati nābhiniviśati nādhitiṣṭhati na kalpayati na vikalpayati
analyzed: evam na jīvam na jantum na poṣam na pudgalam na skandha dhātu āyatanāni prapaṃcayati na abhiniviśati na adhitiṣṭhati na kalpayati na vikalpayati
translated: In the same way, he does not proliferate or become attached to, cling to, conceptualize, or discriminate a living being, a creature, a person, a human, the aggregates, elements, or sense bases.

original: kathaṃ nāma tvaṃ bhagini tathāgatakāyaṃ prapaṃcayasi /
analyzed: katham nāma tvam bhagini tathāgata kāyam prapaṃcayasi
translated: Sister, how can you proliferate the Tathāgata's body?

original: amitāyus tathāgata āha /🔽samīkṣya devānām indra vācaṃ bhāṣasva /
analyzed: amita āyuḥ tathāgataḥ āha 🔽samīkṣya devānām indra vācam bhāṣasva
translated: The Tathāgata Amitāyus said,🔽Gautama, look and speak.

original: mā te syād dīrgharātram aniṣṭaṃ phalaṃ /
analyzed: mā te syāt dīrgharātram aniṣṭam phalam
translated: Let it not be that you will experience unpleasant results for a long time.

original: mahāsatpuruṣo hy eṣa bahubuddhakṛtādhikāro 'varopitakuśalamūlo buddhānāṃ bhagavatām antike /
analyzed: mahā sat puruṣaḥ hi eṣa bahu buddha kṛta adhikāraḥ varopita kuśala mūlaḥ buddhānām bhagavatām antike
translated: This is a great good man, who has served many Buddhas, planted wholesome roots in the presence of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones.

original: anena punaḥ satpuruṣeṇa tathāgatapūjākarmaṇe svalaṃkṛtastrīrūpam abhinirmitaṃ /
analyzed: anena punar sat puruṣeṇa tathāgata pūjā karmaṇe su alaṃkṛta strī rūpam abhinirmitam
translated: Moreover, this good man has manifested the form of a well-adorned woman in order to make offerings to the Tathagata.

original: mā tvam enaṃ strīvādena samudācare /
analyzed: mā tvam enam strī vādena samudācare
translated: Do not address him as a woman.

original: atha śikhindharaḥ śakro bhūteśvaraṃ brahmāṇam evam āha /
analyzed: atha śikhindharaḥ śakraḥ bhūteśvaram brahmāṇam evam āha
translated: Then Shakra, the lord of the gods, said to Brahma, the lord of beings:

original: kṣamasva kulaputra mamānukaṃpām upādāya /🔽mā cāham asyābhibhāṣitasyāniṣṭaṃ Kurumiya
analyzed: kṣamasva kula putra mama anukaṃpām upādāya  mā ca aham asya abhibhāṣitasya aniṣṭam
translated: Forgive me, son of good family, out of compassion.

original: phalaṃ prāpnuyām iti //
analyzed: phalam prāpnuyām iti
translated: And let me not experience unpleasant results from this speech.

original: atha kautūhaliko bodhisattva āha /
analyzed: atha kautūhalikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: Then the Bodhisattva Kautuhala said:

original: yadi bhagavañ chakreṇedaṃ vacanam apratideśitam abhaviṣyat kiyāṃś tasya phalvipākaḥ /
analyzed: yadi bhagavam śakreṇa idam vacanam a pratideśitam abhaviṣyat kiyān tasya phalvipākaḥ
translated: If, Blessed One, this statement had not been confessed by Shakra, what would have been the result of his action?

original: amitāyuṣas tathāgata āha /
analyzed: amita āyuṣaḥ tathāgataḥ āha
translated: The Tathagata Amitayus said:

original: yadi kulaputrānena na pratideśitam abhaviṣyac caturaśītir janmasahasrāṇi kāmagarbhaparibhūtastrībhāvaḥ parigṛhītaḥ syāt /
analyzed: yadi kula putra anena na pratideśitam abhaviṣyat caturaśītiḥ janma sahasrāṇi kāma garbha paribhūta strī bhāvaḥ parigṛhītaḥ syāt
translated: If, son of good family, this had not been confessed, he would have taken on the state of a woman, despised by the world, for eighty-four thousand births.

original: tasmāt tarhi rakṣitavyaṃ vākkarma /
analyzed: tasmāt tarhi rakṣitavyam vāc karma
translated: Therefore, then, one should guard one's verbal action.

original: pratibhātu te kulaputrādhiṣṭhitas tathāgataiḥ tava svaramaṇḍalavāgvyāhāraḥ //
analyzed: pratibhātu te kula putra adhiṣṭhitaḥ tathāgataiḥ tava svara maṇḍala vāc vyāhāraḥ
translated: May your voice, O son of noble family, be empowered by the Tathagatas, may your voice, your utterance, be empowered.

original: atha bhūteśvaro brahmā buddhādhiṣṭhānena prāṃjalir daśadiśo vyavalokyaivam āha /
analyzed: atha bhūteśvaraḥ brahmā buddha adhiṣṭhānena prāṃjaliḥ daśa diśaḥ vyavalokya evam āha
translated: Then Brahma Bhuteshvara, by the empowerment of the Buddha, with palms joined, looked at the ten directions and said this:

original: samanvāharaṃtu māṃ buddhā bhagavanto bodhisattvāś ca mahāsattvā mahāśrāvakāś ca devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragāś
analyzed: samanvāharaṃtu mām buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ bodhisattvāḥ ca mahāsattvāḥ mahāśrāvakāḥ ca deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoragāḥ
translated: May the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, the great disciples, the gods, nagas, yakshas, gandharvas, asuras, garudas, kinnaras, and mahoragas all think of me.

original: cātra cchandaṃ dadantu yasyāyam abhiprāyaḥ syād iyaṃ dharmanetrī cirasthitikā bhaved
analyzed: ca atra chandam dadantu yasya ayam abhiprāyaḥ syāt iyam dharma netrī cirasthitikā bhavet
translated: May they give their consent to this, with the intention that this Dharma method may remain for a long time,

original: dharmabhāṇakānāṃ dhārmaśrāvaṇikānāṃ ca pratipattiyuktānāṃ mā viheṭhā bhaved iti /
analyzed: dharma bhāṇakānām dhārmaśrāvaṇikānām ca pratipatti yuktānām mā viheṭhā bhavet iti
translated: and that there may be no harm to the Dharma teachers, the listeners of the Dharma, and those endowed with practice.

original: sa ca me cchandaṃ dadātu yat paścime kāle na mārā yāvan manuṣyāmanuṣyās teṣāṃ viheṭhāṃ kuryuḥ /
analyzed: sa ca me chandam dadātu yat paścime kāle na mārāḥ yāvat manuṣya amanuṣyāḥ teṣām viheṭhām kuryuḥ
translated: May he give his consent to me, so that in the future time Mara and others, up to humans and non-humans, may not cause harm to them.

original: atha sa bhūteśvaro brahmā teṣāṃ duṣṭacittānāṃ pratiṣedhanāya / / / / / /āya ca svaraśabdaṃ mumoca /
analyzed: atha sa bhūteśvaraḥ brahmā teṣām duṣṭa cittānām pratiṣedhanāya ca svara śabdam mumoca
translated: Then that Brahma Bhuteshvara, in order to prevent those with evil minds, and for the sake of protection, he let out a voice.

original: tena ca śabdena sarvām imāṃ lokadhātum āpūrayām āsa //
analyzed: tena ca śabdena sarvām imām lokadhātum āpūrayām āsa
translated: And that sound filled this entire world system.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena sarve brahmendrā ekakaṇṭhenaivam āhuḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena sarve brahma indrāḥ eka kaṇṭhena evam āhuḥ
translated: At that time, all the Brahma kings spoke with one voice, saying:

original: Kurumiya vayam api asyāṃ dhāraṇyāṃ chandaṃ dadāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam api asyām dhāraṇyām chandam dadāmaḥ
translated: We too will give our consent to this Dharani.

original: svayaṃ ca paścime kāle imān dhāraṇīṃ dhārayiṣyāmaḥ prakāśayiṣyāmaḥ saddharmaṃ rakṣiṣyāmas tāṃś ca dharmabhāṇākān dhārmaśrāvaṇikāṃś ca pratipattiyuktān
analyzed: svayam ca paścime kāle imān dhāraṇīm dhārayiṣyāmaḥ prakāśayiṣyāmaḥ saddharmam rakṣiṣyāmaḥ tān ca dharma bhāṇākān dhārmaśrāvaṇikān ca pratipatti yuktān
translated: And in the future, we will uphold this Dharani, proclaim the true Dharma, and protect those who expound the Dharma and listen to the Dharma with the practice of realization.

original: rakṣiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: rakṣiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will protect them.

original: vada tvaṃ satpuruṣa /
analyzed: vada tvam sat puruṣa
translated: Speak, good man.

original: vayaṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānāṃ ca mahāśrāvakānām ca purato 'syān dhāraṇyāṃ chandaṃ dadāmaḥ //
analyzed: vayam buddhānām bhagavatām bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām ca mahāśrāvakānām ca puratas syān dhāraṇyām chandam dadāmaḥ
translated: We give our consent to this Dharani in the presence of the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, the Bodhisattvas, the Great Beings, and the Great Disciples.

original: atha khalu bhūteśvaro brahmā evam āha /
analyzed: atha khalu bhūteśvaraḥ brahmā evam āha
translated: Then the Brahma God Lord of Beings said this:

analyzed: hāre caṇḍe mahācaṇḍe came mahācame some sthāme
translated: in the garland, in the fierce, in the greatly fierce, in the Chame, in the Mahachame, in the Soma, in the Sthame.

original: abaha vibaha /
analyzed: abaha vibaha
translated: In the Abah, in the Vibah.

analyzed: aṃgajā netrakhave mūla paricchede yakṣacaṇḍe piśācacaṇḍe āvartani saṃvartani saṃkāraṇi jaṃbhani mohani  ucchāṭani hamaha
translated: The one who causes uprooting, the one who causes trembling.

analyzed: maha maha maha ākuṃcane  khaga śava  amala
translated: The one who causes contraction, the one who causes trembling.🔽The one who has the speed of a bird, the one who is stainless.

analyzed: svāhā
