translated: Then all those Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, and the bodhisattva mahāsattvas dwelling in that Buddha-field,

original: śakrabrahmalokapālā devanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragendrā ye ca mahaujaskamahaujaskāḥ
analyzed: śakra brahma lokapālāḥ deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga indrāḥ ye ca mahā ojaska mahā ojaskāḥ
translated: Śakra, Brahmā, the Lokapālas, the lords of gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas, and those of great power and splendor,🔽[said:]

original: sattvā ye ca cāturdvīpikāyāṃ lokadhātau nevāsikās tān sarvān āmantryaivam āha /
analyzed: sattvāḥ ye ca cāturdvīpikāyām lokadhātau nevāsikāḥ tān sarvān āmantrya evam āha
translated: And all the beings who are residents in the four-continent world system, having addressed them all, he said this:

original: yuṣmākaṃ mārṣā haste bhūyiṣṭhataram imāṃ saddharmanetrīm adhiṣṭhāya parindāmaḥ sarvasattvaparipākārthaṃ /
analyzed: yuṣmākam mārṣāḥ haste bhūyiṣṭhataram imām saddharma netrīm adhiṣṭhāya parindāmaḥ sarva sattva paripāka artham
translated: O friends, we entrust to you this Dharma method, having empowered it with the most excellent, for the sake of ripening all beings.

original: tathā yuṣmābhir iyaṃ saddharmanetrī manasikartavyā ujjvālayitavyā rakṣitavyā yathā na kṣipram ihāyaṃ saddharmaḥ pralujyeta nāntardhāyeta /
analyzed: tathā yuṣmābhiḥ iyam saddharma netrī manasi kartavyā ujjvālayitavyā rakṣitavyā yathā na kṣipram iha ayam saddharmaḥ pralujyeta na antardhāyeta
translated: In that way, you should keep this Dharma method in mind, make it shine, and protect it, so that this true Dharma does not quickly disappear or vanish here.

original: ye ca śraddhāḥ kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca imāṃ mahāsannipātadharmaparyāyaṃ dhārayiṣyaṃti yāval likhitvā bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikāḥ Kurumiya
analyzed: ye ca śraddhāḥ kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca imām mahā sannipāta dharmaparyāyam dhārayiṣyaṃti yāvat likhitvā bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ
translated: And those faithful sons and daughters of good family who will uphold this Dharma discourse of the Great Assembly, up to those who write it down, the monks, nuns, male and female lay followers,

original: saddharmadhārakāḥ pudgalās tān sarvān yuṣmākaṃ haste nyāyataḥ parindāmaḥ ārakṣaparipālanatāyai /
analyzed: saddharma dhārakāḥ pudgalāḥ tān sarvān yuṣmākam haste nyāyataḥ parindāmaḥ ārakṣa paripālana tāyai
translated: the upholders of the true Dharma, all of them we entrust to you in the right way, for the sake of protection and preservation.

original: dharmabhāṇakāḥ pudgalā dharmakāmā dhyānābhiratā dharmaśravaṇikāḥ saddharmadhārakāḥ yuṣmābhi rakṣitavyāḥ yāvat paripālayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: dharma bhāṇakāḥ pudgalāḥ dharma kāmāḥ dhyāna abhiratāḥ dharma śravaṇikāḥ saddharma dhārakāḥ yuṣmābhiḥ rakṣitavyāḥ yāvat paripālayitavyāḥ
translated: The individuals who are Dharma teachers, who desire the Dharma, who delight in meditation, who listen to the Dharma, who uphold the true Dharma, should be protected by you, up to being guarded.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: What is the reason for that?

original: yeha te bhūtās tathāgatā arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ sarvais tais tathāgataiḥ kliṣṭe
analyzed: yā iha te bhūtāḥ tathāgatāḥ arhantaḥ samyaksaṃbuddhāḥ sarvaiḥ taiḥ tathāgataiḥ kliṣṭe
translated: Those past Tathāgatas, Arhats, Perfectly Awakened Ones, all those Tathāgatas, having assembled in a defiled

original: paṃcakaṣāye buddhakṣetre sannipatya sarveṣāṃ śakrabrahmalokapālānāṃ haste iyaṃ dharmanetrī
analyzed: paṃcakaṣāye buddhakṣetre sannipatya sarveṣām śakra brahma lokapālānām haste iyam dharma netrī
translated: buddha-field with five degenerations, entrusted this Dharma method to the hands of all the Śakras, Brahmās, and Lokapālas,

original: parīttārakṣāyai anantardhānāya saddharmadhārakapudgalārakṣāyai yāvat sarvasattvaparipākāya /
analyzed: parītta ārakṣāyai an antardhānāya saddharma dhāraka pudgala ārakṣāyai yāvat sarva sattva paripākāya
translated: for the protection of the little, for the non-disappearance, for the protection of the individuals who uphold the true Dharma, and so on, up to the complete maturation of all beings.

original: evam eva ye bhaviṣyanty anāgate 'dhvani daśasu dikṣu buddhā bhagavantaḥ te 'pi sarve
analyzed: evam eva ye bhaviṣyanti anāgate dhvani daśasu dikṣu buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ te sarve
translated: In the same way, those Blessed Buddhas who will be in the future in the ten directions, they all

original: kliṣṭeṣu paṃcakaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu kṣaṇāt sannipatya sattvahitārtham etāni dhāraṇīmantrapadāni bhāṣiṣyaṃte /
analyzed: kliṣṭeṣu paṃca kaṣāyeṣu buddhakṣetreṣu kṣaṇāt sannipatya sattva hita artham etāni dhāraṇī mantra padāni bhāṣiṣyaṃte
translated: will quickly assemble in defiled buddha-fields with five degenerations, and for the benefit of beings they will proclaim these dhāraṇī-mantra words and

original: imāṃ ca dharmanetrīm adhiṣṭhāsyaṃte /
analyzed: imām ca dharmanetrīm adhiṣṭhāsyaṃte
translated: will consecrate this Dharma method.

original: sarveṣāṃ śakrabrahmalokapālānāṃ haste imāṃ dharmanetrīm anuparindīṣyaṃti rakṣāparipālanārthaṃ /
analyzed: sarveṣām śakra brahma lokapālānām haste imām dharmanetrīm anuparindīṣyaṃti rakṣā paripālana artham
translated: They will entrust this Dharma method to the hands of all the Śakras, Brahmās, and Lokapālas, for the sake of protection and preservation.

original: tathā vayam apy etarhi yuṣmākam iha buddhakṣetranivāsināṃ cāturdvīpikānivāsināṃ ca
analyzed: tathā vayam api etarhi yuṣmākam iha buddhakṣetra nivāsinām cāturdvīpikā nivāsinām ca
translated: In the same way, we also now, to you who dwell in this buddha-field and in the four continents,🔽and to all the beings who dwell in the four continents,

original: śakrabrahmalokapāladevanāgayakṣagandharvāsuragaruḍakinnaramahoragendrāṇāṃ haste bhūyiṣṭhataram
analyzed: śakra brahma lokapāla deva nāga yakṣa gandharva asura garuḍa kinnara mahoraga indrāṇām haste bhūyiṣṭhataram
translated: We entrust it most of all to the hands of the lords of the Śakras, Brahmās, Lokapālas, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas,

original: anuparindāmaḥ ārakṣāyai sattvaparipākārthaṃ /
analyzed: anuparindāmaḥ ārakṣāyai sattva paripāka artham
translated: in order to protect and develop beings.

original: tathā yuṣmābhir iyaṃ saddharmanetrī Kurumiya
analyzed: tathā yuṣmābhiḥ iyam saddharma netrī
translated: In this way, you should keep this method of the true Dharma in mind,

original: manasikartavyā projjvālayitavyā yathā na kṣipram eva pralujyeta nāntardhāyeta /
analyzed: manasi kartavyā projjvālayitavyā yathā na kṣipram eva pralujyeta na antardhāyeta
translated: and kindle it so that it does not quickly disappear or vanish.

original: ye ca śraddhāḥ kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca saddharmadhārakāś ca pudgalā bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikā
analyzed: ye ca śraddhāḥ kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca saddharma dhārakāḥ ca pudgalāḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikā
translated: And those faithful sons and daughters of good family, and those individuals who uphold the true Dharma, the monks, nuns, laymen and laywomen,

original: ya imaṃ mahāsannipātaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ dhārayaṃti yāvat pustakalikhitam api kṛtvā
analyzed: ye imam mahā sannipātam dharmaparyāyam dhārayaṃti yāvat pustaka likhitam api kṛtvā
translated: who uphold this Dharma discourse of the Great Assembly, up to those who write it down in book form and uphold it,

original: dhārayanti dharmabhāṇakā dhārmaśravaṇikā dhyānayuktāḥ saddharmadhārakā yuṣmābhis
analyzed: dhārayanti dharma bhāṇakāḥ dhārmaśravaṇikāḥ dhyāna yuktāḥ saddharma dhārakāḥ yuṣmābhiḥ
translated: the Dharma teachers, the listeners of the Dharma, those who are devoted to meditation, the upholders of the true Dharma, you should

original: te rakṣitavyāḥ pūjayitavyāḥ /
analyzed: te rakṣitavyāḥ pūjayitavyāḥ
translated: protect and honor them.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: sarvabuddhādhiṣṭhito 'yaṃ dharmaparyāyaḥ /
analyzed: sarva buddha dhiṣṭhitaḥ yam dharmaparyāyaḥ
translated: This Dharma discourse is blessed by all the Buddhas.

original: yatra kvacid grāme vā nagare vā nigame vā janapade vā karvaṭe vā rājakule vāraṇyāyatane🔽vā yāvat kuṭumbikagṛhe vāyaṃ dharmaparyāyaḥ pracaret prakāśyetoddiśyeta paryavāpyeta
analyzed: yatra kvacid grāme vā nagare vā nigame vā janapade vā karvaṭe vā rāja kule vā araṇi āyatane  vā yāvat kuṭumbika gṛhe vā ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ pracaret prakāśyeta uddiśyeta paryavāpyeta
translated: Wherever, in a village, town, city, country, capital, or forest dwelling,🔽up to a householder's home, this Dharma discourse would be practiced, taught, recited,

original: vāntaśaḥ pustakalikhitam api kṛtvā dhāryeta tena dharmarasena pṛthivīrasasattvaujāṃsi vivardhiṣyanti /
analyzed: vā antaśas pustaka likhitam api kṛtvā dhāryeta tena dharma rasena pṛthivī rasa sattva ojāṃsi vivardhiṣyanti
translated: or even written down in a book and preserved, by that elixir of Dharma the vital essence of the earth's essence will increase.

original: tena yūyam ojovantas tejobalavīryaparākramavanto bhaviṣyaṃti /
analyzed: tena yūyam ojovantaḥ tejaḥ bala vīrya parākramavantaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: By that you will be full of vigor, with splendor, strength, energy, and prowess.

original: parivāravimānavṛddhiś ca yuṣmākaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: parivāra vimāna vṛddhiḥ ca yuṣmākam bhaviṣyati
translated: You will have an increase in retinue and celestial palaces.

original: manuṣyarājā apy ārakṣitā bhaviṣyaṃti /🔽rājaiśvaryeṇa te vivardhiṣyanti /
analyzed: manuṣya rājāḥ api ārakṣitāḥ bhaviṣyanti  rāja aiśvaryeṇa te vivardhiṣyanti
translated: Even human kings will be protected.🔽They will increase in royal power and sovereignty.

original: sarvarāṣṭraṃ ca teṣām ārakṣitaṃ bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sarva rāṣṭram ca teṣām ārakṣitam bhaviṣyati
translated: Their entire kingdom will be protected.

original: tena ca dharmarasena santarpitā jaṃbudvīparājānaḥ parasparahitacittā bhaviṣyaṃti /
analyzed: tena ca dharma rasena santarpitāḥ jaṃbudvīpa rājānaḥ paraspara hita cittāḥ bhaviṣyaṃti
translated: The kings of Jambudvīpa, satisfied by that elixir of Dharma, will have thoughts of mutual benefit.

original: karmavipākaṃ śraddadhāsyaṃti kuśalacittā bhaviṣyanty amatsaracittā hitavastucittā sarvasattvadayācittāḥ yāvat samyagdṛṣṭikā rājāno bhaviṣyanti
analyzed: karma vipākam śraddadhāsyaṃti kuśala cittāḥ bhaviṣyanti amatsara cittāḥ hita vastu cittā sarva sattva dayā cittāḥ yāvat samyak dṛṣṭikāḥ rājānaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will have faith in the ripening of karma, have wholesome thoughts, be free from stinginess, have thoughts of beneficial things, thoughts of compassion for all beings, up to having right views.

original: pratipratisvaviṣaye 'bhiraṃsyante /
analyzed: prati prati sva viṣaye
translated: They will delight in their own respective kingdoms.

original: Kurumiya ayaṃ ca jaṃbudvīpaḥ sphīta udārajanākīrṇo bhaviṣyati subhikṣataro ramaṇīyataraś ca bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: ayam ca jaṃbudvīpaḥ sphītaḥ udāra jana ākīrṇaḥ bhaviṣyati subhikṣataraḥ ramaṇīyataraḥ ca bhaviṣyati
translated: And this Jambudvīpa will be prosperous, filled with a great many people, more abundant in food, and more delightful.

original: bahujanamanuṣyākīrṇā ojovati ca pṛthivī bhaviṣyati snigdhatarāṇi ca mṛṣṭataraphalāni ca patrauṣadhidhanadhānyasamṛddhatarā cārogyasukhasparśavihārasaṃjananī
analyzed: bahu jana manuṣya ākīrṇā ojovati ca pṛthivī bhaviṣyati snigdhatarāṇi ca mṛṣṭatara phalāni ca patra oṣadhi dhana dhānya samṛddhatarā ca ārogya sukha sparśa vihāra saṃjananī
translated: The earth will be full of many people and will be full of vitality. The crops, vegetables, herbs, wealth, grain, and fruits will be more tender, more delicious, and more abundant. It will generate health, happiness, and pleasant experiences.

original: ca bhaviṣyati /🔽sarvakalikalahadurbhikṣarogaparacakradaṃśamaśakaśalabhāśīviṣaduṣṭayakṣarākṣasamṛgapakṣivṛkākālavātavṛṣṭayaḥ praśamiṣyanti /
analyzed: ca bhaviṣyati  sarva kali kalaha durbhikṣa roga para cakra daṃśa maśaka śalabha āśīviṣa duṣṭa yakṣa rākṣasa mṛga pakṣi vṛka akāla vāta vṛṣṭayaḥ praśamiṣyanti
translated: It will be so.🔽All quarrels, fights, famines, diseases, invasions by foreign powers, mosquitoes, gadflies, locusts, poisonous snakes, evil yakṣas, rākṣasas, animals, birds, wolves, untimely winds, and untimely rains will be pacified.

original: samyaṅnakṣatrarātridivasamāsārdhamāsartusaṃvatsarāṇi pravahiṣyaṃti /
analyzed: samyak nakṣatra rātri divasa māsa ardha māsa ṛtu saṃvatsarāṇi pravahiṣyanti
translated: The constellations, nights, days, months, fortnights, seasons, and years will proceed correctly.

original: sattvāś ca prāyo daśakuśalakarmapathacāriṇo bhaviṣyaṃti /
analyzed: sattvāḥ ca prāyas daśa kuśala karma patha cāriṇaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: And beings will mostly practice the ten wholesome paths of action.

original: itaś cyutāḥ sugatisvargagāmino bhaviṣyaṃti /
analyzed: itas cyutāḥ sugati svarga gāminaḥ bhaviṣyanti
translated: Having passed away from here, they will go to the happy destinies and the heavens.

original: te 'pi yuṣmatparivāro bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: te pi yuṣmad parivāraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: They will also become your retinue.

original: evaṃ bahuguṇamahānuśaṃso 'yaṃ dhāraṇīdharmaparyāyaḥ /
analyzed: evam bahuguṇa mahā anuśaṃsaḥ yam dhāraṇī dharmaparyāyaḥ
translated: Thus, this dhāraṇī Dharma discourse has many good qualities and great benefits.

original: sarvabuddhādhiṣṭhito mahāsannipātaḥ sattvānāṃ saṃskārapāraṃgamāya yaśovivṛddhipāripūryai
analyzed: sarva buddha dhiṣṭhitaḥ mahā sannipātaḥ sattvānām saṃskāra pāraṃgamāya yaśaḥ vivṛddhi pāripūryai
translated: It is blessed by all the Buddhas, a great assembly, for beings to perfect their conditioning, for the increase and fulfillment of fame,

original: bhaviṣyati niravaśeṣamātṛgrāmabhāvaparikṣayāyopapattivedanīyo 'paraparyāyavedanīyaḥ
analyzed: bhaviṣyati niravaśeṣa mātṛgrāma bhāva parikṣayāya upapatti vedanīyaḥ para paryāya vedanīyaḥ
translated: for the complete exhaustion of the female state that is to be experienced in this life or in subsequent lives,

original: saṃkṣepād Kurumiya
analyzed: saṃkṣepāt
translated: in brief, Kuruṃiya

original: dṛṣṭadharmavedanīyo 'pi so mātṛgrāmātmabhāvaḥ ākṣiptaḥ sa sarvaḥ parikṣayaṃ yāsyati sthāpyānantaryakāriṇaṃ saddharmapratikṣepakaṃ vāryāpavādakaṃ 🔽vā /
analyzed: dṛṣṭa dharma vedanīyaḥ pi saḥ mātṛgrāma ātmabhāvaḥ ākṣiptaḥ sa sarvaḥ parikṣayam yāsyati sthāpya ānantarya kāriṇam saddharma pratikṣepakam vārya apavādakam  vā
translated: Even that female state that is to be experienced in this very life, all of it will be completely exhausted, except for one who has committed an immediate [evil], one who has rejected the true Dharma, or one who has slandered the noble ones.

original: yad anyat kāyavāṅmanaḥphalavipākadauṣṭhulyaṃ tat sarvaṃ parikṣayaṃ yāsyati /
analyzed: yat anyat kāya vāc manaḥ phala vipāka dauṣṭhulyam tat sarvam parikṣayam yāsyati
translated: Whatever other unpleasant results of body, speech, and mind there are, all of that will be completely exhausted.

original: ya imaṃ dharmaparyāyam antaśaḥ pustakalikhitam api kṛtvā dhārayiṣyati tasya sumerumātrāṇi karmakleśāvaraṇāni parikṣayaṃ yāsyaṃti /
analyzed: yaḥ imam dharmaparyāyam antaśas pustaka likhitam api kṛtvā dhārayiṣyati tasya sumeru mātrāṇi karma kleśa āvaraṇāni parikṣayam yāsyanti
translated: Whoever, having written out this Dharma discourse in book form, would keep it, their karmic afflictions and obscurations, as great as Mount Sumeru, will be completely exhausted.

original: sarvakuśalamūlāraṃbaṇāni ca vivṛddhiṃ pāripūriṃ yāsyaṃti /
analyzed: sarva kuśala mūla āraṃbaṇāni ca vivṛddhim pāripūrim yāsyaṃti
translated: And all the bases of their roots of virtue will increase and be fulfilled.

original: sarvāṃgapāripūriḥ sarvābhiprāyasaṃpattiḥ sarvāṇi kāyavāṅmanaḥsucaritāni vivardhiṣyaṃti /
analyzed: sarva aṃga pāripūriḥ sarva abhiprāya saṃpattiḥ sarvāṇi kāya vāc manaḥ su caritāni vivardhiṣyaṃti
translated: All their bodily, verbal, and mental good actions will increase.

original: sarvakudṛṣṭiprahāṇaṃ sarvaśatrusahadharmanigrahaḥ sarvasūkṣmaśāntamārgāvatāro bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: sarva kudṛṣṭi prahāṇam sarva śatru sahadharma nigrahaḥ sarva sūkṣma śānta mārga avatāraḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: All their bad views will be abandoned, all their enemies will be subdued through the Dharma, and they will enter all the subtle peaceful paths.

original: asya sarvabuddhādhiṣṭhitasya mahāsannipātadhāraṇīdharmaparyāyasya prabhāvena //
analyzed: asya sarva buddha dhiṣṭhitasya mahā sannipāta dhāraṇī dharmaparyāyasya prabhāvena
translated: By the power of this great assembly dhāraṇī Dharma discourse, which is blessed by all the Buddhas.

original: yatra ca viṣaye punar ayaṃ dhāraṇīdharmaparyāyaḥ🔽pracariṣyati tatra sā pṛthivī snigdhatarā bhaviṣyati /🔽ojovatī mṛṣṭaphalarasā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: yatra ca viṣaye punar ayam dhāraṇī dharma paryāyaḥ  pracariṣyati tatra sā pṛthivī snigdhatarā bhaviṣyati  ojovatī mṛṣṭa phala rasā bhaviṣyati
translated: And in whatever realm this dhāraṇī Dharma discourse🔽is practiced, there the earth will become more moist.🔽It will be full of vitality and have delicious fruits and juices.

original: tiktakaṭukaparuṣavirasaparivarjitā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: tikta kaṭuka paruṣa virasa parivarjitā bhaviṣyati
translated: It will be free from bitter, pungent, rough, and tasteless things.

original: puṣpaphalasamṛddhatarā dhanadhānyakośakoṣṭhāgārakuṃbhakalaśavṛddhir bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: puṣpa phala samṛddhatarā dhana dhānya kośa koṣṭhāgāra kuṃbha kalaśa vṛddhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: There will be an abundance of flowers and fruits, an increase in wealth, grain, treasuries, granaries, jars, and vases.

original: vastrānnapānauṣadhopakaraṇabhūyiṣṭhatarāḥ ye ca tatrānnapānopajīvinaḥ sattvās te
analyzed: vastra anna pāna auṣadha upakaraṇa bhūyiṣṭhatarāḥ ye ca tatra anna pāna upajīvinaḥ sattvāḥ te
translated: Those beings who depend on food and drink there will have an abundance of clothing, food, drink, medicine, and utensils.

original: 'rogatarā bhaviṣyaṃti varṇavanto balavantaḥ smṛtivantaḥ prajñāvanto dharmakāmāḥ kuśalaparyeṣṭyabhiratāḥ pāpaparivarjitāḥ /
analyzed: rogatarāḥ bhaviṣyanti varṇavantaḥ balavantaḥ smṛtivantaḥ prajñāvantaḥ dharma kāmāḥ kuśala paryeṣṭi abhiratāḥ pāpa parivarjitāḥ
translated: They will be healthier, more beautiful, stronger, more mindful, wiser, desirous of the Dharma, devoted to seeking virtue, and free from evil.

original: te tataś cyavitvā yuṣmākaṃ sahabhāvyatayopapatsyaṃte /
analyzed: te tatas cyavitvā yuṣmākam sahabhāvya tayā upapatsyaṃte
translated: Having passed away from there, they will be reborn in your company.

original: Kurumiya tayā yūyaṃ parivāravṛddhyā balavanto 'pratihatacakrā dharmabalena cāturvarṇyaṃ janakāyaṃ paripālayiṣyata /
analyzed: tayā yūyam parivāra vṛddhyā balavantaḥ pratihata cakrāḥ dharma balena cāturvarṇyam jana kāyam paripālayiṣyata
translated: By that increase in your retinue, you will be strong, with an invincible wheel, and will protect the people of the four castes with the power of the Dharma.

original: sattvān dharmārtheṣu niyokṣyata /
analyzed: sattvān dharma artheṣu niyokṣyata
translated: You will engage beings in the aims of the Dharma.

original: evaṃ yuṣmābhiḥ sarvatryadhvānugatānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati //
analyzed: evam yuṣmābhiḥ sarva tri adhva anugatānām buddhānām bhagavatām pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati
translated: In this way, you will have made offerings to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who are followed throughout the three times.

original: atha khalu māndāravagandharocas tathāgato viśuddhena buddhaviṣayajñānasvaraghoṣeṇārthapadavyāhārānurūpeṇa
analyzed: atha khalu māndāravagandharocaḥ tathāgataḥ viśuddhena buddha viṣaya jñāna svara ghoṣeṇa artha pada vyāhāra anurūpeṇa
translated: Then the Tathāgata Manda-ra-va-gandha-roca, with a pure voice that is the knowledge and sound of the Buddha's domain, in a way that accords with the expression of meaning and words,

original: kṛtsnam idaṃ buddhakṣetram āpūrya sarve ca bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ śakrendrā yāvad
analyzed: kṛtsnam idam buddhakṣetram āpūrya sarve ca bodhisattvāḥ mahāsattvāḥ śakra indrāḥ yāvat
translated: and all the Bodhisattva-Mahasattvas, the Shakra Indras, up to

original: brahmendrā mahoragendrā ye ceha buddhakṣetre nivāsino bhūyiṣṭhataram asyāṃ cāturdvīpikāyāṃ🔽nivāsinaḥ sarvabuddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ vacanena cāsya mahāsannipātasūtrasya dharmanetryā
analyzed: brahma indrāḥ mahoraga indrāḥ ye ca iha buddhakṣetre nivāsinaḥ bhūyiṣṭhataram asyām cāturdvīpikāyām  nivāsinaḥ sarva buddhānām bhagavatām vacanena ca asya mahā sannipāta sūtrasya dharma netryā
translated: the Brahma Indras, the great serpent lords, and those who dwell in this Buddha-field, mostly dwelling in this four-continent world-system,

original: dhāraṇāya prakāśanāya rakṣaṇāyotsāhayām āsa //
analyzed: dhāraṇāya prakāśanāya rakṣaṇāya utsāhayām āsa
translated: all of them, by the word of all the Blessed Buddhas, were exhorted to encourage the upholding, teaching, and protecting of this Dharma method of the Great Collection Sutra.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena maitreyapūrvaṃgamāṇāṃ saptanavatikoṭīsahasrāṇi kṣāntipratilabdhānāṃ
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena maitreya pūrvaṃgamāṇām saptanavati koṭī sahasrāṇi kṣānti pratilabdhānām
translated: Then at that time, the seventy-nine koṭi-s of bodhisattva-mahāsattva-s headed by Maitreya, who had attained forbearance,

original: bodhisattvānāṃ mahāsattvānām iha buddhakṣetre nivāsīni tāni sarvāṇy ekakaṇṭhenaivam āhuḥ /
analyzed: bodhisattvānām mahāsattvānām iha buddhakṣetre nivāsīni tāni sarvāṇi eka kaṇṭhena evam āhuḥ
translated: and all those who dwelt in this Buddha-field, they all spoke with one voice, saying:

original: vayam api sarvabuddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ vacanena sarvanetryadhvānugatānāṃ tathāgatānāṃ pūjārtham imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ nyāyataḥ śāstṛsaṃmataṃ gurugauraveṇa
analyzed: vayam api sarva buddhānām bhagavatām vacanena sarva netrī adhva anugatānām tathāgatānām pūjā artham imam dharmaparyāyam nyāyataḥ śāstṛ saṃmatam guru gauraveṇa  /
translated: We too, by the word of all the Blessed Buddhas, for the sake of worshipping all the Tathāgata-s who have gone, are going, and will go in the three times, accept this Dharma discourse in accordance with justice, as esteemed by the Teacher, with reverence for the Guru,

original: pratigṛhṇīmaḥ /
analyzed: pratigṛhṇīmaḥ
translated: we accept it.

original: kāruṇyena sattvaparipākārthaṃ yāvad anuttare mārge pratiṣṭhāpanārthaṃ vayam imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ grāmanagaranigamajanapadarājadhānyaraṇyāyataneṣu 🔽vistareṇoddyotayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: kāruṇyena sattva paripāka artham yāvat anuttare mārge pratiṣṭhāpana artham vayam imam dharmaparyāyam grāma nagara nigama janapada rājadhānī araṇya āyataneṣu  vistareṇa uddyotayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Out of compassion, for the sake of ripening beings, up to establishing them in the unsurpassed path, we will illuminate this Dharma discourse extensively in villages, towns, cities, countries, capitals, and forests,

original: sattvāṃś ca paripācayiṣyāmaḥ saddharmacirasthityarthaṃ /
analyzed: sattvān ca paripācayiṣyāmaḥ saddharma cira sthiti artham
translated: and we will ripen beings for the sake of the long duration of the true Dharma.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena sarve buddhā bhagavantas tadbuddhakṣetrāntargatāḥ sādhukāraṃ pradaduḥ /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena sarve buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ tad buddhakṣetra antargatāḥ sādhukāram pradaduḥ
translated: Then at that time all the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who had entered that Buddha-field, gave their approval:

original: sādhu sādhu satpuruṣā evaṃ yuṣmābhiḥ karaṇīyam //
analyzed: sādhu sādhu sat puruṣāḥ evam yuṣmābhiḥ karaṇīyam
translated: Good, good, O good men! You should do just as you have said.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: kuru-mi

original: atha khalu sarve śakrabrahmamahoragendrā ye caiha buddhakṣetre 'parāṇi catuḥṣaṣṭikoṭīnayutāni mahaujaskamahaujaskānāṃ sattvānāṃ te sarve ekakaṇṭhenaivam
analyzed: atha khalu sarve śakra brahma mahā uraga indrāḥ ye ca eha buddhakṣetre parāṇi catuḥṣaṣṭi koṭī nayutāni mahā ojaska mahā ojaskānām sattvānām te sarve eka kaṇṭhena evam
translated: Then indeed all the Śakras, Brahmās, and lords of the mahoragas, and those other sixty-four quintillion extremely powerful beings in this Buddha-field, they all with one voice

original: āhuḥ /
analyzed: āhuḥ
translated: said this:

original: vayam apīmaṃ mahāsannipātaṃ dharmaparyāyam udgṛhīṣyāmo yāvad vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyāmaḥ samuddyotayiṣyāmaḥ sattvāṃś ca paripācayiṣyāmaḥ saddharmacirasthityarthaṃ
analyzed: vayam api imam mahā sannipātam dharmaparyāyam udgṛhīṣyāmaḥ yāvat vistareṇa saṃprakāśayiṣyāmaḥ samuddyotayiṣyāmaḥ sattvān ca paripācayiṣyāmaḥ saddharma cira sthiti artham
translated: We too will uphold this Dharma discourse of the Great Assembly, and we will teach it extensively and illuminate it, and we will ripen beings, for the sake of the long endurance of the true Dharma.

original: saddharmadhārakān dhārmaśravaṇikāṃś ca rakṣiṣyāmaḥ paripālayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: saddharma dhārakān dhārmaśravaṇikān ca rakṣiṣyāmaḥ paripālayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will protect and care for the upholders of the true Dharma and those who listen to the Dharma.

original: yatra cāyaṃ dharmaparyāyaḥ pracariṣyati tatra vayaṃ sarvabuddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ vacanena
analyzed: yatra ca ayam dharmaparyāyaḥ pracariṣyati tatra vayam sarva buddhānām bhagavatām vacanena
translated: And wherever this Dharma discourse is practiced, there we will, by the word of all the Blessed Buddhas,

original: sarvakalikalahavigrahavivādadurbhikṣarogaparacakrākālavātavṛṣṭiśītoṣṇāni duṣṭarūkṣaparuṣavirasatiktakaṭukabhāvān praśamayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: sarva kali kalaha vigraha vivāda durbhikṣa roga para cakra akāla vāta vṛṣṭi śīta uṣṇāni duṣṭa rūkṣa paruṣa virasa tikta kaṭuka bhāvān praśamayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: pacify all quarrels, disputes, battles, famines, diseases, invasions by foreign powers, untimely storms and rains, cold and heat, and the conditions of impurity, roughness, harshness, flavorlessness, bitterness, and pungency.

original: kṣemaramaṇīyatāṃ subhikṣasāmagrīṃ saṃpādayiṣyāmaḥ /🔽saddharmanetrīcirasthityartham udyogam āpatsyāmaḥ /
analyzed: kṣema ramaṇīya tām subhikṣa sāmagrīm saṃpādayiṣyāmaḥ  saddharma netrī cira sthiti artham udyogam āpatsyāmaḥ
translated: We will bring about security, peace, happiness, and abundance of food.🔽For the sake of the long endurance of the lineage of the true Dharma, we will strive.

original: bhūyasyā mātrayā dhārmikān rājñaḥ paripālayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: bhūyasyā mātrayā dhārmikān rājñaḥ paripālayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will even more thoroughly protect righteous kings.

original: dhyānābhiratāṃś ca sattvān rakṣiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: dhyāna abhiratān ca sattvān rakṣiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will guard those beings who delight in meditation.

original: atha sarve te buddhā bhagavantaḥ sādhukāraṃ pradaduḥ /
analyzed: atha sarve te buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ sādhukāram pradaduḥ
translated: Then all those Blessed Buddhas gave their approval.

original: sādhu sādhu bhadramukhā evaṃ yuṣmābhiḥ karaṇīyaṃ /
analyzed: sādhu sādhu bhadra mukhāḥ evam yuṣmābhiḥ karaṇīyam
translated: Good, good, O you with good faces! You should act in this way.

original: ātmobhayaparārtham udyogam āpattavyaṃ /
analyzed: ātma ubhaya para artham udyogam āpattavyam
translated: You should strive for the benefit of both self and others.

original: evaṃ ca yuṣmābhis tryadhvānugatānāṃ buddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: evam ca yuṣmābhiḥ tri adhva anugatānām buddhānām bhagavatām pūjā kṛtā bhaviṣyati
translated: In this way, you will have made offerings to the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, who have gone in the three times.

original: yatra hi nāma yūyaṃ sattvaparipākārthaṃ saddharmanetryujjvālanārthaṃ saddharmacirasthityartham udyuktā na cireṇa yūyaṃ kṣipram anuttarāṃ samyaksaṃodhim
analyzed: yatra hi nāma yūyam sattva paripāka artham saddharma netrī ujjvālana artham saddharma cira sthiti artham udyuktāḥ na cireṇa yūyam kṣipram anuttarām samyaksaṃodhim
translated: For, indeed, you are striving for the sake of ripening beings, for the sake of kindling the torch of the true Dharma, for the sake of the long duration of the true Dharma. Before long, you will quickly attain

original: abhisaṃbhotsyata //🔽atha khalu ye 'syāṃ madhyamāyāṃ cāturdvīpikāyāṃ nivāsinaḥ śakrabrahmadevendrā mahoragendrā ye ca mahaujaskamahaujaskāḥ sattvās te sarve Kurumiya
analyzed: abhisaṃbhotsyata  atha khalu ye syām madhyamāyām cāturdvīpikāyām nivāsinaḥ śakra brahma deva indrāḥ mahoraga indrāḥ ye ca mahā ojaska mahā ojaskāḥ sattvāḥ te sarve
translated: the highest complete enlightenment.

original: utthāyāsanāt prāṃjalayaḥ sthitvaivam āhuḥ /
analyzed: utthāya āsanāt prāṃjalayaḥ sthitvā evam āhuḥ
translated: Then, indeed, all those who dwell in this central four-continent world-system, the Śakras, Brahmās, Lords of the Gods, Great Nāga Lords, and those beings of great power and great influence, all of them, having risen from their seats, with palms joined, stood thus and said:

original: vayam api sarvabuddhānāṃ bhagavatāṃ vacanenemāṃ saddharmanetrīm uddyotayiṣyāmaḥ rakṣiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: vayam api sarva buddhānām bhagavatām vacanena imām saddharma netrīm uddyotayiṣyāmaḥ rakṣiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We too, by the word of all the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, will illuminate this torch of the true Dharma, we will protect it.

original: imaṃ ca mahāsannipātaṃ sarvabuddhādhiṣṭhitaṃ dhāraṇīmudrādharpaparyāyaṃ nyāyataḥ
analyzed: imam ca mahā sannipātam sarva buddha dhiṣṭhitam dhāraṇī mudrā dharpa paryāyam nyāyataḥ
translated: And we will properly receive this Great Collection, which is empowered by all the Buddhas, this Dhāraṇī-Mudrā-Dharma-Gate,

original: pratigrahīṣyāmaḥ yāvad grāmanagaranigamajanapadarājadhānyaraṇyāyataneṣu vistareṇa
analyzed: pratigrahīṣyāmaḥ yāvat grāma nagara nigama janapada rājadhānī araṇya āyataneṣu vistareṇa
translated: and we will extensively teach it in villages, towns, cities, countries, capitals, and forests,

original: samprakāśayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: samprakāśayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: as far as we can.

original: saddharmadhārakāṃś ca pudgalān rakṣiṣyāmaḥ paripālayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: saddharma dhārakān ca pudgalān rakṣiṣyāmaḥ paripālayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: And we will protect and guard the people who uphold the true Dharma.

original: ye ca dharmapratipattisthitā dharmabhāṇakā dhārmaśravaṇikā bhikṣubhikṣuṇyupāsakopāsikāḥ
analyzed: ye ca dharma pratipatti sthitāḥ dharma bhāṇakāḥ dhārmaśravaṇikāḥ bhikṣu bhikṣuṇī upāsaka upāsikāḥ
translated: And those Dharma teachers and Dharma listeners who abide in the practice of the Dharma, the monks, nuns, laymen, and laywomen,

original: śraddhāḥ kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitarāś ca imaṃ dharmaparyāyam udgrahīṣyaṃti yāvat pustakalikhitam
analyzed: śraddhāḥ kula putrāḥ kula duhitarāḥ ca imam dharmaparyāyam udgrahīṣyaṃti yāvat pustaka likhitam
translated: the faithful sons and daughters of good family who will uphold this Dharma teaching, as far as writing it down in book form

original: api kṛtvā dhārayiṣyaṃti dhyānābhiyuktāḥ tāṃ vayaṃ sarvān rakṣiṣyāmaḥ paripālayiṣyāmaḥ
analyzed: api kṛtvā dhārayiṣyaṃti dhyāna abhiyuktāḥ tām vayam sarvān rakṣiṣyāmaḥ paripālayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: and keeping it, those who are devoted to meditation, we will all protect and guard them,

original: satkariṣyāmo gurukariṣyāmo mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ cīvaracchatradhvajapatākāvilepanair
analyzed: satkariṣyāmaḥ gurukariṣyāmaḥ mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ cīvara chatra dhvaja patākā vilepanaiḥ
translated: we will honor them, revere them, respect them, and make offerings to them with robes, parasols, banners, flags, ointments,

original: yāvat sarvabhaiṣajyapariṣkāraiḥ satkariṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yāvat sarva bhaiṣajya pariṣkāraiḥ satkariṣyāmaḥ
translated: as far as all medicinal supplies and necessities, we will honor them.🔽And we will also protect and guard those who listen to this Dharma teaching, those who write it down, those who have it written, those who keep it, those who read it, those who recite it, those who understand it, and those who practice it in accordance with the teaching, and we will also honor them.

original: asya ca dharmaparyāyasya bhāṣyamāṇasya prakāśyamānasya vayaṃ svayam upasaṃkramiṣyāmaḥ śravaṇāya /
analyzed: asya ca dharmaparyāyasya bhāṣyamāṇasya prakāśyamānasya vayam svayam upasaṃkramiṣyāmaḥ śravaṇāya
translated: We will personally go to listen to this Dharma teaching being taught and explained.

original: śāstṛsaṃjñayā vayam imaṃ dharmaparyāyaṃ satkariṣyāmo gurukariṣyāmo mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ chatradhvajapatākābhiḥ /
analyzed: śāstṛ saṃjñayā vayam imam dharmaparyāyam satkariṣyāmaḥ gurukariṣyāmaḥ mānayiṣyāmaḥ pūjayiṣyāmaḥ chatra dhvaja patākābhiḥ
translated: With the perception of a teacher, we will honor, revere, respect, and venerate this Dharma teaching with parasols, banners, and flags.

original: tat kasya hetoḥ /
analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: asmin vayaṃ sarvabuddhādhiṣṭhite dhāraṇīmudrādharmaparyāye prakāśyamāne dharmarasenaujovanto bhaviṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: asmin vayam sarva buddha dhiṣṭhite dhāraṇī mudrā dharmaparyāye prakāśyamāne dharma rasena ojovantaḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ
translated: When this dhāraṇī-seal-like Dharma teaching, blessed by all the Buddhas, is being taught, we will be vigorous with the essence of the Dharma.

original: balavanto vīryavantaḥ smṛtimanto jñānavantaḥ pakṣaparivāravantaḥ apratihatacakraparākramā bhaviṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: balavantaḥ vīryavantaḥ smṛtimantaḥ jñānavantaḥ pakṣa parivāravantaḥ a pratihata cakra parākramāḥ bhaviṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will be strong, energetic, mindful, wise, with a retinue, and our wheel of conquest will be unimpeded.

original: evaṃ Kurumiya 🔽vayaṃ sarvaviṣaye sarvāṃ kalikalahavigrahavivādadurbhikṣarogaparacakrākālavātavṛṣṭiśītoṣṇānāvrṣṭiduḥsvapnadurnimittaduṣṭarūkṣaparuṣatiktakaṭukavirasākuśalapakṣakarān
analyzed: evam  vayam sarva viṣaye sarvām kali kalaha vigraha vivāda durbhikṣa roga para cakra akāla vāta vṛṣṭi śīta uṣṇa anāvrṣṭi duḥsvapna durnimitta duṣṭa rūkṣa paruṣa tikta kaṭuka virasa akuśala pakṣa karān
translated: Thus have I heard...🔽We will pacify all quarrels, disputes, wars, famines, diseases, invasions by foreign powers, untimely winds, rains, cold, heat, droughts, bad dreams, bad omens, and unwholesome factors in all our realms.

original: bhāvān praśamayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: bhāvān praśamayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will pacify all these things that cause harm, roughness, harshness, bitterness, acrimony, and unpalatability.

original: bhūyasyā mātrayā kṣemasubhikṣānnaramaṇīyārogyasāmagrīṃ saṃpādayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: bhūyasyā mātrayā kṣema subhikṣa anna ramaṇīya ārogya sāmagrīm saṃpādayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will bring about an abundance of peace, prosperity, food, and health.

original: kālena vātavṛṣṭiśītoṣṇaughān āvāhayiṣyāmaḥ /🔽samyag rātridivasamāsārdhamāsartusaṃvatsarān āvāhayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: kālena vāta vṛṣṭi śīta uṣṇa oghān āvāhayiṣyāmaḥ  samyak rātri divasa māsa ardha māsa ṛtu saṃvatsarān āvāhayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: In a timely manner, we will bring forth winds, rains, cold, and heat.🔽We will bring forth the proper order of nights, days, months, fortnights, seasons, and years.

original: samyag grahanakṣatrasūryacandramasa āvāhyiṣāmaḥ /
analyzed: samyak graha nakṣatra sūrya candramasaḥ āvāhyiṣāmaḥ
translated: We will bring forth the proper order of the planets, constellations, sun, and moon.

original: nadyutsasarastaḍākapuṣkariṇīḥ prapūrayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: nadī utsa saraḥ taḍāka puṣkariṇīḥ prapūrayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will fill rivers, springs, lakes, ponds, and lotus pools.

original: yatra sattvānām udakaughena pīḍā bhaviṣyati tad vayaṃ pratinivārayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: yatra sattvānām udaka oghena pīḍā bhaviṣyati tat vayam pratinivārayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: Wherever beings are afflicted by floods of water, we will stop them.

original: bhūyasyā mātrayā vayaṃ teṣu grāmanagaranigamajanapadeṣu sattvahitārthaṃ pattraśākhāpuṣpaphalakandadhānyauṣadhasasyāni snigdhamṛṣṭavarṇarasamahatprabhūtatarāṇi 🔽niṣpādayiṣyāmaḥ /
analyzed: bhūyasyā mātrayā vayam teṣu grāma nagara nigama janapadeṣu sattva hita artham pattra śākhā puṣpa phala kanda dhānya auṣadha sasyāni snigdha mṛṣṭa varṇa rasa mahat prabhūtatarāṇi  niṣpādayiṣyāmaḥ
translated: We will produce leaves, branches, flowers, fruits, roots, grains, and crops that are more abundant, smooth, glossy, colorful, and flavorful in those villages, towns, markets, and countries for the benefit of beings.

original: dhanadhānyauṣadhavastrābharaṇaiḥ sattvānām avaikalyaṃ saṃpādayiṣyāmaḥ /

translated: And for those beings who seek virtue, in those houses, cities, towns, countries, and capitals where this Dharma discourse, the dhāraṇī-seal, which is blessed by all the Buddhas, is taught, even if only written down in a book🔽and kept,

original: evam eva ye kecid ahitakāmāḥ /

translated: Here, all the Blessed Buddhas gave their approval.

original: sarve ca bodhisattvā mahāsattvāḥ manuṣyāmanuṣyā devāś ca sādhukāraṃ pradaduḥ /

translated: And all the Bodhisattva Mahasattvas, humans, non-humans, and gods gave their approval.

original: atha tāvad eva tasyāṃ velāyām akaṃpad vasumatī cakṣubhur jaladharāḥ cakaṃpire śailarājanaḥ /
analyzed: atha tāvat eva tasyām velāyām akaṃpat vasumatī cakṣubhuḥ jaladharāḥ cakaṃpire śailarājanaḥ
translated: Then at that very moment, the earth trembled, the clouds shook, and the king of mountains trembled.

original: cakṣobha tatra sa māraḥ saparivāraḥ sthāpya devakaṭapūtanāṃ bodhisattvāṃś ca kṣāntipratilabdhān //
analyzed: cakṣobha tatra sa māraḥ sa parivāraḥ sthāpya devakaṭapūtanām bodhisattvān ca kṣānti pratilabdhān
translated: There Māra, together with his retinue, was agitated, except for Devakūṭa and Pūtanā, the Bodhisattvas who had attained patience.

original: atha khalu māraḥ pāpīmāṃ dṛḍhamatiṃ bodhisattvam āmantrayati sma /
analyzed: atha khalu māraḥ pāpi imām dṛḍhamatim bodhisattvam āmantrayati sma
translated: Then the evil Māra addressed the Bodhisattva Dṛḍhamati, saying:

original: kulaputra kuto 'syāgastino mārasya balaṃ /
analyzed: kula putra kutas sya agastinaḥ mārasya balam
translated: Son of good family, from where does this Māra Agastya have power?

original: kutaḥ prabhāvaḥ /
analyzed: kutas prabhāvaḥ
translated: From where does he have influence?

original: yad anenākṛpeṇa sarvaḥ svapakṣo mama ca viṣayabalaparākramaḥ sarvo vidhūta / / / / / / / / nā / / / pamocchedavādinaḥ śramaṇasya gautamasya pakṣaḥ samucchrepitaḥ
analyzed: yat anena a kṛpeṇa sarvaḥ sva pakṣaḥ mama ca viṣaya bala parākramaḥ sarvaḥ
translated: This merciless one has destroyed all my followers and my power and valor in the realm, and has raised up the faction of the ascetic Gautama, who advocates the annihilation of all...

original: ahaṃ ca sahaśravaṇād evāsyā dhāraṇyā durgandhaklinnakāyo 'karmaṇyaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ /
analyzed: aham ca saha śravaṇāt eva asyāḥ dhāraṇyāḥ durgandha klinna kāyaḥ karmaṇyaḥ saṃvṛttaḥ
translated: And as soon as I heard this dhāraṇī, my body became foul-smelling, moist, and unserviceable.

original: sarvadiśo me 'ndhīkṛtāḥ adarśanābhāsā /
analyzed: sarva diśaḥ me adarśana ābhāsā
translated: All directions have been blinded for me, appearing as if invisible.

original: mahāparidāghena ca dahyāmi /
analyzed: mahā paridāghena ca dahyāmi
translated: And I am burning with great anguish.

original: dṛḍhamatir bodhisattva āha /
analyzed: dṛḍhamatiḥ bodhisattvaḥ āha
translated: The bodhisattva Dṛḍhamati said:

original: sarvabuddhānāṃ bhagavatām adhiṣṭhānena pāpīmaṃ sarvamanuṣyāmanuṣyāṇāṃ ca balādhānenāgastī māraḥ imaṃ sarvamārabalaviṣayaparākramaṃ vidhvaṃsayati🔽imāni cānenāparājitāni Kurumiya
analyzed: sarva buddhānām bhagavatām adhiṣṭhānena pāpī imam sarva manuṣya amanuṣyāṇām ca bala ādhānena agastī māraḥ imam sarva māra bala viṣaya parākramam vidhvaṃsayati  imāni ca anena aparājitāni
translated: By the blessing of all the Blessed Buddhas and by the empowerment of all humans and non-humans, the evil Māra destroys this entire power and domain of Māra.

original: mantrapadāni bhāṣitāni /🔽prasādaya tvaṃ pāpīmaṃs tathāgatānām antike cittam utpādayasva cānuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittaṃ yathā tvam ebhyaḥ kāyavāṅmānasebhyo duḥkhebhyaḥ
analyzed: mantra padāni bhāṣitāni  prasādaya tvam pāpīman tathāgatānām antike cittam utpādayasva ca anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam yathā tvam ebhyaḥ kāya vāc mānasebhyaḥ duḥkhebhyaḥ
translated: And he has spoken these unconquerable Kuru-mīya mantra words.🔽Have faith, evil one, in the Tathāgatas, and arouse the mind for supreme perfect enlightenment, so that you will be liberated from these sufferings of body, speech, and mind.

original: parimokṣyasi /
analyzed: parimokṣyasi
translated: And so that you will be liberated from all the sufferings of the hells, animal realms, and the world of Yama.

original: māraḥ pāpīmān āha /
analyzed: māraḥ pāpīmān āha
translated: Māra, the evil one, said:

original: utsahāmy aham aparāntakoṭyo 'saṃkhyeyāḥ ataḥ pāpiṣṭatarāṇi kāyavāṅmanoduḥkhāni na tv evāham anuttarāyāṃ samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayāmi //
analyzed: utsahāmi aham saṃkhyeyāḥ atas pāpiṣṭatarāṇi kāya vāc manaḥ duḥkhāni na tu eva aham anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādayāmi
translated: I am able to endure even more painful bodily, verbal, and mental sufferings for countless eons in the future, but I still will not arouse the mind of supreme perfect enlightenment.

original: mahāsannipātān mahāyānasūtrād ratnaketuparivartād ekadaśamaḥ saddharmanetryārakṣaṇaparivartaḥ samāptāḥ //
analyzed: mahā sannipātāt mahāyāna sūtrāt ratnaketu parivartāt eka daśamaḥ saddharma netrī ārakṣaṇa parivartaḥ samāptāḥ
translated: From the Great Collection of the Mahāyāna Sūtras, the chapter on Ratnaketu, the eleventh chapter on protecting the eye of the true Dharma is completed.

original: Kurumiya XII /
analyzed: kurumiya xiii
translated: Kuruṃiya XII.

original: athāṭavako mahāyakṣasenāpatir bhīṣaṇakayakṣarūpeṇa saṃjñiko mṛgarūpeṇa jñānolko markaṭarūpeṇa
analyzed: atha āṭavakaḥ mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ bhīṣaṇaka yakṣa rūpeṇa saṃjñikaḥ mṛga rūpeṇa jñāna ulkaḥ markaṭa rūpeṇa
translated: Then the great yakṣa general Aṭavaka in a terrifying yakṣa form, Saṃjñika in a deer form, Jñānolkā in a monkey form,

translated: Tṛṣṇājha in a goat form, and Chhinnastrota in an elephant form, these five great beings of Śākyamuni,

analyzed: tathāgatasya na atidūre kauṇḍinya arciṣaḥ tathāgatasya puratas punar niṣaṇṇāḥ abhūvan
translated: not too far from the Tathāgata, in front of the Tathāgata Kauṇḍinyarcī, were seated again.

original: sarvakāyāc caiṣāṃ viśuddhā saugandhikā prabhā niścacāra /
analyzed: sarva kāyāt ca eṣām viśuddhā saugandhikā prabhā niścacāra
translated: And from all their bodies, pure fragrant light shone forth.

original: atha te paṃcamahāsattvā ubhābhyāṃ pāṇibhyāṃ jyotiṣprabhaṃ nāma mahāmaṇiratnaṃ bhagavataḥ pūjākarmāya dadhrire //
analyzed: atha te paṃca mahāsattvāḥ ubhābhyām pāṇibhyām jyotiṣprabham nāma mahā maṇi ratnam bhagavataḥ pūjā karmāya dadhrire
translated: Then those five great beings, with both hands, held up a great jewel called Jyotis-prabha for the sake of worshipping the Blessed One.

original: atha kautūhaliko bodhisattvo mahāsattvaḥ yoniśas teṣām āśayaviśuddhim avekṣya bodhisattvā hy ete mahāsattvā iti tam āṭavakaṃ mahāyakṣasenāpatim
analyzed: atha kautūhalikaḥ bodhisattvaḥ mahāsattvaḥ yoniśas teṣām āśaya viśuddhim avekṣya bodhisattvāḥ hi ete mahāsattvāḥ iti tam āṭavakam mahā yakṣa senāpatim
translated: Then the bodhisattva mahāsattva Kautūhalika, having examined their pure intentions, said to the great yakṣa general Āṭavika, These are bodhisattva mahāsattvas.

original: āmaṃtryovāca /
analyzed: āmaṃtrya uvāca
translated: He addressed him, saying:

translated: In the past, noble ones, ninety-one eons ago, in this buddha-field there was a thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha named Vipaśyin.

original: tena khalu punaḥ samayena vayaṃ paṃca bhrātaraḥ sahodarā abhūvan /
analyzed: tena khalu punar samayena vayam paṃca bhrātaraḥ sahodarāḥ abhūvan
translated: At that time, we were five brothers born from the same womb.

analyzed: tathā asmābhiḥ anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau cittam utpādya sattva paripākāya udyogaḥ kṛtaḥ
translated: In the same way, we generated the mind of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment and made an effort for the sake of ripening beings.

original: tato /eṇa śikhinas tathāgatasyaivaṃ viśvabhuvaḥ yāvad eva sahapraviṣṭe bhadrake mahākalpe kakutsundas tathāgato loka udapādi Kurumiya
analyzed: śikhinaḥ tathāgatasya evam viśva bhuvaḥ yāvat eva sahapraviṣṭe bhadrake mahā kalpe kakutsundaḥ tathāgataḥ loke udapādi
translated: Then, in the same way, when the good eon had just begun, Kakutsunda, the Tathāgata, appeared in the world.

original: tatra vayaṃ tathaiva pūrvapraṇidhānena sahodarā eva bhrātaro 'bhūt /
analyzed: tatra vayam tathā eva pūrva praṇidhānena sahodarāḥ eva bhrātaraḥ bhūt

analyzed: tasya ca asmābhiḥ tathāgatasya bahuvidham pūjā upasthānam kṛtam abhūt
translated: And we made extensive offerings and service to that Tathāgata.

original: atha tatra saṃjñiko mahāsattva upāsako dhyānābhiratas tatredam evaṃrūpaṃ mahāpraṇidhānaṃ cakāra /
analyzed: atha tatra saṃjñikaḥ mahāsattvaḥ upāsakaḥ dhyāna abhirataḥ tatra idam evaṃrūpam mahā praṇidhānam cakāra
translated: Then there, the great being Saṃjīva, the lay devotee, who delighted in meditation, made this kind of great vow:

original: aham iha nityaṃ bhadrake mahākalpe mahāyakṣasenāpatir bhaveyaṃ /
analyzed: aham iha nityam bhadrake mahā kalpe mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ bhaveyam
translated: May I always be the great general of the yakṣas in this good eon.

analyzed: ye tatra aṭavi kāntāra nivāsinaḥ duṣṭāḥ a kṛpāḥ a dayā āpannāḥ sattveṣu nānā vikṛta rūpāḥ yakṣāḥ yāvat kaṭapūtanāḥ tebhyaḥ ham tādṛśīm dharma deśanām kuryām
translated: To those wicked, merciless, and cruel yakṣas who dwell in the forests and wildernesses, in various distorted forms, up to the kṭapūtanas, I will give such a Dharma teaching

analyzed: yat prasāda pratilabdhān kṛtvā śikṣā grahaṇe niveśya śive mārge pratiṣṭhāpayeyam yāvat
translated: that, having attained faith, having taken up the precepts, they will be established in the auspicious path. Up to

original: tatra tiryagyonigatebhyo 'pi mṛgahariṇasūkarādibhyo dharmaṃ deśayeyaṃ yāvad gaṃgānadīvalukāsamān
analyzed: tatra tiryagyoni gatebhyaḥ pi mṛga hariṇa sūkara ādibhyaḥ dharmam deśayeyam yāvat gaṃgā nadī valukā samān
translated: There, I would teach the Dharma even to those in the animal realm, such as deer, antelope, pigs, and so on, and would ripen

analyzed: duṣṭa yakṣān yāvat tiryagyoni gatān api an avaropita kuśala mūlān dharma deśanayā paripācya
translated: even the wicked yakshas and those in the animal realm who have not planted roots of virtue by teaching the Dharma,

analyzed: triṣu yāneṣu pratiṣṭhāpayeyam tatas paścāt aham vyākaraṇam anuttarāyām samyaksaṃbodhau pratilabheya
translated: and establish them in the three vehicles. Only then would I receive the prophecy of unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: evaṃ jñānolko yakṣo markaṭarūpeṇa markaṭaparipākāya praṇidhānaṃ cakāra /
analyzed: evam jñānolkaḥ yakṣaḥ markaṭa rūpeṇa markaṭa paripākāya praṇidhānam cakāra
translated: Thus, the yaksha Jnanolkha, in the form of a monkey, made a vow for the ripening of monkeys.

original: tṛṣṇājahaś chagalarūpeṇākṣaṇasaṃkaṭaprāptānāṃ sattvānāṃ paripākāya praṇidhānaṃ cakāra /
analyzed: tṛṣṇā jahaḥ chagala rūpeṇa akṣaṇa saṃkaṭa prāptānām sattvānām paripākāya praṇidhānam cakāra
translated: Trishnajaha, in the form of a goat, made a vow for the ripening of beings who have fallen into the dangerous abyss.

original: chinnaśroto gajarūpeṇa gajaparipākāya praṇidhānaṃ cakāra /
analyzed: chinna śrotaḥ gaja rūpeṇa gaja paripākāya praṇidhānam cakāra
translated: Chhinashrota, in the form of an elephant, made a vow for the ripening of elephants.

analyzed: evam dvādaśabhiḥ maharddhika yakṣa sahasraiḥ cāturdvīpikā nivāsibhiḥ sattva paripākāya nānāvidhāni praṇidhānāni kṛtāni abhūvan anuttarām samyaksaṃbodhim 🔽paryeṣamānaiḥ
translated: Thus, twelve thousand powerful yakshas who dwell in the four continents made various vows for the ripening of beings, seeking unsurpassed perfect enlightenment.

original: tasyaiva cāhaṃ kakutsundasya tathāgatasya Kurumiya
analyzed: tasya eva ca aham kakutsundasya tathāgatasya
translated: And in front of that very Tathāgata Kakutsunda,

original: purato 'nuttarāṃ samyaksaṃbodhiṃ paryeṣamāṇo duṣṭayakṣaparipākāya praṇidhānaṃ kṛtavān iha kṛtsne bhadrake mahākalpe /

translated: seeking unsurpassed perfect enlightenment, I made a vow to ripen wicked yakṣas in this entire auspicious great eon.

analyzed: haṃta duṣṭa yakṣān a kṛpān a kṛtajñān viṣama cārām pāpa icchān a dayā āpannān yāvat kaṭapūtanān
translated: Alas, the wicked yakṣas are merciless, ignorant, of irregular conduct, of evil desires, and devoid of compassion, up to the kṭṭapūtanas,

analyzed: sattva viheṭhakān ojaḥ harām citta vikṣobhakān akuśala citta kārakām prāṇa atipātikān yāvan
translated: harming beings, taking away their vital energy, disturbing their minds, causing unwholesome thoughts, taking life, up to

original: mithyādṛṣṭikāṃ kṣatriyabrāhmaṇaviṭchūdracittasaṃkṣobhakān rāṣṭragrāmanagaranigamajanapadasaṃkṣobhakāṅ
analyzed: mithyādṛṣṭikām kṣatriya brāhmaṇa viś śūdra citta saṃkṣobhakān rāṣṭra grāma nagara nigama janapada saṃkṣobhakān
translated: having wrong views, disturbing the minds of kṣatriyas, brahmins, vaiśyas, and śūdras, disturbing countries, villages, towns, markets, and regions,

original: grahanakṣatracandrasūryarātridivasamāsārdhamāsartusaṃvatsarasaṃkṣobhakāṅ kalikalahadurbhikṣarogaparacakrākālavātavṛṣṭyatiśītoṣṇaniyojakān
analyzed: graha nakṣatra candra sūrya rātri divasa māsa ardha māsa ṛtu saṃvatsara saṃkṣobhakān kali kalaha durbhikṣa roga para cakra akāla vāta vṛṣṭi atiśīta uṣṇa niyojakān
translated: disturbing the planets, stars, moon, sun, night, day, month, fortnight, season, and year, causing quarrels, fights, famine, disease, foreign invasions, untimely winds and rains, and excessive cold and heat,🔽causing the destruction of crops, fruits, flowers, and leaves, and causing the destruction of the world's wealth, grain, and happiness.

original: bījauṣadhipatrapuṣpaphalarasavināśakān sattvasukhasaumanasyārogyasāmagrīkuśaladharmacchandapṛthivīrasaujārthadharmarasavimuktirasān
analyzed: bīja oṣadhi patra puṣpa phala rasa vināśakān sattva sukha saumanasya ārogya sāmagrī kuśala dharma chanda pṛthivī rasa oja artha dharma rasa vimukti rasān
translated: I would cause those who destroy seeds, herbs, leaves, flowers, fruits, and juices, and who deprive beings of happiness, joy, health, wholesomeness, and the desire for the Dharma, and who destroy the essence of the earth, the essence of the Dharma, and the essence of liberation,

original: antardhāpakāñ śikṣāgrahaṇe niyojyāvaivartikatve sthāpayeyaṃ tataḥ paścād aham anuttarāyāṃ
analyzed: antardhāpakām śikṣā grahaṇe niyojya a vaivartika tve sthāpayeyam tatas paścāt aham anuttarāyām
translated: to disappear. Having caused them to take up the precepts, I would establish them in irreversibility. Only then would I receive a prophecy of unsurpassed

original: samyaksaṃbodhau vyākaraṇaṃ pratilabheyaṃ //
analyzed: samyaksaṃbodhau vyākaraṇam pratilabheyam
translated: perfect enlightenment.

original: tataś cāhaṃ prabhṛti nityaṃ yakṣasenāpatiṣūpapadya pāpayakṣān yāvat pāpakaṭapūtanān triṣu yāneṣu paripācyāvaivartikatve pratiṣṭhāpayāmi /
analyzed: tatas ca aham prabhṛti nityam yakṣa senāpatiṣu upapadya pāpa yakṣān yāvat pāpa kaṭapūtanān triṣu yāneṣu paripācya a vaivartika tve pratiṣṭhāpayāmi
translated: From that time forth, I was always reborn as a yakṣa general, and having ripened evil yakṣas up to evil kaṭapūtanas in the three vehicles, I established them in irreversibility.

original: tataḥ prabhṛti hīnamadhyotkṛṣṭabhūtāṃ dṛṣṭvā nābhijānāmi paribhavituṃ /
analyzed: tatas prabhṛti hīna madhya utkṛṣṭa bhūtām dṛṣṭvā na abhijānāmi paribhavitum
translated: From that time forth, having seen those of inferior, middling, and superior status, I do not recall ever despising them.

original: yadrūpāṃś ca paśyāmi tenaiva rūpeṇa tān aham ālapāmi saṃlapāmi samuttejayāmi saṃpraharṣayāmi pāpāt pratinivārayāmi maitrakaruṇācittatāyāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmi
analyzed: yad rūpān ca paśyāmi tena eva rūpeṇa tān aham ālapāmi saṃlapāmi samuttejayāmi saṃpraharṣayāmi pāpāt pratinivārayāmi maitra karuṇā citta tāyām pratiṣṭhāpayāmi
translated: Whatever forms I see, with just that form I address them, converse with them, inspire them, delight them, turn them away from evil, and establish them in a mind of loving-kindness and compassion.

original: yathābhiprāyeṇa triṣu ratneṣv avaivartikāṃ pratiṣṭhāpayāmi /
analyzed: yathā abhiprāyeṇa triṣu ratneṣu a vaivartikām pratiṣṭhāpayāmi
translated: According to their aspirations, I establish them in the three jewels without turning back.

original: yāṃ yām eva yakṣaparṣadam upasaṃkramāmi tatra te māṃ yakṣa āṭavakamiti svāgatavācā āmantrayaṃti /
analyzed: yām yām eva yakṣa parṣadam upasaṃkramāmi tatra te mām yakṣa āṭavakam iti svāgata vācāḥ āmantrayaṃti
translated: Whatever assembly of yakṣas I approached, there they greeted me with the words 'Welcome, O Yakṣa Aṭavaka.'

original: tena me āṭavakamiti nāma samājñā udapādi /
analyzed: tena me āṭavakam iti nāma samājñā udapādi
translated: Therefore the name 'Aṭavaka' became known to me.

original: ye caitarhi manuṣyāḥ purāṇadharmarahitā asaṃvarasthā ekāntakṛṣṇakarmasamācarās te kālaṃ kṛtvā tṛṣv apāyeṣūpapadyaṃte parittā manuṣyeṣu /
analyzed: ye ca etarhi manuṣyāḥ purāṇa dharma rahitāḥ asaṃvara sthāḥ ekānta kṛṣṇa karma samācarāḥ te kālam kṛtvā apāyeṣu upapadyaṃte parittāḥ manuṣyeṣu
translated: Now those humans who are devoid of the ancient Dharma, who abide in non-restraint, and who engage in completely dark actions, when they die, are reborn in the three lower realms, in the limited human realm.

original: ye vyāmiśrakarmasamācārās tṛṣu ratneṣu acalaprasādās te kālaṃ kṛtvā yadbhūyasā pāpayakṣeṣu pāpakaṭapūtaneṣūpapadyaṃte /🔽tad etarhi bhūyiṣṭhataraṃ pāpayakṣeṣu yāvat pāpakaṭapūtaneṣūpapadyaṃte /🔽tenaitarhi pāpayakṣāṇāṃ yāvat Kurumiya
analyzed: ye vyāmiśra karma samācārāḥ ratneṣu acala prasādāḥ te kālam kṛtvā yat bhūyasā pāpa yakṣeṣu pāpa kaṭapūtaneṣu upapadyaṃte  tat etarhi bhūyiṣṭhataram pāpa yakṣeṣu yāvat pāpa kaṭapūtaneṣu upapadyaṃte  tena etarhi pāpa yakṣāṇām yāvat
translated: Those who engage in mixed actions, who have unshakable faith in the Three Jewels, when they die, are mostly reborn among the evil yakṣas, the evil kaṭapūtanas.🔽Now they are mostly reborn among the evil yakṣas, up to the evil kaṭapūtanas.

original: pāpakaṭapūtanānāṃ loke vṛddhiḥ /
analyzed: pāpa kaṭapūtanānām loke vṛddhiḥ
translated: Therefore now there is an increase in the world of the evil yakṣas, up to the evil kaṭapūtanas.

original: sarve ca te śuklapakṣasyāntardhānāyodyuktāḥ /
analyzed: sarve ca te śuklapakṣasya antardhānāya udyuktāḥ
translated: And all of them are dedicated to the disappearance of the bright fortnight.

original: tenaitarhy atīva kaliyuge pravartate na cāhaṃ bhagavaṃ chaktaḥ sarvakālaṃ tān duṣṭayakṣān yāvad duṣṭakaṭapūtanān mārdavaśukladharmeṣu vivardhayituṃ
analyzed: tena etarhi atīva kali yuge pravartate na ca aham sarvakālam tān duṣṭa yakṣān yāvat duṣṭa kaṭapūtanān mārdava śukla dharmeṣu vivardhayitum
translated: Therefore, at present, in the extremely turbulent Kali Yuga, and I am not able, Blessed One, to always make those wicked yakshas, up to the wicked kshudrakas and putanas, increase in gentleness and the wholesome dharmas.🔽And I am not able to pacify the turmoil of all the kshatriyas, brahmins, vaishyas, shudras, ascetics, women, men, boys, and girls.🔽And I am not able to pacify the turmoil of villages, towns, cities, countries, and kingdoms.

original: na cāhaṃ śakto bhūyaḥ sarvakṣatriyabrāhmaṇaviṭchūdraśramaṇastrīpuruṣadārakadārikāsaṃkṣobhaṃ praśamayituṃ /
analyzed: na ca aham śaktaḥ bhūyas sarva kṣatriya brāhmaṇa viś śūdra śramaṇa strī puruṣa dāraka dārikā saṃkṣobham praśamayitum
translated: And I am not able to establish the taste of liberation in the minds and mental factors of beings.🔽O son of noble family, I have fully understood, through the splendor of all the Buddhas, the deceitfulness, the use of deceit, and the knowledge of the entry into the hearts of all yakshas and putanas.🔽O son of noble family, there is a heart of beings called Vajra Space, which is a great and fierce knowledge mantra for the retention of the extremely wrathful.

original: na ca gṛamanagaranigamajanapadarāṣṭrasaṃkṣobhaṃ praśamayitum /
analyzed: na ca gṛama nagara nigama janapada rāṣṭra saṃkṣobham praśamayitum
translated: By which mantra words, when employed, no yaksha, or she-yaksha, or old yaksha, or🔽 Translation: Therefore, at present, in the extremely turbulent Kali Yuga, and I am not able, Blessed One, to always make those wicked yakshas, up to the wicked kshudrakas and putanas, increase in gentleness and the wholesome dharmas.🔽And I am not able to pacify the turmoil of all the kshatriyas, brahmins, vaishyas, shudras, ascetics, women, men, boys, and girls.🔽And I am not able to pacify the turmoil of villages, towns, cities, countries, and kingdoms.

original: na ca bhūyo 'haṃ śakto bhūtānāṃ cittacaitasikeṣu vimuktirasaṃ pratiṣṭhāpayituṃ /
analyzed: na ca bhūyas ham śaktaḥ bhūtānām citta caitasikeṣu vimukti rasam pratiṣṭhāpayitum
translated: And I am not able to establish the taste of liberation in the minds and mental factors of beings.

original: parijñātā mayā kulaputra sarvabuddhatejasā sarvayakṣakaṭapūtanānāṃ hṛdayaśāṭhyaprayogāvakramaṇajñānatā //
analyzed: parijñātā mayā kula putra sarva buddha tejasā sarva yakṣa kaṭa pūtanānām hṛdaya śāṭhya prayoga avakramaṇa jñāna tā
translated: O son of noble family, I have fully understood, through the splendor of all the Buddhas, the deceitfulness, the use of deceit, and the knowledge of the entry into the hearts of all yakshas and putanas.

original: asti kulaputra vajrakhavasarī nāma bhūtānāṃ hṛdayaṃ mahācaṇḍadāruṇavidyāmantradhāraṇī
analyzed: asti kula putra vajrakhavasarī nāma bhūtānām hṛdayam mahā caṇḍa dāruṇa vidyā mantradhāraṇī
translated: O son of noble family, there is a heart of beings called Vajra Space, which is a great and fierce knowledge mantra for the retention of the extremely wrathful.

original: yair maṃtrapadaiḥ prayuktair na bhūyaś kaścid yakṣo vā yakṣiṇī vā yakṣamahallako
analyzed: yaiḥ maṃtra padaiḥ prayuktaiḥ na bhūyas kaścid yakṣaḥ vā yakṣiṇī vā
translated: By which mantra words, when employed, no yaksha, or she-yaksha, or old yaksha,

original: vā yakṣamahallikā vā yakṣadārako vā yakṣadārikā vā yakṣapārṣado yakṣapārṣadi vā rākṣaso
analyzed: vā yakṣa mahallikā vā yakṣa dārakaḥ vā yakṣa dārikā vā yakṣa pārṣadaḥ yakṣa pārṣadi vā rākṣasaḥ
translated: or a Yaksha boy or Yaksha girl or Yaksha attendant or Yaksha attendantess or a Rakshasa

original: vā rākṣasī vā yāvan nāgo vā nāgī vā kuṃbhāṇḍo vā kuṃbhāṇḍī vā ekāhiko vā yāvac caturthako
analyzed: vā rākṣasī vā yāvat nāgaḥ vā nāgī vā kuṃbhāṇḍaḥ vā kuṃbhāṇḍī vā ekāhikaḥ vā yāvat
translated: or a Rakshasi or up to a Naga or a Naga woman or a Kumbhanda or a Kumbhandini or a one-day demon or up to a four-day demon

original: vā pūtano vā kaṭapūtano vā kaṭapūtanā vā kaṭapūtanamahallako vā kaṭapūtanamahallikā
analyzed: vā pūtanaḥ vā kaṭapūtanaḥ vā kaṭapūtanā vā kaṭapūtana mahallakaḥ vā kaṭapūtana mahallikā
translated: or a Putana or a Kataputana or a Kataputani or a Kataputana elder or a Kataputana elderess

original: vā kaṭapūtanapotako vā kaṭapūtanapotīkā vā kaṭapūtanapārṣado vā kaṭapūtanapārṣadī
analyzed: vā kaṭapūtana potakaḥ vā kaṭapūtana potīkā vā kaṭapūtana pārṣadaḥ vā kaṭapūtana pārṣadī
translated: or a Kataputana boy or a Kataputana girl or a Kataputana attendant or a Kataputana attendantess

original: vā śaktāḥ kṣatriyasaṃkṣobhaṃ yāvaj janapadasaṃkṣobhaṃ vā kartum //🔽yatra punaḥ kulaputra gṛame vā nagare vā nigame vā yāvat kuṭumbikagṛhe vā asyā vajrakhavasaryāḥ
analyzed: vā śaktāḥ kṣatriya saṃkṣobham yāvat janapada saṃkṣobham vā kartum  yatra punar kula putra gṛame vā nagare vā nigame vā yāvat kuṭumbika gṛhe vā asyāḥ vajrakhavasaryāḥ
translated: are able to cause a disturbance among the Kshatriyas up to a disturbance in the country.🔽But, son of good family, where this Vajrakhvasarya

original: sarvabhūtahṛdayāyāḥ mahācaṇḍadāruṇavidyāyāḥ mantrapadānāṃ prakāśanaṃ syāt tatra te
analyzed: sarva bhūta hṛdayāyāḥ mahā caṇḍadāruṇa vidyāyāḥ mantra padānām prakāśanam syāt tatra te
translated: of all beings, the great fierce and terrible knowledge, the words of the mantra are revealed, in that village or town or market town up to the household of a householder, there

original: duṣṭayakṣakaṭapūtanāḥ tāṃ pūrvavairānubaddhām Kurumiya
analyzed: duṣṭa yakṣa kaṭapūtanāḥ tām pūrva vaira anubaddhām
translated: those evil Yakshas and Kataputanas, bound by their former enmity,

original: akuśalakarmakṛyāṃ prajahuḥ /
analyzed: a kuśala karma kṛyām prajahuḥ
translated: abandon their unwholesome actions.

original: maitrīkaruṇāmṛducittāḥ sarvabhūtadayāpannāḥ hitacittā bhaveyuḥ /🔽tāṃś ca sarvān rāṣṭrakuṭuṃbadevanāgayakṣakaṭapūtanasaṃkṣobhāṃ sarvacandrasūryagrahanakṣatradaṇḍaviṣaśastrakākhordasaṃkṣobhāṃ
analyzed: maitrī karuṇā mṛdu cittāḥ sarva bhūta dayā āpannāḥ hita cittāḥ bhaveyuḥ  tān ca sarvān rāṣṭra kuṭuṃba deva nāga yakṣa kaṭa pūtana saṃkṣobhām sarva candra sūrya graha nakṣatra daṇḍa viṣa śastraka ākhorda saṃkṣobhām
translated: They should have minds tender with loving-kindness and compassion, and be full of mercy for all beings. They should have thoughts of benefit.🔽They should pacify all disturbances in the country, household, gods, nāgas, yakṣas, kumbhāṇḍas, and khattas, and all disturbances from the planets, stars, rods, poisons, weapons, and Kākāsyas.

original: chārirāṃś ca vātapittaśleṣmasannipātajvaraikāhikadvaitīyakatraitīyakacāturthakakuṣṭhamarjakaṇḍukāsavīsarpodaraśūlāṃgapratyaṃgavyādhisaṃkṣobhāṃ
analyzed: chārirān ca vāta pitta śleṣma sannipāta jvara aikāhika dvaitīyaka traitīyaka cāturthaka kuṣṭha marja kaṇḍu kāsa vīsarpa udara śūla aṃga pratyaṃga vyādhi saṃkṣobhān
translated: They should pacify all disturbances from the body, such as wind, bile, phlegm, their combinations, fevers, one-day fevers, two-day fevers, three-day fevers, four-day fevers, leprosy, scabies, itching, coughing, erysipelas, abdominal distension, and pain in the limbs and minor parts.

original: praśameyuḥ /
analyzed: praśameyuḥ
translated: They should pacify all these.

original: tatra ca manuṣyāmanuṣyān mṛgapakṣiṇaḥ śuklakarmāntābhiyuktāṃ sarvabhayaprahīṇān sarvasukhasaukhyasamanvitān
analyzed: tatra ca manuṣya amanuṣyān mṛga pakṣiṇaḥ śukla karmānta abhiyuktām sarva bhaya prahīṇān sarva sukha saukhya samanvitān
translated: There, they should make humans, non-humans, deer, and birds diligently engaged in wholesome actions, free from all fears, endowed with all happiness and well-being,

original: rātriṃdivasātināmanakuśalāṃ dānadamasamyamābhiratān aklāntakāyacittāṃ bodhimārgaparyeṣaṇābhiyuktāṃ kuryuḥ //
analyzed: rātriṃdiva atināmana kuśalām dāna dam asamyama abhiratān a klānta kāya cittām bodhi mārga paryeṣaṇa abhiyuktām kuryuḥ
translated: and delighting in generosity, self-control, and restraint, with unwearied body and mind, diligently seeking the path to enlightenment, as the days and nights pass by.

original: atha āṭavako mahāyakṣasenāpatir evam āha /
analyzed: atha āṭavakaḥ mahā yakṣa senāpatiḥ evam āha
translated: Then the great yakṣa general Āṭavaka said this:

original: sacet me kulaputrāḥ sarve buddhā bhagavanta eṣu mantrapadeṣu karmasiddhin dadyur
analyzed: saced me kula putrāḥ sarve buddhāḥ bhagavantaḥ eṣu mantra padeṣu karma siddhin dadyuḥ
translated: If all the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, were to grant me success in this mantra practice,

original: adhiṣṭhiteṣur anumodeyur yad aham etāni sarvasaṃkṣobhapraśamanakarāṇi sarvaprasādakarāṇi
analyzed: adhiṣṭhita iṣuḥ anumodeyuḥ yat aham etāni sarva saṃkṣobha praśamana karāṇi sarva prasāda karāṇi
translated: May the Buddhas and Lords who are present now, and the Bodhisattvas, the great beings, rejoice in the fact that I am speaking these words that pacify all disturbances, that bring about all faith,

original: sarvākuśalapakṣanivārakāṇi sarvakuśalapakṣavivardhanāni sarvabhūtakhavasarīmaṃtrapadāni bhāṣitā /🔽adhitiṣṭhatu me śākyamunis tathāgataḥ svaramaṇḍalavāgvyāhāraṃ yad ahaṃ kṛtsnam idaṃ
analyzed: sarva akuśala pakṣa nivārakāṇi sarva kuśala pakṣa vivardhanāni sarva bhūta khavasarī maṃtra padāni bhāṣitā  adhitiṣṭhatu me śākyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ svara maṇḍala vāc vyāhāram yat aham kṛtsnam idam
translated: that prevent all unwholesome factors, that increase all wholesome factors, and that are the secret mantra words for all spirits.

original: buddhakṣetraṃ svaramaṇḍalavāgvyāhārākṣararutenāpūrayitvā etāṃ yathāsannipātāṃ parṣadaṃ
analyzed: buddhakṣetram svara maṇḍala vāc vyāhāra akṣara rutena āpūrayitvā etām yathā sannipātām parṣadam
translated: May the Tathagata Shakyamuni bless my voice, my speech, and my expression, so that I may fill this entire Buddha field with the sounds, words, and syllables of my voice,

original: svaramaṇḍalavāgvyāhārārthapadavyaṃjanaiḥ paritoṣayeyam //
analyzed: svara maṇḍala vāc vyāhāra artha pada vyaṃjanaiḥ paritoṣayeyam
translated: and satisfy this assembly gathered here with the meaning, words, phrases, and letters of my speech.

original: Kurumiya
analyzed: kurumiya
translated: Kuruṃiya

original: atha khalu śakyamunis tathāgata āṭavakaṃ mahāyakṣasenāpatim āmantrayaivam āha /🔽adhiṣṭhitas te kulaputrair buddhair bhagavadbhiḥ svaramaṇḍalavāgvyāhāraḥ asyā vajrakhavasaryāḥ sarvabhūtahṛdayāyā maṃtradhāraṇyāḥ kṛṣṇapakṣavidrāpaṇāya
analyzed: atha khalu śakyamuniḥ tathāgataḥ āṭavakam mahā yakṣa senāpatim āmantraya evam āha  adhiṣṭhitaḥ te kula putraiḥ buddhaiḥ bhagavadbhiḥ svara maṇḍala vāc vyāhāraḥ asyāḥ vajrakhavasaryāḥ sarva bhūta hṛdayāyāḥ maṃtra dhāraṇyāḥ kṛṣṇapakṣa vidrāpaṇāya  /
translated: Then the Tathagata Shakyamuni addressed the great yaksha general Āṭavika, saying:🔽Son of good family, your voice, speech, and expression have been blessed by the Buddhas, the Blessed Ones, for the sake of dispelling the dark side

original: śuklapakṣajvālanāya /
analyzed: śuklapakṣa jvālanāya
translated: and illuminating the bright side of this Vajra Secret Mantra, the heart of all spirits.

original: utsaha tvaṃ satpuruṣa vadasvemāni saṃkṣobhapraśamanakāryā vajrakhavasaryāḥ sarvabhūtahṛdayamantradhāraṇyāḥ sarvaduṣṭanivāraṇāni mantrapadāni
analyzed: utsaha tvam sat puruṣa vadasva imāni saṃkṣobha praśamana kāryāḥ vajra khavasaryāḥ sarva bhūta hṛdaya mantra dhāraṇyāḥ sarva duṣṭa nivāraṇāni mantra padāni
translated: You are able, good man, speak these words for the pacification of the disturbance, the vajra-space-travel, the heart-mantra dhāraṇīs of all spirits, the mantra words that ward off all evil ones.

translated: Those beings who in the future will uphold,

original: evam ukte bhagavāṃ sa mahācandanagandhas tathāgatas taṃ brāhmaṇaṃ sahāṃpatim etad avocat /
analyzed: evam ukte bhagavām sa mahācandanagandhaḥ tathāgataḥ tam brāhmaṇam sahāṃpatim etat avocat
translated: When this was said, the Blessed One, the Tathagata Maha-Chandanagandha, said this to the Brahmin Sahamapati:

original: yathaiva brahmaṃ ṣaḍdhātavaḥ sarvabuddhair adhiṣṭhitā mārapakṣavigrahārthaṃ sarvakaliyugapraśamārthaṃ
analyzed: yathā eva brahmam ṣaṭ dhātavaḥ sarva buddhaiḥ adhiṣṭhitāḥ māra pakṣa vigraha artham sarva kali yuga praśama artham
translated: Just as, Brahmin, the six elements are blessed by all the Buddhas for the sake of conquering the faction of Mara, for the sake of pacifying all the Kali ages,

original: sarvasattvaparipākārthaṃ saddharmanetryāś cirasthityarthaṃ mārgaviśuddhyartham /
analyzed: sarva sattva paripāka artham saddharma netryāḥ cira sthiti artham mārga viśuddhi artham
translated: for the sake of maturing all beings, for the sake of the long-lasting of the Dharma eye, and for the sake of purifying the path.

original: evaṃ sarvabuddhabodhisattvair daśabhir dharmais te sattvā adhiṣṭhitā ye 'nāgate 'dhvanīmaṃ dharmaparyāyam udgrahīṣyaṃti yāval likhitvā dhārayiṣyaṃti
analyzed: evam sarva buddha bodhisattvaiḥ daśabhiḥ dharmaiḥ te sattvāḥ adhiṣṭhitāḥ ye na āgate dhvani imam dharmaparyāyam udgrahīṣyaṃti yāvat likhitvā dhārayiṣyaṃti
translated: In the same way, all the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas bless those beings with ten dharmas who in the future will uphold this Dharma discourse, and so on up to writing and carrying it.

original: katamair daśabhir Kurumiya
analyzed: katamaiḥ daśabhiḥ
translated: With which ten? Kuru-mi-ya

original: yad uteha brahmaṃs te sattvāḥ sarvabuddhabodhisattvaiḥ sarveṣāṃ devanāgayakṣagandharvarākṣasakuṃbhāṇḍānāṃ nyāyataḥ parittā nityakālaṃ yuṣmābhi
analyzed: yat uta iha brahman te sattvāḥ sarva buddha bodhisattvaiḥ sarveṣām deva nāga yakṣa gandharva rākṣasa kuṃbhāṇḍānām nyāyataḥ parittāḥ nityakālam yuṣmābhiḥ
translated: Brahman, you should always protect those beings, as is proper, from all harm, and you should always keep them away from misfortune, and you should always engage them in wholesome bodily, verbal, and mental actions, with generous food, drink, enjoyment, and comfort, and even at the cost of your own life, you should always protect those beings.🔽They will have faultless memory, understanding, insight, and eloquence.🔽They will not dwell with minds and thoughts attached to the pleasures of the senses.

original: rakṣitavyāḥ /
analyzed: rakṣitavyāḥ
translated: They will dwell in emptiness.🔽They will have minds as vast as the earth, they will possess profound patience, and they will be dedicated to the means of gathering disciples.🔽Those beings who are established in wholesome qualities, who have given the essence of their bodies, who are pure in the three spheres, will surpass the conduct of enlightenment.

original: anarthāt pratinivārayitavyāḥ kuśale kāyavāṅmanaskarmaṇi niyojayitavyā udārānnapānopabhogaparibhogārogyakauśalyenātmajīvitaparityāgenāpi
analyzed: anarthāt pratinivārayitavyāḥ kuśale kāya vāc manaḥ karmaṇi niyojayitavyāḥ udāra anna pāna upabhoga paribhoga ārogya kauśalyena ātma jīvita parityāgena api
translated: Brahman, you should always protect those beings, as is proper, from all harm, and you should always keep them away from misfortune, and you should always engage them in wholesome bodily, verbal, and mental actions, with generous food, drink, enjoyment, and comfort, and even at the cost of your own life, you should always protect those beings.

original: te sattvāḥ sandhārayitavyā nirdoṣāṇi ca teṣāṃ smṛtimatigatipratibhānakauśalyāni bhaviṣyaṃti /

translated: They will have faultless memory, understanding, insight, and eloquence.

original: na ca taiḥ kāmaguṇasaṃsaktair manaḥsaṃkalpair vihariṣyaṃti /
analyzed: na ca taiḥ kāma guṇa saṃsaktaiḥ manaḥ saṃkalpaiḥ vihariṣyaṃti
translated: They will not dwell with minds and thoughts attached to the pleasures of the senses.

original: śūnyatāvihāriṇaś ca te bhaviṣyaṃti /
analyzed: śūnyatā vihāriṇaḥ ca te bhaviṣyanti
translated: They will dwell in emptiness.

translated: They will have minds as vast as the earth, they will possess profound patience, and they will be dedicated to the means of gathering disciples.

original: kuśaladharmāvasthitāḥ sattvāḥ pariṣat kāyādattasārāḥ trivastupariśuddhā bodhicaryām uttariṣyaṃti /

translated: Those beings who are established in wholesome qualities, who have given the essence of their bodies, who are pure in the three spheres, will surpass the conduct of enlightenment.

original: ratnadhvajaṃ samādhiṃ pratilapsyante yena samādhinā sarvasamādhiṣu vyavacārajñānakuśalā bhaviṣyaṃti /

translated: And at the time of death, those beings will see in front of them immeasurable and incalculable Buddhas, Blessed Ones, surrounded by assemblies of monks and with assemblies of bodhisattvas in front, abiding and

translated: And they will hear the Dharma being taught by those Buddhas, Blessed Ones, with such meaning, words, and syllables,

translated: And they will be reborn spontaneously in the perfectly pure Buddha-fields,🔽in those Buddha-fields where the Buddhas, Blessed Ones, abide and
